column2: the requests extra is officially deprecated and will be removed in requests v2.26.0.
column3: updated included ca bundle with new mistrusts and automated process for the future
column4: features and improvements
column5: features and improvements
column6: urls with schemes that begin with http but are not http or https no longer have their host parts forced to lowercase.
column7: sessions and adapters are now picklable, i.e., can be used with the multiprocessing library
column8: fixed regression from v2.12.1 for urls with schemes that begin with http . these urls have historically been processed as though they were http-schemed urls, and so have had parameters added. this was removed in v2.12.2 in an overzealous attempt to resolve problems with idna-encoding those urls. this change was reverted: the other fixes for idna-encoding have been judged to be sufficient to return to the behaviour requests had before v2.12.0.
column9: pinning for chardet and idna now uses major version instead of minor. this hopefully reduces the need for releases everytime a dependency is updated.
column10: fix error when urllib3 is unbundled and requests continues to use the vendored import location.
column11: fixed regression from 2.12.2 where non-string types were rejected in the basic auth parameters. while support for this behaviour has been readded, the behaviour is deprecated and will be removed in the future.
column12: the json parameter to post and friends will now only be used if neither data nor files are present, consistent with the documentation.
column13: session cookies not saved when session.request is called with return_response=false
column14: response is now a context manager, so can be used directly in a with statement without first having to be wrapped by contextlib.closing.
column15: updated support for internationalized domain names from idna2003 to idna2008. this updated support is required for several forms of idns and is mandatory for .de domains.
column16: certifi support was removed
column17: added request.url attribute for context and redirects
column18: the behavior of sessionredirectmixin was slightly altered. resolve_redirects will now detect a redirect by calling get_redirect_target instead of directly querying response.is_redirect and response.headers. advanced users will be able to process malformed redirects more easily.
column19: support for connect timeouts! timeout now accepts a tuple which is used to set individual connect and read timeouts.
column20: anything that is a subclass of mapping is now treated like a dictionary by the data= keyword argument.
column21: fixed several issues with idna-encoding urls that are technically invalid but which are widely accepted. requests will now attempt to idna-encode a url if it can but, if it fails, and the host contains only ascii characters, it will be passed through optimistically. this will allow users to opt-in to using idna2003 themselves if they want to, and will also allow technically invalid but still common hostnames.
column22: the caseinsensitivedict used for http headers now behaves like a normal dictionary when references as string or viewed in the interpreter.
column23: cookies with , and _ allowed.
column24: fixed a bug when using iter_content with decode_unicode=true for streamed bodies would raise attributeerror. this bug was introduced in 2.11.
column25: fix error when requests is an install_requires dependency and python setup.py test is run.
column26: prevent hanging when using streaming uploads and digest auth when a 401 is received.
column27: massive refactor and simplification
column28: if a request is made with a file-like object as the body and that request is redirected with a 307 or 308 status code, requests will now attempt to rewind the body object so it can be replayed.
column29: fixed param handling with urls containing fragments.
column30: sessions used by the functional api are always closed
column31: sessions are now closed in all cases when using the functional api rather than leaking and waiting for the garbage collector to clean them up.
column32: much improved handling of non-ascii location header values in redirects. fewer unicodedecodeerrors are encountered on python 2, and python 3 now correctly understands that latin-1 is unlikely to be the correct encoding.
column33: changed a less-than to an equal-to and an or in the dependency markers to widen compatibility with older setuptools releases.
column34: requests is an elegant and simple http library for python, built for human beings. you are currently looking at the documentation of the development release.
column35: post redirects now break rfc to do what browsers do: follow up with a get.
column36: pyopenssl tls implementation is now only used if python either doesn t have an ssl module or doesn t support sni. previously pyopenssl was unconditionally used if available. this applies even if pyopenssl is installed via the requests extra
column37: switch back to using chardet, since it has merged with charade.
column38: reject header values that contain leading whitespace or newline characters to reduce risk of header smuggling.
column39: forced basic is default authentication type
column40: resolve redirects now receives and forwards all of the original arguments to the adapter.
column41: fixed an issue where unicode strings could not be used in basic auth.
column42: fixed an issue where urls with leading whitespace would raise invalidschema errors.
column43: when users provide invalid paths to certificate bundle files or directories requests now raises ioerror, rather than failing at the time of the https request with a fairly inscrutable certificate validation error.
column44: replace references of gittip with gratipay
column45: fixed an issue where some urls without the http or https schemes would still have http url preparation applied to them.
column46: values of headers set by requests are now always the native string type.
column47: features
column48: requests v2.25.x will be the last release series with support for python 3.5.
column49: significantly change how hooks are dispatched - hooks now receive all the arguments specified by the user when making a request so hooks can make a secondary request with the same parameters. this is especially necessary for authentication handler authors
column50: actually added md5-sess to digest auth instead of pretending to like last time.
column51: recommended packages and extensions
column52: new features
column53: new persistent sessions object and context manager
column54: cve-2015-2296: fix handling of cookies on redirect. previously a cookie without a host value set would use the hostname for the redirected url exposing requests users to session fixation attacks and potentially cookie stealing. this was disclosed privately by matthew daley of .
column55: return connections to the pool when a chunked upload is successful, rather than leaking it.
column56: changed the default user-agent string to avoid leaking data on linux: now contains only the requests version.
column57: added new method to httpadapter objects: httpadapter.proxy_headers. this should not be called directly, but improves the subclass interface.
column58: cookies set by hooks are now correctly persisted on sessions.
column59: changed the dependency markers to widen compatibility with older pip releases.
column60: the timeout parameter now affects requests with both stream=true and stream=false equally.
column61: updated urllib3 to 1.10.4, resolving several bugs involving chunked transfer encoding and response framing.
column62: requests now supports per-host proxies. this allows the proxies dictionary to have entries of the form { <scheme>://<hostname> : <proxy> }. host-specific proxies will be used in preference to the previously-supported scheme-specific ones, but the previous syntax will continue to work.
column63: httplib.incompleteread exceptions caused by incorrect chunked encoding will now raise a requests chunkedencodingerror instead.
column64: fixes incorrect parsing of proxy credentials that contain a literal or encoded # character.
column65: added win_inet_pton as conditional dependency for the extra on windows with python 2.7.
column66: fixed an issue with json encoding detection, specifically detecting big-endian utf-32 with bom.
column67: requests handling of unvendored dependencies is now more restrictive.
column68: if you d like to stay up to date on the community and development of requests, there are several options:
column69: fixed cookies on sessions and on requests
column70: add deprecation warnings to functions in requests.utils that will be removed in 3.0
column71: fixed issue where responses whose body had not been fully consumed would have the underlying connection closed but not returned to the connection pool, which could cause requests to hang in situations where the httpadapter had been configured to use a blocking connection pool.
column72: fix regression where compressed data that was sent as chunked data was not properly decompressed.
column73: allow keyword arguments to be passed to json.loads via the response.json method
column74: requests has officially stopped support for python 2.6.
column75: added support for sha-256 and sha-512 digest auth algorithms.
column76: added file attribute to post and put requests for multipart-encode file uploads.
column77: restrict requests to http/1.1 and http/1.0
column78: fixed bug with unintended authorization header stripping for redirects using default ports .
column79: deprecated invalidmethodexception.
column80: accept unicode methods in python 2.6 and 2.7.
column81: allow usage of urllib3 s retry object with httpadapters
column82: correctly handle digest auth headers with a malformed qop directive that contains no token, by treating it the same as if no qop directive was provided at all.
column83: requests now tolerates empty passwords in proxy credentials, rather than stripping the credentials.
column84: changed the proxy bypass implementation on windows: the proxy bypass check doesn t use forward and reverse dns requests anymore
column85: requests has officially stopped support for python 3.4.
column86: non-string objects can be passed in data values alongside files.
column87: requestexception is now a subclass of ioerror, not runtimeerror.
column88: if no response.encoding is specified and chardet is available, response.text will guess an encoding.
column89: update width of buttons and sidebar
column90: fix crash with custom method parameter to session.request
column91: replace unicode errors on first pass, no need for second pass.
column92: when using the preparedrequest flow, requests will now correctly handle a unicode-string method name on python 2. broken in 2.8.0.
column93: dns resolution in proxy bypass no longer includes the username and password in the request. this also fixes the issue of dns queries failing on macos.
column94: settings context manager and module
column95: add forced basic authentication
column96: fixed issue where non-utf8 reason phrases got severely mangled by falling back to decoding using iso 8859-1 instead.
column97: requests will now use certifi if it is available.
column98: copy pip s import machinery. when downstream redistributors remove requests.packages.urllib3 the import machinery will continue to let those same symbols work. example usage in requests documentation and 3rd-party libraries relying on the vendored copies of urllib3 will work without having to fallback to the system urllib3.
column99: the iter_lines method on a response now accepts a delimiter with which to split the content
column100: avoid data duplication when creating a request with str, bytes, or bytearray input to the files argument.
column101: the change in how hooks are dispatched will likely cause a great deal of issues.
column102: remove redundant generator for chunked transfer encoding
column103: digest auth support is now thread safe.
column104: cookies are now properly managed when 401 authentication responses are received.
column105: cookies.get now supports default argument
column106: for file-like objects that are not sought to the very beginning, we now send the content length for the number of bytes we will actually read, rather than the total size of the file, allowing partial file uploads.
column107: fragments are now properly maintained across redirects.
column108: handle unicodedecodeerrors when trying to deal with a unicode url that cannot be encoded in ascii.
column109: error messages for invalid headers now include the header name for easier debugging
column110: attempt to quote parts of the url on redirect if unquoting and then quoting fails.
column111: fixed an issue encountered by some requests plugins where constructing a response object would cause response.content to raise an attributeerror.
column112: verify ssl is default.
column113: allow file uploads and post data together
column114: resolve installation failure if multiprocessing is not available
column115: the change in v2.0.0 to mandate explicit proxy schemes has been reverted. proxy schemes now default to http://.
column116: revert changes to our vendored certificate bundle. for more context see (#2455, #2456, and <link
column117: support for proper chunk streams with boundaries.
column118: fix how link headers are parsed using the regular expression library
column119: proxy urls now must have an explicit scheme. a missingschema exception will be raised if they don t.
column120: removal of all hooks except response
column121: allow explicit content types to be specified for file data
column122: use lists as dicts for parameters
column123: the verify keyword argument now supports being passed a path to a directory of ca certificates, not just a single-file bundle.
column124: when using the preparedrequest flow, requests will now correctly respect the json parameter. broken in 2.8.0.
column125: fixed issue where the all_proxy environment variable would be preferred over scheme-specific variables like http_proxy.
column126: this is the first release that follows our new release process. for more, see (link
column127: don t send content-length header by default on get or head requests
column128: note: code that was written to import against the requests.packages namespace previously will have to import code that rests at this module-level now.
column129: resolve tests crash if multiprocessing is not able to determine the number of cpu cores
column130: allow copying of preparedrequests without headers/cookies.
column131: if there is no content in a response don t throw an error the second time that content is attempted to be read.
column132: when passed objects that throw exceptions from tell, send them via chunked transfer encoding instead of failing.
column133: stop advertising compress as a supported content-encoding.
column134: students and teachers, save up to 60% on adobe creative cloud.
column135: invalid percent-escape sequences now cause a requests invalidurl exception to be raised.
column136: allow content-length header to always be overridden
column137: added md5-sess to digest auth
column138: redirect resolution should now only occur when allow_redirects is true.
column139: this is not a backwards compatible change.
column140: fix out-of-range issue with iter_lines.
column141: add more references for interlinking
column142: warnings are now emitted when sending files opened in text mode.
column143: restricted httpdigestauth to only respond to auth challenges made on 4xx responses, rather than to all auth challenges.
column144: no longer perform unnecessary content-length calculation for requests that won t use it.
column145: fix post redirects containing files.
column146: cookies set on individual requests through a session ) are no longer persisted to the session.
column147: fixed a bug where requests would not correctly correlate cookies set when using custom host headers if those host headers did not use the native string type for the platform.
column148: warn user about possible slowdown when using cryptography version < 1.3.4
column149: fixed issue where requests would raise connectionerror instead of sslerror when encountering ssl problems when using urllib3 v1.22.
column150: major proxy work thanks to @lukasa including parsing of proxy authentication from the proxy url
column151: unencode http basic usernames and passwords extracted from urls.
column152: requests removes authorization header from requests redirected from https to http on the same hostname.
column153: 301 and 302 redirects now change the verb to get for all verbs, not just post, improving browser compatibility.
column154: will need to be re-written to be:
column155: updated internal urllib3 and chardet.
column156: strip content-type and transfer-encoding headers from the header block when following a redirect that transforms the verb from post/put to get.
column157: the best way to track the development of requests is through the github repo.
column158: automatic casting of urls to strings
column159: added new method to session objects: session.prepare_request. this method updates and prepares a request object, and returns the corresponding preparedrequest object.
column160: the dismayed person emoticon no longer has a big head. i m sure this is what you were all worrying about most.
column161: fixed issue with unexpected importerror on windows system which do not support winreg module.
column162: correctly honor decode_unicode even if it wasn t used earlier in the same response.
column163: fixed problem where httplib.badstatusline would get raised if combining stream=true with contextlib.closing.
column164: urlerrors are treated as explicitly raised r.requests.get; r.raise_for_status
column165: much improved heuristics for guessing content lengths: requests will no longer read an entire stringio into memory.
column166: should_bypass_proxies now handles uris without hostnames .
column167: still handles request in the event of an httperror.
column168: fixed bug where using oauth 1 with body signature_type sent no data
column169: we now handle being passed a query string as a bytestring on python 3, by decoding it as utf-8.
column170: the response.history parameter is now always a list.
column171: automatic decoding of unicode, based on http headers.
column172: client certificates are ignored when verify=false
column173: fix for oauth + posts
column174: changed the internal calculation of elapsed request time to have higher resolution on windows.
column175: added type checks to ensure that iter_content only accepts integers and none for chunk sizes.
column176: added license to installed version.
column177: change to bundled projects import logic to make it easier to unbundle requests downstream.
column178: update css for theme
column179: new verify argument for ssl requests.
column180: update vendored urllib3 to include ssl bug fixes
column181: usage of new charade project, which provides python 2 and 3 simultaneous chardet.
column182: fix a bug in 2.8.0 where requests would raise connecttimeout instead of connectionerror
column183: resolve regression introduced in 2.9.0 that made it impossible to send binary strings as bodies in python 3.
column184: requests would incorrectly ignore a non-cidr ip address in the no_proxy environment variables: requests now treats it as a specific ip.
column185: converted auth system to use simpler callable objects.
column186: simply default accept-encoding
column187: connection: keep-alive header is now sent automatically.
column188: it is now possible to pass no_proxy as a key to the proxies dictionary to provide handling similar to the no_proxy environment variable.
column189: timeouts now apply to read time if stream=false.
column190: unicode url improvements for python 2.
column191: improved tolerance for file-like objects that have no tell method but do have a seek method.
column192: updated bundled certifi to 2017.4.17.
column193: allows for custom auth handlers
column194: full unicode url support
column195: requests now supports idna v2.8.
column196: removal of requests.async in favor of (link
column197: new unicode decoding system, based on over-ridable response.encoding.
column198: clean up connections when we hit problems during chunked upload, rather than leaking them.
column199: copy a preparedrequest s cookiejar more reliably when it is not an instance of requestscookiejar.
column200: running $ python -m requests.help now includes the installed version of idna.
column201: properly handle the case where a server issuing digest authentication challenges provides both auth and auth-int qop-values.
column202: add link to changelog in sidebar
column203: requests now supports urllib3 v1.26.
column204: requests.help no longer fails on python 2.6 due to the absence of ssl.openssl_version_number.
column205: improved request object constructor
column206: allow hooks to return responses that indicate errors.
column207: fixed occasional typeerror when attempting to decode a json response that occurred in an error case. now correctly returns a valueerror.
column208: avoid crashing when attempting to get authentication credentials from ~/.netrc when running as a user without a home directory.
column209: removed use of cgi module to expedite library load time.
column210: fixed issue where status_codes.py s init function failed trying to append to a __doc__ value of none.
column211: exceptions now inherit from runtimeerror.
column212: support for mixed case schemes.
column213: headers set to none on the session are now correctly not sent.
column214: support for proxies
column215: append / to bare-domain urls before query insertion.
column216: ensure that cookies are persisted over redirect.
column217: new allow_redirects param for following non-get/head redirects
column218: allow = in cookies.
column219: added new method to session objects: session.update_request. this method updates a request object with the data stored on the session.
column220: new response property is_redirect, which is true when the library could have processed this response as a redirection .
column221: minor performance improvement to request.content.
column222: support for ip address ranges for no_proxy environment variable
column223: relative redirect support
column224: automatic expansion of parameterized headers.
column225: fixed a bug when sending json data that could cause us to encounter obscure openssl errors in certain network conditions .
column226: multiple calls to iter* fail with unhelpful error. ((link (link
column227: new argument to the default connection adapter for passing a block argument

column2: the parameter numeric_only of categorical.min and categorical.max is deprecated and replaced with skipna
column3: futurewarning: using a dict with renaming is deprecated and
column4: the type import pandas.tslib.nattype is deprecated and can be replaced by using type
column5: apply_index is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. use offset + other instead
column6: is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column7: futurewarning: pd.rolling_mean is deprecated for dataframe and will be removed in a future version, replace with
column8: the method name index.sym_diff is deprecated and can be replaced by index.symmetric_difference
column9: dateoffset.__call__ is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use offset + other instead
column10: multiindex.to_hierarchical is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column11: index.get_duplicates is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column12: index.get_value is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column13: the null_counts parameter of dataframe.info is deprecated and replaced by show_counts. it will be removed in a future version
column14: series.nonzero is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column15: the inplace parameter of categorical.remove_unused_categories is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column16: ndframe.get_ftype_counts is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column17: index.summary is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column18: dataframe and panel constructors with invalid input will now raise valueerror rather than pandas.core.common.pandaserror, if called with scalar inputs and not axes; the exception pandaserror is removed as well.
column19: added top-level function read_excel to replace the following, the original api is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column20: the top-level pd.value_range has been deprecated and can be replaced by .describe
column21: dataframe.lookup is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use dataframe.melt and dataframe.loc instead
column22: dataframe and panel constructors with invalid input will now raise valueerror rather than pandaserror, if called with scalar inputs and not axes
column23: datetimearray.week and datetimearray.weekofyear are deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use datetimearray.isocalendar.week instead
column24: compact_ints and use_unsigned have been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column25: categorical.to_dense is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use np.asarray instead
column26: pandas.tseries.frequencies.get_offset is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use pandas.tseries.frequencies.to_offset instead
column27: timedelta.resolution is deprecated and replaced with timedelta.resolution_string. in a future version, timedelta.resolution will be changed to behave like the standard library datetime.timedelta.resolution
column28: pandas.stats.fama_macbeth routines are deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column29: as_recarray has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column30: to be compatible with period addition and subtraction, pd.nat now supports addition and subtraction with int. previously it raised valueerror.
column31: indexing with a list with missing labels is deprecated
column32: indexing with a list with missing labels is deprecated
column33: bug in series constructor with scalar and dtype=categoricaldtype where categories and ordered are not maintained
column34: the index set operations + and - were deprecated in order to provide these for numeric type operations on certain index types. + can be replaced by .union or |, and - by .difference. further the method name index.diff is deprecated and can be replaced by index.difference
column35: series.reshape and categorical.reshape have been deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release
column36: setting values with .loc using a positional slice is deprecated and will raise in a future version. use .loc with labels or .iloc with positions instead
column37: categorical.from_array has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column38: buffer_lines has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column39: using dataframe.rename_axis and series.rename_axis to alter index or column labels is now deprecated in favor of using .rename. rename_axis may still be used to alter the name of the index or columns .
column40: multiindex.labels has been deprecated and replaced by multiindex.codes. the functionality is unchanged. the new name better reflects the natures of these codes and makes the multiindex api more similar to the api for categoricalindex . as a consequence, other uses of the name labels in multiindex have also been deprecated and replaced with codes:
column41: datetimeindex.week and datetimeindex.weekofyear are deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use datetimeindex.isocalendar.week instead
column42: the is_copy attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future version .
column43: sparselist has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column44: this behavior has been corrected in version 0.18.0, which is consistent with other anchored offsets like monthbegin and yearbegin.
column45: dataframe.tshift and series.tshift are deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use dataframe.shift and series.shift instead
column46: series.str.__iter__ was deprecated and will be removed in future releases .
column47: datetimeindex.to_perioddelta is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. use index - index.to_period.to_timestamp instead
column48: pandas.stats.ols, pandas.stats.plm and pandas.stats.var routines are deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column49: pandas.api.types.is_categorical is deprecated and will be removed in a future version; use pandas.api.types.is_categorical_dtype instead
column50: the by argument of dataframe.sort_index has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version.
column51: the order parameter of factorize is deprecated and will be removed in a future release
column52: the how keyword in periodindex.astype is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use index.to_timestamp instead
column53: pandas.parser.overflowerror exception has been removed and has been replaced with python s built-in overflowerror exception
column54: skip_footer has been deprecated in favor of skipfooter and will be removed in a future version
column55: partial slicing on unordered datetimeindex objects with keys that are not in the index is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column56: the attributes categorical labels and levels attributes are deprecated and renamed to codes and categories.
column57: bug in to_datetime which raises unhandled overflowerror when called with mix of invalid dates and nan values with format='%y%m%d' and error='coerce'
column58: the deprecated irow, icol, iget and iget_value methods are removed in favor of iloc and iat as explained here .
column59: series.dt.week and series.dt.weekofyear are deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use series.dt.isocalendar.week instead
column60: removed the previously deprecated behavior of altering column or index labels with series.rename_axis or dataframe.rename_axis
column61: bug in dataframe.truncate and series.truncate where index was assumed to be monotone increasing
column62: addition and subtraction of the base index type and of datetimeindex previously performed set operations . this behavior was already deprecated since 0.15.0 and .difference methods), and is now disabled. when possible, + and - are now used for element-wise operations, for example for concatenating strings or subtracting datetimes .
column63: remove error raised due to duplicated input functions in named aggregation in dataframe.groupby and series.groupby. previously error will be raised if the same function is applied on the same column and now it is allowed if new assigned names are different.
column64: the following top-level pandas functions have been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column65: the generate_bq_schema function is now deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column66: integer addition/subtraction with datetimes and timedeltas is deprecated
column67: eval keyword argument truediv is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column68: timestamp.fromisocalendar is now compatible with python 3.8 and above
column69: bug in .iloc when used with inplace addition or assignment and an int indexer on a multiindex causing the wrong indexes to be read from and written to
column70: # but setting names is not deprecated
column71: pandas.core.datetools module has been deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release
column72: the default behaviour of series.str.match has changed from extracting groups to matching the pattern. the extracting behaviour was deprecated since pandas version 0.13.0 and can be done with the series.str.extract method . as a consequence, the as_indexer keyword is ignored and is deprecated.
column73: futurewarning: pd.rolling_cov is deprecated for series and
column74: the pivot_table/dataframe.pivot_table and crosstab functions now take arguments index and columns instead of rows and cols. a futurewarning is raised to alert that the old rows and cols arguments will not be supported in a future release
column75: backtick quoting in dataframe.query and dataframe.eval can now also be used to use invalid identifiers like names that start with a digit, are python keywords, or are using single character operators.
column76: dateoffset.isanchored and datetoffset.onoffset are deprecated and will be removed in a future version, use dateoffset.is_anchored and dateoffset.is_on_offset instead
column77: the pandas.io.ga module which implements google-analytics support is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column78: values like 'yes' and 'no' are not interpreted as boolean by default, though this can be controlled by new true_values and false_values arguments:
column79: for method multiindex.copy, the labels parameter has been deprecated and replaced by a codes parameter.
column80: the dataframe.compound and series.compound methods are deprecated and will be removed in a future version .
column81: drop_duplicates and duplicated s take_last keyword was deprecated in favor of keep.
column82: the cut will now accept parameter ordered with default ordered=true. if ordered=false and no labels are provided, an error will be raised
column83: datetimeindex.shift and periodindex.shift now accept periods argument instead of n for consistency with index.shift and series.shift. using n throws a deprecation warning
column84: passing multiple axes to the axis parameter in dataframe.dropna has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column85: sparsearray.all and sparsearray.any are now implemented to handle sparsearray, these were used but not implemented
column86: the existing methods series.sort, series.order, and dataframe.sort have been deprecated and will be removed in a future version.
column87: bug in index and series created with nan and nat mixed data may not have datetime64 dtype
column88: the squeeze keyword in groupby is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column89: dataframe.between_time and series.between_time now only parse a fixed set of time strings. parsing of date strings is no longer supported and raises a valueerror.
column90: adding or subtracting nan from a dataframe column with timedelta64 dtype will now raise a typeerror instead of returning all-nat. this is for compatibility with timedeltaindex and series behavior
column91: reindex now supports method='nearest' for frames or series with a monotonic increasing or decreasing index :
column92: the parameter is_copy of series.take and dataframe.take has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version.
column93: the signature of series.set_axis and dataframe.set_axis has been changed from set_axis to set_axis, for consistency with the rest of the api. the old signature is deprecated and will show a futurewarning
column94: dataframe.pivot_table and crosstab s rows and cols keyword arguments were removed in favor of index and columns
column95: fixed bug in series.max with datetime64-dtype failing to return nat when nulls are present and skipna=false is passed

column97: the fastpath keyword in the singleblockmanager constructor is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column98: furthermore, pd.to_timedelta has gained a similar api, of errors='raise'|'ignore'|'coerce', and the coerce keyword has been deprecated in favor of errors='coerce'.
column99: removed the previously deprecated dataframe.reindex_axis and series.reindex_axis
column100: bug in index constructor with dtype=categoricaldtype where categories and ordered are not maintained
column101: in gh4892 indexing with floating point numbers on a non-float64index was deprecated . in 0.18.0, this deprecation warning is removed and these will now raise a typeerror.
column102: the parameter label in lreshape has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column103: index.repeat and multiindex.repeat have deprecated the n parameter in favor of repeats
column104: index.is_mixed is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, check index.inferred_type directly instead

column106: # should be replaced by

column108: the behavior of series.argmax and series.argmin have been deprecated in favor of series.idxmax and series.idxmin, respectively .

column111: will be removed in a future version, replace with

column113: grouper and resample now supports the arguments origin and offset
column114: holidays calendars are now available and can be used with the custombusinessday offset
column115: bug in multiindex.drop dropping more values than expected when index has duplicates and is not sorted
column116: additionally we no longer depend on feather-format for feather based storage and replaced it with references to pyarrow .
column117: using a scalar float indexer will be deprecated in a future version, but is allowed for now.
column118: the series.ftype, series.ftypes and dataframe.ftypes methods are deprecated and will be removed in a future version. instead, use series.dtype and dataframe.dtypes .
column119: dataframe.to_dict has deprecated accepting short names for orient and will raise in a future version
column120: bar now also supports tablewise application with axis=none and setting clipping range with vmin and vmax . nan values are also handled properly.
column121: multiple offset aliases with decimal points are now supported
column122: upsampling and calling .ohlc previously returned a series, basically identical to calling .asfreq. ohlc upsampling now returns a dataframe with columns open, high, low and close . this is consistent with downsampling and datetimeindex behavior.
column123: the result of series.where is now a series with sparse values, like with other extension arrays
column124: styler.set_table_styles now allows the direct styling of rows and columns and can be chained
column125: dataframe has dropped the combineadd and combinemult methods in favor of add and mul respectively
column126: date parser functions parse_date_time, parse_date_fields, parse_all_fields and generic_parser from pandas.io.date_converters are deprecated and will be removed in a future version; use to_datetime instead
column127: can be unpacked with
column128: the msgpack format is deprecated as of 0.25 and will be removed in a future version. it is recommended to use pyarrow for on-the-wire transmission of pandas objects.
column129: the tz keyword in period.to_timestamp is deprecated and will be removed in a future version; use per.to_timestamp.tz_localize instead
column130: previous api will work but with deprecations
column131: previous api will work but with deprecations
column132: the center keyword in the dataframe.expanding function is deprecated and will be removed in a future version
column133: index.to_datetime and datetimeindex.to_datetime have been deprecated in favor of pd.to_datetime
column134: removed the previously deprecated keywords reduce and broadcast from dataframe.apply
column135: when calling dataframe.describe with an empty categorical / object column, the top and freq columns were previously omitted, which was inconsistent with the output for non-empty columns. now the top and freq columns will always be included, with numpy.nan in the case of an empty dataframe
column136: bug in dataframe.to_json and series.to_json when used with lines=true and orient='records' the last line of the record is not appended with new line character
column137: fixed an issue with a duplicate index and duplicate selector with .loc
column138: futurewarning: pd.rolling_mean is deprecated for series and
column139: support for slicing with monotonic decreasing indexes, even if start or stop is not found in the index :
column140: this is a bug fix release from 0.9.0 and includes several new features and enhancements along with a large number of bug fixes. the new features include by-column sort order for dataframe and series, improved na handling for the rank method, masking functions for dataframe, and intraday time-series filtering for dataframe.
column141: .ix supports mixed integer and label based access. it is primarily label based, but will fallback to integer positional access. .ix is the most general and will support any of the inputs to .loc and .iloc, as well as support for floating point label schemes. .ix is especially useful when dealing with mixed positional and label based hierarchical indexes.
column142: following keywords are now acceptable for dataframe.plot with kind='bar' and kind='barh':
column143: the pandas.options.display.mpl_style configuration has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version of pandas. this functionality is better handled by matplotlib s style sheets .
column144: slicing series and dataframes with an monotonically increasing categoricalindex is now very fast and has speed comparable to slicing with an int64index. the speed increase is both when indexing by label and position slicing a monotonically increasing categoricalindex itself shows similar speed improvements as above
column145: the deprecated attributes _axis_names and _axis_numbers of dataframe and series will no longer show up in dir or inspect.getmembers calls
column146: mod and divmod operations are now defined on timedelta objects when operating with either timedelta-like or with numeric arguments. see the documentation here.
column147: deprecate use of strings denoting units with m , y or y in to_timedelta
column148: bug in pd.pivot_table may raise typeerror or valueerror when index or columns is not scalar and values is not specified
column149: removed deprecated behavior of series.argmin and series.argmax, use series.idxmin and series.idxmax for the old behavior
column150: fixed bug with values raising an error on a dataframe with duplicate columns and mixed dtypes, surfaced in
column151: new keywords iterator=boolean, and chunksize=number_in_a_chunk are provided to support iteration on select and select_as_multiple
column152: bug in series construction with categorical and dtype='category' is specified
column153: this is a major release from 0.8.1 and includes several new features and enhancements along with a large number of bug fixes. new features include vectorized unicode encoding/decoding for series.str, to_latex method to dataframe, more flexible parsing of boolean values, and enabling the download of options data from yahoo! finance.
column154: support for multi-dimensional indexing on a index is deprecated and will be removed in a future version, convert to a numpy array before indexing instead
column155: this is a new feature and is under active development. we ll be adding features an possibly making breaking changes in future releases. feedback is welcome.
column156: and the differences in reindexing df with mi_2 and using method='pad' can be seen here:
column157: this is a major release from 0.11.0 and includes several new features and enhancements along with a large number of bug fixes.
column158: futurewarning: select is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. you can use .loc as a replacement
column159: bug in period and periodindex creation raises keyerror if freq="minute" is specified. note that minute freq is deprecated in v0.17.0, and recommended to use freq="t" instead
column160: previously indexing with a nullable boolean array containing na would raise a valueerror, however this is now permitted with na being treated as false.
column161: the functions pd.rolling_*, pd.expanding_*, and pd.ewm* are deprecated and replaced by the corresponding method call. note that the new suggested syntax includes all of the arguments
column162: added drop_duplicates and duplicated functions for removing duplicate dataframe rows and checking for duplicate rows, respectively
column163: index now supports duplicated and drop_duplicates.
column164: deprecated
column165: with matplotlib 2.0.0 and above, calculation of x limits for line plots is left to matplotlib, so that its new default settings are applied.
column166: pandas.api.types.is_datetimetz is deprecated in favor of pandas.api.types.is_datetime64tz
column167: bug in dataframe.pivot_table when margin is true and only column is defined
column168: bug in to_datetime with invalid dates and formats supplied
column169: bug in pandas.core.window.rolling.median and pandas.core.window.rolling.quantile where memoryerror is raised with empty window
column170: the behavior of sum and prod on all-nan series/dataframes is now consistent and no longer depends on whether bottleneck is installed, and sum and prod on empty series now return nan instead of 0, see here.
column171: series.rolling.apply, dataframe.rolling.apply, series.expanding.apply, and dataframe.expanding.apply have deprecated passing an np.array by default. one will need to pass the new raw parameter to be explicit about what is passed
column172: furthermore, previously you could change the ordered attribute of a categorical by just setting the attribute, e.g. cat.ordered=true; this is now deprecated and you should use cat.as_ordered or cat.as_unordered. these will by default return a new object and not modify the existing object.
column173: for reading and writing to filesystems other than local and reading from http, the optional dependency fsspec will be used to dispatch operations . this will give unchanged functionality for s3 and gcs storage, which were already supported, but also add support for several other storage implementations such as azure datalake and blob, ssh, ftp, dropbox and github. for docs and capabilities, see the fsspec docs.
column174: dataframe.min and dataframe.max were not returning consistent results with series.min and series.max when called on objects initialized with empty pd.to_datetime
column175: when read_csv, read_sas and read_json are called with chunksize/iterator they can be used in a with statement as they return context-managers
column176: drop_duplicates and duplicated now accept a keep keyword to target first, last, and all duplicates. the take_last keyword is deprecated, see here
column177: bug in read_csv with engine='c': eof preceded by a comment, blank line, etc. was not handled correctly
column178: to_datetime now supports parsing formats containing timezone names and utc offsets from different timezones then converting them to utc by setting utc=true. this would return a datetimeindex with timezone at utc as opposed to an index with object dtype if utc=true is not set .
column179: bug in resample with a timezone and certain offsets
column180: legacy offsets are deprecated
column181: bug in dataframe.to_csv and series.to_csv caused a valueerror when it was called with a filename in combination with mode containing a b
column182: nat now supports arithmetic operations with integers and floats.
column183: comparing timestamp with unsupported objects now returns notimplemented instead of raising typeerror. this implies that unsupported rich comparisons are delegated to the other object, and are now consistent with python 3 behavior for datetime objects
column184: performance improvement when comparing a categorical with a scalar and the scalar is not found in the categories
column185: bug in concat was not allowing for concatenation of dataframe and series with duplicate keys
column186: pandas.json_normalize is now exposed in the top-level namespace. usage of json_normalize as pandas.io.json.json_normalize is now deprecated and it is recommended to use json_normalize as pandas.json_normalize instead .
column187: the options display.line_with and display.height are removed in favor of display.width and display.max_rows respectively
column188: fix regression where categorical.replace would replace with nan whenever the new value and replacement value were equal
column189: bug causing unicodeencodeerror when get_dummies called with unicode values and a prefix
column190: bug in dataframe.resample when there is a time change and resampling frequency is 12h or higher
column191: this is a minor bug-fix release from 0.16.1 and includes a large number of bug fixes along some new features method), enhancements, and performance improvements.
column192: dataframe.from_csv and series.from_csv have been deprecated in favor of read_csv
column193: the dataframe.drop_duplicates and dataframe.duplicated methods now take argument subset instead of cols to better align with dataframe.dropna. a futurewarning is raised to alert that the old cols arguments will not be supported in a future release
column194: dataframe.replace s infer_types parameter is removed and now performs conversion by default.
column195: removed the previously deprecated keyword pat from series.str.partition and series.str.rpartition, use sep instead
column196: bug in clipboard functions on linux with python2 with unicode and separators
column197: bug in the categorical constructor with empty values and categories causing the .categories to be an empty float64index rather than an empty index with object dtype
column198: ability to read pickles containing categorical instances created with pre-0.16 version of pandas has been removed
column199: this is a major release from 0.23.4 and includes a number of api changes, new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes.
column200: bug in to_datetime which does not replace the invalid argument with nat when error is set to coerce
column201: series and index constructors now raise when the data is incompatible with a passed dtype=
column202: removed the previously deprecated keywords verbose and private_key from read_gbq
column203: dataframe.to_excel and dataframe.to_csv cols keyword argument was removed in favor of columns
column204: fixed bug where astype with equal dtype and copy=false would return a new object
column205: top-level pd.ordered_merge has been renamed to pd.merge_ordered and the original name will be removed in a future version
column206: bug in dataframe.groupby with grouper when there is a time change and grouping frequency is '1d'
column207: or with frequency as offset
column208: improved performance of dataframe.median with axis=1 when bottleneck is not installed
column209: dataframe.query and dataframe.eval now supports quoting column names with backticks to refer to names with spaces
column210: fixed regression in rollinggroupby with sort=false not being respected
column211: bug in pd.qcut with a single quantile and an array with identical values
column212: timestamp.min and timestamp.max now represent valid timestamp instances instead of the default datetime.min and datetime.max , thanks @sleepingpills
column213: compression defaults in hdf stores now follow pytables standards. default is no compression and if complib is missing and complevel > 0 zlib is used
column214: # replaced with empty char
column215: bug in series.replace when argument to_replace is of type dict/list and is used on a series containing <na> was raising a typeerror. the method now handles this by ignoring <na> values when doing the comparison for the replacement
column216: pandas.core.window.exponentialmovingwindow now supports a times argument that allows mean to be calculated with observations spaced by the timestamps in times
column217: holiday now raises notimplementederror if both offset and observance are used in the constructor instead of returning an incorrect result .
column218: series.plot and dataframe.plot now accepts xlabel and ylabel parameters to present labels on x and y axis .
column219: in particular, upsampling and taking the sum or product is affected, as upsampling introduces missing values even if the original series was entirely valid.
column220: note: the default behavior in 0.12 remains unchanged from prior versions, but starting with 0.13, the default to write and read multiindex columns will be in the new format.
column221: as using integer slices with .ix have different behavior depending on whether the slice is interpreted as position based or label based, it s usually better to be explicit and use .iloc or .loc.
column222: this is a major release from 0.12.0 and includes a number of api changes, several new features and enhancements along with a large number of bug fixes.
column223: index.droplevel is now implemented also for flat indexes, for compatibility with multiindex
column224: combining a categorical with integer categories and which contains missing values with a float dtype column in operations such as concat or append will now result in a float column instead of an object dtype column
column225: an undesired api breakage with functions taking the inplace option has been reverted and deprecation warnings added.
column226: bug in left and right align of series with multiindex may be inverted
column227: indexing with a list of labels, where one or more of the labels is missing, is deprecated and will raise a keyerror in a future version, see here.
column228: removed the previously deprecated ordered and categories keyword arguments in astype
column229: fixed regression in groupby.agg which was failing on frames with multiindex columns and a custom function
column230: bug in pd.unique for arrays with the datetime64 or timedelta64 dtype that meant an array with object dtype was returned instead the original dtype
column231: the data, base, strides, flags and itemsize properties of the series and index classes have been deprecated and will be removed in a future version .
column232: improved performance and reduced memory when indexing with a multiindex
column233: fixed an issue with a duplicate index and assignment with a dtype change
column234: read_html now rewinds seekable io objects after parse failure, before attempting to parse with a new parser. if a parser errors and the object is non-seekable, an informative error is raised suggesting the use of a different parser
column235: removed the previously deprecated keyword errors in timestamp.tz_localize, datetimeindex.tz_localize, and series.tz_localize
column236: note this disables the ability to read parquet files from directories on s3 again , which was added in the 1.0.4 release, but is now targeted for pandas 1.1.0.
column237: chained assignment will now by default warn if the user is assigning to a copy. this can be changed with the option mode.chained_assignment, allowed options are raise/warn/none. see the docs.
column238: series and index now support divmod which will return a tuple of series or indices. this behaves like a standard binary operator with regards to broadcasting rules .
column239: series.clip_lower, series.clip_upper, dataframe.clip_lower and dataframe.clip_upper are deprecated and will be removed in a future version. use series.clip, series.clip and the equivalent dataframe methods
column240: see dtypes and attributes and underlying data for more.
column241: see dtypes and attributes and underlying data for more.
column242: removed the previously deprecated select method of dataframe and series
column243: the dataframe.to_csv and dataframe.to_excel functions now takes argument columns instead of cols. a futurewarning is raised to alert that the old cols arguments will not be supported in a future release
column244: bug in dataframe.pivot_table which fails when the aggfunc arg is of type string. the behavior is now consistent with other methods like agg and apply
column245: addition and subtraction of integer or integer-dtype arrays with timestamp will now raise nullfrequencyerror instead of valueerror
column246: ...: # line_terminator does not work, and csv is saved with '\r\n'.
column247: this is a major release from 0.10.1 and includes many new features and enhancements along with a large number of bug fixes. the methods of selecting data have had quite a number of additions, and dtype support is now full-fledged. there are also a number of important api changes that long-time pandas users should pay close attention to.
column248: bug in dtypes being lost in dataframe.__invert__ with mixed dtypes and for extension-array backed series and dataframe
column249: new instance variables for calls and puts are automatically created when a method that creates them is called. this works for current month where the instance variables are simply calls and puts. also works for future expiry months and save the instance variable as callsmmyy or putsmmyy, where mmyy are, respectively, the month and year of the option s expiry.
column250: some new subpackages are created with public functionality that is not directly exposed in the top-level namespace: pandas.errors, pandas.plotting and pandas.testing . together with pandas.api.types and certain functions in the pandas.io and pandas.tseries submodules, these are now the public subpackages.
column251: categoricalindex.append with an index that contains non-category values will now cast instead of raising typeerror
column252: bug in dataframegroupby.transform would raise when used with axis=1 and a transformation kernel
column253: base should be replaced by offset.
column254: the rplot trellis plotting interface is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. we refer to external packages like seaborn for similar but more refined functionality . the documentation includes some examples how to convert your existing code from rplot to seaborn here.
column255: series.sortlevel and dataframe.sortlevel have been deprecated in favor of series.sort_index and dataframe.sort_index
column256: support for negative integer for pd.options.display.max_colwidth is deprecated in favor of using none
column257: this is a minor release from 0.7.2 and fixes many minor bugs and adds a number of nice new features. there are also a couple of api changes to note; these should not affect very many users, and we are inclined to call them bug fixes even though they do constitute a change in behavior. see the full release notes or issue tracker on github for a complete list.
column258: dataframe.combineadd and dataframe.combinemult are deprecated. they can easily be replaced by using the add and mul methods: dataframe.add and dataframe.mul .
column259: panel4d and panelnd constructors are deprecated and will be removed in a future version. the recommended way to represent these types of n-dimensional data are with the xarray package. pandas provides a to_xarray method to automate this conversion .
column260: fixed regression in dataframe.replace and series.replace where compiled regular expressions would be ignored during replacement
column261: bug in dataframe and series bar and barh plot raises typeerror when bottom and left keyword is specified
column262: this is a minor bug-fix release from 0.18.0 and includes a large number of bug fixes along with several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column263: selection with all keys found is unchanged.
column264: pandas has split off google bigquery support into a separate package pandas-gbq. you can conda install pandas-gbq -c conda-forge or pip install pandas-gbq to get it. the functionality of read_gbq and dataframe.to_gbq remain the same with the currently released version of pandas-gbq=0.1.4. documentation is now hosted here
column265: performance improvement when checking if values in a categorical are equal, equal or larger or larger than a given scalar. the improvement is not present if checking if the categorical is less than or less than or equal than the scalar
column266: fixed bug in dataframe.convert_dtypes for series with mix of integers and strings
column267: bug in constructing a sparsearray: if data is a scalar and index is defined it will coerce to float64 regardless of scalar s dtype.
column268: the differences in reindexing df with mi_2 and using method='backfill' can be seen here:
column269: dataframes with nullable integer, the new string dtype and period data type can now be converted to pyarrow , which means that it is supported in writing to the parquet file format when using the pyarrow engine . full roundtrip to parquet / read_parquet) is supported starting with pyarrow >= 0.16 .
column270: this restores the behavior of multiindex.get_indexer with method='backfill' or method='pad' to the behavior before pandas 0.23.0. in particular, multiindexes are treated as a list of tuples and padding or backfilling is done with respect to the ordering of these lists of tuples .
column271: bug in to_datetime where an uninformative runtimeerror was raised when passing a naive timestamp with datetime strings with mixed utc offsets
column272: timestamp.to_datetime has been deprecated in favor of timestamp.to_pydatetime
column273: transform now allows func to be pad, backfill and cumcount .
column274: the default for pd.to_datetime error handling has changed to errors='raise'. in prior versions it was errors='ignore'. furthermore, the coerce argument has been deprecated in favor of errors='coerce'. this means that invalid parsing will raise rather that return the original input as in previous versions.
column275: series and dataframe can now be created with allows_duplicate_labels=false flag to control whether the index or columns can contain duplicate labels . this can be used to prevent accidental introduction of duplicate labels, which can affect downstream operations.
column276: periodindex.to_datetime has been deprecated in favor of periodindex.to_timestamp
column277: bug in interval_range when start/periods or end/periods are specified with float start or end
column278: panel.shift now has a function signature that matches dataframe.shift. the old positional argument lags has been changed to a keyword argument periods with a default value of 1. a futurewarning is raised if the old argument lags is used by name.
column279: see dependencies and optional dependencies for more.
column280: see dependencies and optional dependencies for more.
column281: see dependencies and optional dependencies for more.
column282: see dependencies and optional dependencies for more.
column283: read_html now raises when no tables are found and beautifulsoup==4.2.0 is detected
column284: for datetimeindex and timedeltaindex with freq=none, addition or subtraction of integer-dtyped array or index will raise nullfrequencyerror instead of typeerror
column285: bug in read_excel in which index_col=none was not being respected and parsing index columns anyway
column286: dataframe.interpolate uses the correct axis convention now. previously interpolating along columns lead to interpolation along indices and vice versa. furthermore interpolating with methods pad, ffill, bfill and backfill are identical to using these methods with dataframe.fillna
column287: the default for display.show_dimensions will now be truncate. this is consistent with how series display length.
column288: pandas.api.types.is_period is deprecated in favor of pandas.api.types.is_period_dtype
column289: read_excel has deprecated parse_cols in favor of usecols for consistency with read_csv
column290: the result of concat with a mix of sparse and dense series is a series with sparse values, rather than a sparseseries.
column291: bug in dataframe.plot draws points and errorbars with different colors when the color is specified by c keyword
column292: fixed regression in to_json failing to use compression with url-like paths that are internally opened in binary mode or with user-provided file objects that are opened in binary mode
column293: to_csv supports file handles in binary mode with encoding and compression . if pandas does not automatically detect whether the file handle is opened in binary or text mode, it is necessary to provide mode="wb".
column294: sparseseries, sparsedataframe and the dataframe.to_sparse method have been removed . we recommend using a series or dataframe with sparse values instead. see migrating for help with migrating existing code.
column295: dataframe.consolidate and series.consolidate have been removed
column296: new datetimeindex class supports both fixed frequency and irregular time series. replaces now deprecated daterange class
column297: the method and axis arguments of dataframe.replace are deprecated
column298: we have also deprecated and changed similar methods in two series-like classes, index and categorical.
column299: the pd.read_json and dataframe.to_json has gained support for reading and writing json lines with lines option see line delimited json
column300: some of the existing functions or function aliases have been deprecated and will be removed in future versions. this includes: tquery, uquery, read_frame, frame_query, write_frame.
column301: dataframe.melt accepting a value_name that already exists is deprecated, and will be removed in a future version
column302: now, when apply is called on an empty dataframe: if the reduce argument is true a series will returned, if it is false a dataframe will be returned, and if it is none the function being applied will be called with an empty series to try and guess the return type.
column303: bug in series constructor with categorical where a valueerror is not raised when an index of different length is given
column304: the pandas.rpy interface is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. similar functionality can be accessed through the rpy2 project
column305: the pandas.sandbox.qtpandas interface is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. we refer users to the external package pandas-qt.
column306: the default column names when header=none and no columns names passed to functions like read_csv has changed to be more pythonic and amenable to attribute access:
column307: initialising an empty pandas.series without specifying a dtype will raise a deprecationwarning now . the default dtype will change from float64 to object in future releases so that it is consistent with the behaviour of dataframe and index.
column308: raise importerror in the sql functions when sqlalchemy is not installed and a connection string is used .
column309: split tests into cases for cpython and pypy where needed, which highlights the fragility of index matching with float, np.nan and nat
column310: inspired by dplyr s mutate verb, dataframe has a new assign method. the function signature for assign is simply **kwargs. the keys are the column names for the new fields, and the values are either a value to be inserted , or a function of one argument to be called on the dataframe. the new values are inserted, and the entire dataframe is returned.
column311: periodindex now has its own period dtype, and changed to be more consistent with other index classes. see here
column312: pandas.api.types.categoricaldtype has been added to the public api and expanded to include the categories and ordered attributes. a categoricaldtype can be used to specify the set of categories and orderedness of an array, independent of the data. this can be useful for example, when converting string data to a categorical :
column313: this is a minor release from 0.15.1 and includes a large number of bug fixes along with several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements. a small number of api changes were necessary to fix existing bugs. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column314: refactor rename methods to core/generic.py; fixes series.rename for , and adds rename with the same signature for panel
column315: panel is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. the recommended way to represent 3-d data are with a multiindex on a dataframe via the to_frame or with the xarray package. pandas provides a to_xarray method to automate this conversion .
column316: this change breaks rpy2<=2.3.8. an issue has been opened against rpy2 and a workaround is detailed in gh5698. thanks @janschulz.
column317: you will get a deprecation warning in the 0.10.x series, and the deprecated functionality will be removed in 0.11 or later.
column318: we ve added a key argument to the dataframe and series sorting methods, including dataframe.sort_values, dataframe.sort_index, series.sort_values, and series.sort_index. the key can be any callable function which is applied column-by-column to each column used for sorting, before sorting is performed . see sort_values with keys and sort_index with keys for more information.
column319: where clauses in pytables are only accepted as strings and expressions types and not other data-types
column320: pd.read_msgpack now supports serializing and de-serializing categoricals with msgpack
column321: in order to promote more consistency among the pandas api, we have added additional top-level functions isna and notna that are aliases for isnull and notnull. the naming scheme is now more consistent with methods like .dropna and .fillna. furthermore in all cases where .isnull and .notnull methods are defined, these have additional methods named .isna and .notna, these are included for classes categorical, index, series, and dataframe. .
column322: dataframe.to_sql has deprecated the flavor parameter, as it is superfluous when sqlalchemy is not installed
column323: default sorting algorithm for series.order is now quicksort, to conform with series.sort
column324: previously assignments, .where and .fillna with a bool assignment, would coerce to same the type , or raise for datetimelikes. these will now preserve the bools with object dtypes. .
column325: series.copy no longer accepts the order parameter and is now consistent with ndframe copy
column326: bug in to_datetime with utc=true and datetime strings that would apply previously parsed utc offsets to subsequent arguments
column327: bug in using numpy ufunc with periodindex to add or subtract integer raise incompatiblefrequency. note that using standard operator like + or - is recommended, because standard operators use more efficient path
column328: option data frames are now saved on the instance as callsyymmdd or putsyymmdd. previously they were saved as callsmmyy and putsmmyy. the next expiry is saved as calls and puts.
column329: plotting with error bars is now supported in the .plot method of dataframe and series objects , see the docs.
column330: transform and aggregate have gained engine and engine_kwargs arguments that support executing functions with numba
column331: multiindex.set_labels has been deprecated in favor of multiindex.set_codes.
column332: in earlier versions of pandas, if a bool was passed the header argument of read_csv, read_excel, or read_html it was implicitly converted to an integer, resulting in header=0 for false and header=1 for true
column333: constructing a multiindex with nan levels or codes value < -1 was allowed previously. now, construction with codes value < -1 is not allowed and nan levels corresponding codes would be reassigned as -1.
column334: categorical.is_dtype_equal and categoricalindex.is_dtype_equal are deprecated, will be removed in a future version
column335: sparsearray, the array backing sparseseries and the columns in a sparsedataframe, is now an extension array . to conform to this interface and for consistency with the rest of pandas, some api breaking changes were made:
column336: option to .info and .memory_usage to provide for deep introspection of memory consumption. note that this can be expensive to compute and therefore is an optional parameter.
column337: paths beginning with ~ will now be expanded to begin with the user s home directory
column338: multiindex.get_loc_level will now raise a keyerror, rather than returning an empty slice, if asked a label which is present in the levels but is unused
column339: bug where merge was unable to join on categorical and extension dtype columns
column340: bug in .groupby.rolling when on is specified and using a datetimeindex
column341: wrote fast time series merging / joining methods in cython. will be integrated later into dataframe.join and related functions
column343: bug in dataframe.rank and series.rank when method='dense' and pct=true in which percentile ranks were not being used with the number of distinct observations
column344: to replace all occurrences of the string '.' with zero or more instances of surrounding white space with nan.
column345: bug in datetimeindex.__contains__ when index has duplicates and is not monotonic increasing
column346: the default column names for a file with no header have been changed to the integers 0 through n - 1. this is to create consistency with the dataframe constructor with no columns specified. the v0.9.0 behavior can be reproduced by specifying prefix='x':
column347: bug in dataframe.combine_first when used with multiindex containing string and nan values raises typeerror
column348: pd.expanding_apply and pd.rolling_apply now take args and kwargs that are passed on to the func
column349: bug in read_excel when parse_cols is specified with an empty dataset
column350: dataframe.style.bar now accepts two more options to further customize the bar chart. bar alignment is set with align='left'|'mid'|'zero', the default is left , which is backward compatible; you can now pass a list of color=.
column351: timestamp.day_name and datetimeindex.day_name are now available to return day names with a specified locale
column352: bugs in pd.to_datetime when passing a unit with convertible entries and errors='coerce' or non-convertible with errors='ignore'. furthermore, an outofboundsdateime exception will be raised when an out-of-range value is encountered for that unit when errors='raise'.
column353: removed private_key and verbose from read_gbq as they are no longer supported in pandas-gbq
column354: comparison with sql, which should be useful for those familiar with sql but still learning pandas.
column355: bug in dataframe.join which does an outer instead of a left join when being called with multiple dataframes and some have non-unique indices
column356: dataframe.itertuples now works with frames with duplicate column names
column357: fix dataframe.memory_usage to support pypy. objects on pypy do not have a fixed size, so an approximation is used instead
column358: the broadcast parameter of .apply is deprecated in favor of result_type='broadcast'
column359: bug in series.__setitem__ incorrectly assigning values with boolean indexer when the length of new data matches the number of true values and new data is not a series or an np.array
column360: bug in categorical and categoricalindex with interval values when using the in operator with objects that are not comparable to the values in the interval
column361: categorical.searchsorted and series.searchsorted have deprecated the v parameter in favor of value
column362: pd.timedelta is now accepted and will return nat, mirroring pd.timestamp
column363: fixed an issue where periodindex joining with self was returning a new instance rather than the same instance ; also adds a test for this for the other index types
column364: bug when grouping by a single column and aggregating with a class like list or tuple
column365: pandas.merge and dataframe.merge will show a specific error message when trying to merge with an object that is not of type dataframe or a subclass
column366: addition and subtraction of nan from a series with dtype='timedelta64' will raise a typeerror instead of treating the nan as nat
column367: addition and subtraction of int or integer-arrays is no longer allowed in timestamp, datetimeindex, timedeltaindex, use obj + n * obj.freq instead of obj + n
column368: other indexers will coerce to a like integer for both getting and setting. the futurewarning has been dropped for .loc, .ix and .
column369: bug in dataframe.apply with functions that used *args or **kwargs and returned an empty result
column370: we introduce a categoricalindex, a new type of index object that is useful for supporting indexing with duplicates. this is a container around a categorical and allows efficient indexing and storage of an index with a large number of duplicated elements. prior to 0.16.1, setting the index of a dataframe/series with a category dtype would convert this to regular object-based index.
column371: this is a minor release from 0.10.0 and includes new features, enhancements, and bug fixes. in particular, there is substantial new hdfstore functionality contributed by jeff reback.
column372: bug in date_range where ambiguous or nonexistent start or end times were not handled by the ambiguous or nonexistent keywords respectively
column373: removed the previously deprecated keywords how , fill_method , and limit from dataframe.resample
column374: period is now immutable, and will now raise an attributeerror when a user tries to assign a new value to the ordinal or freq attributes .
column375: but for consistency with the all-nan case, this was changed to return nan as well:
column376: fixed regression that prevented rgb and rgba tuples from being used as color arguments
column377: please note that the string index is not supported with the round trip format, as it is used by default in write_json to indicate a missing index name.
column378: default for display.max_seq_len is now 100 rather than none. this activates truncated display of long sequences in various places.
column379: bug fix in apply when using custom function and objects are not mutated
column380: duplicate indexes with and empty dataframe.from_records will return a correct frame
column381: bug in datetimeindex, timedeltaindex and periodindex.equals may return true when input isn t index but contains the same values
column382: bug in datetimeindex and timedeltaindex where setting the freq attribute was not fully supported
column383: this is unchanged from prior versions, but shown for illustration purposes:
column384: read_csv was closing user-provided binary file handles when engine="c" and an encoding was requested
column385: bug in pd.series.rolling.skew and rolling.kurt with all equal values has floating issue
column386: bug in pandas.core.resample.resampler.size and pandas.core.resample.resampler.count returning wrong dtype when used with an empty series or dataframe
column387: read_excel now raises a valueerror when input is of type pandas.io.excel.excelfile and engine param is passed since pandas.io.excel.excelfile has an engine defined
column388: the get_dummies method can now be used on dataframes. by default only categorical columns are encoded as 0 s and 1 s, while other columns are left untouched.
column389: bug in fy5253quarter, lastweekofmonth where rollback and rollforward behavior was inconsistent with addition and subtraction behavior
column390: bug where some inplace operators were not being wrapped and produced a copy when invoked
column391: the categorical.labels attribute was renamed to categorical.codes and is read only. if you want to manipulate codes, please use one of the api methods on categoricals.
column392: will warn with a attributeconflictwarning if you are attempting to append an index with a different frequency than the existing, or attempting to append an index with a different name than the existing
column393: dataframe.mean and dataframe.median with numeric_only=none will include datetime64 and datetime64tz columns in a future version
column394: fixes bug where indexing with np.inf caused an overflowerror to be raised
column395: the infer_types argument to read_html now has no effect and is deprecated .
column396: cparsererror has been renamed to parsererror in pd.read_csv and will be removed in the future
column397: bug in pd.read_csv when an index was specified and no values were specified as null values
column398: removed the previously deprecated keyword encoding from read_stata and dataframe.to_stata
