column399: bug in dataframe.max and dataframe.min with axis=1 where a series with nan would be returned when all columns contained the same timezone
column400: apache parquet provides a cross-language, binary file format for reading and writing data frames efficiently. parquet is designed to faithfully serialize and de-serialize dataframe s, supporting all of the pandas dtypes, including extension dtypes such as datetime with timezones.
column401: removed the previously deprecated dataframe.from.csv and series.from_csv
column403: pandas.core.index has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version, the public classes are available in the top-level namespace
column404: bug in to_datetime which would raise valueerror: tz-aware datetime.datetime cannot be converted to datetime64 unless utc=true when called with cache=true, with arg including datetime strings with different offset
column405: the options display.latex.escape and display.latex.longtable have also been added to the configuration and are used automatically by the to_latex method. see the available options docs for more info.
column406: bug in dataframe when initiating a frame with lists and assign columns with nested list for multiindex
column407: additionally mean supports execution via numba with the engine and engine_kwargs arguments. numba must be installed as an optional dependency to use this feature.
column408: is_any_int_dtype, is_floating_dtype, and is_sequence are deprecated from pandas.api.types
column409: bug in series.plot and dataframe.plot was throwing a valueerror when the series or dataframe was indexed by a timedeltaindex with a fixed frequency and the x-axis lower limit was greater than the upper limit
column410: creating a tick object with normalize=true is no longer supported. this prevents unexpected behavior where addition could fail to be monotone or associative.
column411: one of the potentially riskiest api changes in 0.7.0, but also one of the most important, was a complete review of how integer indexes are handled with regard to label-based indexing. here is an example:
column412: added get_value and set_value methods to series, dataframe, and panel for very low-overhead access to scalar elements . set_value is capable of producing an enlarged object.
column413: there was bug in read_excel and read_csv with the python engine, where missing values turned to 'nan' with dtype=str and na_filter=true. now, these missing values are converted to the string missing indicator, np.nan.
column414: intervalindex.from_intervals is deprecated in favor of the intervalindex constructor
column415: this is a major release from 0.9.1 and includes many new features and enhancements along with a large number of bug fixes. there are also a number of important api changes that long-time pandas users should pay close attention to.
column416: dataframe.corr and series.corr now raise a valueerror along with a helpful error message instead of a keyerror when supplied with an invalid method
column417: removal of support for positional indexing with floats, which was deprecated since 0.14.0. this will now raise a typeerror, see here.
column418: performance improvements in multiindex.duplicated by working with labels instead of values
column419: the exception pandas.core.common.ambiguousindexerror is removed as it is not referenced
column420: the parallel_coordinates and andrews_curves functions now take positional argument frame instead of data. a futurewarning is raised if the old data argument is used by name.
column421: the parallel_coordinates and andrews_curves functions now take positional argument frame instead of data. a futurewarning is raised if the old data argument is used by name.
column422: interval and period data may now be stored in a series or dataframe, in addition to an intervalindex and periodindex like previously .
column423: bug in to_datetime where passing an out-of-bounds datetime with errors='coerce' and utc=true would raise outofboundsdatetime instead of parsing to nat
column424: this is a combined release for 0.20.0 and 0.20.1. version 0.20.1 contains one additional change for backwards-compatibility with downstream projects using pandas utils routines.
column425: bug in dataframe.apply where, when supplied with a string argument and additional positional or keyword arguments ), a typeerror was wrongly raised
column426: sparsearray.dtype and sparseseries.dtype are now instances of sparsedtype, rather than np.dtype. access the underlying dtype with sparsedtype.subtype.
column427: bug in categorical.__setitem__ not allowing setting with another categorical when both are unordered and have the same categories, but in a different order
column428: bug in datetimeindex addition and subtraction with some types of dateoffset objects incorrectly retaining an invalid freq attribute
column429: bug in week with weekday incorrectly raising attributeerror instead of typeerror when adding or subtracting an invalid type
column430: bug in astype where inf values were incorrectly converted to integers. now raises error now with astype for series and dataframes
column431: bug in pd.to_datetime raise attributeerror with nan and the other string is not valid when errors='ignore'
column432: dataframe.xs now raises a typeerror if a level keyword is supplied and the axis is not a multiindex. previously an attributeerror was raised
column433: custombusinessmonthbegin and custombusinessmonthend are now available
column434: fixed bug in unique handled signed zeros inconsistently: for some inputs 0.0 and -0.0 were treated as equal and for some inputs as different. now they are treated as equal for all inputs
column435: bug in datetimeindex and timedeltaindex addition and subtraction where name of the returned object was not always set consistently.
column436: in version 0.18.0, a new inplace keyword was added to choose whether the assignment should be done inplace or return a copy.
column437: warnings against the obsolete usage categorical, which were emitted for instance when the first two arguments to categorical had different dtypes, and recommended the use of categorical.from_codes, have now been removed
column438: pd.read_csv now supports opening files using xz compression, via extension inference or explicit compression='xz' is specified; xz compressions is also supported by dataframe.to_csv in the same way
column439: a valueerror is now raised instead of a generic exception in read_csv when true_values is specified, and the c engine encounters an element in a column containing unencodable bytes
column440: series.is_time_series is dropped in favor of series.index.is_all_dates
column441: bug in .to_json for the c engine where rollover was not correctly handled for case where frac is odd and diff is exactly 0.5
column442: .isnull and .notnull have been added to index object to make them more consistent with the series api
column443: bug in to_datetime which would raise invalidindexerror: reindexing only valid with uniquely valued index objects when called with cache=true, with arg including at least two different elements from the set {none, numpy.nan, pandas.nat}
column444: deprecated indexing dataframe rows with a single datetime-like string as df , use df.loc instead
column445: bug in dataframe.plot when x and y arguments given as positions caused incorrect referenced columns for line, bar and area plots
column446: indexing with __getitem__/.iloc/.loc/.ix works similarly to an index with duplicates. the indexers must be in the category or the operation will raise.
column448: pd.to_datetime and pd.to_timedelta have dropped the coerce parameter in favor of errors
column449: bug in series with dtype='timedelta64' where addition or subtraction of timedeltaindex could return a series with an incorrect name
column450: bug in datetimearray, timedeltaarray, and periodarray where inplace addition and subtraction did not actually operate inplace
column451: infer and downcast dtype if downcast='infer' is passed to fillna/ffill/bfill
column452: pandas.io.json.json_normalize has gained a sep option that accepts str to separate joined fields; the default is . , which is backward compatible.
column453: # and missing values will be treated as zeros.
column454: bug in class:~pandas.io.stata.statareader not converting date/time columns with display formatting addressed . previously columns with display formatting were normally left as ordinal numbers and not converted to datetime objects.
column455: if you wish to do indexing with sequences and slicing on an integer index with label semantics, use ix.
column456: periodindex now supports arithmetic with np.ndarray
column457: bug in sparsearray indexing with tuples are not handled properly
column458: the pandas 1.0 release removed a lot of functionality that was deprecated in previous releases . it is recommended to first upgrade to pandas 0.25 and to ensure your code is working without warnings, before upgrading to pandas 1.0.
column459: the following methods and options are added to index, to be more consistent with the series and dataframe api.
column460: note that column 'c' was not converted - only scalar numeric types will be converted to a new type. other types of conversion should be accomplished using the to_numeric function , to_timedelta).
column461: a new pd.na value is introduced to represent scalar missing values. up to now, pandas used several values to represent missing data: np.nan is used for this for float data, np.nan or none for object-dtype data and pd.nat for datetime-like data. the goal of pd.na is to provide a missing indicator that can be used consistently across data types. pd.na is currently used by the nullable integer and boolean data types and the new string data type .
column462: rename factor to categorical and add a number of usability features
column463: the series.select and dataframe.select methods are deprecated in favor of using df.loc
column464: the deprecated dataframe.iterkv has been removed in favor of dataframe.iteritems
column465: bug in series construction of mixed type with datelike and an integer
column466: minor change to select and remove: require a table only if where is also provided
column467: select now supports passing start and stop to provide selection space limiting in selection.
column468: bug in dataframe.xs when used with indexslice raises typeerror with message "expected label or tuple of labels"
column469: label-based slicing using ix now requires that the index be sorted unless both the start and endpoint are contained in the index:
column470: series.argmin and series.argmax will now raise a typeerror when used with object dtypes, instead of a valueerror
column471: bug in pandas.plotting.bootstrap_plot was causing cluttered axes and overlapping labels
column472: bug in panel when using major_xs and copy=false is passed .
column473: removed the previously deprecated keyword index from read_stata, statareader, and statareader.read, use index_col instead
column474: the delimited file parsing engine has been rewritten from the ground up and now uses a fraction the amount of memory while parsing, while being 40% or more faster in most use cases .
column475: this release includes a few new features, performance enhancements, and over 30 bug fixes from 0.8.0. new features include notably na friendly string processing functionality and a series of new plot types and options.
column476: dataframes with numerical or datetime indices are now sorted prior to plotting
column477: the options html.border and mode.use_inf_as_null were deprecated in prior versions, these will now show futurewarning rather than a deprecationwarning
column478: arithmetic operations with only bool dtypes now give a warning indicating that they are evaluated in python space for +, -, and * operations and raise for all others
column479: removed the warn argument from open. instead a possibledatalosserror exception will be raised if you try to use mode='w' with an open file handle
column480: fixed an issue with dataframe.sort_index where, when sorting by a single column and passing a list for ascending, the argument for ascending was being interpreted as true
column481: series accessors .dt, .cat and .str now raise attributeerror instead of typeerror if the series does not contain the appropriate type of data . this follows python s built-in exception hierarchy more closely and ensures that tests like hasattr are consistent on both python 2 and 3.
column482: bug in transform causing length mismatch when null entries were present and a fast aggregator was being used
column483: fixed regression in read_csv with more than 1m rows and specifying a index_col argument
column484: non-convertible dates in an excel date column will be returned without conversion and the column will be object dtype, rather than raising an exception .
column485: added optional ddof argument to expanding_cov and rolling_cov. the default value of 1 is backwards-compatible.
column486: dataframe.items and series.items are now present in both python 2 and 3 and is lazy in all cases.
column487: removed the previously deprecated keyword n from datetimeindex.shift, timedeltaindex.shift, periodindex.shift, use periods instead
column488: bug in series.nunique with dropna=true was returning incorrect results when both na and none missing values were present
column489: index with object dtype supports division and multiplication
column490: improved performance of iso 8601 date parsing for dates without separators , leading zeros and with white space preceding the time zone
column491: bug in hiding ticklabels with subplots and shared axes when adding a new plot to an existing grid of axes
column492: attempting to use the xlwt engine will raise a futurewarning unless the option io.excel.xls.writer is set to "xlwt". while this option is now deprecated and will also raise a futurewarning, it can be globally set and the warning suppressed. users are recommended to write .xlsx files using the openpyxl engine instead.
column493: bug in index created with tz-aware timestamp and mismatched tz option incorrectly coerces timezone
column494: the deprecated longpanel class has been completely removed
column495: compatibility with pypy in read_csv with usecols= and read_json
column496: bug in selection from a hdfstore with a fixed format and start and/or stop specified will now return the selected range
column497: removed the previously deprecated keyword by from dataframe.sort_index, use dataframe.sort_values instead
column498: for datetimeindex and timedeltaindex with non-none freq attribute, addition or subtraction of integer-dtyped array or index will return an object of the same class
column499: indexing a multiindex or a floatindex with a list containing some missing keys will now show a futurewarning, which is consistent with other types of indexes .
column500: bug in series.hasnans that could be incorrectly cached and return incorrect answers if null elements are introduced after an initial call
column501: previously, the behaviour on resetting the time or not in offsets.apply, rollforward and rollback operations differed between offsets. with the support of the normalize keyword for all offsets with a default value of false , the behaviour changed for certain offsets :
column502: series.argmin and series.argmax are now aliased to series.idxmin and series.idxmax. these return the index of the
column503: fixed bug in series construction with ea dtype and index but no data or scalar data fails
column504: read_csv/read_table will now be noisier w.r.t invalid options rather than falling back to the pythonparser.
column505: repr of categorical was not distinguishing between int and str
column506: bug in series.isin with perioddtype dtype and periodindex.isin failing to consider arguments with different perioddtype as always different
column507: # common elements are now guaranteed to be ordered by the left side
column508: nat and timedelta have expanded arithmetic operations, which are extended to series arithmetic where applicable. operations defined for datetime64 or timedelta64 are now also defined for nat .
column509: bug in datetimeindex and timedeltaindex where adding or subtracting an array-like of dateoffset objects either raised or broadcast incorrectly
column510: removed the previously deprecated keyword raise_conflict from dataframe.update, use errors instead
column511: dataframe.plot now recognizes xlabel and ylabel arguments for plots of type scatter and hexbin
column512: bug in plotting if sharex was enabled and index was a timeseries, would show labels on multiple axes .
column513: named aggregation is the recommended replacement for the deprecated dict-of-dicts approach to naming the output of column-specific aggregations with a dictionary when renaming).
column514: we haven t removed or deprecated series.values or dataframe.values, but we highly recommend and using .array or .to_numpy instead.
column515: division operations on index and subclasses will now fill division of positive numbers by zero with np.inf, division of negative numbers by zero with -np.inf and 0 / 0 with np.nan. this matches existing series behavior.
column516: using a single function is equivalent to .apply.
column517: fixed bug in pandas.read_excel producing incorrect results when the engine openpyxl is used and the excel file is missing or has incorrect dimension information; the fix requires openpyxl >= 3.0.0, prior versions may still fail
column518: sparsedataframe.combine and dataframe.combine_first no longer supports combining a sparse column with a dense column while preserving the sparse subtype. the result will be an object-dtype sparsearray.
column519: the format keyword now replaces the table keyword; allowed values are fixed or table the same defaults as prior < 0.13.0 remain, e.g. put implies fixed format and append implies table format. this default format can be set as an option by setting io.hdf.default_format.
column520: series.astype and index.astype with an incompatible dtype will now raise a typeerror rather than a valueerror
column521: in previous versions, showing .memory_usage on a pandas structure that has an index, would only include actual index values and not include structures that facilitated fast indexing. this will generally be different for index and multiindex and less-so for other index types.
column522: starting in v0.17.0, comparing index objects of different lengths will raise a valueerror. this is to be consistent with the behavior of series.
column523: the convert_datetime64 parameter in dataframe.to_records has been deprecated and will be removed in a future version. the numpy bug motivating this parameter has been resolved. the default value for this parameter has also changed from true to none .
column524: read_pickle, dataframe.to_pickle and series.to_pickle can now read from and write to compressed pickle files. compression methods can be an explicit parameter or be inferred from the file extension. see the docs here.
column525: bug in pd.cut with negative values and a single bin
column526: tolerance is also exposed by the lower level index.get_indexer and index.get_loc methods.
column527: add a limit_direction keyword argument that works with limit to enable interpolate to fill nan values forward, backward, or both
column528: bug in dataframe.agg and series.agg with aggregating on non-callable attributes
column529: datetime.timezone objects are now supported as arguments to timezone methods and constructors
column530: pd.timegrouper is deprecated in favor of pandas.grouper
column531: raises a helpful exception when a non-numeric index is sent to interpolate with methods which require numeric index.
column532: fixed regression in dataframe.resample.apply raised attributeerror when input was a dataframe and only a series was evaluated
column533: removed the previously deprecated keyword data from parallel_coordinates, use frame instead
column534: pickle compatibility is preserved for pickles created prior to 0.13. these must be unpickled with pd.read_pickle, see pickling.
column535: a series of dtype=category constructed from an empty dict will now have categories of dtype=object rather than dtype=float64, consistently with the case in which an empty list is passed
column536: index.get_indexer_non_unique now returns a ndarray indexer rather than an index; this is consistent with index.get_indexer
column537: the out and mode parameters are now longer accepted .
column538: we are adding an implementation that natively supports datetime with timezones. a series or a dataframe column previously could be assigned a datetime with timezones, and would work as an object dtype. this had performance issues with a large number rows. see the docs for more details. .
column539: bug in indexing with a scalar and a categoricalindex
column540: max_rows and max_cols parameters removed from htmlformatter since truncation is handled by dataframeformatter
column541: bug in index raises keyerror displaying incorrect column when column is not in the df and columns contains duplicate values
column542: bug in where when dtype is datetime64/timedelta64, but dtype of other is not
column543: in a typical time-series example, we have trades and quotes and we want to asof-join them. this also illustrates using the by parameter to group data before merging.
column544: series, dataframes, and panels now have a new method: sample. the method accepts a specific number of rows or columns to return, or a fraction of the total number or rows or columns. it also has options for sampling with or without replacement, for passing in a column for weights for non-uniform sampling, and for setting seed values to facilitate replication.
column545: dataframe.replace now supports the method parameter, which can be used to specify the replacement method when to_replace is a scalar, list or tuple and value is none
column546: indexing a dataframe or series with a datetimeindex with a date string with a utc offset would previously ignore the utc offset. now, the utc offset is respected in indexing.
column547: duplicate indexes with getitem will return items in the correct order and handle missing elements like unique indices
column548: dataframe and series now properly handle numpy masked arrays with hardened masks. previously, constructing a dataframe or series from a masked array with a hard mask would create a pandas object containing the underlying value, rather than the expected nan.
column549: the sparseseries and sparsedataframe subclasses are deprecated. their functionality is better-provided by a series or dataframe with sparse values.
column550: bug in pd.read_csv for the python engine in which an unhelpful error message was being raised when multi-char delimiters were not being respected with quotes
column551: series.droplevel and dataframe.droplevel are now implemented
column552: created a new block type in internals, sparseblock, which can hold multi-dtypes and is non-consolidatable. sparseseries and sparsedataframe now inherit more methods from there hierarchy , and no longer inherit from sparsearray
column553: unique no longer mangles nan-floats and the nat-object for np.object-dtype, i.e. nat is no longer coerced to a nan-value and is treated as a different entity.
column554: series.set_axis and dataframe.set_axis now require labels as the first argument and axis as an optional named parameter
column555: bug in series.is_unique where extraneous output in stderr is shown if series contains objects with __ne__ defined
column556: bug in dataframe.crosstab when margins set to true and normalize is not false, an error is raised.
column557: bug in nanops.var with ddof=1 and 1 elements would sometimes return inf rather than nan on some platforms
column558: timestamp.offset property , has been deprecated in favor of freq
column559: categorical.unique now returns new categoricals with categories and codes that are unique, rather than returning np.array
column560: calling pandas.core.groupby.groupby.rank with empty groups and pct=true was raising a zerodivisionerror
column561: in 0.15.0 index has internally been refactored to no longer sub-class ndarray but instead subclass pandasobject, similarly to the rest of the pandas objects. this change allows very easy sub-classing and creation of new index types. this should be a transparent change with only very limited api implications :
column562: slicing is always on the values of the index, for ,ix,loc and always positional with iloc
column563: pandas.tseries.frequencies.to_offset s freqstr keyword is deprecated in favor of freq
column564: bug in series.loc and dataframe.loc raises when the index was of object dtype and the given numeric label was in the index
column565: the implementation of dataframegroupby.apply previously evaluated the supplied function consistently twice on the first group to infer if it is safe to use a fast code path. particularly for functions with side effects, this was an undesired behavior and may have led to surprises.
column566: grouping by a categorical and summing now returns 0 instead of nan for categories with no observations. the product now returns 1 instead of nan.
column567: this is a major release from 0.7.3 and includes extensive work on the time series handling and processing infrastructure as well as a great deal of new functionality throughout the library. it includes over 700 commits from more than 20 distinct authors. most pandas 0.7.3 and earlier users should not experience any issues upgrading, but due to the migration to the numpy datetime64 dtype, there may be a number of bugs and incompatibilities lurking. lingering incompatibilities will be fixed asap in a 0.8.1 release if necessary. see the full release notes or issue tracker on github for a complete list.
column568: bug in to_datetime which would raise an valueerror when called with a date far into the future and the format argument specified instead of raising outofboundsdatetime
column569: add flexible replace method for efficiently substituting values
column570: fixed regression in read_excel that incorrectly raised when the argument io was a non-path and non-buffer and the engine argument was specified
column571: improved pandas.core.window.rolling, pandas.core.window.window and pandas.core.window.exponentialmovingwindow functions to exclude nuisance columns from results instead of raising errors and raise a dataerror only if all columns are nuisance
column572: consistency when introducing code samples, using either colon or period. rewrote some sentences for greater clarity, added more dynamic references to functions, methods and classes.
column573: improved performance of .clip with scalar arguments
column574: pd.timeseries was deprecated officially in 0.17.0, though has already been an alias since 0.13.0. it has been dropped in favor of pd.series. .
column575: numexpr is now a recommended dependencies, to accelerate certain types of numerical and boolean operations
column577: improved performance of sparse arithmetic with blockindex when the number of blocks are large, though recommended to use intindex in such cases
column578: bug in dataframe.to_dict raises valueerror when used with orient='index' and a non-unique index instead of losing data
column579: and optional groups can also be used.
column580: pandas.util.compat and pandas.util.py3compat have been merged into pandas.compat. pandas.compat now includes many functions allowing 2/3 compatibility. it contains both list and iterator versions of range, filter, map and zip, plus other necessary elements for python 3 compatibility. lmap, lzip, lrange and lfilter all produce lists instead of iterators, for compatibility with numpy, subscripting and pandas constructors.
column581: series & dataframe have been enhanced to support the aggregation api. this is a familiar api from groupby, window operations, and resampling. this allows aggregation operations in a concise way by using agg and transform. the full documentation is here .
column582: pd.unique will now be consistent with extension types
column583: pd.unique will now be consistent with extension types
column584: removed the previously deprecated keywords start , end , and periods from the datetimeindex, timedeltaindex, and periodindex constructors; use date_range, timedelta_range, and period_range instead
column585: bug in series with numeric dtype when adding or subtracting an array or series with timedelta64 dtype
column586: as part of making pandas api more uniform and accessible in the future, we have created a standard sub-package of pandas, pandas.api to hold public api s. we are starting by exposing type introspection functions in pandas.api.types. more sub-packages and officially sanctioned api s will be published in future versions of pandas
column587: describe on a dataframe with a mix of timestamp and string like objects returns a different index . previously the index was unintentionally sorted.
column588: added sparseseries.to_coo and sparseseries.from_coo methods for converting to and from scipy.sparse.coo_matrix instances . for example, given a sparseseries with multiindex we can convert to a scipy.sparse.coo_matrix by specifying the row and column labels as index levels:
column589: the default value for the return_type parameter for dataframe.plot.box and dataframe.boxplot changed from none to "axes". these methods will now return a matplotlib axes by default instead of a dictionary of artists. see here .
column590: bug in datetimeindex and timedeltaindex where indexing with ellipsis would incorrectly lose the index s freq attribute
column591: improved error message when using frac > 1 and replace = false
column592: dataframe.rename_axis now supports index and columns arguments and series.rename_axis supports index argument .
column593: this is a major release from 0.19.2 and includes a number of api changes, deprecations, new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column594: series and index now internally share more common operations, e.g. factorize,nunique,value_counts are now supported on index types as well. the series.weekday property from is removed from series for api consistency. using a datetimeindex/periodindex method on a series will now raise a typeerror. .
column595: dataframe or series: draw matplotlib.table using the passed data. the data will be drawn as displayed in print method . also, helper function pandas.tools.plotting.table is added to create a table from dataframe and series, and add it to an matplotlib.axes.
column596: the dataframe.interpolate keyword downcast default has been changed from infer to none. this is to preserve the original dtype unless explicitly requested otherwise .
column597: stringdtype is currently considered experimental. the implementation and parts of the api may change without warning.
column598: time series data are now represented using numpy s datetime64 dtype; thus, pandas 0.8.0 now requires at least numpy 1.6. it has been tested and verified to work with the development version of numpy as well which includes some significant user-facing api changes. numpy 1.6 also has a number of bugs having to do with nanosecond resolution data, so i recommend that you steer clear of numpy 1.6 s datetime64 api functions and only interact with this data using the interface that pandas provides.
column599: bug in dataframe.reset_index was incorrectly raising a valueerror for input with a multiindex with missing values in a level with categorical dtype
column600: datetimeindex.unique now returns a datetimeindex with the same name and
column601: bug in index construction with nan elements and integer dtype specified
column602: bug in c csv parser causing spurious nans when data started with newline followed by white space.
column603: the support for the mysql flavor when using dbapi connection objects has been deprecated. mysql will be further supported with sqlalchemy engines .
column604: the support for the mysql flavor when using dbapi connection objects has been deprecated. mysql will be further supported with sqlalchemy engines .
column605: bug in series and dataframe with integer dtype failing to raise typeerror when adding or subtracting a np.datetime64 object
column606: in version 0.16.2 a dataframe with multiindex columns could not be written to excel via to_excel. that functionality has been added , along with updating read_excel so that the data can be read back with, no loss of information, by specifying which columns/rows make up the multiindex in the header and index_col parameters
column607: added proper, tested weighted least squares to standard and panel ols
column608: the reduce parameter of .apply is deprecated in favor of result_type='reduce'
column609: clarified documentation on interpolate with method=akima. the der parameter must be scalar or none
column610: fixed regression in groupby.sem where the presence of non-numeric columns would cause an error instead of being dropped
column611: bug in rolling.median and rolling.quantile returned wrong values for baseindexer subclasses with non-monotonic starting or ending points for windows
column612: removed the previously deprecated keyword colors from parallel_coordinates, use color instead
column613: fix a bug with ndframe.replace which made replacement appear as though it was using regular expressions .
column614: made both the c-based and python engines for read_csv and read_table ignore empty lines in input as well as white space-filled lines, as long as sep is not white space. this is an api change that can be controlled by the keyword parameter skip_blank_lines. see the docs
column615: note that missing values now propagate, rather than always comparing unequal like numpy.nan. see experimental na scalar to denote missing values for more.
column616: series.interpolate and dataframe.interpolate now raise a valueerror if limit_direction is 'forward' or 'both' and method is 'backfill' or 'bfill' or limit_direction is 'backward' or 'both' and method is 'pad' or 'ffill'
column617: series.truncate and dataframe.truncate will raise a valueerror if the index is not sorted instead of an unhelpful keyerror
column618: when read_csv is called with chunksize=n and without specifying an index, each chunk used to have an independently generated index from 0 to n-1. they are now given instead a progressive index, starting from 0 for the first chunk, from n for the second, and so on, so that, when concatenated, they are identical to the result of calling read_csv without the chunksize= argument .
column619: bug in .loc result with duplicated key may have index with incorrect dtype
column620: the order of the arguments of dataframe.to_html and dataframe.to_string is rearranged to be consistent with each other.
column621: bug in dataframe.pivot modified index argument when columns was passed but values was not
column622: in 0.15.0 index has internally been refactored to no longer sub-class ndarray but instead subclass pandasobject, similarly to the rest of the pandas objects. this change allows very easy sub-classing and creation of new index types. this should be a transparent change with only very limited api implications
column623: bug in series.replace and dataframe.replace when dict is used as the to_replace value and one key in the dict is another key s value, the results were inconsistent between using integer key and using string key
column624: improved performance of read_csv by faster parsing of n/a and boolean values
column625: merge errors will now be sub-classes of valueerror rather than raw exception
column626: styler.apply is now more strict about the outputs your function must return. for axis=0 or axis=1, the output shape must be identical. for axis=none, the output must be a dataframe with identical columns and index labels .
column627: fixed regression in dataframe.transform and series.transform giving incorrect column labels when passed a dictionary with a mix of list and non-list values
column628: fixed inconsistency in .ix between list and scalar keys when the index has integer dtype and does not include the desired keys
column629: bug in datetimeindex.searchsorted, timedeltaindex.searchsorted, periodindex.searchsorted, and series.searchsorted with datetime64, timedelta64 or period dtype placement of nat values being inconsistent with numpy
column630: fixed regression in reindex and groupby with a multiindex or multiple keys that contains categorical datetime-like values .
column631: the methods series.str.partition and series.str.rpartition have deprecated the pat keyword in favor of sep
column632: the .dtype property of a categorical, categoricalindex or a series with categorical type will now return an instance of categoricaldtype. while the repr has changed, str) is still the string 'category'. we ll take this moment to remind users that the preferred way to detect categorical data is to use pandas.api.types.is_categorical_dtype, and not str == 'category'.
column633: .to_json now supports ndframes that contain categorical and sparse data
column634: fix regression in groupby.first and groupby.last where none is not preserved in object dtype
column635: the validate argument for merge now checks whether a merge is one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one, or many-to-many. if a merge is found to not be an example of specified merge type, an exception of type mergeerror will be raised. for more, see here
column636: categorical can now be included in series and dataframes and gained new methods to manipulate. thanks to jan schulz for much of this api/implementation. .
column637: bug in pd.read_csv which caused errors to be raised when a dictionary containing scalars is passed in for na_values
column638: added to_julian_date to timestamp and datetimeindex. the julian date is used primarily in astronomy and represents the number of days from noon, january 1, 4713 bc. because nanoseconds are used to define the time in pandas the actual range of dates that you can use is 1678 ad to 2262 ad.
column639: bug in fillna with limit and value specified
column640: self or other contain values that can not be compared .
column641: dataframe.to_stata is now faster when outputting data with any string or non-native endian columns
column642: for compatibility with numpy arrays, pd.series implements argmax and argmin. since pandas 0.13.0, argmax has been an alias for pandas.series.idxmax, and argmin has been an alias for pandas.series.idxmin. they return the label of the maximum or minimum, rather than the position.
column643: series.rename and ndframe.rename_axis can now take a scalar or list-like argument for altering the series or axis name, in addition to their old behaviors of altering labels.
column644: fixed bug in comparison of ordered categorical that contained missing values with a scalar which sometimes incorrectly resulted in true
column645: fixed regression in read_csv and other read functions were the encoding error policy did not default to "replace" when no encoding was specified
column646: bug in dateoffset where keyword arguments week and milliseconds were accepted and ignored. passing these will now raise valueerror
column647: corrected business day subtraction logic when the offset is more than 5 bdays and the starting date is on a weekend
column648: indexers will warn futurewarning when used with a scalar indexer and a non-floating point index
column649: added experimental compatibility with openpyxl for versions >= 2.0. the dataframe.to_excel method engine keyword now recognizes openpyxl1 and openpyxl2 which will explicitly require openpyxl v1 and v2 respectively, failing if the requested version is not available. the openpyxl engine is a now a meta-engine that automatically uses whichever version of openpyxl is installed.
column650: .groupby has been enhanced to provide convenient syntax when working with .rolling, .expanding and .resample per group, see here
column651: bug in read_csv with float_precision="high" caused segfault or wrong parsing of long exponent strings. this resulted in a regression in some cases as the default for float_precision was changed in pandas 1.2.0
column652: bug in dataframe.to_html with notebook=true where dataframes with named indices or non-multiindex indices had undesired horizontal or vertical alignment for column or row labels, respectively
column653: as of 10/10/13, there is a bug in google s api preventing result sets from being larger than 100,000 rows. a patch is scheduled for the week of 10/14/13.
column655: improved csv write performance with mixed dtypes, including datetimes by up to 5x
column656: bug with kde plot and nans
column657: dataframegroupby.mean and seriesgroupby.mean , std and var) now raise a typeerror if a non-accepted keyword argument is passed into it. previously an unsupportedfunctioncall was raised )
column658: round, ceil, and floor for datetimeindex and timestamp now support an ambiguous argument for handling datetimes that are rounded to ambiguous times and a nonexistent argument for handling datetimes that are rounded to nonexistent times. see nonexistent times when localizing
column659: bug in categorical.from_codes where an unhelpful error was raised when an invalid ordered parameter was passed in
column660: fixed regression in dataframe.agg, dataframe.apply, series.agg, and series.apply where internal suffix is exposed to the users when no relabelling is applied
column661: multiple bugs in pandas.core.window.rolling.min with closed='left' and a datetime-like index leading to incorrect results and also segfault.
column662: add dataframe.to_panel with code adapted from longpanel.to_long
column663: rename_categories now accepts a dict-like argument for new_categories. the previous categories are looked up in the dictionary s keys and replaced if found. the behavior of missing and extra keys is the same as in dataframe.rename.
column664: for the c parsing engine, the methods read_csv and read_table previously defaulted to a parser that could read floating point numbers slightly incorrectly with respect to the last bit in precision. the option floating_precision="high" has always been available to avoid this issue. beginning with this version, the default is now to use the more accurate parser by making floating_precision=none correspond to the high precision parser, and the new option floating_precision="legacy" to use the legacy parser. the change to using the higher precision parser by default should have no impact on performance.
column665: series.nsmallest and nlargest s take_last keyword was deprecated in favor of keep.
column666: for optional libraries the general recommendation is to use the latest version. the following table lists the lowest version per library that is currently being tested throughout the development of pandas. optional libraries below the lowest tested version may still work, but are not considered supported.
column667: for optional libraries the general recommendation is to use the latest version. the following table lists the lowest version per library that is currently being tested throughout the development of pandas. optional libraries below the lowest tested version may still work, but are not considered supported.
column668: for optional libraries the general recommendation is to use the latest version. the following table lists the lowest version per library that is currently being tested throughout the development of pandas. optional libraries below the lowest tested version may still work, but are not considered supported.
column669: for optional libraries the general recommendation is to use the latest version. the following table lists the lowest version per library that is currently being tested throughout the development of pandas. optional libraries below the lowest tested version may still work, but are not considered supported.
column670: fix reindexing with multiple axes; if an axes match was not replacing the current axes, leading to a possible lazy frequency inference issue
column671: fixed regression in dataframe.apply with object dtype and non-reducing function
column672: bug in numeric indexes resulted in it being possible to instantiate an int64index, uint64index, or float64index with an invalid dtype
column673: dataframe.to_stata will now check data for compatibility with stata data types and will upcast when needed. when it is not possible to losslessly upcast, a warning is issued
column674: the default setting of dropna argument is true which means na are not included in group keys.
column675: previously agg lost the result columns, when the as_index option was set to false and the result columns were relabeled. in this case the result values were replaced with the previous index .
column676: allow index and rangeindex to be passed to numpy min and max functions
column677: to_html now accepts an optional escape argument to control reserved html character escaping and escapes &, in addition to < and >.
column678: bug in categoricalindex and categorical incorrectly raising valueerror instead of typeerror when a list is passed using the in operator
column679: tz_localize for tz-aware timestamp and datetimeindex now removes timezone holding local time, previously this resulted in exception or typeerror
column680: bug in dataframe.hist, xrot=0 does not work with by and subplots .
column681: fixed regression where setting pd.options.display.max_colwidth was not accepting negative integer. in addition, this behavior has been deprecated in favor of using none
column682: dataframe.set_index now gives a better keyerror, raises a valueerror for incorrect types, and will not fail on duplicate column names with drop=true.
column683: factorize now supports na_sentinel=none to include nan in the uniques of the values and remove dropna keyword which was unintentionally exposed to public facing api in 1.1 version from factorize
column684: constructor for multiindex verifies that the given sortorder is compatible with the actual lexsort_depth if verify_integrity parameter is true
column685: bug in datetimeindex with nanosecond frequency does not include timestamp specified with end
column687: a multiplied freq represents a span of corresponding length. the example below creates a period of 3 days. addition and subtraction will shift the period by its span.
column688: indexing an index object with a float key is deprecated, and will raise an indexerror in the future. you can manually convert to an integer key instead .
column689: bug where setting a timedelta column by index causes it to be casted to double, and therefore lose precision
column690: period and periodindex can contain nat in its values
column691: series.repeat has deprecated the reps parameter in favor of repeats
column692: deprecated parameters levels and codes in multiindex.copy. use the set_levels and set_codes methods instead
column693: issue with groupby agg with a single function and a mixed-type frame
column694: bug in dataframe.replace and series.replace with numeric values and string to_replace
column695: pandas.read_clipboard updated to use qtpy, falling back to pyqt5 and then pyqt4, adding compatibility with python3 and multiple python-qt bindings
column696: fixed regression in read_csv in which the encoding option was not recognized with certain file-like objects
column697: calling pandas.concat on a categorical of ints with na values now causes them to be processed as objects when concatenating with anything other than another categorical of ints
column698: indexing with date strings with utc offsets
column699: pandas has gained the ability to hold integer dtypes with missing values. this long requested feature is enabled through the use of extension types.
column701: bug in read_parquet with fixed offset time zones. string representation of time zones was not recognized
column702: a keyerror is now raised if .unstack is called on a series or dataframe with a flat index passing a name which is not the correct one
column703: bug when constructing a datetimeindex with timestamp constructed with the replace method across dst
column704: we ve added experimental support for conditional html formatting: the visual styling of a dataframe based on the data. the styling is accomplished with html and css. accesses the styler class with the pandas.dataframe.style, attribute, an instance of styler with your data attached.
column705: added extensiondtype._is_numeric for controlling whether an extension dtype is considered numeric .
column706: bug in timestamp constructor where microsecond resolution was lost if hhmmss were not separated with :
column707: the behavior of sort=true can now be obtained with sort=none. this will sort the result only if the values in self and other are not identical.
column708: concat will now concatenate mixed series and dataframes using the series name or numbering columns as needed . see the docs
column709: bug in series.nlargest for signed and unsigned integer dtypes when the minimum value is present
column710: this is a major release from 0.20.3 and includes a number of api changes, deprecations, new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column711: iterator support via read_hdf that automatically opens and closes the store when iteration is finished. this is only for tables
column712: a newly constructed empty dataframe with integer as the dtype will now only be cast to float64 if index is specified
column713: importing concat from pandas.tools.merge has been deprecated in favor of imports from the pandas namespace. this should only affect explicit imports
column714: fixed regression in pandas.io.json.json_normalize when called with none values in nested levels in json, and to not drop keys with value as none .
column715: deprecated parameter inplace in multiindex.set_codes and multiindex.set_levels
column716: fixed regression in .groupby.rolling where a segfault would occur with center=true and an odd number of values
column717: construction of interval is restricted to numeric, timestamp and timedelta endpoints
column718: when applied to a dataframe, they key is applied per-column to all columns or a subset if by is specified, e.g.
column719: the general semantics of anchored offsets for n=0 is to not move the date when it is an anchor point , and otherwise roll forward to the next anchor point.
column720: futurewarning: using '+' to provide set union with indexes is deprecated, use '|' or .union
column721: read_fwf was inferring compression with compression=none which was not consistent with the other read_* functions
column722: a dataframe can now be written to and subsequently read back via json while preserving metadata through usage of the orient='table' argument . previously, none of the available orient values guaranteed the preservation of dtypes and index names, amongst other metadata.
column723: timestamp.weekday_name, datetimeindex.weekday_name, and series.dt.weekday_name are deprecated in favor of timestamp.day_name, datetimeindex.day_name, and series.dt.day_name
column724: bug in dataframe.drop caused boolean labels false and true to be treated as labels 0 and 1 respectively when dropping indices from a numeric index. this will now raise a valueerror
column725: supplying codes/labels and levels to the categorical constructor is not supported anymore. supplying two arguments to the constructor is now interpreted as values and levels . please change your code to use the from_codes constructor.
column726: using pd.na with series.str.repeat now correctly outputs a null value instead of raising error for vector inputs
column727: bug in dataframe.loc returning and assigning elements in wrong order when indexer is differently ordered than the multiindex to filter
column728: boolean comparisons of a series vs none will now be equivalent to comparing with np.nan, rather than raise typeerror. .
column729: trust me: don t panic. if you are using numpy 1.6 and restrict your interaction with datetime64 values to pandas s api you will be just fine. there is nothing wrong with the data-type ; all of the important data processing happens in pandas and is heavily tested. i strongly recommend that you do not work directly with datetime64 arrays in numpy 1.6 and only use the pandas api.
column730: bug in dataframe.to_json where using a tuple as a column or index value and using orient="columns" or orient="index" would produce invalid json
column731: added factorize functions to index and series to get indexer and unique values
column732: bug in using iloc/loc with a cross-sectional and duplicate indices
column733: series.str.split s return_type keyword was removed in favor of expand
column734: regression fixed in , where groupby with a datetime-like converting to float with certain aggregators
column735: bug in concat where error was raised in concatenating series with numpy scalar and tuple names
column736: pd.read_msgpack and pd.to_msgpack are now a supported method of serialization of arbitrary pandas in a lightweight portable binary format. see the docs
column737: the parallel_coordinates function now takes argument color instead of colors. a futurewarning is raised to alert that the old colors argument will not be supported in a future release.
column738: the parallel_coordinates function now takes argument color instead of colors. a futurewarning is raised to alert that the old colors argument will not be supported in a future release.
column739: bug when constructing dataframe where passing a dictionary with only scalar values and specifying columns did not raise an error
column740: this usage is now deprecated. instead add or subtract integer multiples of the object s freq attribute .
column741: dataframe.to_stata, read_stata, statareader and statawriter have deprecated the encoding argument. the encoding of a stata dta file is determined by the file type and cannot be changed
column742: added documentation to i/o regarding the perils of reading in columns with mixed dtypes and how to handle it
column743: fixed an issue where dataframe.sum was slower than dataframe.mean for integer valued frames
column744: bug in dataframe with datetime64 dtype addition and subtraction with timedelta-like objects
column745: bug in to_timedelta fails when arg is a series with int64 dtype containing null values
column746: the default is set at origin='unix', which defaults to 1970-01-01 00:00:00, which is commonly called unix epoch or posix time. this was the previous default, so this is a backward compatible change.
column747: bug in dataframe.groupby where spurious warning is raised when grouper object is used to override ambiguous column name
column748: this is a major release from 0.22.0 and includes a number of api changes, deprecations, new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column749: fixed regression in read_csv used in file like object rawiobase is not recognize encoding option
column750: pandas.tseries.frequencies.get_standard_freq has been removed in favor of pandas.tseries.frequencies.to_offset.rule_code
column751: bug in groupby.agg, groupby.transform, and groupby.resample where subclasses are not preserved
column752: datetimeindex.strftime and periodindex.strftime now return an index instead of a numpy array to be consistent with similar accessors
column753: grouping by a tuple of keys now emits a futurewarning and is deprecated. in the future, a tuple passed to 'by' will always refer to a single key that is the actual tuple, instead of treating the tuple as multiple keys. to retain the previous behavior, use a list instead of a tuple
column754: we introduce a new scalar type timedelta, which is a subclass of datetime.timedelta, and behaves in a similar manner, but allows compatibility with np.timedelta64 types as well as a host of custom representation, parsing, and attributes. this type is very similar to how timestamp works for datetimes. it is a nice-api box for the type. see the docs.
column755: to_stata supports compression using the compression keyword argument. compression can either be inferred or explicitly set using a string or a dictionary containing both the method and any additional arguments that are passed to the compression library. compression was also added to the low-level stata-file writers statawriter, statawriter117, and statawriterutf8 .
column756: dataframe.from_dict now accepts a columns argument that can be used to specify the column names when orient='index' is used
column757: bug in read_msgpack where encoding is not respected
column758: fixed regression in replace raising an assertionerror when replacing values in an extension dtype with values of a different dtype
column759: bug in to_excel where a negative sign was being prepended to positive infinity and was absent for negative infinity
column760: the behavior of sum and prod on all-nan series/dataframes no longer depends on whether bottleneck is installed, and return value of sum and prod on an empty series has changed .
column761: typeerror exceptions raised by read_csv and read_table were showing as parser_f when an unexpected keyword argument was passed
column762: add support for separating years and quarters using dashes, for example 2014-q1.
column763: and integer or boolean arrays are valid indices
column764: provide a useful exception for indexing with an invalid type for that index when using .loc. for example trying to use .loc on an index of type datetimeindex or periodindex or timedeltaindex, with an integer .
column765: for series and indexes backed by normal numpy arrays, series.array will return a new arrays.pandasarray, which is a thin wrapper around a numpy.ndarray. pandasarray isn t especially useful on its own, but it does provide the same interface as any extension array defined in pandas or by a third-party library.
column766: loffset should be replaced by directly adding an offset to the index dataframe after being resampled.
column767: bugs in concatenation with a coercible dtype was too aggressive, resulting in different dtypes in output formatting when an object was longer than display.max_rows
column768: period, periodindex and period_range can now accept multiplied freq. also, period.freq and periodindex.freq are now stored as a dateoffset instance like datetimeindex, and not as str
column769: fixed regression in series.align when other is a dataframe and method is not none
column770: new unified concatenation function for concatenating series, dataframe or panel objects along an axis. can form union or intersection of the other axes. improves performance of series.append and dataframe.append
column771: this is a minor bug-fix release from 0.16.0 and includes a large number of bug fixes along several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column772: bug in dataframe.__getitem__ and dataframe.loc.__getitem__ with intervalindex columns and a numeric indexer
column773: historically, this would have been done with series.values, but with .values it was unclear whether the returned value would be the actual array, some transformation of it, or one of pandas custom arrays . for example, with periodindex, .values generates a new ndarray of period objects each time.
column774: is_extension_type is deprecated, is_extension_array_dtype should be used instead
column775: align: specify the bar alignment. default is center . in previous versions, pandas passes align='edge' to matplotlib and adjust the location to center by itself, and it results align keyword is not applied as expected.
column776: dataframe.rename would previously accept positional arguments that would lead to ambiguous or undefined behavior. from pandas 1.0, only the very first argument, which maps labels to their new names along the default axis, is allowed to be passed by position .
column777: these changes conform sparse handling to return the correct types and work to make a smoother experience with indexing.
column778: reduction methods like series.sum now accept the default value of keepdims=false when called from a numpy ufunc, rather than raising a typeerror. full support for keepdims has not been implemented .
column779: bug in dataframe.to_string and more generally in the floating repr formatter. zeros were not trimmed if inf was present in a columns while it was the case with na values. zeros are now trimmed as in the presence of na .
column780: more flexible multiple function application in groupby, and can pass list tuples to get result in particular order with given names
column781: deleting of consecutive rows is much faster than before
column782: removed the previously deprecated keyword data from andrews_curves, use frame instead
column783: fixed regression in series.sort_index and dataframe.sort_index, which exited with an ungraceful error when having kwarg ascending=none passed. passing ascending=none is still considered invalid, and the improved error message suggests a proper usage
column784: of course if you have missing values that are introduced, then the resulting dtype will be upcast, which is unchanged from previous.
column785: bug in ols where running with cluster and nw_lags parameters did not work correctly, but also did not throw an error .
column786: bar and horizontal bar plots no longer add a dashed line along the info axis. the prior style can be achieved with matplotlib s axhline or axvline methods .
column787: the nrows and chunksize arguments in pd.read_csv are supported if both are passed
column788: bug in to_datetime and to_timedelta causing index name to be lost
column789: a long-time requested feature has been added through the merge_asof function, to support asof style joining of time-series . full documentation is here.
column790: bug in testing.assert_series_equal and testing.assert_frame_equal for series or dataframes with differing unicode data
column791: this method is also exposed by the lower level index.get_indexer and index.get_loc methods.
column792: we are adding a standard public module for all pandas exceptions & warnings pandas.errors. . previously these exceptions & warnings could be imported from pandas.core.common or pandas.io.common. these exceptions and warnings will be removed from the *.common locations in a future release.
column793: eval/query expressions with strings containing the @ character will now work .
column794: bug in to_datetime where utc=true was not respected when specifying a unit and errors='ignore'
column795: bug in pandas.core.window.rolling.max and pandas.core.window.rolling.min where incorrect results are returned with an empty variable window
column796: this is a minor bug-fix release from 0.17.0 and includes a large number of bug fixes along several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column797: dataframe.to_csv and series.to_csv now accept an errors argument
column798: the convert parameter has been deprecated in the .take method, as it was not being respected
column799: bug in timedeltaindex addition with a datetime-like object where addition overflow was not being caught
column800: # these are float64indexes, so integer or floating point is acceptable
column801: in comparisons, na / nan will always come through as false except with != which is true. be very careful with boolean arithmetic, especially negation, in the presence of na data. you may wish to add an explicit na filter into boolean array operations if you are worried about this:
column802: raising an invalid typeerror rather than valueerror when appending with a different block ordering
column803: non-unique indexing with a slice via loc and friends fixed
column804: bug in unequal comparisons between categorical data and a scalar, which was not in the categories , ordered=true)) > "d". this returned false for all elements, but now raises a typeerror. equality comparisons also now return false for == and true for !=.
column805: bug in dataframe.crosstab was returning incorrect results on inputs with duplicate row names, duplicate column names or duplicate names between row and column labels
column806: bug in setting with ix/loc and a mixed int/string index
column807: all-nan levels in a multiindex are now assigned float rather than object dtype, promoting consistency with index .
column808: fixed regression in series.min and series.max where numeric_only=true was ignored when the series contained categorical data
column809: dataframe.replace now allows regular expressions on contained series with object dtype. see the examples section in the regular docs replacing via string expression
column810: passing multiple axes to dataframe.dropna is no longer supported
column812: add option to disable sparse display of hierarchical indexes
column813: nat division with datetime.timedelta will now return nan instead of raising
column814: bug in series and dataframe repr where np.datetime64 and np.timedelta64 with dtype=object would be represented as nan
column815: display format with plain text can optionally align with unicode east asian width, see here
column816: for series the following indexing functions are deprecated .
column817: read_csv will now raise a valueerror if a column with missing values is declared as having dtype bool
column818: bug in datetimeindex and timedeltaindex addition and subtraction where operations with numpy arrays raised typeerror
column819: a simple version of panel.round is now implemented
column820: .groupby has been enhanced to provide convenient syntax when working with .rolling, .expanding and .resample per group, see .
column821: bug in intervalindex.get_loc and intervalindex.get_indexer when used with an intervalindex containing a single interval
column822: bug in pd.read_csv with engine='c' in which null quotechar was not accepted even though quoting was specified as none
column823: 0.10 of hdfstore is backwards compatible for reading tables created in a prior version of pandas, however, query terms using the prior methodology are unsupported. you must read in the entire file and write it out using the new format to take advantage of the updates.
column824: bug in pd.read_csv with engine='python' in which nan values weren t being detected after data was converted to numeric values
column825: fixed regression in dataframe.unstack with columns with integer dtype
column826: bug in datetimeindex where constructing with an integer and tz would not localize correctly
column827: timestamp.tz_localize, datetimeindex.tz_localize, and series.tz_localize have deprecated the errors argument in favor of the nonexistent argument
column828: when .ix is asked for a missing integer label in a multiindex with a first level of integer type, it now raises a keyerror, consistently with the case of a flat int64index, rather than falling back to positional indexing
column829: pd.read_* functions can now also accept pathlib.path, or py._path.local.localpath objects for the filepath_or_buffer argument. - the dataframe and series functions .to_csv, .to_html and .to_latex can now handle paths beginning with tildes
column830: period conversions in the range of seconds and below were reworked and extended up to nanoseconds. periods in the nanosecond range are now available.
column831: timeseries deprecated in favor of series ,
column832: we ve introduced a new method dataframe.pipe. as suggested by the name, pipe should be used to pipe data through a chain of function calls. the goal is to avoid confusing nested function calls like
column833: fixed an issue with dataframe.plot.scatter that incorrectly raised a keyerror when categorical data is used for plotting
column834: bug in astype converting to object dtype when passed extension type classes rather than instances. now a typeerror is raised when a class is passed .
column835: indexing methods for intervalindex have been modified to require exact matches only for interval queries. intervalindex methods previously matched on any overlapping interval. behavior with scalar points, e.g. querying with an integer, is unchanged .
column836: enabling this option will affect the performance for printing of dataframe and series . use only when it is actually required.
column838: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.ffill and pandas.core.groupby.groupby.bfill where the fill within a grouping would not always be applied as intended due to the implementations use of a non-stable sort
column839: fixed to_datetime for array with both tz-aware datetimes and nat s
column840: however, .agg can also accept a dict that allows renaming of the result columns. this is a complicated and confusing syntax, as well as not consistent between series and dataframe. we are deprecating this renaming functionality.
column841: pd.tseries.util.isleapyear has been deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent release. datetime-likes now have a .is_leap_year property
column842: the month and year parameters have been undeprecated and can be used to get all options data for a given month.
column843: this release includes a few new features and addresses over a dozen bugs in 0.7.0.
column844: bug in timedeltaindex addition with a datetime-like object where addition overflow in the negative direction was not being caught
column845: dataframe.merge and dataframe.join can now be used to join multi-indexed dataframe instances on the overlapping index levels
column846: some numeric reduction operators would return valueerror, rather than typeerror on object types that includes strings and numbers
column847: bug in resampling with .nunique and a sparse index
column848: added sparse accessor for working with a dataframe whose values are sparse
column849: dataframe is now a series with sparse values, rather than a sparseseries, when slicing a single column with sparse values .
column850: improved performance of series constructor with no data and datetimeindex
column851: experimental: the new floating data types are currently experimental, and their behavior or api may still change without warning. especially the behavior regarding nan is subject to change.
column852: during division involving a series or dataframe, 0/0 and 0//0 now give np.nan instead of np.inf.
column853: bug in tz-aware datetimeindex where addition/subtraction with a timedeltaindex or array with dtype='timedelta64' was incorrect
column854: numexpr version is now required to be >= 2.4.6 and it will not be used at all if this requisite is not fulfilled .
column855: bug in dataframe.plot.bar and series.plot.bar where ticks positions were assigned by value order instead of using the actual value for numeric or a smart ordering for string . this fix has been reverted in pandas 1.2.1, see what s new in 1.2.1
column856: deprecations will be introduced in minor releases
column857: revamp of frequency aliases and support for frequency shortcuts like 15min , or 1h30min
column858: added support for specifying a schema to read from/write to with read_sql_table and to_sql . for example:
column859: bug in series.rank and dataframe.rank when pct=true and more than 224 rows are present resulted in percentages greater than 1.0
column860: concat and append now preserve extension dtypes, for example combining a nullable integer column with a numpy integer column will no longer result in object dtype but preserve the integer dtype .
column861: fixed printing of dataframes with hierarchical columns with long names
column862: with 'object' dtype where each element is a 'pandas.timestamp' with the correct 'tz'.
column863: bug in any and all incorrectly returning <na> for all false or all true values using the nulllable boolean dtype and with skipna=false
column864: bug in creating a series from an array that contains both tz-naive and tz-aware values will result in a series whose dtype is tz-aware instead of object
column865: bug in dataframegroupby.rank where ranks were incorrect when both infinity and nan were present
column866: bug in index and series may ignore np.datetime64 and np.timdelta64 to infer dtype
column867: implemented & and | to intersect / union index objects, respectively
column868: bug in setitem with list-of-lists and single vs mixed types
column869: lookups on a series with a single-item list containing a slice ]]) are deprecated and will raise in a future version. either convert the list to a tuple, or pass the slice directly instead
column870: fix regression where an ordered categorical containing only nan values would raise rather than returning nan when taking the minimum or maximum
column871: fixed regression in groupby.first and groupby.last where none was considered a non-na value
column872: removed the previously deprecated keyword time_rule from offsets.generate_range, which has been moved to core.arrays._ranges.generate_range
column873: the file reader will now raise an exception when na values are found in an explicitly specified integer column instead of converting the column to float
column874: pandas.tseries.frequencies.get_freq_group and pandas.tseries.frequencies.days are removed from the public api
column875: read_html now accepts a displayed_only keyword argument to controls whether or not hidden elements are parsed
column876: bug in dataframe.drop behaviour is not consistent for unique and non-unique indexes
column877: series.to_dict and dataframe.to_dict now support an into keyword which allows you to specify the collections.mapping subclass that you would like returned. the default is dict, which is backwards compatible.
column878: improved performance in pd.read_csv on some platforms with buffered reads
column879: bug in read_csv where a multiindex with duplicate columns was not being mangled appropriately
column880: fixed issue with drop and a non-unique index on series
column881: intervalindex constructor will raise if the closed parameter conflicts with how the input data is inferred to be closed
column882: deprecated the string method match, whose role is now performed more idiomatically by extract. in a future release, the default behavior of match will change to become analogous to contains, which returns a boolean indexer. in this release, the deprecated behavior is the default, but the new behavior is available through the keyword argument as_indexer=true.
column883: regression in series.quantile with nans and .describe ); furthermore now names the series with the quantile
column884: recent changes in ipython cause warnings to be emitted when using previous versions of pandas in qtconsole, now fixed. if you re using an older version and need to suppress the warnings, see .
column885: bug in index.astype with a categorical dtype where the resultant index is not converted to a categoricalindex for all types of index
column888: series backed by an extensionarray now work with util.hash_pandas_object
column889: bug in dataframegroupby.transform produces an incorrect result with transformation functions
column890: deprecated the unique method, can be replicated by select_column.unique
column891: we can also match rows only with prior data, and not an exact match.
column892: the string representation of index and its sub-classes have now been unified. these will show a single-line display if there are few values; a wrapped multi-line display for a lot of values will show a truncated display . the formatting for multiindex is unchanged . the display width responds to the option display.max_seq_items, which is defaulted to 100.
column893: bug in groupby.apply raises valueerror when the by axis is not sorted, has duplicates, and the applied func does not mutate passed in objects
column894: fix selection with ix/loc and non_unique selectors
column895: bug in read_html where nan s were incorrectly being used to indicate missing values in text. should use the empty string for consistency with the rest of pandas .
column896: enable serialization of lists and dicts to strings in excelwriter
column897: series.ptp will now ignore missing values by default
column898: bug in dataframe and series where timezone aware data with dtype='datetime64 was not cast to naive
column899: bug in series.reset_index where appropriate error was not raised with an invalid level name
column900: bug in series and index comparison may output incorrect result if it contains nat with object dtype
column901: likewise, get_indexer and get_indexer_non_unique will also only return locations for exact matches to interval queries, with -1 denoting that an exact match was not found.
column902: these are the changes in pandas 1.1.2. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column903: improved performance of series.searchsorted. the speedup is especially large when the dtype is int8/int16/int32 and the searched key is within the integer bounds for the dtype
column904: a series based on an extensionarray now supports arithmetic and comparison operators . there are two approaches for providing operator support for an extensionarray:
column905: passing a non-existent column in .to_excel is deprecated and will raise a keyerror in the future
column906: groupby.count is now implemented in cython and is much faster for large numbers of groups .
column907: parsing datetime strings with different utc offsets will now create an index of datetime.datetime objects with different utc offsets
column908: pd.options.html.border has been deprecated in favor of pd.options.display.html.border .
column909: bug in dataframe.join when doing left join on index and there are multiple matches
column910: bug in read_hdf where reading a table from an hdf5 file written directly with pytables fails with a valueerror when using a sub-selection via the start or stop arguments
column911: index.repeat and multiindex.repeat have renamed the n argument to repeats
column912: integers in floatindex, e.g. 1., are now formatted with a decimal point and a 0 digit, e.g. 1.0 this change not only affects the display to the console, but also the output of io methods like .to_csv or .to_html.
column913: calling series.dt.end_time will now result in a time of 23:59:59.999999999 as is the case with period.end_time, for example
column914: bug in series.isin with datetime64 dtype and datetimeindex.isin failing to consider tz-aware and tz-naive datetimes as always different
column915: categorical.from_codes now can take a dtype parameter as an alternative to passing categories and ordered .
column916: series.mode and dataframe.mode now support the dropna parameter which can be used to specify whether nan/nat values should be considered
column917: dataframe.plot now raises a valueerror when the x or y argument is improperly formed
column918: currently the default is expand=none which gives a futurewarning and uses expand=false. to avoid this warning, please explicitly specify expand.
column919: bug in to_json with certain orients and a categoricalindex would segfault
column920: dataframe.replace and series.replace will raise a typeerror if to_replace is not an expected type. previously the replace would fail silently
column921: datetimeindex can be instantiated using strings contains nat
column922: quantile and quantile now accept the interpolation keyword, linear by default
