column923: this is a minor bug-fix release from 0.15.0 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column924: when a dataframe s integer slice is partially updated with a new slice of floats that could potentially be down-casted to integer without losing precision, the dtype of the slice will be set to float instead of integer.
column925: passing utc=true will mimic the previous behavior but will correctly indicate that the dates have been converted to utc
column926: index.set_value has been deprecated. for a given index idx, array arr, value in idx of idx_val and a new value of val, idx.set_value is equivalent to arr = val, which should be used instead .
column927: comparisons between series and index would return a series with an incorrect name, ignoring the index s name attribute
column928: by default, extracting matching patterns from strings with str.extract used to return a series if a single group was being extracted . as of pandas 0.23.0 str.extract always returns a dataframe, unless expand is set to false. finally, none was an accepted value for the expand parameter , but now raises a valueerror.
column929: period and periodindex supports addition/subtraction with timedelta-likes
column930: note that numeric index objects already performed element-wise operations. for example, the behavior of adding two integer indexes is unchanged. the base index is now made consistent with this behavior.
column931: bug in series with dtype='timedelta64' where addition or subtraction of timedeltaindex had results cast to dtype='int64'
column932: bug in dataframe.to_stata that lead to data loss in certain cases, and could be exported using the wrong data types and missing values
column933: to preserve output behavior with prior versions the default value of display.precision has been reduced to 6 from 7.
column934: using pd.na with dataframe.to_json now correctly outputs a null value instead of an empty object
column935: series.cat.categorical, series.cat.name and series.cat.index have been deprecated. use the attributes on series.cat or series directly. .
column936: creating a timedeltaindex, datetimeindex, or periodindex by passing range arguments start, end, and periods is deprecated in favor of timedelta_range, date_range, or period_range
column937: fixed regression in dataframe.apply with raw=true and user-function returning string
column938: some new warnings are issued for operations that require or are likely to materialize a large dense array:
column939: see experimental na scalar to denote missing values for more on the differences between pandas.na and numpy.nan.
column940: the merge_asof performs an asof merge, which is similar to a left-join except that we match on nearest key rather than equal keys.
column941: a user-defined-function that is passed to series.rolling.aggregate, dataframe.rolling.aggregate, or its expanding cousins, will now always be passed a series, rather than a np.array; .apply only has the raw keyword, see here. this is consistent with the signatures of .aggregate across pandas
column942: removed the previously deprecated convert keyword argument in series.take and dataframe.take
column943: this is a major release from 0.13.1 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column944: bug in .to_string when called with an integer line_width and index=false raises an unboundlocalerror exception because idx referenced before assignment.
column945: the verbose keyword in dataframe.info, which controls whether to shorten the info representation, is now none by default. this will follow the global setting in display.max_info_columns. the global setting can be overridden with verbose=true or verbose=false.
column946: dataframe.__getitem__ now accepts dictionaries and dictionary keys as list-likes of labels, consistently with series.__getitem__
column947: bug in dataframe.combine_first caused wrong alignment with dtype string and one level of multiindex containing only na
column948: following new methods are accessible via .str accessor to apply the function to each values. this is intended to make it more consistent with standard methods on strings.
column949: in a future version of pandas pandas.concat will no longer sort the non-concatenation axis when it is not already aligned. the current behavior is the same as the previous , but now a warning is issued when sort is not specified and the non-concatenation axis is not aligned .
column950: bug with sort=true in dataframe.join and pd.merge when joining on indexes
column951: the same is true for multiindex, but the logic is applied separately on a level-by-level basis.
column952: this is a minor bug-fix release in the 0.20.x series and includes some small regression fixes and bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column953: in order to improve tab-completion, pandas does not include most deprecated attributes when introspecting a pandas object using dir ). to see which attributes are excluded, see an object s _deprecations attribute, for example pd.dataframe._deprecations .
column954: some east asian countries use unicode characters its width is corresponding to 2 alphabets. if a dataframe or series contains these characters, the default output cannot be aligned properly. the following options are added to enable precise handling for these characters.
column955: this is a major release from 0.18.1 and includes number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column956: fix multiindex.sort_index ordering when ascending argument is a list, but not all levels are specified, or are in a different order .
column957: bug in dataframe.plot and series.plot with datetimeindex where a figure generated by them is not pickleable in python 3
column958: dataframe.to_parquet will now write non-default indexes when the underlying engine supports it. the indexes will be preserved when reading back in with read_parquet .
column959: strings passed to dataframe.merge as the on, left_on, and right_on parameters may now refer to either column names or index level names. this enables merging dataframe instances on a combination of index levels and columns without resetting indexes. see the merge on columns and levels documentation section.
column960: when calling apply on a grouped series, the return value will also be a series, to be more consistent with the groupby behavior with dataframe:
column961: note that the default value for inplace in a query is false, which is consistent with prior versions.
column962: removed the previously deprecated keyword join_axes from concat; use reindex_like on the result instead
column963: bug in creating a multiindex with tuples and not passing a list of names; this will now raise valueerror
column964: bug in timedeltaindex.sum and series.sum with timedelta64 dtype on an empty index or series returning nat instead of timedelta
column965: added experimental custombusinessday class to support dateoffsets with custom holiday calendars and custom weekmasks.
column966: improved performance of pairwise .rolling and .expanding with .cov and .corr operations
column967: bug in iloc allowing memory outside bounds of a series to be accessed with negative integers
column968: to_sql now infers data types of non-na values for columns that contain na values and have dtype object .
column969: a list or tuple with length matching the number of columns in the dataframe will now operate row-by-row instead of raising valueerror .
column970: vbench refactored merging / joining code into a tidy class and disabled unnecessary computations in the float/object case, thus getting about 10% better performance
column971: this is a minor release from 0.13.0 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column972: bug in comparison of datetimeindex against none or datetime.date objects raising typeerror for == and != comparisons instead of all-false and all-true, respectively
column973: bug in to_datetime with infer_datetime_format=true where timezone names would not be parsed correctly
column974: dataframe.loc or series.loc with listlike indexers and missing labels will no longer reindex
column975: bug in series.str.startswith and series.str.endswith with category dtype not propagating na parameter
column976: bug in timestamp and to_datetime where a string representing a barely out-of-bounds timestamp would be incorrectly rounded down instead of raising outofboundsdatetime
column977: enhanced support for time zones. add tz_convert and tz_localize methods to timeseries and dataframe. all timestamps are stored as utc; timestamps from datetimeindex objects with time zone set will be localized to local time. time zone conversions are therefore essentially free. user needs to know very little about pytz library now; only time zone names as strings are required. time zone-aware timestamps are equal if and only if their utc timestamps match. operations between time zone-aware time series with different time zones will result in a utc-indexed time series.
column978: the pandas.io.data package is deprecated and will be replaced by the pandas-datareader package. this will allow the data modules to be independently updated to your pandas installation. the api for pandas-datareader v0.1.1 is exactly the same as in pandas v0.17.0 .
column979: this is a major release from 0.17.1 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.

column997: bug in series.at returning series with one element instead of scalar when index is a multiindex with one level

column1001: the option, tupleize_cols can now be specified in both to_csv and read_csv, to provide compatibility for the pre 0.12 behavior of writing and reading multindex columns via a list of tuples. the default in 0.12 is to write lists of tuples and not interpret list of tuples as a multiindex column.
column1002: fixed a bug with all the dtypes being converted to object when using the csv cparser with the usecols parameter

column1010: support constructing panel or panel4d with scalar data
column1011: adding experimental support for panel4d and factory functions to create n-dimensional named panels. here is a taste of what to expect.
column1012: this is a major release from 0.14.1 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1013: new cut and qcut functions for computing a categorical variable from a continuous variable by binning values either into value-based or quantile-based bins
column1014: raise on iloc when boolean indexing with a label based indexer mask e.g. a boolean series, even with integer labels, will raise. since iloc is purely positional based, the labels on the series are not alignable

column1023: bug in dataframe.astype where column metadata is lost when converting to categorical or a dictionary of dtypes
column1024: bug in convert_objects where converted values might not be returned if all null and coerce
column1025: dataframe.plot and series.plot keywords are now have consistent orders
column1026: options.get_forward_data now has optional kwargs near and above_below. this allows the user to specify if they would like to only return forward looking data for options near the current stock price. this just obtains the data from options.get_near_stock_price instead of options.get_xxx_data .
column1027: the default value of regex for series.str.replace will change from true to false in a future release. in addition, single character regular expressions will not be treated as literal strings when regex=true is set
column1028: the outtype argument to pd.dataframe.to_dict has been deprecated in favor of orient.
column1029: bugs in to_msgpack and read_msgpack introduced in 0.17.0 and fixed in 0.18.0, caused files packed in python 2 unreadable by python 3 . the following table describes the backward and forward compat of msgpacks.
column1030: deprecated iterkv, which will be removed in a future release .
column1031: bug in dataframe construction where sets would be duplicated rather than raising
column1032: previously this would have yielded a column of datetime64 dtype, but without timezone info.
column1033: if series.sort is called on a column of a dataframe, an exception will now be raised. before it was possible to accidentally mutate a dataframe s column by doing df.sort instead of the side-effect free method df.order
column1034: added option to disable pandas-style tick locators and formatters using series.plot or pandas.plot_params = true
column1035: previously if .to_datetime encountered mixed integers/floats and strings, but no datetimes with errors='coerce' it would convert all to nat.
column1036: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.cumsum, pandas.core.groupby.groupby.cumprod, pandas.core.groupby.groupby.cummin and pandas.core.groupby.groupby.cummax with categorical column having absent categories, would return incorrect result or segfault
column1037: bug in offsets.generate_range where start and end have finer precision than offset
column1038: pandas has until now mostly defined string representations in a pandas objects __str__/__unicode__/__bytes__ methods, and called __str__ from the __repr__ method, if a specific __repr__ method is not found. this is not needed for python3. in pandas 0.25, the string representations of pandas objects are now generally defined in __repr__, and calls to __str__ in general now pass the call on to the __repr__, if a specific __str__ method doesn t exist, as is standard for python. this change is backward compatible for direct usage of pandas, but if you subclass pandas objects and give your subclasses specific __str__/__repr__ methods, you may have to adjust your __str__/__repr__ methods .
column1039: fixed bug where inplace setting of levels or labels on multiindex would not clear cached values property and therefore return wrong values.
column1040: twinned axes were losing their tick labels which should only happen to all but the last row or column of externally shared axes
column1041: bug in transform when groups are equal in number and dtype to the input index
column1042: bug in unique of series with category dtype, which returned all categories regardless whether they were used or not . previous behaviour was to return all categories:
column1043: frozenndarray.searchsorted has deprecated the v parameter in favor of value
column1044: bug in dataframe.nsmallest and dataframe.nlargest where identical values resulted in duplicated rows
column1045: bug in rangeindex can be created without no arguments rather than raises typeerror
column1046: bug in categoricalindex reindexing in which specified indices containing duplicates were not being respected
column1047: dataframe.plot and series.plot now supports area plot with specifying kind='area' , see the docs
column1048: see the docs. joining multiindex dataframes on both the left and right is not yet supported atm.
column1049: pd.read_csv and pd.to_datetime learned a new infer_datetime_format keyword which greatly improves parsing perf in many cases. thanks to @lexual for suggesting and @danbirken for rapidly implementing.
column1050: add encode and decode for unicode handling to vectorized string processing methods in series.str
column1051: read_csv now treats 'null' and 'n/a' strings as missing values by default
column1052: series.rank and dataframe.rank now accept method='dense' for ranks without gaps
column1053: bug in groupby for integer and datetime64 columns when applying an aggregator that caused the value to be changed when the number was sufficiently large
column1054: bug in dataframe.groupby where a valueerror would be raised when grouping by a categorical column with read-only categories and sort=false
column1055: added ability to replace an existing table and schema when calling the pandas.io.gbq.to_gbq function via the if_exists argument. see the docs for more details .
column1056: bug when doing label based indexing with integers not found in the index for non-unique but monotonic indexes .
column1057: ewmstd, ewmvol, ewmvar, ewmcov, and ewmcorr now have an optional adjust argument, just like ewma does, affecting how the weights are calculated. the default value of adjust is true, which is backwards-compatible. see exponentially weighted moment functions for details.
column1058: bug in weekofmonth and week where addition and subtraction did not roll correctly
column1059: periodindex.fillna with period has different freq now coerces to object dtype
column1060: more helpful error message with an invalid .transform with user defined input
column1061: bug in constructing index with an iterator or generator
column1062: the .groupby.agg, .rolling.agg, and .resample.agg syntax can accept a variable of inputs, including scalars, list, and a dict of column names to scalars or lists. this provides a useful syntax for constructing multiple aggregations.
column1063: in series.where with categorical data, providing an other that is not present in the categories is deprecated. convert the categorical to a different dtype or add the other to the categories first .
column1064: high performance and flexible resample method for converting from high-to-low and low-to-high frequency. supports interpolation, user-defined aggregation functions, and control over how the intervals and result labeling are defined. a suite of high performance cython/c-based resampling functions have also been implemented.
column1065: datetimeindex and series with datetime64 or datetime64tz dtypes now support std
column1066: numexpr version 2.4.4 will now show a warning and not be used as a computation back-end for pandas because of some buggy behavior. this does not affect other versions .
column1067: allow slicing with float-like values on an integer index for .ix. previously this was only enabled for .loc:
column1068: qualify memory usage in dataframe.info by adding + if it is a lower bound
column1069: 0.13.1 fixes a bug that was caused by a combination of having numpy < 1.8, and doing chained assignment on a string-like array. please review the docs, chained indexing can have unexpected results and should generally be avoided.
column1070: dataframe.info now ends its output with a newline character
column1071: one place that deserves special mention is in read_csv. previously, with dtype={'col': 'category'}, the returned values and categories would always be strings.
column1072: the logic flows from inside out, and function names are separated from their keyword arguments. this can be rewritten as
column1073: fixed regression in to_clipboard that defaulted to copying dataframes with space delimited instead of tab delimited
column1074: removed the previously deprecated raise_on_error keyword argument in dataframe.where and dataframe.mask
column1075: this is a minor bug-fix release in the 0.20.x series and includes some small regression fixes, bug fixes and performance improvements. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1076: this is especially useful after reading in data using readers such as read_csv and read_excel. see here for a description.
column1077: bug in read_json for orient='table' and float index, as it infers index dtype by default, which is not applicable because index dtype is already defined in the json schema
column1078: bug in take with duplicate columns that were not consolidated
column1079: bug in pd.read_csv in which the nrows parameter was not being respected for large input when using the c engine for parsing
column1080: bug in adding and subtracting periodindex with periodindex raise typeerror
column1081: made sure different locales are tested on travis-ci . also adds a couple of utilities for getting locales and setting locales with a context manager.
column1082: merge now directly allows merge between objects of type dataframe and named series, without the need to convert the series object into a dataframe beforehand
column1083: dataframe.to_stata and statawriter will accept keyword arguments time_stamp and data_label which allow the time stamp and dataset label to be set when creating a file.
column1084: the default for to_datetime will now be to raise when presented with unparsable formats, previously this would return the original input. also, date parse functions now return consistent results. see here
column1085: pd.read_csv now supports opening zip files that contains a single csv, via extension inference or explicit compression='zip'
column1086: date_range now accepts y in addition to a as an alias for end of year.
column1087: note that plots created by dataframe.plot and series.plot do register the converters automatically. the only behavior change is when plotting a date-like object via matplotlib.pyplot.plot or matplotlib.axes.plot. see custom formatters for timeseries plots for more.
column1088: bug in series replace with timestamp dict
column1089: bug in series update where the parent frame is not updating its cache based on changes or types , fillna
column1090: unclear error message in csv parsing when passing dtype and names and the parsed data is a different data type
column1091: 0.18.0 is backward-compatible for reading files packed by older versions, except for files packed with 0.17 in python 2, in which case only they can only be unpacked in python 2.
column1092: when given a boolean mask key and a series of new values, series __setitem__ will now align the incoming values with the original series
column1093: query method has been added that allows you to select elements of a dataframe using a natural query syntax nearly identical to python syntax. for example,
column1094: removed the previously deprecated keyword skip_footer from read_excel; use skipfooter instead
column1095: will be removed in a future version
column1096: remove offset and timerule keywords from series.tshift/shift, in favor of freq
column1097: timestamp is now equivalent to timestamp.now in that it returns the local time rather than utc. also, timestamp is now equivalent to timestamp.today and both have tz as a possible argument.
column1098: duplicate column names are now supported in read_csv whether they are in the file or passed in as the names parameter
column1099: bug in pd.read_csv, pd.read_table, pd.read_fwf, pd.read_stata and pd.read_sas where files were opened by parsers but not closed if both chunksize and iterator were none.
column1100: removed the previously deprecated tupleize_cols keyword argument in read_html, read_csv, and dataframe.to_csv
column1101: when passing in an ax to df.plot, the sharex kwarg will now default to false. the result is that the visibility of xlabels and xticklabels will not anymore be changed. you have to do that by yourself for the right axes in your figure or set sharex=true explicitly . if pandas creates the subplots itself , then the default is still sharex=true and the visibility changes are applied.
column1102: set_option now validates that the plot backend provided to 'plotting.backend' implements the backend when the option is set, rather than when a plot is created
column1103: it is also possible to obtain an iterator and read an xport file incrementally.
column1104: the infer_dst argument in tz_localize will be deprecated in favor of ambiguous to allow for more flexibility in dealing with dst transitions. replace infer_dst=true with ambiguous='infer' for the same behavior . see the docs for more details.
column1105: bug in func crosstab when using multiple columns with margins=true and normalize=true
column1106: periodindex now emits a keyerror when a malformed string is looked up, which is consistent with the behavior of datetimeindex
column1107: fixed issue where individual names, levels and labels could be set on multiindex without validation
column1108: pd.read_html can now parse html strings, files or urls and return dataframes, courtesy of @cpcloud. . it works with a single parser backend: beautifulsoup4 + html5lib see the docs
column1109: series.from_array and sparseseries.from_array are deprecated. use the normal constructor series and sparseseries instead .
column1110: infinity and negative infinity are no longer treated as na by isnull and notnull. that they ever were was a relic of early pandas. this behavior can be re-enabled globally by the mode.use_inf_as_null option:
column1111: requesting all columns is possible with the shorthand all
column1112: bug in date_range where using dates with millisecond resolution or higher could return incorrect values or the wrong number of values in the index
column1113: significantly improve the performance of parsing iso8601-format date strings with datetimeindex or to_datetime
column1114: indexing with integers with a multiindex that has an integer-dtype first level incorrectly failed to raise keyerror when one or more of those integer keys is not present in the first level of the index
column1115: fixed regression in the repr of an object-dtype index with bools and missing values
column1116: this is a major release from 0.15.2 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1117: strings passed to dataframe.sort_values as the by parameter may now refer to either column names or index level names. this enables sorting dataframe instances by a combination of index levels and columns without resetting indexes. see the sorting by indexes and values documentation section.
column1118: bug in read_csv in which unicode column names were not being properly recognized with python 2.x
column1119: bug in groupby.transform when axis=1 is specified with a non-monotonic ordered index
column1120: .iloc is strictly integer position based , will raise indexerror when the requested indices are out of bounds. allowed inputs are:
column1121: improved performance of dataframe.set_index with columns consisting of period objects
column1122: the convert_dummies method has been deprecated in favor of get_dummies
column1123: applymap on a dataframe with a non-unique index now works , and fix
column1124: dataframe.dot will not do data alignment, and also work with series
column1125: improved performance of iloc indexing with a list or array .
column1126: bug in merge where merging with equivalent categorical dtypes was raising an error
column1127: as part of the new api for window functions and resampling, aggregation functions have been clarified, raising more informative error messages on invalid aggregations. . a full set of examples are presented in groupby.
column1128: bug in setitem with a duplicate index and an alignable rhs
column1129: bug in resampling when using a timedeltaindex and .asfreq, would previously not include the final fencepost
column1130: empty dataframe columns are now created as object dtype. this will prevent a class of typeerrors that was occurring in code where the dtype of a column would depend on the presence of data or not
column1131: add squeeze keyword to groupby to allow reduction from dataframe -> series if groups are unique. this is a regression from 0.10.1. we are reverting back to the prior behavior. this means groupby will return the same shaped objects whether the groups are unique or not. revert this issue with .
column1132: improved performance of membership checks in categorical and categoricalindex . categoricalindex.contains is likewise much faster
column1133: fixed bug in pandas.read_excel sometimes producing a dataframe with trailing rows of np.nan when the engine openpyxl is used
column1134: bug in pickles contains dateoffset may raise attributeerror when normalize attribute is referred internally
column1135: in 0.13.0 series has internally been refactored to no longer sub-class ndarray but instead subclass ndframe, similar to the rest of the pandas containers. this should be a transparent change with only very limited api implications. see internal refactoring
column1136: the string format is as the python standard library and details can be found here
column1137: using rolling.var instead of rolling.std avoids numerical issues for rolling.corr when rolling.var is still within floating point precision while rolling.std is not
column1138: because of the default align value changes, coordinates of bar plots are now located on integer values . this is intended to make bar plot be located on the same coordinates as line plot. however, bar plot may differs unexpectedly when you manually adjust the bar location or drawing area, such as using set_xlim, set_ylim, etc. in this cases, please modify your script to meet with new coordinates.
column1139: removed the previously deprecated behavior of arithmetic operations with datetime.date objects
column1140: passing list-likes to .loc or with any missing label will raise
column1141: if parse_dates is enabled and this flag is set, pandas will attempt to infer the format of the datetime strings in the columns, and if it can be inferred, switch to a faster method of parsing them. in some cases this can increase the parsing speed by ~5-10x.
column1142: pandas.tseries.holiday.holiday now supports a list of offsets in python3
column1143: bug in categorical.to_numpy and np.array with tz-aware datetime64 categories incorrectly dropping the time zone information instead of casting to object dtype
column1144: bug in index.union and index.intersection where name of the index of the result was not computed correctly for certain cases
column1145: the existing capability to interface with s3 and gcs will be unaffected by this change, as fsspec will still bring in the same packages as before.
column1146: pandas has gained new frequency offsets, semimonthend and semimonthbegin . these provide date offsets anchored to the 15th and end of month, and 15th and 1st of month respectively.
column1147: bug in read_csv in which a column specified with categoricaldtype of boolean categories was not being correctly coerced from string values to booleans
column1148: changed the default inplace argument in dataframe.set_index and series.set_axis from none to false
column1149: for dataframe the following indexing functions are deprecated .
column1150: bug in datetimeindex.get_slice_bound where datetime.date objects were not accepted or naive timestamp with a tz-aware datetimeindex
column1151: allow conversion of values with dtype datetime64 or timedelta64 to strings using astype
column1152: all division with ndframe objects is now truedivision, regardless of the future import. this means that operating on pandas objects will by default use floating point division, and return a floating point dtype. you can use // and floordiv to do integer division.
column1153: bug in expanding_cov, expanding_corr, rolling_cov, rolling_cor, ewmcov, and ewmcorr returning results with columns sorted by name and producing an error for non-unique columns; now handles non-unique columns and returns columns in original order
column1154: fixed bug preventing cut from working with np.inf levels without explicitly passing labels
column1155: bug in dataframe.loc returned requested key plus missing values when loc was applied to single level from a multiindex
column1156: added skip_footer and converters options to read_csv and read_table
column1157: cut and qcut now returns a datetimeindex or timedeltaindex bins when the input is datetime or timedelta dtype respectively and retbins=true
column1158: sparse data structures gained enhanced support of int and bool dtypes, see here
column1159: this is a minor bug-fix release from 0.19.0 and includes some small regression fixes, bug fixes and performance improvements. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1160: .to_latex and .to_html gain a decimal parameter like .to_csv; the default is '.'
column1161: all the above applies to a datetimeindex with tz-aware values as well.
column1162: these are the changes in pandas 1.0.3. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1163: some users may unknowingly have an incomplete python installation lacking the lzma module from the standard library. in this case, import pandas failed due to an importerror . pandas will now warn, rather than raising an importerror if the lzma module is not present. any subsequent attempt to use lzma methods will raise a runtimeerror. a possible fix for the lack of the lzma module is to ensure you have the necessary libraries and then re-install python. for example, on macos installing python with pyenv may lead to an incomplete python installation due to unmet system dependencies at compilation time . compilation will succeed, but python might fail at run time. the issue can be solved by installing the necessary dependencies and then re-installing python.
column1164: float64index is now backed by a float64 dtype ndarray instead of an object dtype array .
column1165: describe now includes a datetime_is_numeric keyword to control how datetime columns are summarized
column1166: both will now raise a keyerror. the rule is that at least 1 indexer must be found when using a list-like and .loc
column1167: fixed pickling of pandas.na. previously a new object was returned, which broke computations relying on na being a singleton
column1168: bug where nan was returned instead of 0 by series.pct_change and dataframe.pct_change when fill_method is not none
column1169: bug in timestamp arithmetic when adding or subtracting an np.ndarray with timedelta64 dtype
column1170: bug in series.str.cat with an index which was filtered as to not include the first item
column1171: a tuple passed to datafame.sort_index will be interpreted as the levels of the index, rather than requiring a list of tuple
column1172: reindex called with no arguments will now return a copy of the input object
column1173: min and max reductions on datetime64 and timedelta64 dtyped series now result in nat and not nan .
column1174: read_csv has deprecated the tupleize_cols argument. column tuples will always be converted to a multiindex
column1175: furthermore, where now aligns the input boolean condition , such that partial selection with setting is possible. this is analogous to partial setting via .ix
column1176: bug in read_csv in which unnecessary warnings were being raised when the dialect s values conflicted with the default arguments
column1177: all non-index ndframes , now support the entire set of arithmetic operators and arithmetic flex methods . sparsepanel does not support pow or mod with non-scalars.
column1178: bug in read_csv in which incorrect error messages were being raised when skipfooter was passed in along with nrows, iterator, or chunksize
column1179: these are the changes in pandas 1.2.1. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1180: bug where labels did not appear properly in the legend of dataframe.plot, passing label= arguments works, and series indices are no longer mutated.
column1181: a timeseries/index localized to utc when inserted into a series/dataframe will preserve the utc timezone and inserted as object dtype rather than being converted to a naive datetime64 .
column1182: dataframe.asof will return a null filled series instead the scalar nan if a match is not found
column1183: read_html copies cell data across colspan and rowspan, and it treats all-th table rows as headers if header kwarg is not given and there is no thead
column1184: io.gbq.read_gbq and io.gbq.to_gbq were refactored to remove the dependency on the google bq.py command line client. this submodule now uses httplib2 and the google apiclient and oauth2client api client libraries which should be more stable and, therefore, reliable than bq.py. see the docs. .
column1185: bug in cartesian_product and multiindex.from_product which may raise with empty input arrays
column1186: bug in dataframe.replace when passing a nested dict that contained keys not in the values to be replaced
column1187: bug in dataframegroupby.resample using .agg with sum produced different result than just calling .sum
column1188: performance boost for to_datetime conversions with a passed format=, and the exact=false
column1189: add log x and y scaling options to dataframe.plot and series.plot
column1190: bug in pd.read_csv in which missing data was being improperly handled with usecols
column1191: dataframe.to_records now accepts index_dtypes and column_dtypes parameters to allow different data types in stored column and index records
column1192: raise a helpful exception when an unsupported weighted window function is used as an argument of pandas.core.window.window.aggregate
column1193: note that the unintentional conversion of ordered discussed above did not arise in previous versions due to separate bugs that prevented astype from doing any type of category to category conversion . these bugs have been fixed in this release, and motivated changing the default value of ordered.
column1194: bug where valueerror is wrongly raised when calling count method of a seriesgroupby when the grouping variable only contains nans and numpy version < 1.13 .
column1195: appending on a store would fail if the table was not first created via put
column1196: improved the warnings for the deprecated methods series.real and series.imag
column1197: usecols parameter in pd.read_csv is now respected even when the lines of a csv file are not even
column1198: fixed regression where dataframe.agg would fail with typeerror when passed positional arguments to be passed on to the aggregation function .
column1199: inconsistency in series floor-division and divmod filling positive//zero with nan instead of inf
column1200: a function union_categorical has been added for combining categoricals, see here
column1201: this also provides compatibility with numpy 1.15, which now dispatches to dataframe.all. with numpy 1.15 and pandas 0.23.1 or earlier, numpy.all will no longer reduce over every axis:
column1202: dataframe.as_blocks is deprecated, as this is exposing the internal implementation
column1203: to replace all occurrences of the string '.' with nan.
column1205: allow equality comparisons of series with a categorical dtype and object dtype; previously these would raise typeerror
column1206: bug in merge_ordered returned wrong join result when length of left_by or right_by equals to the rows of left or right
column1208: forward incompatible changes in msgpack writing format were made over 0.17.0 and 0.18.0; older versions of pandas cannot read files packed by newer versions
column1209: this is a minor release from 0.14.0 and includes a small number of api changes, several new features, enhancements, and performance improvements along with a large number of bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1210: tz_localize now accepts the ambiguous keyword which allows for passing an array of bools indicating whether the date belongs in dst or not, nat for setting transition times to nat, infer for inferring dst/non-dst, and raise for an ambiguoustimeerror to be raised. see the docs for more details
column1211: bug in read_csv that caused the c engine on python 3.6+ on windows to improperly read csv filenames with accented or special characters
column1212: sparsearray with bool dtype now supports logical operators
column1213: bug in .resample with a periodindex not retaining its type or name with an empty dataframe appropriately when empty
column1214: bug in dataframe.query/eval where local string variables with the @ sign were being treated as temporaries attempting to be deleted .
column1215: starting in 0.11.0, construction of dataframe/series will use default dtypes of int64 and float64, regardless of platform. this is not an apparent change from earlier versions of pandas. if you specify dtypes, they will be respected, however
column1216: series.unique with datetime and timezone now returns return array of timestamp with timezone .
column1217: dataframe.nlargest and dataframe.nsmallest now returns the correct n values when keep != all also when tied on the first columns
column1218: bug in the alignment of range objects and other list-likes with dataframe leading to operations being performed row-wise instead of column-wise
column1219: bug in pivot_table performed with nameless index and columns raises keyerror
column1220: bug in installation where html_encoding/*.html wasn t installed and therefore some tests were not running correctly .
column1221: the following error & warning messages are removed from pandas.core.common :
column1222: methods with the inplace option now all return none instead of the calling object. e.g. code written like df = df.fillna may stop working. to fix, simply delete the unnecessary variable assignment.
column1223: bug in read_csv with float_precision='round_trip' did not handle decimal and thousands parameters
column1224: bug in melt where supplying mixed strings and numeric values for id_vars or value_vars would incorrectly raise a valueerror
column1225: the methods dataframe.update and panel.update have deprecated the raise_conflict=false|true keyword in favor of errors='ignore'|'raise'
column1226: bug in both dataframe.first_valid_index and series.first_valid_index raised for a row index having duplicate values
column1227: raise a typeerror on inplace-setting with a .where and a non np.nan value as this is inconsistent with a set-item expression like df = none
column1228: removed the previously deprecated keyword box from to_datetime and to_timedelta; in addition these now always returns datetimeindex, timedeltaindex, index, series, or dataframe
column1229: improve performance of dataframe construction with certain offsets, by removing faulty caching ,
column1230: if a dataframe is sliced with a dataframe based boolean condition , then a dataframe the same size as the original is returned, with elements that do not meet the boolean condition as nan. this is accomplished via the new method dataframe.where. in addition, where takes an optional other argument for replacement.
column1231: bug in multiindex.drop dropped nan values when non existing key was given as input
column1232: if needed you can adjust the bins with the argument offset that would be added to the default origin.
column1233: bug in c parser with delim_whitespace=true and \r-delimited lines
column1234: msgpack submodule has been updated to 0.4.6 with backward compatibility
column1235: bug in seriesgroupby.agg where any column name was accepted in the named aggregation of seriesgroupby previously. the behaviour now allows only str and callables else would raise typeerror.
column1236: notice that the series is now ordered by insertion order. this new behavior is used for all relevant pandas types .
column1237: dataframe.boxplot has a new keyword argument, return_type. it accepts 'dict', 'axes', or 'both', in which case a namedtuple with the matplotlib axes and a dict of matplotlib lines is returned.
column1238: bug in .skew and .kurt due to roundoff error for highly similar values
column1239: column names are now given precedence over locals
column1240: bug in dataframe with datetime64 dtype addition and subtraction with dateoffset objects returning an object dtype instead of datetime64 dtype
column1241: the time values in period and periodindex objects are now set to 23:59:59.999999999 when calling series.dt.end_time, period.end_time, periodindex.end_time, period.to_timestamp with how='end', or periodindex.to_timestamp with how='end'
column1242: series.str.replace now takes an optional regex keyword which, when set to false, uses literal string replacement rather than regex replacement
column1243: this is a minor bug-fix release in the 0.23.x series and includes some small regression fixes and bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1244: this is a minor bug-fix release in the 0.23.x series and includes some small regression fixes and bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1245: this is a minor bug-fix release in the 0.23.x series and includes some small regression fixes and bug fixes. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1246: dataframe.to_dict with orient='index' no longer casts int columns to float for a dataframe with only int and float columns
column1247: much work has been taking place on improving the docs, and a new contributing section has been added.
column1248: parse missing values using read_json with dtype=false to nan instead of none
column1249: implement dataframe.join with vector on argument
column1250: if you want to perform calculations based on today s date, use timestamp.now and pandas.tseries.offsets.
column1251: sum/prod of all-nan or empty series/dataframes is now consistently nan
column1252: sum/prod of all-nan or empty series/dataframes is now consistently nan
column1253: all offsets supports the normalize keyword to specify whether offsets.apply, rollforward and rollback resets the time or not :
column1254: bug in multiindex.sort_index which was not guaranteed to sort correctly with level=1; this was also causing data misalignment in particular dataframe.stack operations
column1255: bug in series.at when used with a multiindex would raise an exception on valid inputs
column1256: fillna is now supported for timedeltas
column1257: bug in series and dataframe indexing with a time key on a datetimeindex with nat entries
column1258: bug where datareader s would fail if one of the symbols passed was invalid. now returns data for valid symbols and np.nan for invalid
column1259: added nrows, chunksize, and iterator arguments to read_csv and read_table. the last two return a new textparser class capable of lazily iterating through chunks of a flat file
column1260: if an index_col is not specified , then any names on the columns index will be lost.
column1261: while propagating na in comparisons may seem like the right behavior to some users , the evaluation was made that propagating na everywhere, including in numerical arrays, would cause a large amount of problems for users. thus, a practicality beats purity approach was taken. this issue may be revisited at some point in the future.
column1262: these are the changes in pandas 0.25.0. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1263: dataframe.astype has deprecated the raise_on_error parameter in favor of errors
column1264: timedeltaindex.searchsorted, datetimeindex.searchsorted, and periodindex.searchsorted have deprecated the key parameter in favor of value
column1265: if interpreting precision as significant figures this did work for scientific notation but that same interpretation did not work for values with standard formatting. it was also out of step with how numpy handles formatting.
column1266: valueerror: only one regex group is supported with index
column1267: bug in pd.read_csv with engine='python' in which trailing nan values were not being parsed
column1268: can call cummin and cummax on series and dataframe to get cumulative minimum and maximum, respectively
column1269: axis parameter of dataframe.quantile now accepts also index and column.
column1270: pandas.tseries.offsets larger than the day offset can now be used with a series for addition/subtraction . see the docs for more details.
column1271: moving and expanding window functions are now methods on series and dataframe, similar to .groupby, see here.
column1272: added ability to export categorical data to/from hdf5 . queries work the same as if it was an object array. however, the category dtyped data is stored in a more efficient manner. see here for an example and caveats w.r.t. prior versions of pandas.
column1273: bug in the css classes assigned to dataframe.style for index names. previously they were assigned "col_heading level<n> col<c>" where n was the number of levels + 1. now they are assigned "index_name level<n>", where n is the correct level for that multiindex.
column1274: bug in dataframe.clip in which column types are not preserved and casted to float
column1275: bug in dataframe.plot and series.plot was overwriting matplotlib s shared y axes behavior when no sharey parameter was passed
column1276: previously, series.str.cat did not in contrast to most of pandas align series on their index before concatenation . the method has now gained a keyword join to control the manner of alignment, see examples below and here.
column1277: a new public pandas.plotting module has been added that holds plotting functionality that was previously in either pandas.tools.plotting or in the top-level namespace. see the deprecations sections for more details.
column1278: when plotting with a periodindex, the matplotlib internal axes will now be arrays of period rather than a periodindex
column1279: for pandas 1.2.1, we restored the previous behaviour to avoid a breaking change, but the above example of np.add with non-aligned inputs will now to raise a warning, and a future pandas 2.0 release will start aligning the inputs first . calling a numpy ufunc on series objects ) already aligns and continues to do so.
column1280: dataframe describe on an empty categorical / object column will return top and freq
column1281: this is equivalent to the following
column1282: bug in pythonparser where str and bytes were being mixed when dealing with the decimal field
column1283: the methods ffill, bfill, pad and backfill of dataframegroupby previously included the group labels in the return value, which was inconsistent with other groupby transforms. now only the filled values are returned.
column1284: bug in read_csv with buffer overflows with certain malformed input files
column1285: in previous versions, the default value for the ordered parameter was false. this could potentially lead to the ordered parameter unintentionally being changed from true to false when users attempt to update categories if ordered is not explicitly specified, as it would silently default to false. the new behavior for ordered=none is to retain the existing value of ordered.
column1286: dropping support for pytables less than version 3.0.0, and numexpr less than version 2.1
column1287: read_pickle and read_msgpack are only guaranteed backwards compatible back to pandas version 0.20.3
column1289: improved performance of read_csv by faster concatenating date columns without extra conversion to string for integer/float zero and float nan; by faster checking the string for the possibility of being a date
column1290: in 0.23.x, pandas would raise a valueerror on a merge of a numeric column and an object dtyped column . we have re-enabled the ability to merge object and other dtypes; pandas will still raise on a merge between a numeric and an object dtyped column that is composed only of strings
column1291: bug in dataframe.to_string and dataframe.to_latex that would lead to incorrect output when the header keyword is used
column1292: dataframe has new where and mask methods to select values according to a given boolean mask
column1293: the old behavior can be retained with by localizing directly to the final timezone:
column1294: bug in dataframe.agg, dataframe.transform and dataframe.apply where, when supplied with a list of functions and axis=1 ), a typeerror was wrongly raised. for all three methods such calculation are now done correctly. .
column1295: bug in pandas.core.window.rolling.count and pandas.core.window.expanding.count was previously ignoring the axis keyword
column1296: see parsing datetime strings with timezone offsets for more.
column1297: subtracting datetimeindex/periodindex from another datetimeindex/periodindex is being deprecated as a set-operation. this will be changed to an actual numeric subtraction yielding a timedeltaindex in a future version. .difference should be used for the differencing set operation.
column1298: these are the changes in pandas 1.1.5. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1299: numeric dtypes will propagate and can coexist in dataframes. if a dtype is passed (either directly via the dtype keyword, a passed ndarray, or a passed series, then it will be preserved in dataframe operations. furthermore, different numeric dtypes will not be combined. the following example will give you a taste.
column1300: the behavior of datetimeindex when passed integer data and a timezone is changing in a future version of pandas. previously, these were interpreted as wall times in the desired timezone. in the future, these will be interpreted as wall times in utc, which are then converted to the desired timezone .
column1301: bug in bingrouper.group_info where returned values are not compatible with base class
column1302: pd.merge will now allow duplicate column names if they are not merged upon .
column1303: inconsistent behavior in .where with datetimelikes which would raise rather than coerce to object
column1304: read_csv and read_table will throw unicodeerror and not coredump on badly encoded strings
column1305: an analogous change has been made to multiindex.from_product. as a consequence, groupby and set_index also preserve categorical dtypes in indexes
column1306: new api functions for working with pandas options :
column1307: fixed regression in dataframe.all and dataframe.any where bool_only=true was ignored
column1308: fixed regression in setting with dataframe.loc raising valueerror when dataframe has unsorted multiindex columns and indexer is a scalar
column1309: bug in the xlsxwriter and xlwtwriter implementations that resulted in datetime columns being formatted without the time were being passed to plotting method
column1310: bug in dataframe.plot with duplicated columns outputs incorrect result
column1311: deprecate groupby.agg with a dictionary when renaming
column1312: deprecate groupby.agg with a dictionary when renaming
column1313: read_excel can now read milliseconds in excel dates and times with xlrd >= 0.9.3.
column1314: .searchsorted for index and timedeltaindex now accept a sorter argument to maintain compatibility with numpy s searchsorted function
column1315: .searchsorted for index and timedeltaindex now accept a sorter argument to maintain compatibility with numpy s searchsorted function
column1316: bug in dataframe.to_csv in which float values were being quoted even though quotations were specified for non-numeric values only
column1317: added test to assert roundtripping to parquet with dataframe.to_parquet or read_parquet will preserve categorical dtypes for string types
column1318: these are the changes in pandas 1.1.0. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1319: improved performance of datetimeindex.tz_localize and various datetimeindex attributes with dateutil utc timezone
column1320: the groupby methods transform and filter can be used on series and dataframes that have repeated indices.
column1321: selecting from a series or dataframe using or loc now only returns exact matches for interval queries.
column1322: added new option plotting.backend to be able to select a plotting backend different than the existing matplotlib one. use pandas.set_option where <backend-module is a library implementing the pandas plotting api
column1323: these are the changes in pandas 0.25.3. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1324: fixed regression in dataframe.shift with axis=1 and heterogeneous dtypes
column1325: calling on an index with a regex with more than one capture group raises valueerror if expand=false.
column1326: bug in the display of .info where a qualifier would always be displayed with a multiindex that contains only non-strings
column1327: you should initialize a multiindex instance using a parameter named codes rather than labels.
column1328: there are no announced changes in 0.13 or prior that are taking effect as of 0.13.1
column1329: the documentation has had references to versions < v0.17 removed and cleaned up
column1330: rangeindex.union now supports the sort argument. if sort=false an unsorted int64index is always returned. sort=none is the default and returns a monotonically increasing rangeindex if possible or a sorted int64index if not
column1331: fixed pandas.testing.assert_series_equal to correctly raise if the left argument is a different subclass with check_series_type=true .
column1332: json normalize with max_level param support
column1333: bug in interval where a timedelta could not be added or subtracted from a timestamp interval
column1334: .values is changed to return an array of period objects, rather than an array of integers .
column1335: we have introduced a new method, dataframe.sort_values, which is the merger of dataframe.sort, series.sort, and series.order, to handle sorting of values.
column1336: bug in dataframegroupby.rolling returned wrong values with time aware window containing nan. raises valueerror because windows are not monotonic now
column1337: change in default floating precision for read_csv and read_table
column1338: bug in dataframe when creating a new column from an ndarray of timestamp objects with timezones creating an object-dtype column, rather than datetime with timezone
column1339: an unsupportedfunctioncall error is now raised if numpy ufuncs like np.mean are called on groupby or resample objects .
column1340: can pass a list of functions to aggregate with groupby on a dataframe, yielding an aggregated result with hierarchical columns
column1341: the default behavior of binary operations between a dataframe and a series has always been to align on the dataframe s columns and broadcast down the rows, except in the special case that the dataframe contains time series. since there are now method for each binary operator enabling you to specify how you want to broadcast, we are phasing out this special case . here s what i m talking about:
column1342: inserting missing values into indexes will work for all types of indexes and automatically insert the correct type of missing value regardless of the type passed in
column1343: bug in multiindex.set_labels which would cause casting of the new labels if the level argument is not 0 or a list like
column1344: notice in the example above that the converted categorical has retained ordered=true. had the default value for ordered remained as false, the converted categorical would have become unordered, despite ordered=false never being explicitly specified. to change the value of ordered, explicitly pass it to the new dtype, e.g. categoricaldtype, ordered=false).
column1345: the product of an empty or all-na series is now 1
column1346: these changes allow pandas to handle sparse data with more dtypes, and for work to make a smoother experience with data handling.
column1347: bug in dataframe instantiating with a dict of iterators or generators )})) raised an error .
column1348: bug in dataframe.resample which silently ignored unsupported options for label, closed and convention
column1349: a cparsererror is now raised instead of a generic exception in read_csv when the c engine cannot parse a column
column1350: improved exception message when calling .iloc or .loc with a boolean indexer with different length .
column1352: bug in seriesgroupby.aggregate was resulting in aggregations being overwritten when they shared the same name
column1353: previously, sparse data were float64 dtype by default, even if all inputs were of int or bool dtype. you had to specify dtype explicitly to create sparse data with int64 dtype. also, fill_value had to be specified explicitly because the default was np.nan which doesn t appear in int64 or bool data.
column1354: dataframe.interpolate has gained a limit_area parameter to allow further control of which nan s are replaced. use limit_area='inside' to fill only nans surrounded by valid values or use limit_area='outside' to fill only nan s outside the existing valid values while preserving those inside. see the full documentation here.
column1355: ensured that result group order is correct when grouping on an ordered categorical and specifying observed=true
column1356: bug in scalar in index if scalar is a float while the index is of integer dtype
column1357: series.clip and dataframe.clip now treat na values for upper and lower arguments as none instead of raising valueerror .
column1358: fix an issue with cacheableoffset not properly being used by many dateoffset; this prevented the dateoffset from being cached
column1359: dataframe.resample and series.resample with a periodindex will now respect the base argument in the same fashion as with a datetimeindex.
column1360: removed the previously deprecated parse_cols keyword in read_excel
column1361: fixed regression in dataframe.loc and dataframe.iloc when selecting a row containing a single datetime64 or timedelta64 column
column1362: adding datetimeindex/periodindex to another datetimeindex/periodindex is being deprecated as a set-operation. this will be changed to a typeerror in a future version. .union should be used for the union set operation.
column1363: nat s methods now either raise valueerror, or return np.nan or nat
column1364: categorical.searchsorted and series.searchsorted have renamed the v argument to value
column1365: passing an array with 2 or more dimensions to the series constructor now raises the more specific valueerror rather than a bare exception
column1366: bug in datetimeindex and periodindex.value_counts resets name from its result, but retains in result s index.
column1367: dataframe.unstack will now default to filling with np.nan for object columns.
column1368: bug in datetimeindex and period subtraction raises valueerror or attributeerror rather than typeerror
column1369: pivot_table can now accept grouper by index and columns keywords
column1370: using an unsupported version of beautiful soup 4 will now raise an importerror instead of a valueerror
column1371: pd.read_csv now supports the error_bad_lines and warn_bad_lines arguments for the python parser
column1372: the result of sparseseries.unstack is now a dataframe with sparse values, rather than a sparsedataframe .
column1373: levels names of a multiindex are now required to be unique: trying to create a multiindex with repeated names will raise a valueerror
column1374: bug in core.groupby.seriesgroupby.nunique where nat values were interfering with the count of unique values
column1375: bug in dataframe.plot.scatter and dataframe.plot.hexbin caused x-axis label and ticklabels to disappear when colorbar was on in ipython inline backend
column1376: bug in dataframe.loc and series.loc where keyerror was not raised for a multiindex when the key was less than or equal to the number of levels in the multiindex .
column1377: some background: in pandas 0.21, we fixed a long-standing inconsistency in the return value of all-na series depending on whether or not bottleneck was installed. see sum/prod of all-nan or empty series/dataframes is now consistently nan. at the same time, we changed the sum and prod of an empty series to also be nan.
column1378: dataframe.convert_objects has been deprecated in favor of type-specific functions pd.to_datetime, pd.to_timestamp and pd.to_numeric .
column1379: bug in series.mask and dataframe.mask with list conditionals
column1380: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.first and pandas.core.groupby.groupby.last where timezone information would be dropped
column1381: these are the changes in pandas 1.2.3. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1382: pandas implements some matplotlib converters for nicely formatting the axis labels on plots with datetime or period values. prior to pandas 0.21.0, these were implicitly registered with matplotlib, as a side effect of import pandas.
column1383: upsampling operations take you from a lower frequency to a higher frequency. these are now performed with the resampler objects with backfill, ffill, fillna and asfreq methods.
column1384: bug on inplace operation of a series that was adding a column to the dataframe from where it was originally dropped from
column1385: slicing with .loc where the start and/or stop bound is not found in the index is now allowed; this previously would raise a keyerror. this makes the behavior the same as .ix in this case. this change is only for slicing, not when indexing with a single label.
column1386: dataframe.agg and series.agg now accept named aggregation for renaming the output columns/indexes.
column1387: can store objects indexed by tuples and floats in hdfstore
column1388: series.rename_axis and dataframe.rename_axis with inplace=true now return none while renaming the axis inplace.
column1389: a class of bugs were introduced in pandas 0.21 with categoricaldtype that affects the correctness of operations like merge, concat, and indexing when comparing multiple unordered categorical arrays that have the same categories, but in a different order. we highly recommend upgrading or manually aligning your categories before doing these operations.
column1390: bug in datetimeindex.take and timedeltaindex.take may not raise indexerror against invalid index
column1391: fixed regression in df.groupby.rolling with the resulting multiindex when grouping by a label that is in the index
column1392: a similar approach is now available for series groupby objects as well. because there s no need for column selection, the values can just be the functions to apply
column1393: bug in indexing on a series or dataframe with a multiindex and a level named "0"
column1394: nat defines more arithmetic operations with datetime64 and timedelta64.
column1395: bug in dataframe.to_string where values were truncated using display options instead of outputting the full content
column1396: read_json and to_json now accept a compression argument which allows them to transparently handle compressed files.
column1397: read_html previously ignored colspan and rowspan attributes. now it understands them, treating them as sequences of cells with the same value.
column1398: a errors.performancewarning is issued when using fillna with a method, as a dense array is constructed to create the filled array. filling with a value is the efficient way to fill a sparse array.
column1399: when created with duplicate labels, multiindex now raises a valueerror.
column1400: subtraction of series with timezone-aware dtype='datetime64' with mismatched timezones will raise typeerror instead of valueerror
column1401: removed the previously deprecated keyword dtype from block.make_block_same_class
column1402: bug in dataframe.to_html where values were truncated using display options instead of outputting the full content
column1403: .groupby.groups will now return a dictionary of index objects, rather than a dictionary of np.ndarray or lists
column1404: groupby nth now reduces by default; filtering can be achieved by passing as_index=false. with an optional dropna argument to ignore nan. see the docs.
column1405: bug in .corr and .cov where the column and index were the same object
column1406: additionally, the endpoint parameter end was not included in the intervals produced by interval_range. however, all other range functions include end in their output. to promote consistency among the range functions, interval_range will now include end as the right endpoint of the final interval, except if freq is specified in a way which skips end.
column1407: sorting in descending order is now stable for series.sort_values and index.sort_values for datetime-like index subclasses. this will affect sort order when sorting a dataframe on multiple columns, sorting with a key function that produces duplicates, or requesting the sorting index when using index.sort_values. when using series.value_counts, the count of missing values is no longer necessarily last in the list of duplicate counts. instead, its position corresponds to the position in the original series. when using index.sort_values for datetime-like index subclasses, nats ignored the na_position argument and were sorted to the beginning. now they respect na_position, the default being last, same as other index subclasses
column1408: this is a minor bug-fix release in the 0.19.x series and includes some small regression fixes, bug fixes and performance improvements. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version.
column1409: hdfstore.remove now handles start and stop
column1410: bug in indexing on a series or dataframe with a categoricalindex using list-like indexer that contains elements that are in the index s categories but not in the index itself failing to raise keyerror
column1411: improved performance of iterating over a series. using dataframe.itertuples now creates iterators without internally allocating lists of all elements
column1412: these are the changes in pandas 1.2.2. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1413: for earlier versions this can be done using the following.
column1414: bug with reindexing on the index with a non-unique index will now raise valueerror
column1415: construction is by default for floating type values.
column1416: the timestamp class has dropped the offset attribute in favor of freq
column1417: one example where the behavior of np.nan and pd.na is different is comparison operations:
column1418: added support for writing datetime.date and datetime.time object columns with to_sql .
column1419: index.get_indexer now supports method='pad' and method='backfill' even for any target array, not just monotonic targets. these methods also work for monotonic decreasing as well as monotonic increasing indexes .
column1420: the default behavior for hdfstore write functions with format='table' is now to keep rows that are all missing. previously, the behavior was to drop rows that were all missing save the index. the previous behavior can be replicated using the dropna=true option.
column1421: fixed regression in .groupby.rolling where a custom baseindexer would be ignored
column1422: bug in groupby where callable objects without name attributes would take the wrong path, and produce a dataframe instead of a series
column1423: calling numpy ufuncs on non-aligned dataframes changed behaviour in pandas 1.2.0 , but this change is reverted in pandas 1.2.1. the behaviour to not align is now deprecated instead, see the the 1.2.1 release notes for more details.
column1424: compatibility between pandas array-like methods and their numpy counterparts has been greatly increased by augmenting the signatures of the pandas methods so as to accept arguments that can be passed in from numpy, even if they are not necessarily used in the pandas implementation
column1425: dataframe.to_csv and series.to_csv now support the compression keyword when a file handle is passed.
column1426: bug in pd.read_html when using bs4 flavor and parsing table with a header and only one column
column1427: fixed regression in dataframe.groupby which would not emit an error when called with a tuple key not in the index
column1428: for a concrete example on combining .groupby and .pipe , imagine having a dataframe with columns for stores, products, revenue and sold quantity. we d like to do a groupwise calculation of prices per store and per product. we could do this in a multi-step operation, but expressing it in terms of piping can make the code more readable.
column1429: fix bound checking for timestamp with datetime64 input
column1430: fixed regression in certain offsets and below) no longer being hashable
column1431: fixed regression in .groupby.rolling where column selection was ignored
column1432: these are the changes in pandas 0.25.1. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1433: bug in holiday with no offset or observance
column1434: bug in pd.read_csv with engine='c' in which fields were not properly cast to float when quoting was specified as non-numeric
column1435: fixed regression where dataframe.apply would raise valueerror for elements with s dtype
column1436: constructing a dataframe with an index argument that wasn t already an instance of index was broken .
column1437: constructing a categoricalindex with empty values and boolean categories was raising a valueerror after a change to dtype coercion .
column1438: new users are often puzzled by the relationship between column operations and attribute access on dataframe instances . one specific instance of this confusion is attempting to create a new column by setting an attribute on the dataframe:
column1439: furthermore, previously if you rank inf or -inf values together with nan values, the calculation won t distinguish nan from infinity when using top or bottom argument.
column1440: the minimum supported python version will be bumped to 3.6 in a future release.
column1441: bug in dataframe.loc with dictionary of values changes columns with dtype of int to float
column1443: bug in series.where and dataframe.where where array-like conditionals were being rejected
column1444: we ve added an engine keyword to apply and apply that allows the user to execute the routine using numba instead of cython. using the numba engine can yield significant performance gains if the apply function can operate on numpy arrays and the data set is larger . for more details, see rolling apply documentation
column1445: bug in float64index where iat and at were not testing and were failing .
column1446: bug in to_timedelta that accepted invalid units and misinterpreted m/h
column1447: bug in datetimeindex.equals and timedeltaindex.equals incorrectly considering int64 indexes as equal
column1448: internal type checking is now done via a suite of generated classes, allowing isinstance without having to directly import the klass, courtesy of @jtratner
column1449: performance improvements when creating dataframe or series with dtype str or stringdtype from array with many string elements
column1450: bug in cut and qcut where timezone information was dropped
column1451: in v.0.23 join will default to none , but this default will change to 'left' in a future version of pandas.
column1452: additionally, dataframes with datetime columns that were parsed by read_sql_table and read_sql_query will also be localized to utc only if the original sql columns were timezone aware datetime columns.
column1453: bug when adding or subtracting a businesshour to a timestamp with the resulting time landing in a following or prior day respectively
column1454: bug in pd.read_csv in which a file containing a row with many columns followed by rows with fewer columns would cause a crash
column1455: bug in dataframe.merge and pandas.merge returning inconsistent ordering in result for how=right and how=left
column1456: pd.read_csv is now able to infer compression type for files read from aws s3 storage .
column1457: added rolling.sem and expanding.sem to compute the standard error of the mean
column1458: fixed regression in dataframe setting values with a slice indexing by label instead of position
column1459: the labels attribute of the categorical class has been removed in favor of categorical.codes
column1460: added vbench benchmarks for alternative excelwriter engines and reading excel files
column1461: bug in timedelta.__floordiv__ and timedelta.__rfloordiv__ dividing by many incompatible numpy objects was incorrectly allowed
column1462: bug in seriesgroupby.transform with datetime values and missing groups
column1463: a verbose argument has been augmented in io.read_excel, defaults to false. set to true to print sheet names as they are parsed.
column1464: sparsearray.to_dense has deprecated the fill parameter, as that parameter was not being respected
column1465: we ve added a min_count parameter to .sum and .prod controlling the minimum number of valid values for the result to be valid. if fewer than min_count non-na values are present, the result is na. the default is 0. to return nan, the 0.21 behavior, use min_count=1.
column1527: bug in filter and transform when grouping on multiple keys, one of which is datetime-like
column1528: bug in series.rank and dataframe.rank when ascending='false' failed to return correct ranks for infinity if nan were present
column1529: the dataframe.infer_objects and series.infer_objects methods have been added to perform dtype inference on object columns, replacing some of the functionality of the deprecated convert_objects method. see the documentation here for more details.
column1530: bug in series.resample using a frequency of nano when the index is a datetimeindex and contains non-zero nanosecond parts
column1531: rolling and expanding already have a min_periods keyword that behaves similar to min_count. the only case that changes is when doing a rolling or expanding sum with min_periods=0. previously this returned nan, when fewer than min_periods non-na values were in the window. now it returns 0.
column1532: bug in pd.read_csv in which invalid values for nrows and chunksize were allowed
column1533: dataframe.pivot_table now accepts an observed parameter which is passed to underlying calls to dataframe.groupby to speed up grouping categorical data.
column1534: the default sum for empty or all-na series is now 0.
column1535: enable pd.read_hdf to be used without specifying a key when the hdf file contains a single dataset
column1536: performance improvement in dataframe.select_dtypes by using vectorization instead of iterating over a loop
column1537: to_csv and read_csv did not honor compression and encoding for path-like objects that are internally converted to file-like objects
column1538: when aggregating using concat or the dataframe constructor, pandas will now attempt to preserve index and column names whenever possible . in the case where all inputs share a common name, this name will be assigned to the result. when the input names do not all agree, the result will be unnamed. here is an example where the index name is preserved:
column1539: diff will raise a typeerror rather than implicitly losing the dtype of extension types in the future. convert to the correct dtype before calling diff instead
column1540: index.intersection and inner join now preserve the order of the left index
column1541: index.intersection and inner join now preserve the order of the left index
column1542: bug in area plot draws legend incorrectly if subplot is enabled or legend is moved after plot
column1543: bug in holiday.dates where observance rules could not be applied to holiday and doc enhancement
column1544: the idiomatic way to achieve selecting potentially not-found elements is via .reindex
column1545: fixes dtype of result with integer dtype input, from pivot_table when called with margins=true
column1546: fixed metadata propagation in series.abs and ufuncs called on series and dataframes
column1547: bug that returns none and does not raise notimplementederror when operator functions of panel are not implemented
