column1548: series.all and series.any now support the level and skipna parameters. series.all, series.any, index.all, and index.any no longer support the out and keepdims parameters, which existed for compatibility with ndarray. various index types no longer support the all and any aggregation functions and will now raise typeerror. .
column1550: bug in dataframe indexing returning an incorrect series in some cases when the series has been altered and a cache not invalidated
column1551: bug in pandas.testing.assert_series_equal and pandas.testing.assert_frame_equal where extension dtypes were not ignored when check_dtypes was set to false
column1552: added support for 3-character iso and non-standard country codes in io.wb.download
column1553: bug in dataframe.plot when kind='box' and data contains datetime or timedelta data. these types are now automatically dropped
column1554: the top-level pandas.eval function does not allow you use the '@' prefix and provides you with an error message telling you so.
column1555: series.where with categorical dtype with categorical column) no longer allows setting new categories
column1556: datetimeindex.to_series now accepts index and name kwargs
column1557: bug in dataframe.interpolate when called on a dataframe with column names of string type was throwing a valueerror. the method is now independent of the type of the column names
column1558: regression in pivot_table where an ordered categorical with missing values for the pivot s index would give a mis-aligned result
column1559: require at least 0.23 version of cython to avoid problems with character encodings
column1560: dataframe now properly supports simultaneous copy and dtype arguments in constructor
column1561: bug in adding a index with object dtype to a series with timedelta64 dtype incorrectly raising
column1562: bug in radviz and andrews_curves where multiple values of color were being passed to plotting method
column1563: fixed a bug with setting invalid or out-of-range values in indexing enlargement scenarios
column1564: when passed dataframes whose values are sparse, concat will now return a series or dataframe with sparse values, rather than a sparsedataframe .
column1565: bug in dataframe.reset_index and series.reset_index would not preserve data types on an empty dataframe or series with a multiindex
column1566: bug in dataframe constructor when columns parameter is set, and data is an empty list
column1567: bug in merging with categorical dtypes with datetimelikes incorrectly raised a typeerror
column1568: interpolate and fillna will raise a valueerror if the limit keyword argument is not greater than 0.
column1569: describe now accepts an array of percentiles to include in the summary statistics
column1570: bug in index.to_series where the index was not copied ,
column1571: bug in dataframe.to_stata and statawriter which produces incorrectly formatted files to be produced for some locales
column1572: note that integer- and floating-dtype indexes are considered compatible . the integer values are coerced to floating point, which may result in loss of precision. see set operations on index objects for more.
column1573: bug in dataframe.sort_index where an error is thrown when a multi-indexed dataframe is sorted on all levels with the initial level sorted last
column1574: bug in dataframe.to_latex where pairs of braces meant to serve as invisible placeholders were escaped
column1575: excelfile.parse has deprecated sheetname in favor of sheet_name for consistency with read_excel .
column1576: bug in .str accessor methods may raise valueerror if input has name and the result is dataframe or multiindex
column1577: added top-level function read_sql that is equivalent to the following
column1578: these are the changes in pandas 1.0.4. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1579: slicing with negative start, stop & step values handles corner cases better :
column1580: bug in unstack with timedeltaindex or datetimeindex and nulls .
column1581: bug in series flex arithmetic methods where the result when operating with a list, tuple or np.ndarray would have an incorrect name
column1582: calling a binary-input numpy ufunc on multiple dataframe objects now aligns, matching the behavior of binary operations and ufuncs on series . this change has been reverted in pandas 1.2.1, and the behaviour to not align dataframes is deprecated instead, see the the 1.2.1 release notes.
column1583: improved performance in dataframe.asof when where is a scalar
column1584: suppressed error in the construction of a dataframe from a dict containing scalar values when the corresponding keys are not included in the passed index
column1585: removed neg - boolean operations on numpy arrays in favor of inv ~, as this is going to be deprecated in numpy 1.9
column1586: period objects no longer raise a typeerror when compared using == with another object that isn t a period. instead when comparing a period with another object using == if the other object isn t a period false is returned.
column1587: bug in rolling_std and rolling_var for a single value producing 0 rather than nan
column1588: in order to standardize the read_csv api for both the c and python engines, both will now raise an emptydataerror, a subclass of valueerror, in response to empty columns or header
column1589: bug causing groupby.sum and similar to not preserve metadata
column1590: bug in which dataframe.append produced an erroneous warning indicating that a keyerror will be thrown in the future when the data to be appended contains new columns .
column1591: a list or tuple with length matching the number of rows in the dataframe will now raise valueerror instead of operating column-by-column (gh22880.
column1592: eval and dataframe.eval have changed the default of inplace from none to false
column1593: in previous versions, a dataframe was truncated once the dimension constraints were reached and an ellipse signaled that part of the data was cut off.
column1594: to_datetime has gained a new parameter, origin, to define a reference date from where to compute the resulting timestamps when parsing numerical values with a specific unit specified.
column1595: bug in execute was raising a programmingerror for some db-api drivers when the sql statement contained the % character and no parameters were present
column1596: bug in to_excel could not handle the column name render and was raising an keyerror
column1597: passing na into a format string using format specs will now work. for example "{:.1f}".format would previously raise a valueerror, but will now return the string "<na>"
column1598: the configuration option pd.options.mode.use_inf_as_null is deprecated, and pd.options.mode.use_inf_as_na is added as a replacement.
column1599: series.is_time_series deprecated in favor of series.index.is_all_dates
column1600: deprecations will be enforced in major releases
column1601: bug in timestamp comparisons with == and int64 dtype
column1602: this can also be seen in multi-axis indexing with a panel.
column1603: fixed bug with reading compressed files with read_fwf in python 3.
column1604: fixed json bug where locales with decimal separators other than . threw exceptions when encoding / decoding certain values.
column1605: see more at advanced indexing and advanced hierarchical.
column1606: pandas.hdfstore s string representation is now faster and less detailed. for the previous behavior, use pandas.hdfstore.info. .
column1607: printing of multiindex instances now shows tuples of each row and ensures that the tuple items are vertically aligned, so it s now easier to understand the structure of the multiindex. :
column1608: bug in indexing with a periodindex incorrectly accepting integers representing years, use e.g. ser.loc instead of ser.loc
column1609: compat issue is dataframe.dtypes when options.mode.use_inf_as_null is true
column1610: show a futurewarning rather than a deprecationwarning on using long-time deprecated syntax in hdfstore.select, where the where clause is not a string-like
column1611: bug in multiindex.get_level_values which would return an invalid index on level of ints with missing values
column1612: removed the previously deprecated keyword fill_value from categorical.fillna, use value instead
column1613: passing an integer to series.fillna and dataframe.fillna with timedelta64 dtypes is deprecated, will raise typeerror in a future version. use obj.fillna) instead
column1614: this new api for resample includes some internal changes for the prior-to-0.18.0 api, to work with a deprecation warning in most cases, as the resample operation returns a deferred object. we can intercept operations and just do what the api did . here is a typical use case:
column1615: bug in dataframe.groupby did not respect the observed argument when selecting a column and instead always used observed=false
column1616: excel files saved in version 0.16.2 or prior that had index names will still able to be read in, but the has_index_names argument must specified to true.
column1617: in prior versions, using series.unique and pandas.unique on categorical and tz-aware data-types would yield different return types. these are now made consistent.
column1618: here is a typical useful syntax for computing different aggregations for different columns. this is a natural, and useful syntax. we aggregate from the dict-to-list by taking the specified columns and applying the list of functions. this returns a multiindex for the columns .
column1619: bug in dataframe.to_hdf was not dropping missing rows with dropna=true
column1620: bug in businessday when adding n days to a date not on offset when n>5 and n%5==0
column1621: bug in pandas.wide_to_long when a string is passed to the stubnames argument and a column name is a substring of that stubname
column1622: finally, you can use a callable in indexing of series, dataframe and panel. the callable must return a valid input for indexing depending on its class and index type.
column1623: the numpy argument of pandas.read_json is deprecated .
column1624: added support for utcfromtimestamp, fromtimestamp, and combine on timestamp class .
column1625: improved performance of rangeindex.min and rangeindex.max by using rangeindex properties to perform the computations
column1626: bug in the html display with a multiindex and truncation
column1627: timezone converting a tz-aware datetime.datetime or timestamp with timestamp and the tz argument is now deprecated. instead, use timestamp.tz_convert
column1628: improve the performance of groupby on single-key aggregations and use with categorical types
column1629: pd.read_hdf will now raise a valueerror instead of keyerror, if a mode other than r, r+ and a is supplied.
column1630: bug in periodindex where adding or subtracting a timedelta or tick object produced incorrect results
column1631: multiplication and division of numeric-dtyped index objects with timedelta-like scalars returns timedeltaindex instead of raising typeerror
column1632: passing a dtype without a precision like np.dtype or timedelta64 to index, datetimeindex and timedeltaindex is now deprecated. use the nanosecond-precision dtype instead .
column1633: series.argmin, series.argmax, and their counterparts on dataframe and groupby objects work correctly with floating point data that contains infinite values .
column1634: bug in categorical not created properly with series.to_frame
column1635: calling np.array and np.asarray on tz-aware series and datetimeindex will now return an object array of tz-aware timestamp
column1636: bug in intervaltree where data containing nan triggered a warning and resulted in incorrect indexing queries with intervalindex
column1637: with tab-completion of available methods and properties.
column1638: significantly improved performance of indexing multiindex with slicers
column1639: datetimeindex now supports conversion to strings with astype
column1640: the longpanel and widepanel classes have been removed
column1641: improved performance of to_datetime when specified format string is iso8601
column1642: fixed operator.xor with a boolean-dtype sparsearray. now returns a sparse result, rather than object dtype
column1643: added new writer for exporting stata dta files in versions 118 and 119, statawriterutf8. these files formats support exporting strings containing unicode characters. format 119 supports data sets with more than 32,767 variables
column1644: improve scatter_matrix plotting function and add histogram or kernel density estimates to diagonal
column1645: for stringmethods.extract, when no match is found, the result - only containing nan values - now also has dtype=object instead of float
column1646: this uses the numpy.busdaycalendar api introduced in numpy 1.7 and therefore requires numpy 1.7.0 or newer.
column1647: dataframe.to_parquet now accepts index as an argument, allowing the user to override the engine s default behavior to include or omit the dataframe s indexes from the resulting parquet file.
column1648: bug in nat comparison if a mixed datetime/np.datetime64 with nat were passed
column1649: read_stata and statareader can import missing data information into a dataframe by setting the argument convert_missing to true. when using this options, missing values are returned as statamissingvalue objects and columns containing missing values have object data type.
column1650: pretty printing sets now uses set literal syntax instead of legacy python syntax )
column1651: previously, outputting a multiindex printed all the levels and codes of the multiindex, which was visually unappealing and made the output more difficult to navigate. for example :
column1652: the .to_latex method will now accept multicolumn and multirow arguments to use the accompanying latex enhancements
column1653: these are the changes in pandas 0.24.2. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1654: this will now convert integers/floats with the default unit of ns.
column1655: selecting via a scalar value that is contained in the intervals.
column1656: bug in passing input with tzinfo to some offsets apply, rollforward or rollback resets tzinfo or raises valueerror
column1657: bug in .clip with axis=1 and a list-like for threshold is passed; previously this raised valueerror
column1658: periodindex can now accept list and array which contains pd.nat
column1659: .loc has compat with .ix for accepting iterators, and namedtuples
column1660: bug in weekofmonth and lastweekofmonth where default keyword arguments for constructor raised valueerror
column1661: unordered category: values and categories are sorted by appearance order.
column1662: for larger series of dataframe with a length above max_rows, only min_rows number of rows is shown .
column1663: bug in pd.concat and .append with the same timezone get reset to utc
column1664: astype fails if data contains values which cannot be converted to specified dtype. note that the limitation is applied to fill_value which default is np.nan.
column1665: the index in .groupby.nth output is now more consistent when the as_index argument is passed :
column1668: will be interpreted differently in a future version of pandas. previously,
column1669: bug in index with numeric dtype when multiplying or dividing an array with dtype timedelta64
column1670: this will now be the default constructed index for ndframe objects, rather than previous an int64index.
column1671: a new, friendlier valueerror is added to protect against the mistake of supplying the sep as an arg, rather than as a kwarg. .
column1672: bug csv: fix problem with trailing white space in skipped rows, , ,
column1673: until python 3.6, dicts in python had no formally defined ordering. for python version 3.6 and later, dicts are ordered by insertion order, see pep 468. pandas will use the dict s insertion order, when creating a series or dataframe from a dict and you re using python version 3.6 or higher.
column1674: bug in dataframe and series constructors where range objects are converted to int32 dtype on windows instead of int64
column1675: these are the changes in pandas 0.24.0. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1676: fixed regression in rollinggroupby causing a segmentation fault with index of dtype object
column1677: bug in sparseseries and sparsedataframe creation with object dtype may raise typeerror
column1678: previously, pandas would register converters with matplotlib as a side effect of importing pandas . this changed the output of plots made via matplotlib plots after pandas was imported, even if you were using matplotlib directly rather than plot.
column1679: categorical.name was deprecated to make categorical more numpy.ndarray like. use series instead .
column1680: bug in rename where an index of same-length tuples was converted to a multiindex
column1681: series.combine with scalar argument now works for any function type
column1682: fixed memoryerror caused by performing counting sort on sorting multiindex levels with a very large number of combinatorial values
column1683: pandas now is python 2/3 compatible without the need for 2to3 thanks to @jtratner. as a result, pandas now uses iterators more extensively. this also led to the introduction of substantive parts of the benjamin peterson s six library into compat.
column1684: dataframe.rank now supports additional argument values for the na_option parameter so missing values can be assigned either the largest or the smallest rank
column1685: elements that do not match return a row of nan. thus, a series of messy strings can be converted into a like-indexed series or dataframe of cleaned-up or more useful strings, without necessitating get to access tuples or re.match objects.
column1686: each method signature only includes relevant arguments. currently, these are limited to required arguments, but in the future these will include optional arguments, as well. for an overview, see the new plotting api documentation.
column1687: bug in datetimeindex and date_range where mismatching tz-aware start and end timezones would not raise an err if end.tzinfo is none
column1688: bug in intervalindex constructor when a list of intervals is passed with non-default closed
column1689: regression from 0.13 with fillna and a series on datetime-like
column1691: dataframe.set_index now works for instances of abc.iterator, provided their output is of the same length as the calling frame
column1692: multi-table creation via append_to_multiple and selection via select_as_multiple can create/select from multiple tables and return a combined result, by using where on a selector table.
column1693: these indexing behaviors of the intervalindex are provisional and may change in a future version of pandas. feedback on usage is welcome.
column1694: in 0.23.0, we unified operations between datetimeindex and series, and in the process changed comparisons between a series of datetimes and datetime.date without warning.
column1695: bug in timestamp.replace with compat for passing long integers
column1696: bug in dataframe.to_stata and pandas.io.stata.statawriter117 that produced invalid files when using strls with non-ascii characters
column1697: improved performance of series.sort_index with a monotonic index
column1698: removal of the legacy time rules , deprecated since 0.17.0 . now legacy time rules raises valueerror. for the list of currently supported offsets, see here.
column1699: methods such as index.get_indexer that return an indexer array, coerce that array to a platform int , so that it can be directly used in 3rd party library operations like numpy.take. previously, a platform int was defined as np.int_ which corresponds to a c integer, but the correct type, and what is being used now, is np.intp, which corresponds to the c integer size that can hold a pointer .
column1700: prior to 0.13, it was impossible to use a label indexer to set a value that was not contained in the index of a particular axis. . see the docs
column1701: timestamp.month_name, datetimeindex.month_name, and series.dt.month_name are now available
column1702: sparse data structures now gained enhanced support of int64 and bool dtype .
column1703: the bins of the grouping are adjusted based on the beginning of the day of the time series starting point. this works well with frequencies that are multiples of a day or that divides a day . but it can create inconsistencies with some frequencies that do not meet this criteria. to change this behavior you can now specify a fixed timestamp with the argument origin.
column1704: fixed bug in to_datetime raising when cache=true and out-of-bound values are present
column1705: df.info now honors the option max_info_rows, to disable null counts for large frames
column1706: bug in index construction with a mixed list of tuples
column1707: series.apply will now operate on a returned value from the applied function, that is itself a series, and possibly upcast the result to a dataframe
column1708: passing period with multiple frequencies to normal index now returns index with object dtype
column1709: bug in dataframe.to_sql when reading dataframes with -np.inf entries with mysql now has a more explicit valueerror
column1710: consistent with the python api, pd.read_csv will now interpret +inf as positive infinity
column1711: bug in date_range with unnecessary overflowerror being raised for very large or very small dates
column1712: index methods &, |, and ^ behaving as the set operations index.intersection, index.union, and index.symmetric_difference, respectively, are deprecated and in the future will behave as pointwise boolean operations matching series behavior. use the named set methods instead
column1713: fixed regression in groupby.nunique which was modifying the original values if nan values were present
column1714: reverted some changes to how na values are handled in non-numeric series:
column1715: dataframe.apply was inconsistent when applying an arbitrary user-defined-function that returned a list-like with axis=1. several bugs and inconsistencies are resolved. if the applied function returns a series, then pandas will return a dataframe; otherwise a series will be returned, this includes the case where a list-like .
column1716: series.to_csv has dropped the nanrep parameter in favor of na_rep
column1717: indexing with a list of strings representing datetimes failed on datetimeindex or periodindex
column1718: hdfstore is now iterable: for k in store is equivalent to for k in store.keys .
column1719: fixed regression in dataframe.apply with axis=1 using str accessor in apply function
column1720: these are the changes in pandas 1.2.0. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1721: added reference to backwards incompatible check_freq arg of testing.assert_frame_equal and testing.assert_series_equal in pandas 1.1.0 whats new
column1722: dataframe.all and dataframe.any now accept axis=none to reduce over all axes to a scalar
column1723: bug in transform and filter when grouping on a categorical variable
column1724: bug in reading a json with orient='table' generated by dataframe.to_json with index=false
column1725: bug in dataframe.unstack which casts int to float if columns is a multiindex with unused levels
column1726: bug in periodindex with attribute freq.n greater than 1 where adding a dateoffset object would return incorrect results
column1727: the method name categorical.sort is deprecated in favor of categorical.sort_values
column1728: passing an invalid engine to read_csv now raises an informative valueerror rather than unboundlocalerror.
column1729: pd.read_csv, pd.read_table, and pd.read_hdf raise the builtin filenotfounderror exception for python 3.x when called on a nonexistent file; this is back-ported as ioerror in python 2.x
column1730: index.to_series now accepts index and name kwargs
column1731: bug in datetimeindex.strftime and series.dt.strftime where nat was converted to the string 'nat' instead of np.nan
column1732: pandas.parser, pandas.lib, and pandas.tslib have been removed
column1733: passing a dtype alias to datetimetzdtype is no longer allowed, use datetimetzdtype.construct_from_string instead
column1734: bug in series.reindex when specifying a method with some nan values was inconsistent
column1735: bug in groupby.quantile causes the quantiles to be shifted when the by axis contains nan
column1736: bug in series.rename when using a custom type indexer. now any value that isn t callable or dict-like is treated as a scalar.
column1737: when constructing dataframe with an array of complex64 dtype previously meant the corresponding column was automatically promoted to the complex128 dtype. pandas will now preserve the itemsize of the input for complex data
column1739: a scalar index that is not found will raise keyerror
column1740: the minimum supported dta version has increased to 105 in read_stata and statareader .
column1741: bug in timestamp where constructing a timestamp from ambiguous epoch time and calling constructor again changed the timestamp.value property
column1742: these are the changes in pandas 1.0.2. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1743: bug in pd.read_csv for the c engine where usecols were being indexed incorrectly with parse_dates
column1744: read_sas has gained the ability to read sas7bdat files, including compressed files. the files can be read in entirety, or incrementally. for full details see here.
column1745: previously, when using certain iteration methods for a series with dtype int or float, you would receive a numpy scalar, e.g. a np.int64, rather than a python int. issue corrected this for series.tolist and list. this change makes all iteration methods consistent, in particular, for __iter__ and .map; note that this only affects int/float dtypes. .
column1746: bug in series.values_counts with excluding nan for categorical type series with dropna=true
column1747: pd.to_timedelta accepts nan and nat, returning nat instead of raising
column1748: raise valueerror when engine='c' specified with unsupported options in read_csv/read_table
column1749: bug in read_csv where missing values were not being handled properly when keep_default_na=false with dictionary na_values
column1750: bug in ewmstd, ewmvol, ewmvar, and ewmcov calculation of de-biasing factors when bias=false . previously an incorrect constant factor was used, based on adjust=true, ignore_na=true, and an infinite number of observations. now a different factor is used for each entry, based on the actual weights factor). in particular, for a single point a value of nan is returned when bias=false, whereas previously a value of 0 was returned.
column1751: previously, parsing datetime strings with utc offsets with to_datetime or datetimeindex would automatically convert the datetime to utc without timezone localization. this is inconsistent from parsing the same datetime string with timestamp which would preserve the utc offset in the tz attribute. now, to_datetime preserves the utc offset in the tz attribute when all the datetime strings have the same utc offset
column1752: implement value_vars in melt to limit values to certain columns and add melt to pandas namespace
column1753: bug in .groupby.resample when the same object is called multiple times
column1754: eval s upcasting rules for float32 types have been updated to be more consistent with numpy s rules. new behavior will not upcast to float64 if you multiply a pandas float32 object by a scalar float64 .
column1755: bottleneck is now a recommended dependencies, to accelerate certain types of nan operations
column1756: using dataframe.groupby with as_index=true and the aggregation nunique would include the grouping column in the columns of the result. now the grouping column only appear in the index, consistent with other reductions.
column1757: similarly, dataframe.at and series.at will raise a typeerror instead of a valueerror if an incompatible key is passed, and keyerror if a missing key is passed, matching the behavior of .loc
column1758: bug in concat and dataframe constructor where input index names are not preserved in some cases
column1759: bug where c variables were declared with external linkage causing import errors if certain other c libraries were imported before pandas.
column1760: the overridden timedelta properties of days, seconds and microseconds have been removed, leveraging their built-in python versions instead
column1761: when converting a dataframe to html it used to return empty dataframe. this special case has been removed, instead a header with the column names is returned .
column1762: removed support of gtk package for clipboards
column1763: bug in dataframe.replace where nested dicts were erroneously depending on the order of dictionary keys and values .
column1764: split indexing documentation into indexing and selecting data and multiindex / advanced indexing
column1765: bug in read_csv where automatic delimiter detection caused a typeerror to be thrown when a bad line was encountered rather than the correct error message
column1766: time series string indexing conveniences / shortcuts: slice years, year and month, and index values with strings
column1767: by default categorical.min now returns the minimum instead of np.nan
column1770: support for a new index type float64index, and other indexing enhancements
column1771: bug in series.replace with datetime64 data when replacing nat
column1772: rolling.var and rolling.std use kahan summation and welford s method to avoid numerical issues
column1773: this fixes an inconsistency between resample and groupby. this also fixes a potential bug, where the values of the result might change depending on how the results are cast back to the original dtype.
column1774: bug in comparison operations for multiindex where error was raised on equality / inequality comparison involving a multiindex with nlevels == 1
column1775: bug in intervalindex where some indexing operations were not supported for overlapping or non-monotonic uint64 data
column1776: bug in dataframe.loc when used with a multiindex. the returned values were not in the same order as the given inputs
column1777: improved performance of read_csv by much faster parsing of mm/yyyy and dd/mm/yyyy datetime formats
column1778: timedelta now supports arithmetic with numpy.ndarray objects of the appropriate dtype .
column1779: bug in timestamp with string offset and tz results incorrect
column1780: # use the traditional nan, which is mapped to nat internally
column1781: bug in bar plot with log=true raises typeerror if all values are less than 1
column1782: groupby with as_index=false will not add erroneous extra columns to result :
column1783: fixed regression in dataframe.reindex and series.reindex when reindexing with index and method=nearest
column1784: bug in pd.read_csv with the c engine when specifying skiprows with newlines in quoted items
column1785: for multiindex, values are dropped if any level is missing by default. specifying how='all' only drops values where all levels are missing.
column1786: bug in dataframe.where with a symmetric shaped frame and a passed other of a dataframe
column1787: bug in core.groupby.dataframegroupby.transform when func='nunique' and columns are of type datetime64, the result would also be of type datetime64 instead of int64
column1788: not showing a deprecationwarning on combining list-likes with an index
column1789: raise a valueerror in df.to_hdf with fixed format, if df has non-unique columns as the resulting file will be broken
column1790: fixes issue with index_col=false when usecols is also specified in read_csv.
column1791: removed the previously deprecated keyword order from factorize
column1792: fixed bug in excel writers where frames with duplicate column names weren t written correctly.
column1793: fixed regression in dataframe.replace where regex=true was only replacing patterns matching the start of the string
column1794: removed the previously deprecated keyword verify_integrity from the datetimeindex and timedeltaindex constructors
column1795: timestamps can be modified in the nanosecond range
column1796: bug in intervalindex, intervalarray, and series with interval data where equality comparisons were incorrect
column1798: the sum and product of all-na bins has changed from nan to 0 for sum and 1 for product.
column1799: these are the changes in pandas 1.2.4. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1800: compatibility with matplotlib 2.0. older versions of pandas should also work with matplotlib 2.0
column1801: added dataframe.align method with standard join options
column1802: improved performance of datetimeindex and series arithmetic operations with business-month and business-quarter frequencies
column1803: add level option to the reindex and align methods on series and dataframe for broadcasting values across a level
column1804: timedeltaindex and datetimeindex no longer accept non-nanosecond dtype strings like timedelta64 or datetime64 , use timedelta64 and datetime64 instead
column1805: fixed regression in dataframe.replace inconsistent replace when using a float in the replace method
column1806: bug in fill_value is ignored if the argument to a binary operator is a constant
column1807: bug in dataframe.aggregate and series.aggregate was causing a recursive loop in some cases
column1808: these are the changes in pandas 0.25.2. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1809: dataframe.to_sql now performs a multi-value insert if the underlying connection supports itk rather than inserting row by row. sqlalchemy dialects supporting multi-value inserts include: mysql, postgresql, sqlite and any dialect with supports_multivalues_insert.
column1810: the pd.read_csv with engine='python' has gained support for the decimal , na_filter and the memory_map option .
column1811: these are the changes in pandas 1.0.5. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1812: bug in series.astype and categorical.astype where an existing categorical data does not get updated
column1813: bug in dataframe.at when either columns or index is non-unique
column1814: userwarning: evaluating in python space because the '+' operator is not
column1815: the panel4d and panelnd classes have been removed
column1816: previously, calling dataframe.apply an empty dataframe would return either a dataframe if there were no columns, or the function being applied would be called with an empty series to guess whether a series or dataframe should be returned:
column1817: bug in dataframe.to_dict where columns of datetime that are tz-aware were not converted to required arrays when used with orient='records', raising typeerror
column1818: but in a future version of pandas this will be changed to expand=true
column1819: bug with comparisons between timedelta and nat raising typeerror
column1820: bug in to_csv where date_format is ignored if the datetime is fractional
column1821: period and periodindex can handle multiplied freq like 3d, which corresponding to 3 days span. see here
column1822: added log10, floor and ceil to the list of supported functions in dataframe.eval
column1823: added option to df.info to override the default display options and force showing of the null-counts
column1824: the freqstr keyword has been removed from pandas.tseries.frequencies.to_offset in favor of freq
column1825: added support for a chunksize parameter to to_sql function. this allows dataframe to be written in chunks and avoid packet-size overflow errors .
column1826: dataframe.to_excel and series.to_excel with non-existent columns will no longer reindex
column1827: when performing a reduction such as a sum with skipna=false, the result will now be pd.na instead of np.nan in presence of missing values .
column1828: bug in assignment against datetime-like data with int may incorrectly convert to datetime-like
column1829: removal of na_last parameters from series.order and series.sort, in favor of na_position.
column1830: bug in .value_counts when normalize=true and dropna=true where nulls still contributed to the normalized count
column1831: fixed regression in subtraction between series objects with datetime64 dtype incorrectly raising overflowerror when the series on the right contains null values
column1832: read_excel has deprecated sheetname in favor of sheet_name for consistency with .to_excel .
column1833: bug in constructing a series or dataframe from a numpy datetime64 array with a non-ns unit and out-of-bound timestamps generating rubbish data, which will now correctly raise an outofboundsdatetime error .
column1834: altered binary operations on differently-indexed sparseseries objects to use the integer-based alignment logic which is faster with a larger number of blocks
column1835: datetimeindex.searchsorted, timedeltaindex.searchsorted, periodindex.searchsorted, and series.searchsorted with datetime-like dtypes will now try to cast string arguments to the matching datetime-like type
column1836: bug when writing to a hdfstore in table format with a min_itemsize value for the index and without asking to append
column1837: we highly encourage using named arguments to avoid confusion when using either style.
column1838: the good news is the return dimensions will differ between the new api and the old api, so this should loudly raise an exception.
column1839: bug in series.divmod and series.rdivmod which would raise an valueerror rather than return a pair of series objects as result
column1840: the pandas.tools.rplot, pandas.sandbox.qtpandas and pandas.rpy modules are deprecated. we refer users to external packages like seaborn, pandas-qt and rpy2 for similar or equivalent functionality, see here
column1841: as part of a larger refactor to multiindex the level names are now stored separately from the levels . we recommend using multiindex.names to access the names, and index.set_names to update the names.
column1842: improved performance in construction of categoricals with series of datetimes containing nat
column1843: indexing of dataframe and series now accepts zerodim np.ndarray
column1844: indexing in multiindex beyond lex-sort depth is now supported, though a lexically sorted index will have a better performance.
column1845: concat to produce a non-unique columns when duplicates are across dtypes is fixed
column1846: starting with the 0.25.x series of releases, pandas only supports python 3.5.3 and higher. see dropping python 2.7 for more details.
column1847: the function get_offset_name has been dropped in favor of the .freqstr attribute for an offset
column1848: allows operating of timestamps to return a datetime if the result is out-of-bounds related
column1849: there is a situation where the new api can not perform all the operations when using original code. this code is intending to resample every 2s, take the mean and then take the min of those results.
column1850: for a full example, see: use origin or offset to adjust the start of the bins.
column1851: bug in csv parser causing lines with initial white space plus one non-space character to be skipped.
column1852: keyword argument deep has been removed from extensionarray.copy
column1853: above was an example of inserting a precomputed value. we can also pass in a function to be evaluated.
column1854: fixed a bug where low memory c parser could create different types in different chunks of the same file. now coerces to numerical type or raises warning.
column1855: improved performance of series.dt.time and datetimeindex.time
column1856: removed compatibility for multiindex pickles prior to version 0.8.0; compatibility with multiindex pickles from version 0.13 forward is maintained
column1857: fixed file reader bug that misaligned columns with data in the presence of an implicit column and a specified usecols value
column1859: these are the changes in pandas 1.0.1. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1860: bug in datetimeindex.insert and timedeltaindex.insert causing index freq to be lost when setting an element into an empty series
column1861: bug in dataframe.unstack which raises an error if index is a multiindex with unused labels on the unstacked level
column1862: bug in to_datetime where box and utc arguments were ignored when passing a dataframe or dict of unit mappings
column1863: bug in divmod with a series object containing zeros incorrectly raising attributeerror
column1864: bug in concatenation with duplicate columns across dtypes not merging with axis=0
column1865: date_range now accepts ys in addition to as as an alias for start of year.
column1866: bug in dataframe arithmetic where missing values in results were incorrectly masked with nan instead of inf
column1867: dataframe.reindex with a categoricalindex would fail when the targets contained duplicates, and wouldn t fail if the source contained duplicates
column1868: bug in dataframe.append with a series with a dateutil timezone would raise a typeerror
column1869: bug in index multiplication and division methods where operating with a series would return an index object instead of a series object
column1870: bug in index.min and max doesn t handle nan and nat properly
column1871: bug in index.get_indexer and index.get_indexer_non_unique where int64 arrays are returned instead of intp
column1872: setting sparsearray.fill_value to a fill value with a different dtype is now allowed.
column1873: add the keyword allow_duplicates to dataframe.insert to allow a duplicate column to be inserted if true, default is false
column1874: dataframe.to_latex now accepts caption and label arguments
column1875: indexing on other index types are preserved , with the exception, that floating point slicing on indexes on non float64index will now raise a typeerror.
column1876: as as notational convenience, you can pass a sequence of labels or a label slice to a series when getting and setting values via . the behavior will be the same as passing similar input to ix except in the case of integer indexing:
column1877: dataframe.add_prefix and dataframe.add_suffix now accept strings containing the % character.
column1878: previously, declaring or converting to stringdtype was in general only possible if the data was already only str or nan-like . stringdtype now works in all situations where astype or dtype=str work:
column1880: bug in read_csv with engine='python' truncating data if multiple items present in first row and first element started with bom
column1881: bug in using grouper functions that need passed through arguments , when using wrapped function ,
column1882: added a new index type, float64index. this will be automatically created when passing floating values in index creation. this enables a pure label-based slicing paradigm that makes ,ix,loc for scalar indexing and slicing work exactly the same. see the docs,
column1883: pd.read_csv no longer allows a combination of strings and integers for the usecols parameter
column1884: nearest is added to support nearest-neighbor upsampling .
column1885: dataframe.to_stata and statawriter check string length for compatibility with limitations imposed in dta files where fixed-width strings must contain 244 or fewer characters. attempting to write stata dta files with strings longer than 244 characters raises a valueerror.
column1886: bug in dataframe.replace and series.replace incorrectly raising an assertionerror instead of a valueerror when invalid parameter combinations are passed
column1887: bug in pd.read_csv with engine='python' in which infinities of mixed-case forms were not being interpreted properly
column1888: added series.align method for aligning two series with choice of join method
column1889: regression in dataframe.replace where a typeerror would be raised when attempting to replace elements of type interval
column1890: bug in resample that causes a valueerror when resampling across multiple days and the last offset is not calculated from the start of the range
column1891: currently, the default display options of pandas ensure that when a series or dataframe has more than 60 rows, its repr gets truncated to this maximum of 60 rows . however, this still gives a repr that takes up a large part of the vertical screen estate. therefore, a new option display.min_rows is introduced with a default of 10 which determines the number of rows showed in the truncated repr:
column1892: the previous default behavior of negative indices in categorical.take is deprecated. in a future version it will change from meaning missing values to meaning positional indices from the right. the future behavior is consistent with series.take .
column1893: bug in dataframe.plot.scatter was adding a colorbar to the plot even if the argument c was assigned to a column containing color names
column1894: pd.melt now accepts the optional parameters var_name and value_name to specify custom column names of the returned dataframe.
column1895: improved performance of set_categories by not materializing the values
column1896: deprecated the nthreads keyword of pandas.read_feather in favor of use_threads to reflect the changes in pyarrow>=0.11.0.
column1897: fix assignment with iloc/loc involving a dtype change in an existing column have internal setitem_with_indexer in core/indexing to use block.setitem
column1898: the timeseries and sparsetimeseries classes, aliases of series and sparseseries, are removed .
column1899: series.isin now treats all nan-floats as equal also for np.object-dtype. this behavior is consistent with the behavior for float64
column1900: we ve reverted a 0.23.0 change to comparing a series holding datetimes and a datetime.date object . in pandas 0.22 and earlier, comparing a series holding datetimes and datetime.date objects would coerce the datetime.date to a datetime before comparing. this was inconsistent with python, numpy, and datetimeindex, which never consider a datetime and datetime.date equal.
column1901: set operations on intervalindex with incompatible index types will now raise a typeerror rather than a valueerror
column1902: dataframe.sample will now also allow array-like and bitgenerator objects to be passed to random_state as seeds
column1903: bug in dataframe.loc did not raise keyerror when missing combination was given with slice for remaining levels
column1904: similarly, a keyerror will be raised for non-exact matches instead of returning overlapping matches.
column1905: dataframe.to_csv has dropped the engine parameter, as was deprecated in 0.17.1
column1906: bug where indexing with a numpy array containing negative values would mutate the indexer
column1907: bug in read_json for orient='table' and string of float column names, as it makes a column name type conversion to timestamp, which is not applicable because column names are already defined in the json schema
column1908: pandas 0.22.0 changes the handling of empty and all-na sums and products. the summary is that
column1909: previously, it was necessary to specify the has_index_names argument in read_excel, if the serialized data had index names. for version 0.17.0 the output format of to_excel has been changed to make this keyword unnecessary - the change is shown below.
column1910: periodindex.tz_convert and periodindex.tz_localize have been removed
column1911: bug in core.groupby.generic.seriesgroupby.apply raising valueerror when a column in the original dataframe is a datetime and the column labels are not standard integers
column1912: bug in dataframe.to_json with unsupported dtype not passed to default handler .
column1913: bug in iat where using it to assign an incompatible value would create a new column
column1914: the first get_dummies returns a dataframe because the column a is not dummy encoded. when just are passed to get_dummies, then all the columns are dummy-encoded, and a sparsedataframe was returned.
column1915: bug in pivot_table where columns with nan values are dropped even if dropna argument is false, when the aggfunc argument contains a list
column1916: bug in timedeltaindex addition where overflow was being allowed without error
column1917: options added to allow one to turn on/off using bottleneck and numexpr, see here
column1918: made consistent a timezone mismatch exception , will now return typeerror rather than valueerror ,
column1919: bug in categorical.searchsorted where alphabetical instead of the provided categorical order was used
column1920: fixed a bug where read_html wasn t correctly inferring values of tables with commas
column1921: creating a long form dataframe is now straightforward using chained operations
column1922: bug in dataframe.count with level="foo" and index level "foo" containing nans causes segmentation fault
column1923: these are the changes in pandas 1.1.1. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1924: bug in dataframe.sort_values when sorting by multiple columns where one column is of type int64 and contains nat
column1925: a valueerror will now be thrown by dataframe.fillna when limit is not a positive integer
column1926: bug in setting by indexer to a scalar value with a mixed-dtype panel4d was failing
column1927: error message for missing required imports now includes the original import error s text
column1928: fixed bug where dataframe column set to scalar extension type via a dict instantiation was considered an object type rather than the extension type
column1929: series.array and index.array have been added for extracting the array backing a series or index.
column1930: addition or subtraction of nat from timedeltaindex will return timedeltaindex instead of datetimeindex
column1931: bug in dataframe.append when appending a series containing a scalar tz-aware timestamp to an empty dataframe resulted in an object column instead of datetime64 dtype
column1932: to_timedelta, timedelta, and timedeltaindex no longer allow m , y , or y for the unit argument
column1933: fixed regression in dataframe.loc and series.loc for __setitem__ when one-dimensional tuple was given to select from multiindex
column1934: series has gained an accessor to succinctly return datetime like properties for the values of the series, if its a datetime/period like series. this will return a series, indexed like the existing series. see the docs
column1935: we can construct a series with the specified dtype. the dtype string int64 is a pandas extensiondtype. specifying a list or array using the traditional missing value marker of np.nan will infer to integer dtype. the display of the series will also use the nan to indicate missing values in string outputs.
column1936: pandas.errors.optionerror is now exposed in pandas.errors
column1937: calling sum or prod on an empty or all-nan series, or columns of a dataframe, will result in nan. see the docs.
column1938: qcut and cut now handle boolean input
column1939: bug in pd.concat in which concatenating with an empty dataframe with join='inner' was being improperly handled
column1940: improved performance of nanops for dtypes that cannot store nans. speedup is particularly prominent for series.all and series.any
column1941: fixed regression in dataframe.__setitem__ raising valueerror when expanding dataframe and new column is from type "0 - name"
column1942: removed the previously deprecated keyword labels from the multiindex constructor, use codes instead
column1943: passing scalar values to datetimeindex or timedeltaindex will now raise typeerror instead of valueerror
column1944: bug in date_range/datetimeindex when the timezone was inferred from input dates yet incorrect times were returned when crossing dst boundaries .
column1945: eval has also been updated to allow multi-line expressions for multiple assignments. these expressions will be evaluated one at a time in order. only assignments are valid for multi-line expressions.
column1946: os.linesep is used for line_terminator of dataframe.to_csv
column1947: in hdfstore, select_as_multiple will always raise a keyerror, when a key or the selector is not found
column1948: bug in read_msgpack with a non existent file is passed in python 2
column1949: bug in dataframe.to_stata, pandas.io.stata.statawriter and pandas.io.stata.statawriter117 where a exception would leave a partially written and invalid dta file
column1950: bug in indexing with a periodindex on an object with a periodindex
column1951: read_excel now supports the true_values and false_values keyword arguments
column1952: the rules for the result dtype in dataframe.resample aggregations have changed for extension types . previously, pandas would attempt to convert the result back to the original dtype, falling back to the usual inference rules if that was not possible. now, pandas will only return a result of the original dtype if the scalar values in the result are instances of the extension dtype s scalar type.
column1953: strings passed to dataframe.groupby as the by parameter may now reference either column names or index level names. previously, only column names could be referenced. this allows to easily group by a column and index level at the same time.
column1954: new apis for accessing the array backing a series or index
column1955: this is all exactly identical to the behavior before. however, if you ask for a key not contained in the series, in versions 0.6.1 and prior, series would fall back on a location-based lookup. this now raises a keyerror:
column1956: fixed regression in dataframe.loc and series.loc throwing an error when a datetime64 value is provided
column1957: the pandas.io.data and pandas.io.wb modules are removed in favor of the pandas-datareader package .
column1958: bug in format in which floating point complex numbers were not being formatted to proper display precision and trimming
column1959: you can have an expression like df.query with no complaints from pandas about ambiguity of the name a.
column1960: the compression code was refactored . as a result, reading dataframes from urls in read_csv or read_table now supports additional compression methods: xz, bz2, and zip . previously, only gzip compression was supported. by default, compression of urls and paths are now inferred using their file extensions. additionally, support for bz2 compression in the python 2 c-engine improved .
column1961: incorrect dtyped series was returned by comparison methods against a constant for an empty dataframe
column1962: bug in series.transform would give incorrect results or raise when the argument func was a dictionary
column1963: fixed regression in series.rename_axis and dataframe.rename_axis where passing none failed to remove the axis name
column1964: clipboard functionality now works with pyside
column1965: more helpful error message when constructing a dataframe with empty data but with indices
column1966: bug in dataframe.equals and series.equals in allowing subclasses to be equal .
column1967: these are the changes in pandas 1.0.0. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column1968: new periodindex and period classes for representing time spans and performing calendar logic, including the 12 fiscal quarterly frequencies <timeseries.quarterly>. this is a partial port of, and a substantial enhancement to, elements of the scikits.timeseries code base. support for conversion between periodindex and datetimeindex
column1969: subtracting nat from a series with dtype='datetime64' returns a series with dtype='timedelta64' instead of dtype='datetime64'
column1970: .get_value and .set_value on series, dataframe, panel, sparseseries, and sparsedataframe are deprecated in favor of using .iat or .at accessors
column1971: due to dropping support for python 2.7, a number of optional dependencies have updated minimum versions . independently, some minimum supported versions of dependencies were updated . if installed, we now require:
column1972: rearranged the order of keyword arguments in read_excel to align with read_csv
column1973: rearranged the order of keyword arguments in read_excel to align with read_csv
column1975: fixed an issue where cumsum and cumprod didn t work with bool dtypes
column1976: the display.show_dimensions option can now also be used to specify whether the length of a series should be shown in its repr .
column1977: bug in to_latex where repeated multiindex values were not printed even though a higher level index differed from the previous row
column1978: possible incompatibility for hdf5 formats created with pandas < 0.13.0
column1979: possible incompatibility for hdf5 formats created with pandas < 0.13.0
column1980: index.astype now accepts an optional boolean argument copy, which allows optional copying if the requirements on dtype are satisfied
column1982: bug in c parser with leading white space
column1983: using dataframe.replace with overlapping keys in a nested dictionary will no longer raise, now matching the behavior of a flat dictionary
column1984: bug in ujson.encode was raising an overflowerror with numbers larger than sys.maxsize
column1985: sparse suite now supports integration with non-sparse data. non-float sparse data is supportable
column1986: constructing a datetimeindex from data with timedelta64-dtyped data is deprecated, will raise typeerror in a future version
column1987: bug in setting a new label on a dataframe or series with a categoricalindex incorrectly raising typeerror when the new label is not among the index s categories
column1988: series.update now accepts objects that can be coerced to a series, such as dict and list, mirroring the behavior of dataframe.update
column1989: bug in sparse indexing using sparsearray with bool dtype may return incorrect result
column1990: notice how we now instead output np.nan itself instead of a stringified form of it.
column1991: intervalindex.to_tuples has gained the na_tuple parameter to control whether na is returned as a tuple of na, or na itself
column1992: bug in str.extractall when there were no matches empty index was returned instead of appropriate multiindex
column1993: fixed bug in pandas.testing.assert_series_equal where dtypes were checked for interval and extensionarray operands when check_dtype was false
column1994: calls such as dataframe.round with a non-unique categoricalindex now return expected data. previously, data would be improperly duplicated .
column1995: bug in series.loc and dataframe.loc when indexing with an integer key on a object-dtype index that is not all-integers
column1996: improved performance series creation with a datetime index and dictionary data
column1997: rolling_window now normalizes the weights properly in rolling mean mode so that the calculated weighted means are distributed about the same means as those calculated without weighting . see the note on normalization for further details.
column1998: accept textfilereader in concat, which was affecting a common user idiom , this was a regression from 0.13.1
column1999: the conversion from a series or index with timezone-aware datetime data will change to preserve timezones by default .
column2000: bug in merge where how='left' and sort=false would not preserve left frame order
column2001: bug in .quantile with empty series may return scalar rather than empty series
column2002: specify string columns to parse as datetimes with the parse_dates keyword in read_sql_query and read_sql_table.
column2003: bug in outputting a multiindex with to_html,index=false which would add an extra column
column2004: creating a series from another series, passing an index, will cause reindexing to happen inside rather than treating the series like an ndarray. technically improper usages like series that worked before by accident will lead to all na series in some cases. to be perfectly clear:
column2005: the categorical constructor with two arguments changed from codes/labels and levels to values and levels . this can lead to subtle bugs. if you use categorical directly, please audit your code by changing it to use the from_codes constructor.
column2006: add logy option to series.plot for log-scaling on the y axis
column2007: deprecate the engine keyword in .to_csv, which will be removed in a future version
column2008: timestamp.tz_localize, datetimeindex.tz_localize, and series.tz_localize have gained the nonexistent argument for alternative handling of nonexistent times. see nonexistent times when localizing
column2012: fixed division by zero error for series.kurt when all values are equal
column2013: bug in series.item with datetime64 or timedelta64 dtype, datetimeindex.item, and timedeltaindex.item returning an integer instead of a timestamp or timedelta
column2014: the read_excel function s sheetname argument now accepts a list and none, to get multiple or all sheets respectively. if more than one sheet is specified, a dictionary is returned.
column2015: pd.stats.moments.rolling_var now uses welford s method for increased numerical stability
column2016: timestamp and datetimeindex comparisons between tz-aware and tz-naive objects now follow the standard library datetime behavior, returning true/false for !=/== and raising for inequality comparisons
column2017: bug in unary inversion operator on a sparseseries with boolean values. the performance of this has also been improved
column2018: this is a major release from 0.21.1 and includes a single, api-breaking change. we recommend that all users upgrade to this version after carefully reading the release note .
column2019: bug in datetimeindex.get_indexer where incorrect output would be returned for mixed datetime-like targets
column2020: # use pandas to process and reshape the dataset
column2021: bug in pd.read_csv when specifying names, usecols, and parse_dates simultaneously with the c engine
column2022: the read_csv function now supports parsing a categorical column when specified as a dtype . depending on the structure of the data, this can result in a faster parse time and lower memory usage compared to converting to categorical after parsing. see the io docs here.
column2023: bug in categorical may not representing properly when category contains tz or period
column2024: previously, the default value for the maximum number of columns was pd.options.display.max_columns=20. this meant that relatively wide data frames would not fit within the terminal width, and pandas would introduce line breaks to display these 20 columns. this resulted in an output that was relatively difficult to read:
column2025: the default time series resample binning behavior of daily d and higher frequencies has been changed to closed='left', label='left'. lower nfrequencies are unaffected. the prior defaults were causing a great deal of confusion for users, especially resampling data to daily frequency .
column2026: however, this input does not make much sense because the output is not being assigned to the target. now, a valueerror will be raised when such an input is passed in:
column2027: fixed the return type of intervalindex.is_non_overlapping_monotonic to be a python bool for consistency with similar attributes/methods. previously returned a numpy.bool_.
column2028: bug in date_range with custom business hours as freq and given number of periods
column2029: calling fillna on series or dataframe with no arguments is no longer valid code. you must either specify a fill value or an interpolation method:
column2030: bug in index prevents copying name of passed index, when a new name is not provided
column2031: bug in to_csv causes encoding error when compression and encoding are specified
column2032: updated bigquery connector to no longer use deprecated oauth2client.tools.run
column2033: dataframe.pivot can now take lists for index and columns arguments
column2034: bug in groupby when grouping on categorical causes valueerror and incorrect grouping if observed=true and nan is present in categorical column .
column2035: bug in datetimeindex and periodindex in-place addition and subtraction cause different result from normal one
column2036: previously an enlargement with a mixed-dtype frame would act unlike .append which will preserve dtypes :
column2037: bug in concat where the resulting freq of two datetimeindex with the same freq would be dropped .
column2038: fixed bug with duplicate columns and type conversion in read_json when orient='split'
column2039: bug in plotting regular and irregular timeseries using shared axes ) .
column2040: operations between a series with dtype dtype='datetime64' and a periodindex will correctly raises typeerror
column2041: after upgrading pandas, you may see new runtimewarnings being issued from your code. these are likely legitimate, and the underlying cause likely existed in the code when using previous versions of pandas that simply silenced the warning. use numpy.errstate around the source of the runtimewarning to control how these conditions are handled.
column2042: fixed a py3 compat issue where bytes were being repr d as tuples
column2043: hdfstore.select_as_coordinates and select_column works with a where clause that results in filters
column2044: miscellaneous renames and deprecations which will raise futurewarning
column2045: highlights include a consistent i/o api naming scheme, routines to read html, write multiindexes to csv files, read & write stata data files, read & write json format files, python 3 support for hdfstore, filtering of groupby expressions via filter, and a revamped replace routine that accepts regular expressions.
column2046: added example for dataframe import to r using hdf5 file and rhdf5 library. see the documentation for more .
column2047: the new implementation allows for having a single-timezone across all rows, with operations in a performant manner.
column2048: hdfstore has a new string based syntax for query specification
column2049: bug in groupby.transform was returning the wrong result when grouping by multiple keys of which some were categorical and others not
column2050: bug in dataframe.to_dict produces a np.datetime64 object instead of timestamp when only datetime is present in data
column2051: bug in categorical.apply where nan values could be handled unpredictably. they now remain unchanged
column2052: the file parsers read_csv and read_table now ignore line comments provided by the parameter comment, which accepts only a single character for the c reader. in particular, they allow for comments before file data begins
column2053: bug in read_excel with multiindex containing integers
column2054: bug in ndframe: conflicting attribute/column names now behave consistently between getting and setting. previously, when both a column and attribute named y existed, data.y would return the attribute, while data.y = z would update the column
column2055: bug in to_datetime which raises typeerror for format='%y%m%d' when called for invalid integer dates with length >= 6 digits with errors='ignore'
column2056: the default value of the ordered parameter for categoricaldtype has changed from false to none to allow updating of categories without impacting ordered. behavior should remain consistent for downstream objects, such as categorical
column2057: fixed bug where stringarray.memory_usage was not implemented
column2058: the dataframe.assign now accepts dependent keyword arguments for python version later than 3.6 . later keyword arguments may now refer to earlier ones if the argument is a callable. see the documentation here
column2059: bug in dataframe.to_csv when supplied a series with a dtype="string" and a na_rep, the na_rep was being truncated to 2 characters.
column2060: bug in dataframe.astype when passing a dict of columns and types the errors parameter was ignored.
column2061: this now matches the existing behavior of concat on series with sparse values. concat will continue to return a sparsedataframe when all the values are instances of sparsedataframe.
column2062: bug in series 0-division with a float and integer operand dtypes
column2063: # will not show dimensions since it is not truncated
column2065: bug in indexing on a series or dataframe with a categoricalindex using a list-like indexer containing na values
column2066: timestamp will no longer silently ignore unused or invalid tz or tzinfo keyword arguments
column2067: timestamp.replace now supports the fold argument to disambiguate dst transition times
column2068: cdate_range has been deprecated in favor of bdate_range, which has gained weekmask and holidays parameters for building custom frequency date ranges. see the documentation for more details
column2069: read_csv will now raise a valueerror when the arguments header and prefix both are not none.
column2070: fixed failing tests in test_yahoo, test_google where symbols were not retrieved but were being accessed
column2071: previously, concat of multiple objects with different float dtypes would automatically upcast results to a dtype of float64. now the smallest acceptable dtype will be used
column2072: bug in resample with non evenly divisible offsets
column2073: until 0.18.1, comparing series with the same length, would succeed even if the .index are different . as of 0.19.0, this will raises valueerror to be more strict. this section also describes how to keep previous behavior or align different indexes, using the flexible comparison methods like .eq.
column2074: fixed regression in dataframe.replace where large strings of numbers would be coerced into int64, causing an overflowerror
column2075: the public functions in pandas.tools.hashing deprecated from that locations, but are now importable from pandas.util
column2076: bug in dataframe and series addition and subtraction between object-dtype objects and datetime64 dtype objects
column2077: bug in read_msgpack where input type is not always checked
column2078: fixed bug in dataframe.set_values which was causing name attributes to be lost when expanding the index.
column2079: as usual, both sides of the slicers are included as this is label indexing.
column2080: fixed performance regression when indexing a dataframe or series with a multiindex for the index using a list of labels
column2081: the only positional indexing is via iloc
column2082: this may cause hdf5 files that were created in prior versions to become unreadable if pd.timeseries was used. this is most likely to be for pandas < 0.13.0. if you find yourself in this situation. you can use a recent prior version of pandas to read in your hdf5 files, then write them out again after applying the procedure below.
column2083: unary + now permitted for series and dataframe as numeric operator
column2084: bug in setting with loc/ix a single indexer with a multiindex axis and a numpy array, related to
column2085: when called on an unsorted multiindex, the loc indexer now will raise unsortedindexerror only if proper slicing is used on non-sorted levels .
column2086: use an operator implementation from pandas that depends on operators that are already defined on the underlying elements of the extensionarray.
column2087: using dataframe.groupby with as_index=false and the function idxmax, idxmin, mad, nunique, sem, skew, or std would modify the grouping column. now the grouping column remains unchanged, consistent with other reductions.
column2088: bug in index constructor with dtype='uint64' where int-like floats were not coerced to uint64index
column2089: dataframe and series now have _constructor_expanddim property as overridable constructor for one higher dimensionality data. this should be used only when it is really needed, see here
column2090: vbench special cython matrix iterator for applying arbitrary reduction operations with 3-5x better performance than np.apply_along_axis
column2091: fixed regression in repr of floats in an object column not respecting float_format when printed in the console or outputted through dataframe.to_string, dataframe.to_html, and dataframe.to_latex
column2092: improved performance in certain types of loc indexing with a multiindex .
column2093: bug in dataframe.apply with result_type="reduce" returning with incorrect index
column2094: set_names, set_labels, and set_levels methods now take an optional level keyword argument to all modification of specific level of a multiindex. additionally set_names now accepts a scalar string value when operating on an index or on a specific level of a multiindex
column2095: intervaldtype now returns true when compared against 'interval' regardless of subtype, and intervaldtype.name now returns 'interval' regardless of subtype
column2096: when plotting a datetimeindex directly with matplotlib s plot function, the axis labels will no longer be formatted as dates but as integers . update this is fixed in 0.15.1, see here.
column2097: .rolling objects are now time-series aware and can accept a time-series offset for the window argument . see the full documentation here.
column2098: fixed regression in dataframe.__setitem__ raising an attributeerror with a multiindex and a non-monotonic indexer
column2099: dataframe.tz_localize and dataframe.tz_convert now accepts an optional level argument for localizing a specific level of a multiindex
column2100: implement dataframe.lookup, fancy-indexing analogue for retrieving values given a sequence of row and column labels
column2101: bug in series constructor with an int or float list where specifying dtype=str, dtype='str' or dtype='u' failed to convert the data elements to strings
column2103: bug in loc setting with multiple indexers and a rhs of a series that needs broadcasting
column2104: in previous versions, .groupby would fail with a valueerror when grouping on a categorical series with some categories not appearing in the data.
column2105: due to a bug fix, looking up a partial string label with datetimeindex.asof now includes values that match the string, even if they are after the start of the partial string label .
column2106: fixed regression in inplace operations on series with extensiondtype with numpy dtyped operand
column2108: fixed regression in integerarray unary plus and minus operations raising a typeerror
column2109: the series constructor and .astype method will now raise a valueerror if timestamp dtypes are passed in without a unit for the dtype parameter
column2110: bug in dataframe assignment with an object-dtyped index where the resultant column is mutable to the original object.
column2111: bug when iterating over datetimeindex that was localized with fixed timezone offset that rounded nanosecond precision to microseconds
column2112: dataframe.to_csv and series.to_csv now support dicts as compression argument with key 'method' being the compression method and others as additional compression options when the compression method is 'zip'.
column2113: dataframe.to_hdf and series.to_hdf will now raise a notimplementederror when saving a multiindex with extension data types for a fixed format.
column2114: you can provide any of the selectors as if you are indexing by label, see selection by label, including slices, lists of labels, labels, and boolean indexers.
column2115: passing categories or ordered kwargs to series.astype is deprecated, in favor of passing a categoricaldtype
column2116: fixed regression in joining on datetimeindex or timedeltaindex to preserve freq in simple cases
column2117: incorrectly distributed .c file in the build on pypi when reading a csv of floats and passing na_values=<a scalar> would show an exception
column2118: a valueerror is now raised instead of a generic exception in read_csv when the c engine encounters a nan value in an integer column
column2119: in 0.13.0 there is a major refactor primarily to subclass series from ndframe, which is the base class currently for dataframe and panel, to unify methods and behaviors. series formerly subclassed directly from ndarray.
column2120: the default behavior of min_periods=none, implying that min_periods equals the window size, is unchanged.
column2121: # to be more consistent with datetime.timedelta conventions
column2122: bug in multiindex where __contains__ returns wrong result if index is not lexically sorted or unique
column2123: read_excel can now use openpyxl to read excel files via the engine='openpyxl' argument. this will become the default in a future release
column2125: reindex_axis has been deprecated in favor of reindex. see here for more .
column2126: bug in series creation with np.datetime64 which has other unit than ns as object dtype results in incorrect values
column2127: dataframe.join now suppresses the futurewarning when the sort parameter is specified
column2128: if python runs in a terminal, the maximum number of columns is now determined automatically so that the printed data frame fits within the current terminal width . if python runs as a jupyter kernel , this value cannot be inferred automatically and is thus set to 20 as in previous versions. in a terminal, this results in a much nicer output:
column2129: bug in dataframe.apply in which reduction was not being prevented for cases in which dtype was not a numpy dtype
column2130: method .groupby syntax with window and resample operations
column2131: method .groupby syntax with window and resample operations
column2132: bug in categorical operations with series.cat not preserving the original series name
column2133: bug in timestamp.tz_localize where localizing a timestamp near the minimum or maximum valid values could overflow and return a timestamp with an incorrect nanosecond value
column2134: experimental support has been added to export dataframe.style formats to excel using the openpyxl engine.
column2135: previously, selecting with a list of labels, where one or more labels were missing would always succeed, returning nan for missing labels. this will now show a futurewarning. in the future this will raise a keyerror . this warning will trigger on a dataframe or a series for using .loc or ] when passing a list-of-labels with at least 1 missing label. see the deprecation docs.
column2136: note that entry 0 is approximately 0, and the debiasing factors are a constant 1.25. by comparison, the following 0.15.0 results have a nan for entry 0, and the debiasing factors are decreasing :
column2137: bug in pd.read_csv when specifying delim_whitespace=true and lineterminator simultaneously with the c engine
column2138: this is like an append operation.
column2139: the power of assign comes when used in chains of operations. for example, we can limit the dataframe to just those with a sepal length greater than 5, calculate the ratio, and plot
column2140: panel was deprecated in the 0.20.x release, showing as a deprecationwarning. using panel will now show a futurewarning. the recommended way to represent 3-d data are with a multiindex on a dataframe via the to_frame or with the xarray package. pandas provides a to_xarray method to automate this conversion .
column2141: allow an excelfile object to be passed into read_excel
column2142: period and periodindex now raises incompatiblefrequency error which inherits valueerror rather than raw valueerror
column2143: more informative exceptions are passed through the csv parser. the exception type would now be the original exception type instead of cparsererror .
column2144: bug with datetimeindex.asof incorrectly matching partial strings and returning the wrong date .
