column2145: bug in pd.read_csv for the python engine in which an unhelpful error message was being raised when skipfooter was not being respected by python s csv library
column2146: fixed issue where taking min or max of a stringarray or series with stringdtype type would raise.
column2147: new behavior. if the input dtypes are integral, the output dtype is also integral and the output values are the result of the bitwise operation.
column2148: pd.read_csv will now issue a parserwarning whenever there are conflicting values provided by the dialect parameter and the user
column2149: bug in arithmetic operations between dataframe objects with non-overlapping columns with duplicate labels causing an infinite loop
column2150: rangeindex now performs standard lookup without instantiating an actual hashtable, hence saving memory
column2151: bug in series constructor when both copy=true and dtype arguments are provided
column2152: this type of aggregation is the recommended alternative to the deprecated behavior when passing a dict to a series groupby aggregation with a dictionary when renaming).
column2153: bug in pd.read_csv with parse_dates when multi-line headers are specified
column2154: changed the default configuration value for options.matplotlib.register_converters from true to "auto" . now, pandas custom formatters will only be applied to plots created by pandas, through plot. previously, pandas formatters would be applied to all plots created after a plot. see units registration for more.
column2155: the inplace keyword parameter was also added the query method.
column2156: previously, these would be cast to a numpy array with object dtype. in general, this should result in better performance when storing an array of intervals or periods in a series or column of a dataframe.
column2157: if you would like to update both the index and column labels, be sure to use the respective keywords.
column2158: the fastpath keyword of the different index constructors is deprecated .
column2159: bug in intervalarray incorrectly allowing the underlying data to be changed when setting values
column2160: dataframe.any and dataframe.all with bool_only=true now determines whether to exclude object-dtype columns on a column-by-column basis, instead of checking if all object-dtype columns can be considered boolean.
column2161: support for s3 handling now uses s3fs, see here
column2162: bug in read_fwf with skip_blank_lines=true was not skipping blank lines
column2163: fixed regression in setitem with dataframe.iloc which raised error when trying to set a value while filtering with a boolean list
column2164: added support for writing nan values with to_sql .
column2165: bug in datetimeindex.intersection and timedeltaindex.intersection with results not having the correct name attribute
column2166: reading from a store with duplicate columns across dtypes would raise
column2168: bug in series that allows it to be indexed by a dataframe which has unexpected results. such indexing is no longer permitted
column2169: bug in to_datetime with a format and coerce=true not raising
column2170: for to_datetime changed default value of cache parameter to true
column2171: bug in is_string_dtype, is_timedelta64_ns_dtype, and is_string_like_dtype in which an error was raised when none was passed in
column2172: in pandas 1.2.0, we refactored how numpy ufuncs are called on dataframes, and this started to align the inputs first , as happens in other pandas operations and as it happens for ufuncs called on series objects.
column2175: new unsortedindexerror raised when indexing/slicing into an unsorted multiindex . this allows differentiation between errors due to lack of sorting or an incorrect key. see here
column2176: this change only affects 64 bit python running on windows, and only affects relatively advanced indexing operations
column2177: if an expiry date that is not valid is given, data for the next expiry after the given date is returned.
column2178: bug in series.where and dataframe.where with datetime64 dtype
column2179: series and multiindex .drop with multiindex raise exception if labels not in given in level
column2180: nat will now returns nat for tz_localize and tz_convert methods
column2181: pd.merge_asof can take multiple columns in by parameter and has specialized dtypes for better performance
column2182: bug in pandas.to_datetime when called with none raising typeerror instead of returning nat
column2183: series now supports bitwise operation for integral types . previously even if the input dtypes were integral, the output dtype was coerced to bool.
column2184: fixes regression from 0.20, series.aggregate and dataframe.aggregate allow dictionaries as return values again
column2185: bug in dataframegroupby.transform when transforming with a passed non-sorted key
column2186: the traceback from a keyerror when asking .loc for a single missing label is now shorter and more clear
column2187: bug in cut raised an error when the argument labels contains duplicates
column2188: bug in dataframe.idxmax and dataframe.idxmin with mixed dtypes incorrectly raising typeerror
column2189: accessing series.str methods on with non-string values now raises typeerror instead of producing incorrect results
column2190: bug in core.groupby.dataframegroupby.agg not able to use lambda function with named aggregation
column2191: improved the col_space parameter in dataframe.to_html to accept a string so css length values can be set correctly
column2192: rolling now supports the closed argument for fixed windows
column2193: bug in pd.to_numeric in which float and unsigned integer elements were being improperly casted
column2194: improved the explanation for the failure when value labels are repeated in stata dta files and suggested work-arounds
column2195: the new functionality works well in method chains. previously these methods only accepted functions or dicts mapping a label to a new label. this continues to work as before for function or dict-like values.
column2196: datetimeindex will now raise an attributeerror when the tz attribute is set after instantiation
column2197: bug in read_stata where value labels could not be read when using an iterator
column2198: bug in series constructor where integer overflow would occur for sufficiently large scalar inputs when an index was provided
column2199: hdfstore.keys has now an optional include parameter that allows the retrieval of all native hdf5 table names
column2200: these are the changes in pandas 1.1.3. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas.
column2201: added ftypes method to series/dataframe, similar to dtypes, but indicates if the underlying is sparse/dense
column2202: bug in dataframe allowing arithmetic operations with list of array-likes with undefined results. behavior changed to raising valueerror
column2203: dtypes are now preserved when transposing a dataframe where each column is the same extension dtype
column2204: bug in setitem with empty indexer and unwanted coercion of dtypes
column2205: series.rolling.apply, dataframe.rolling.apply, series.expanding.apply, and dataframe.expanding.apply have gained a raw=none parameter. this is similar to datafame.apply. this parameter, if true allows one to send a np.ndarray to the applied function. if false a series will be passed. the default is none, which preserves backward compatibility, so this will default to true, sending an np.ndarray. in a future version the default will be changed to false, sending a series.
column2208: bug in assigning to chained series with a series via ix
column2209: bug while selecting from hdfstore with where='' specified .
column2210: bug in assignment against datetime with timezone may not work if it contains datetime near dst boundary
column2211: compat with scipy > 0.17 for deprecated piecewise_polynomial interpolation method; support for the replacement from_derivatives method
column2212: removal of the automatic timeseries broadcasting, deprecated since 0.8.0, see here
column2213: series.first and dataframe.first will now raise a typeerror rather than notimplementederror when index is not a datetimeindex .
column2214: pandas now also registers the datetime64 dtype in matplotlib s units registry to plot such values as datetimes. this is activated once pandas is imported. in previous versions, plotting an array of datetime64 values will have resulted in plotted integer values. to keep the previous behaviour, you can do del matplotlib.units.registry .
column2215: support for writing the index. this can be controlled with the index keyword .
column2216: bug preventing access to the first index when using iloc with a list containing the appropriate negative integer
column2217: bug in get where an indexerror would not cause the default value to be returned
column2218: fixed an issue where hist subplots were being overwritten when they were called using the top level matplotlib api
column2219: dataframe.apply will use the reduce argument to determine whether a series or a dataframe should be returned when the dataframe is empty .
column2220: when .resample was changed from an eager to a lazy operation, like .groupby in v0.18.0, we put in place compatibility , so operations would continue to work. this is now fully removed, so a resampler will no longer forward compat operations
column2221: it was possible to use series/dataframe.sort_index to sort by values by passing the by keyword.
column2222: using date accessors on a categorical dtyped series of datetimes was not returning an object of the same type as if one used the str. / dt. on a series of that type. e.g. when accessing series.dt.tz_localize on a categorical with duplicate entries, the accessor was skipping duplicates
column2223: calling fillna on an empty series now correctly returns a shallow copied object. the behaviour is now consistent with index, dataframe and a non-empty series .
column2224: bug in datetimeindex.tz_localize and timestamp.tz_localize with dateutil.tz.tzlocal near a dst transition that would return an incorrectly localized datetime
column2225: the levels and labels attributes of a multiindex can no longer be set directly .
column2226: index now supports .dropna to exclude missing values
column2227: regression in datetimelike slice indexing with a duplicated index and non-exact end-points
column2228: dataframe.at_time and series.at_time now support datetime.time objects with timezones
column2229: bug in intervalindex where empty and purely na data was constructed inconsistently depending on the construction method
column2230: fixed a bug where a typeerror was wrongly raised if a membership check was made on an extensionarray containing nan-like values
column2231: the last element yielded by the iterator will be a series containing the last element of the longest string in the series with all other elements being nan. here since 'slow' is the longest string and there are no other strings with the same length 'w' is the only non-null string in the yielded series.
column2232: bug in dataframe.resample and series.resample when resampling by a weekly offset across a dst transition
column2233: dataframe.to_latex now supports non-ascii encodings in python 2 with the parameter encoding
column2234: bug in fillna with series and a passed series/dict
column2235: nat is now used similarly for datetime containers.
column2236: pd.ordered_merge has been removed . use pd.merge_ordered instead
column2237: bug in read_csv was raising typeerror when sep=none was used in combination with comment keyword
column2238: bug in dataframe.sparse returning a series when there was a column named sparse rather than the accessor
column2239: fixed bug with reading compressed files in as bytes rather than str in python 3. simplifies bytes-producing file-handling in python 3 .
column2240: check the api changes and deprecations before updating
column2241: allow clip, clip_lower, and clip_upper to accept array-like arguments as thresholds . these methods now have an axis parameter which determines how the series or dataframe will be aligned with the threshold.
column2242: attempting to reindex a series with a categoricalindex with an invalid fill_value now raises a typeerror instead of a valueerror
column2243: this case is rarely used, and there are plenty of alternatives. this preserves the iloc api to be purely positional based.
column2244: bug in dataframe.groupby where tuples were interpreted as lists of keys rather than as keys
column2245: bug in to_msgpack and read_msgpack which would raise a valueerror rather than a filenotfounderror for an invalid path
column2246: you can now select timestamps from an unordered timeseries similarly to an ordered timeseries
column2247: improved performance of groupby.cummin and groupby.cummax
column2248: integration with apache parquet, including a new top-level read_parquet and dataframe.to_parquet method, see here .
column2249: bug in .plot.bar alignment when width is specified with int
column2250: the modules pandas.tools.hashing and pandas.util.hashing have been removed
column2251: avoids indexerror when passing an index or series to .iloc with older numpy
column2252: previously, to_datetime did not localize datetime series data when utc=true was passed. now, to_datetime will correctly localize series with a datetime64 dtype to be consistent with how list-like and index data are handled. .
column2253: arrays of strings can be wrapped to a specified width
column2255: bug in grouping with multiple pd.grouper where one is non-time based
column2256: bug in pivot_table with margins=true when indexes are of categorical dtype
column2257: support for short caption and table position in to_latex
column2258: a tuple passed to dataframe.groupby is now exclusively treated as a single key
column2259: a errors.performancewarning is now issued when concatenating sparse series with differing fill values. the fill value from the first sparse array continues to be used.
column2260: removed the previously deprecated keyword convert_datetime64 from dataframe.to_records
column2261: bug in series.dt.round inconsistent behaviour on nat s with different arguments
column2262: removed the previously deprecated keyword nthreads from read_feather, use use_threads instead
column2263: read_csv will now by default ignore blank lines when parsing, see here
column2264: pd.read_csv will now raise a valueerror for the c engine if the quote character is larger than one byte
column2265: improved performance of series.at and index.get_value for extension arrays values
column2266: bug in index.delete does not preserve name and freq attributes
column2267: clarify sorting of sym_diff on index objects with nan values
column2268: note that for floats that are not coercible to ints, the label based bounds will be excluded
column2269: the series constructor and .astype method have deprecated accepting timestamp dtypes without a frequency for the dtype parameter
column2270: bug in table.select_column where name is not preserved
column2271: to_datetime now raises a valueerror when format includes %w or %u without also including day of the week and calendar year
column2272: an asof merge joins on the on, typically a datetimelike field, which is ordered, and in this case we are using a grouper in the by field. this is like a left-outer join, except that forward filling happens automatically taking the most recent non-nan value.
column2273: the freq and how parameters have been removed from the rolling/expanding/ewm methods of dataframe and series . instead, resample before calling the methods.
column2274: operating against a 2-dimensional np.ndarray with either 1 row or 1 column will now broadcast the same way a np.ndarray would .
column2275: timestamp objects can now appear in the left hand side of a comparison operation with a series or dataframe object .
column2276: scalar selection for ,.ix,.loc will always be label based. an integer will match an equal float index
column2277: removed the previously deprecated keyword fastpath from the index constructor
column2278: when reading buffer object in read_sas method without specified format, filepath string is inferred rather than buffer object.
column2279: pass the desired columns names as the **kwargs to .agg. the values of **kwargs should be tuples where the first element is the column selection, and the second element is the aggregation function to apply. pandas provides the pandas.namedagg namedtuple to make it clearer what the arguments to the function are, but plain tuples are accepted as well.
column2280: the deprecated internal attributes _start, _stop and _step of rangeindex now raise a futurewarning instead of a deprecationwarning
column2281: fixed regression in logical operators raising valueerror when columns of dataframe are a categoricalindex with unused categories
column2282: experimental na scalar to denote missing values
column2283: we ve added a new option to control the converters: pd.options.plotting.matplotlib.register_converters. by default, they are registered. toggling this to false removes pandas formatters and restore any converters we overwrote when registering them .
column2284: passing duplicated percentiles will now raise a valueerror.
column2285: improved performance of slicing and other selected operation on a rangeindex
column2286: here is a summary of the api prior to 0.17.0:
column2287: bug in read_json for orient='table' when it tries to infer dtypes by default, which is not applicable as dtypes are already defined in the json schema
column2288: fixed regression in groupby.rolling.apply where the raw parameter was ignored
column2289: interpolate now also accepts a limit keyword argument. this works similar to fillna s limit:
column2290: bug where calling categorical.min or categorical.max on an empty categorical would raise a numpy exception
column2291: pandas.tseries.holiday has added support for additional holidays and ways to observe holidays
column2292: bug in dataframe.groupby where aggregation by first/last/min/max was causing timestamps to lose precision
column2293: regression in the display of a multiindexed series with display.max_rows is less than the length of the series
column2294: categorical.astype now accepts an optional boolean argument copy, effective when dtype is categorical
column2295: the output formatting of groupby.describe now labels the describe metrics in the columns instead of the index. this format is consistent with groupby.agg when applying multiple functions at once.
column2296: integration with apache parquet, including a new top-level read_parquet function and dataframe.to_parquet method, see here.
column2297: bug in .to_csv when a mix of integer and string column names are passed as the columns parameter
column2298: bug in series.quantile with empty list results has index with object dtype
column2299: bug in rank where comparing floats with tolerance will cause inconsistent behaviour .
column2300: remove force_unicode keyword from dataframe.to_string, dataframe.to_latex, and dataframe.to_html; these function encode in unicode by default
column2301: pandas.tseries.plotting.tsplot is deprecated. use series.plot instead
column2302: merging on a combination of columns and index levels
column2303: merging on a combination of columns and index levels
column2304: background_gradient now also supports tablewise application with axis=none
column2305: bug in nat subtraction from timestamp or datetimeindex with timezones
column2306: categorical has dropped the .order and .sort methods in favor of .sort_values
column2307: bug in datetimetzdtype dtype with dateutil.tz.tzlocal cannot be regarded as valid dtype
column2308: reindex now has a tolerance argument that allows for finer control of limits on filling while reindexing :
column2309: enhanced read_csv/read_table for reading time series data and converting multiple columns to dates
column2310: fixed regression in pandas.testing.assert_frame_equal raising typeerror with check_like=true when index or columns have mixed dtype
column2311: bug in read_excel that was raising a typeerror when header=none and index_col is given as a list
column2312: continuing from v0.16.0, the following enhancements make string operations easier and more consistent with standard python string operations.
column2313: fixed regression in dataframe and series comparisons between numeric arrays and strings
column2314: bug in read_json where date strings with z were not converted to a utc timezone
column2315: one of the inconsistent behaviors occurred when the start, end and period parameters were all specified, potentially leading to ambiguous ranges. when all three parameters were passed, interval_range ignored the period parameter, period_range ignored the end parameter, and the other range functions raised. to promote consistency among the range functions, and avoid potentially ambiguous ranges, interval_range and period_range will now raise when all three parameters are passed.
column2316: sparsearray.cumsum and sparseseries.cumsum will now always return sparsearray and sparseseries respectively
column2317: here is the correct method of assignment.
column2318: integration with the feather-format, including a new top-level pd.read_feather and dataframe.to_feather method, see here.
column2319: integration with the feather-format, including a new top-level pd.read_feather and dataframe.to_feather method, see here.
column2320: notice that by default, if no dtype is specified, the dtype of the returned array is inferred from the data. in particular, note that the first example of would have returned a floating-point array, since nan is a float.
column2321: raise valueerror when fallback to python parser causes options to be ignored
column2322: bug in to_datetime where passing arrays of malformed str with errors= coerce could incorrectly lead to raising valueerror
column2323: it is possible to perform quite complicated selections using this method on multiple axes at the same time.
column2324: inplace arguments now require a boolean value, else a valueerror is thrown
column2325: bug in the date and time converters pandas registers with matplotlib not handling multiple dimensions
column2326: fix regression in error message with np.min or np.max on unordered categorical
column2327: fixes regression when sorting by multiple columns on a datetime64 dtype series with nat values
column2328: c and python parser can now handle the more common multiindex column format which doesn t have a row for index names
column2329: added parse_dates option to read_csv and read_table methods to optionally try to parse dates in the index columns
column2330: the default value ordered=none in categoricaldtype has been deprecated in favor of ordered=false. when converting between categorical types ordered=true must be explicitly passed in order to be preserved.
column2331: bug preventing pandas from being importable with -oo optimization
column2332: improved wording of valueerror raised in to_datetime when unit= is passed with a non-convertible value
column2333: we ve deprecated the current behavior of series.argmax and series.argmin. using either of these will emit a futurewarning. use series.idxmax if you want the label of the maximum. use series.values.argmax if you want the position of the maximum. likewise for the minimum. in a future release series.argmax and series.argmin will return the position of the maximum or minimum.
column2334: fixed panel slicing issued in xs that was returning an incorrect dimmed object
column2335: bug in dataframegroupby.head, dataframegroupby.tail, seriesgroupby.head, and seriesgroupby.tail would raise when used with axis=1
column2336: bug in pd.merge results in empty int64index rather than index when the merge result is empty
column2337: pd.categorical has dropped the levels attribute in favor of categories
column2338: in the past, users could in some cases add or subtract integers or integer-dtype arrays from timestamp, datetimeindex and timedeltaindex.
column2339: the new functions read_sql_query and read_sql_table are introduced. the function read_sql is kept as a convenience wrapper around the other two and will delegate to specific function depending on the provided input .
column2340: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.first and pandas.core.groupby.groupby.last with as_index=false leading to the loss of timezone information
column2341: series.interpolate now supports timedelta as an index type with method='time'
column2342: excelwriter now accepts mode as a keyword argument, enabling append to existing workbooks when using the openpyxl engine
column2343: the i/o api is now much more consistent with a set of top level reader functions accessed like pd.read_csv that generally return a pandas object.
column2344: in pandas 0.17.0, the sub-package pandas.io.data will be removed in favor of a separately installable package .
column2345: read_csv now supports parsing categorical data, see here
column2346: sorting by a combination of columns and index levels
column2347: sorting by a combination of columns and index levels
column2348: the refactoring in categorical changed the two argument constructor from codes/labels and levels to values and levels . this can lead to subtle bugs. if you use categorical directly, please audit your code before updating to this pandas version and change it to use the from_codes constructor. see more on categorical here
column2349: bug in index power operations with reversed operands
column2350: the expiry parameter can now be a single date or a list-like object containing dates.
column2351: releasing of the gil could benefit an application that uses threads for user interactions , or performing multi-threaded computations. a nice example of a library that can handle these types of computation-in-parallel is the dask library.
column2352: improved implementation of rolling min and max
column2353: improved performance of the categoricalindex for data that is already categorical dtype
column2354: read_csv has dropped the compact_ints and use_unsigned parameters
column2355: dataframe.to_excel, series.to_excel, dataframe.to_markdown, and series.to_markdown now support writing to fsspec urls such as s3 and google cloud storage
column2356: bug in float_format option with option not being validated as a callable.
column2357: note that the notebook has a toggle output scrolling feature to limit the display of very large frames . you can also configure the way dataframes are displayed using the pandas options, see here here.
column2358: bug in grouped hist and scatter plots use old figsize default
column2361: removal of the previously deprecated as_indexer keyword completely from str.match

column2363: pd.to_numeric is a new function to coerce strings to numbers
column2364: categorical has dropped support for nan categories
column2365: bug in .set_index raises ambiguoustimeerror if new index contains dst boundary and multi levels
column2366: items in categorical.unique if s is of dtype category) now appear in the order in which they are originally found, not in sorted order . this is now consistent with the behavior for other dtypes in pandas.
column2367: starting in 0.11.0, object selection has had a number of user-requested additions in order to support more explicit location based indexing. pandas now supports three types of multi-axis indexing.
column2368: bug in pd.wide_to_long where no error was raised when i was not a unique identifier
column2369: series.describe for categorical data will now give counts and frequencies of 0, not nan, for unused categories
column2370: with groupby , we ve added a dropna keyword to dataframe.groupby and series.groupby in order to allow na values in group keys. users can define dropna to false if they want to include na values in groupby keys. the default is set to true for dropna to keep backwards compatibility
column2371: series.sort, dataframe.sort, and dataframe.sort_index can now be specified in a per-column manner to support multiple sort orders
column2372: bug in date_range with frequency of day or higher where dates sufficiently far in the future could wrap around to the past instead of raising outofboundsdatetime
column2373: now the final /2 entries of the result are calculated as if the input arg were followed by /2 nan values ).
column2374: bug in datetimeindex, timedeltaindex where indexing with ellipsis would lose their freq attribute
column2375: for backwards compatibility, series.values continues to return a numpy array of objects for interval and period data. we recommend using series.array when you need the array of data stored in the series, and series.to_numpy when you know you need a numpy array.
column2376: revised merge, join, and concatenate documentation, including graphical examples to make it easier to understand each operations, see here
column2377: cut has gained the duplicates='raise'|'drop' option to control whether to raise on duplicated edges
column2378: series.slice_shift and dataframe.slice_shift are deprecated, use series.shift or dataframe.shift instead
column2379: the arg argument in pandas.core.window._window.aggregate has been renamed to func
column2380: drop unused order argument from series.sort; args now are in the same order as series.order; add na_position arg to conform to series.order
column2381: bug in .rolling where pd.timedelta or datetime.timedelta was not accepted as a window argument
column2382: index has dropped the .sym_diff method in favor of .symmetric_difference
column2383: implement method cross for dataframe.merge and dataframe.join
column2384: however, when wrapped in a series whose dtype is datetime64 or timedelta64, the dtype information is respected.
column2385: provide a proper __name__ and __qualname__ attributes for generic functions
column2386: note: this is no longer true starting from v0.16.0, where full compatibility with datetime.timedelta is introduced. see the 0.16.0 whatsnew entry
column2387: bug in pd.read_csv for python 2.x in which unicode quote characters were no longer being respected
column2388: fix install error with pypy on macos
column2389: bug in pd.eval and hdfstore query truncating long float literals with python 2
column2390: fixed regression in rolling.skew and rolling.kurt modifying the object inplace
column2391: support for non-unique indexes: in the latter case, you may have code inside a try:... catch: block that failed due to the index not being unique. in many cases it will no longer fail . however, all is not lost: you can inspect index.is_unique and raise an exception explicitly if it is false or go to a different code branch.
column2392: bug in dataframe.corr raises exception when computes kendall correlation for dataframes with boolean and not boolean columns
column2393: an example of this signature augmentation is illustrated below:
column2394: fix regression in dataframe.loc and series.loc throwing an error when a datetime64 value is provided
column2395: bug in series.replace which replaced a numeric by string
column2396: read_excel now can read binary excel files by passing engine='pyxlsb'. for more details and example usage, see the binary excel files documentation. closes gh8540.
column2397: removal of cols keyword in favor of subset in dataframe.duplicated and dataframe.drop_duplicates
column2398: improved exception message when calling dataframe.iloc with a list of non-numeric objects .
column2399: bug in pd.concat and .append may coerces datetime64 and timedelta to object dtype containing python built-in datetime or timedelta rather than timestamp or timedelta
column2400: for more details, see examples and documentation in dataframe.sort_values, series.sort_values, and sort_index.
column2401: # and is based on noaa gsod data.
column2402: pandas.merge no longer sorts the group keys by default. this was done for performance reasons: the group-key sorting is often one of the more expensive parts of the computation and is often unnecessary.
column2403: bug in sparseseries comparison with dense returns normal series rather than sparseseries
column2404: bug in to_datetime when format='%y%m%d' and coerce=true are specified, where previously an object array was returned ,
column2405: produce parserwarning on fallback to python parser when no options are ignored
column2406: timestamp constructor now accepts a nanosecond keyword or positional argument
column2407: fixed bug where two dateoffset objects with different normalize attributes could evaluate as equal

column2410: fixed issue using read_csv on s3 with python 3
column2411: crosstab has gained a margins_name parameter to define the name of the row / column that will contain the totals when margins=true.
column2412: memory usage for index is more accurate
column2413: memory usage for index is more accurate
column2414: bug with stacked barplots and nans .
column2415: fixed regression in dataframe.groupby whereby taking the minimum or maximum of a column with period dtype would raise a typeerror.
column2416: this is now the correct behavior
column2417: dataframe.corr and series.corr now accept a callable for generic calculation methods of correlation, e.g. histogram intersection
column2418: pd.read_csv in the c engine will now issue a parserwarning or raise a valueerror when sep encoded is more than one character long
column2419: we re working with the matplotlib developers to make this easier. we re trying to balance user convenience with import performance and best practices . in the future we hope to have most of the datetime formatting functionality in matplotlib, with just the pandas-specific converters in pandas. we ll then gracefully deprecate the automatic registration of converters in favor of users explicitly registering them when they want them.
column2420: note the series above is ordered alphabetically by the index values.
column2421: error message in pd.merge_asof for key datatype mismatch now includes datatype of left and right key
column2422: bug in rolling.sum returned wrong values when dtypes where mixed between float and integer and axis=1
column2423: added the na_value argument to series.to_numpy, index.to_numpy and dataframe.to_numpy to control the value used for missing data
column2424: these can accept a callable, and a tuple of callable as a slicer. the callable can return a valid boolean indexer or anything which is valid for these indexer s input.
column2425: bug in read_csv when called with low_memory=false in which a csv with at least one column > 2gb in size would incorrectly raise a memoryerror .
column2426: bug in error messages in dataframe.corr and series.corr. added the possibility of using a callable.
column2427: bug in dataframe.to_json where timedelta objects would not be serialized correctly with date_format="iso"
column2428: you can now use .rolling and .expanding as methods on groupbys. these return another deferred object and .expanding do on ungrouped pandas objects). you can then operate on these rollinggroupby objects in a similar manner.
