column2430: categorical.from_codes has deprecated providing float values for the codes argument.
column2431: or by specifying a sql query:
column2432: the pandas.datetime class is now deprecated. import from datetime instead
column2433: bug in dataframe.to_sql where a naive datetimeindex would be written as timestamp with timezone type in supported databases, e.g. postgresql
column2434: the modules pandas.types, pandas.computation, and pandas.util.decorators have been removed
column2435: timestamp: now supports the keyword-only fold argument according to pep 495 similar to parent datetime.datetime class. it supports both accepting fold as an initialization argument and inferring fold from other constructor arguments . support is limited to dateutil timezones as pytz doesn t support fold.
column2436: sparsearray.take now returns a scalar for scalar input, sparsearray for others. furthermore, it handles a negative indexer with the same rule as index
column2437: moreover, dataframe reductions with numeric_only=none will now be consistent with their series counterparts. in particular, for reductions where the series method raises typeerror, the dataframe reduction will now consider that column non-numeric instead of casting to a numpy array which may have different semantics .
column2438: changed caching in abstractholidaycalendar to be at the instance level rather than at the class level as the latter can result in unexpected behaviour.
column2439: these were announced changes in 0.12 or prior that are taking effect as of 0.13.0
column2440: the keep_tz=false option of the keep_tz keyword of datetimeindex.to_series is deprecated .
column2441: bug when setting a new value with dataframe.loc with a datetimeindex with a dst transition
column2442: bug in series indexing with tuple-valued data and a numeric index
column2443: a new top-level method array has been added for creating 1-dimensional arrays . this can be used to create any extension array, including extension arrays registered by 3rd party libraries. see the dtypes docs for more on extension arrays.
column2444: supplying the string 'category' performs column-wise conversion, with only labels appearing in a given column set as categories:
column2445: bug in hdfstore was dropping time zone information when exporting a series with datetime64 dtypes with a fixed hdf5 store
column2446: bug in tz-conversions with an ambiguous time and .dt accessors
column2447: bug in sql writing with mixed dtypes possibly leading to data loss
column2448: bug in iloc indexing when positional indexer matched int64index of the corresponding axis and no reordering happened
column2449: future versions of pandas will preserve the timezone information by returning an object-dtype numpy array where each value is a timestamp with the correct timezone attached
column2450: passing an invalid value to intervalindex.insert or categoricalindex.insert now raises a typeerror instead of a valueerror
column2451: removed the previously deprecated true option for the dropna keyword argument in seriesgroupby.nth
column2452: we ve added booleandtype / booleanarray, an extension type dedicated to boolean data that can hold missing values. the default bool data type based on a bool-dtype numpy array, the column can only hold true or false, and not missing values. this new booleanarray can store missing values as well by keeping track of this in a separate mask.
column2453: index.map can now accept series and dictionary input objects .
column2454: dataframe.to_json and series.to_json now accept an index argument which allows the user to exclude the index from the json output
column2455: bug in series.where with an empty series and empty cond having non-bool dtype
column2456: label lookups series, series.loc and frame.loc used to raise either keyerror or typeerror depending on the type of key and type of index. these now consistently raise keyerror
column2457: pandas has significantly improved support for operations involving unsigned, or purely non-negative, integers. previously, handling these integers would result in improper rounding or data-type casting, leading to incorrect results. notably, a new numerical index, uint64index, has been created
column2458: updated the .type attribute for perioddtype, datetimetzdtype, and intervaldtype to be instances of the dtype
column2459: bug in eval where the inplace parameter was being incorrectly handled
column2460: bug in timestamp when passing different string date formats with a timezone offset would produce different timezone offsets
column2461: floor division between an integer ndarray and a timedelta is deprecated. divide by timedelta.value instead
column2462: fixed regression when indexing a series or dataframe indexed by datetimeindex with a slice containing a datetime.date
column2463: json nat handling fixed, nats are now serialized to null
column2464: constructing a timedeltaindex from data with datetime64-dtyped data is deprecated, will raise typeerror in a future version
column2465: there is a slightly different string repr for the underlying datetimeindex as a result of the dtype changes, but functionally these are the same.
column2466: bug in printing data which contains period with different freq raises valueerror
column2467: removed the previously deprecated keyword fastpath from pandas.core.internals.blocks.make_block
column2468: pandas.api.types.is_list_like has gained a keyword allow_sets which is true by default; if false, all instances of set will not be considered list-like anymore
column2469: bug in index.union behaving differently depending on whether operand is an index or other list-like
column2470: furthermore, previously if you had an index that was non-numeric , then a boolean index would raise a keyerror. this will now be treated as a boolean indexer.
column2471: a series will now correctly promote its dtype for assignment with incompat values to the current dtype
column2472: improved performance of variable .rolling on .min and .max
column2473: fixed a bug in series.hist where two figures were being created when the by argument was passed .
column2474: bug in groupby.shift, which could cause a segfault or corruption in rare circumstances when grouping by columns with missing values
column2475: datetimeindex partial string indexing now works as an exact match, provided that string resolution coincides with index resolution, including a case when both are seconds . see slice vs. exact match for details.
column2476: interval, intervalindex, and intervalarray have gained an is_empty attribute denoting if the given interval are empty
column2477: added pandas.api.types.register_extension_dtype to register an extension type with pandas
column2479: datetime64 columns in a dataframe allow the use of np.nan to indicate a nan value, in addition to the traditional nat, or not-a-time. this allows convenient nan setting in a generic way. furthermore datetime64 columns are created by default, when passed datetimelike objects
column2480: improved performance of rangeindex.is_monotonic_increasing and is_monotonic_decreasing
column2481: raise errors in certain aggregation cases where an argument such as numeric_only is not handled .
column2482: categorical.fillna will always return a copy, validate a passed fill value regardless of whether there are any nas to fill, and disallow an nat as a fill value for numeric categories
column2483: nat will now correctly return np.nan for timedelta and period accessors such as days and quarter
column2484: bug in dataframe.astype where converting to an extension dtype when duplicate column names are present causes a recursionerror
column2485: in the new repr, all values will be shown, if the number of rows is smaller than options.display.max_seq_items . horizontally, the output will truncate, if it s wider than options.display.width .
column2486: bug in series.__getitem__ when using an unsigned integer array as an indexer giving incorrect results or segfaulting instead of raising keyerror
column2487: added support for google analytics v3 api segment ids that also supports v2 ids.
column2488: dataframe.unstack and series.unstack now take fill_value keyword to allow direct replacement of missing values when an unstack results in missing values in the resulting dataframe. as an added benefit, specifying fill_value will preserve the data type of the original stacked data.
column2489: thus, it is strongly encouraged to install openpyxl to read excel 2007+ files. please do not report issues when using ``xlrd`` to read ``.xlsx`` files. this is no longer supported, switch to using openpyxl instead.
column2490: we typically want to match exactly when possible, and use the most recent value otherwise.
column2491: the following methods / indexers now accept a callable. it is intended to make these more useful in method chains, see the documentation.
column2492: fixed pip installing from source into an environment without numpy
column2493: read_html now defaults to none when reading, and falls back on bs4 + html5lib when lxml fails to parse. a list of parsers to try until success is also valid
column2494: the check_freq argument was added to testing.assert_frame_equal and testing.assert_series_equal in pandas 1.1.0 and defaults to true. testing.assert_frame_equal and testing.assert_series_equal now raise assertionerror if the indexes do not have the same frequency. before pandas 1.1.0, the index frequency was not checked.
column2495: bug in dataframe.as_matrix with mixed datetime64 and timedelta64 dtypes
column2496: bug in categorical.from_codes where nan values in codes were silently converted to 0 . in the future this will raise a valueerror. also changes the behavior of .from_codes.
column2497: bug in dataframe.insert where multiple calls with duplicate columns can fail
column2498: improved performance of datetimeindex.normalize and timestamp.normalize for timezone naive or utc datetimes
column2499: bug in plotting subplots with dataframe.boxplot with by kw raises valueerror if the number of subplots exceeds 1 .
column2500: improved huge datetimeindex, periodindex and timedeltaindex s ops performance including nat
column2503: bug in cut with bins as an overlapping intervalindex where multiple bins were returned per item instead of raising a valueerror
column2504: the skipna parameter of infer_dtype will switch to true by default in a future version of pandas
column2505: .as_blocks will now take a copy optional argument to return a copy of the data, default is to copy ,
column2506: categoricalindex.reindex now raises a valueerror if the target index is non-unique and not equal to the current index. it previously only raised if the target index was not of a categorical dtype .
column2507: fixed regression in multiindex.intersection returning duplicates when at least one of the indexes had duplicates
column2508: the metadata properties of subclasses of pandas objects will now be serialized .
column2509: the overlaps method can be used to create a boolean indexer that replicates the previous behavior of returning overlapping matches.
column2510: bug in pd.read_csv in which the dtype parameter was not being respected for empty data
column2511: bug in dataframe with datetime64 dtype comparing against nat incorrectly
column2512: astype now attempts to convert to datetime64 directly from object with inferred time zone from string
column2513: bug in json_normalize for errors='ignore' where missing values in the input data, were filled in resulting dataframe with the string "nan" instead of numpy.nan
column2514: bug in dataframegroupby.cumsum and dataframegroupby.cumprod when skipna was passed
column2515: bug in series.pct_change and dataframe.pct_change when there are duplicated indices
column2516: pd.get_store, replaced by a direct call to pd.hdfstore
column2517: pandas.io.gbq provides a simple way to extract from, and load data into, google s bigquery data sets by way of pandas dataframes. bigquery is a high performance sql-like database service, useful for performing ad-hoc queries against extremely large datasets. see the docs
column2518: bug in series.__setitem__ with an intervalindex and a list-like key of integers
column2519: reduce memory usage when skiprows is an integer in read_csv
column2520: this release targets bugs in 0.7.1, and adds a few minor features.
column2521: deprecated the units=m and units=y parameters for units of pandas.to_timedelta, pandas.timedelta and pandas.timedeltaindex
column2522: calling on an index with a regex with exactly one capture group returns an index if expand=false.
column2523: percentile identifiers in the index of a .describe output will now be rounded to the least precision that keeps them distinct
column2524: bug in dataframe.boxplot and dataframe.plot.boxplot lost color attributes of medianprops, whiskerprops, capprops and boxprops
column2525: a rangeindex has been added to the int64index sub-classes to support a memory saving alternative for common use cases. this has a similar implementation to the python range object , in that it only stores the start, stop, and step values for the index. it will transparently interact with the user api, converting to int64index if needed.
column2526: timestamp can now accept positional and keyword parameters similar to datetime.datetime
column2527: bug in is_superperiod and is_subperiod cannot handle higher frequencies than s
column2528: bug in sparseseries and sparsedataframe of bool or int64 dtype may display its values like float64 dtype
column2530: bug in intervalindex.is_non_overlapping_monotonic when intervals are closed on both sides and overlap at a point
column2531: bug where dataframe arithmetic operators such as dataframe.mul with a series with axis=1 would raise an attributeerror on dataframe larger than the minimum threshold to invoke numexpr
column2532: dataframe.sortlevel and series.sortlevel have been removed
column2533: file parsers no longer coerce to float or bool for columns that have custom converters specified
column2534: there s no difference in memory usage between a sparsedataframe and a dataframe with sparse values. the memory usage will be the same as in the previous version of pandas.
column2535: dataframe.to_csv, dataframe.to_pickle, and dataframe.to_json now support passing a dict of compression arguments when using the gzip and bz2 protocols. this can be used to set a custom compression level, e.g., df.to_csv
column2536: fixed bug in setting values using a slice indexer with string dtype
column2537: the return type of series.unique for datetime with timezone values has changed from an numpy.ndarray of timestamp objects to a arrays.datetimearray .
column2538: add spearman and kendall rank correlation options to series.corr and dataframe.corr
column2539: bug in read_csv in which memory management was prematurely optimized for the c engine when the data was being read in chunks
column2540: fixed a bug where groupby.plot and friends were duplicating figures multiple times .
column2541: seriesgroupby.nth has deprecated true in favor of 'all' for its kwarg dropna .
column2542: bug in date anchoring for dateframe.resample with offset day when n > 1
column2543: bug in read_pickle when unpickling objects with timedeltaindex or float64index created with pandas prior to version 0.20
column2544: bug in pd.merge_asof where left_index or right_index caused a failure when multiple by was specified
column2545: series.str.cat has deprecated using arbitrary list-likes within list-likes. a list-like container may still contain many series, index or 1-dimensional np.ndarray, or alternatively, only scalar values.
column2546: grouping by a categorical includes the unobserved categories in the output. when grouping by multiple categorical columns, this means you get the cartesian product of all the categories, including combinations where there are no observations, which can result in a large number of groups. we have added a keyword observed to control this behavior, it defaults to observed=false for backward-compatibility.
column2547: bug in dataframe.boxplot where fontsize was not applied to the tick labels on both axes
column2548: bug in timedelta and to_timedelta have inconsistencies in supported unit string
column2549: improve error reporting for dataframe.merge when invalid merge column definitions were given
column2550: fixed panel assignment with a transposed frame
column2551: bug in construction of a dataframe with mixed dtypes including an all-nat column.
column2552: move to klib-based hash tables for indexing; better performance and less memory usage than python s dict
column2553: you can select with partial string selections
column2554: fixed regression where dataframe.to_numpy would raise a runtimeerror for mixed dtypes when converting to str
column2555: slicing a single row of a dataframe with multiple extensionarrays of the same type now preserves the dtype, rather than coercing to object
column2556: slicing a single row of a dataframe with multiple extensionarrays of the same type now preserves the dtype, rather than coercing to object
column2557: an extensionarray with a boolean dtype now works correctly as a boolean indexer. pandas.api.types.is_bool_dtype now properly considers them boolean
column2558: passing int64 values to datetimeindex and a timezone now interprets the values as nanosecond timestamps in utc, not wall times in the given timezone
column2559: this is an experimental feature. currently, many methods fail to propagate the allows_duplicate_labels value. in future versions it is expected that every method taking or returning one or more dataframe or series objects will propagate allows_duplicate_labels.
column2560: bug in multiindex.drop does not raise if labels are partially found
column2561: when reading code, the contents of an object dtype array is less clear than string.
column2562: series.to_pickle and dataframe.to_pickle have gained a protocol parameter . by default, this parameter is set to highest_protocol
column2563: bug in dataframe.update with overwrite=false and nan values
column2564: pandas no longer tests for compatibility with hdf5-files created with pandas < 0.11 .
column2565: by default, read_csv and read_table will now try to infer the compression type based on the file extension. set compression=none to restore the previous behavior .
column2566: bug in intervalindex.symmetric_difference where the symmetric difference with a non-intervalindex did not raise
column2567: represent multiindex labels with a dtype that utilizes memory based on the level size. in prior versions, the memory usage was a constant 8 bytes per element in each level. in addition, in prior versions, the reported memory usage was incorrect as it didn t show the usage for the memory occupied by the underling data array.
column2568: passing an integer dtype other than int64 to np.array will now raise typeerror instead of incorrectly using int64
column2569: added cov instance methods to series and dataframe
column2570: bug in index may ignore specified datetime64 or timedelta64 passed as dtype
column2571: bug in dataframe.groupby raising an attributeerror when selecting a column and aggregating with as_index=false .
column2572: bug in series.groupby where using groupby with a multiindex series with a list of labels equal to the length of the series caused incorrect grouping
column2573: fix regression where series.isna and dataframe.isna would raise for categorical dtype when pandas.options.mode.use_inf_as_na was set to true
column2574: pandas now requires that extension dtypes be hashable . the base class implements a default __eq__ and __hash__. if you have a parametrized dtype, you should update the extensiondtype._metadata tuple to match the signature of your __init__ method. see pandas.api.extensions.extensiondtype for more .
column2575: new methods select_dtypes to select columns based on the dtype and sem to calculate the standard error of the mean.
column2576: bug where index name was still used when plotting a series with use_index=false .
column2577: dataframe.to_html and dataframe.to_latex have dropped the colspace parameter in favor of col_space
column2578: pivot_table now has a margins_name argument so you can use something other than the default of all
column2579: bug in read_csv when using skiprows on a file with cr line endings with the c engine.
column2580: iloc will now accept out-of-bounds indexers for slices, e.g. a value that exceeds the length of the object being indexed. these will be excluded. this will make pandas conform more with python/numpy indexing of out-of-bounds values. a single indexer that is out-of-bounds and drops the dimensions of the object will still raise indexerror . this could result in an empty axis
column2581: bug in sparseseries and sparsearray may have different dtype from its dense values
column2582: a default repr for pandas.api.extensions.extensionarray is now provided .
column2583: dataframe.to_json now accepts an indent integer argument to enable pretty printing of json output
column2584: bug when joining two multiindex without specifying level with different columns. return-indexers parameter was ignored.
column2585: you may have to install an older version of beautifulsoup4, see the installation docs
column2586: date_range, timedelta_range, and interval_range now return a linearly spaced index if start, stop, and periods are specified, but freq is not.
column2587: # show dimensions since this is truncated
column2588: positional setting with .ix and a float indexer will add this value to the index, rather than previously setting the value by position.
column2589: bug in invalid timedelta arithmetic and comparison may raise valueerror rather than typeerror
column2590: drop function can now accept errors keyword to suppress valueerror raised when any of label does not exist in the target data.
column2591: bug in get_dummies, and select_dtypes, where duplicate column names caused incorrect behavior
column2592: for full docs, see the categorical introduction and the api documentation.
column2593: removed the previously deprecated assert_raises_regex function in pandas._testing
column2594: add dayfirst option to parser functions for parsing international dd/mm/yyyy dates
column2595: the arrayformatter for datetime and timedelta64 now intelligently limit precision based on the values in the array
column2596: suppressed deprecationwarning associated with internal calls issued by repr
column2597: dataframe.to_html now raises typeerror when using an invalid type for the classes parameter instead of assertionerror
column2598: improved performance of to_numeric if input is numeric dtype
column2599: testing.assert_index_equal now has a check_order parameter that allows indexes to be checked in an order-insensitive manner
column2600: get_option / set_option - get/set the value of an option. partial names are accepted. - reset_option - reset one or more options to their default value. partial names are accepted. - describe_option - print a description of one or more options. when called with no arguments. print all registered options.
column2601: addition of an intervalindex and interval scalar type, see here
column2602: add nsmallest and series.nlargest methods to series, see the docs
column2603: bug in dataframe.at and series.at that would raise exception if the index was a categoricalindex
column2604: merging / sorting on a combination of columns and index levels.
column2605: bug in series.min which would return nan instead of nat when called on a series of nat
column2606: when a dataframe s slice is updated with a new slice of the same dtype, the dtype of the dataframe will now remain the same.
column2608: add the keyword dropna=true to append to change whether all nan rows are not written to the store , also settable via the option io.hdf.dropna_table
column2609: read_excel now accepts usecols as a list of column names or callable
column2610: bug in categorical that would ignore or crash when calling series.replace with a list-like to_replace
column2611: map on a series with datetime64 values may return int64 dtypes rather than int32
column2612: tz-aware are rounded, floored and ceiled in local times
column2613: bug in float64index.astype where np.inf was not handled properly when casting to an integer dtype
column2614: bug in pandas.concat when joining only series the names argument of concat is no longer ignored
column2615: this is a very long way of saying numpy arrays don t support string-item indexing. with this change, the error message is now this:
column2616: bug in setting using fancy indexing a single element with a non-scalar ,
column2617: io.data.options has been fixed for a change in the format of the yahoo options page ,
column2618: bug in to_datetime when passed a np.nan or integer datelike and a format string
column2619: fixed metadata propagation when selecting columns with dataframe.__getitem__
column2620: api-breaking changes will be made only in major releases
column2621: added cache_dates=true parameter to read_csv, which allows to cache unique dates when they are parsed
column2622: bug in to_excel with openpyxl 2.2+ and merging
column2623: changes to how index and multiindex handle metadata :
column2624: bug in resample with timedelta data where data was casted to float .
column2625: the sum of an empty or all-na series is now 0
column2626: bug in dataframe.eq comparison against nat incorrectly returning true or nan
column2627: the source and binary distributions no longer include test data files, resulting in smaller download sizes. tests relying on these data files will be skipped when using pandas.test.
column2628: bug when resampling dataframe.resample and aggregating on categorical data, the categorical dtype was getting lost.
column2629: bug in pd.read_hdf returns incorrect result when a dataframe with a categorical column and a query which doesn t match any values
column2630: we are releasing the global-interpreter-lock on some cython operations. this will allow other threads to run simultaneously during computation, potentially allowing performance improvements from multi-threading. notably groupby, nsmallest, value_counts and some indexing operations benefit from this.
column2631: improved error reporting for subsetting columns of a dataframegroupby with axis=1
column2632: fixed regression in comparisons between nat and datetime.date objects incorrectly returning true
column2633: dataframe.to_gbq and read_gbq signature and documentation updated to reflect changes from the pandas-gbq library version 0.8.0. adds a credentials argument, which enables the use of any kind of google-auth credentials.
column2634: bug in merge_asof where confusing error message raised when attempting to merge with missing values
column2635: improved performance of index and series .duplicated
column2636: bug in dataframegroupby.quantile and resampler.quantile raised typeerror when values were of type timedelta
column2637: improved the performance of pandas.get_dummies with sparse=true
column2638: will have to adapted to the following to keep the same behaviour:
column2643: previously data was coerced to a common dtype before serialisation, which for example resulted in integers being serialised to floats:
column2644: bug in pd.to_timedelta in which the errors parameter was not being respected
column2645: to_datetime now supports the %z and %z directive when passed into format
column2646: this engine can then be used to write or read data to/from this database:
column2647: fixed regression in modulo of index, series and dataframe using numexpr using c not python semantics
column2648: bug in certain operations with dateutil timezones, manifesting with dateutil 2.3
column2649: assign now inserts new columns in alphabetical order. previously the order was arbitrary.
column2650: bug in sparsedataframe construction with lists not coercing to dtype
column2651: the pandas.io.ga module with a google-analytics interface is removed . similar functionality can be found in the google2pandas package.
column2652: the internal index method _shallow_copy now makes the new index and original index share cached attributes, avoiding creating these again, if created on either. this can speed up operations that depend on creating copies of existing indexes
column2653: bug in formatting tick labels with datetime.time and fractional seconds .
column2654: futurewarning: scalar indexers for index type index should be integers and not floating point
column2655: dataframe.swaplevels now raises a typeerror if the axis is not a multiindex. previously an attributeerror was raised
column2656: bug in string indexing against data with object index may raise attributeerror
column2657: swapaxes on a panel with the same axes specified now return a copy
column2658: bug in datetimeindex.round and timestamp.round floating point accuracy when rounding by milliseconds or less
column2659: bug in indexing with iterator containing only missing keys, which raised no error
column2660: series / panel now allow attribute access to its elements
column2661: pandas.read_excel has deprecated accepting usecols as an integer. please pass in a list of ints from 0 to usecols inclusive instead
column2662: bug in invalid datetime parsing in to_datetime and datetimeindex may raise typeerror rather than valueerror
column2663: bug with insert of strings into datetimeindex
column2665: dtypes and ftypes now return a series with dtype=object on empty containers
column2666: businesshour offset is now supported, which represents business hours starting from 09:00 - 17:00 on businessday by default. see here for details.
column2667: dataframe.astype can now perform column-wise conversion to categorical by supplying the string 'category' or a categoricaldtype. previously, attempting this would raise a notimplementederror. see the object creation section of the documentation for more details and examples.
column2668: date_format and datetime_format keywords can now be specified when writing to excel files
column2670: method read_csv has improved support for duplicate column names
column2671: method read_csv has improved support for duplicate column names
column2672: pandas.tseries.holiday.holiday now supports a days_of_week parameter
column2673: pandas has gained an intervalindex with its own dtype, interval as well as the interval scalar type. these allow first-class support for interval notation, specifically as a return type for the categories in cut and qcut. the intervalindex allows some unique indexing, see the docs.
column2674: bug in dataframe with datetime64 dtype subtracting np.datetime64 object with non-nanosecond unit failing to convert to nanoseconds
column2675: stopped tests from failing if options data isn t able to be downloaded from yahoo
column2676: series.to_timestamp now raises a typeerror if the axis is not a periodindex. previously an attributeerror was raised
column2677: the arguments to pd.to_timedelta are now , previously were as these are more logical.
column2678: when performing index.union operations between objects of incompatible dtypes, the result will be a base index of dtype object. this behavior holds true for unions between index objects that previously would have been prohibited. the dtype of empty index objects will now be evaluated before performing union operations rather than simply returning the other index object. index.union can now be considered commutative, such that a.union == b.union .
column2679: bug in pd.read_csv where the index columns were being incorrectly parsed when parsed as dates with a thousands parameter
column2683: these indexing changes extend to querying a series or dataframe with an intervalindex index.
column2684: read_stata and statareader raise with a more explicit error message when reading stata files with repeated value labels when convert_categoricals=true
column2685: bug in dataframe.replace where changing a dtype through replacement would only replace the first occurrence of a value
column2686: the resulting categories will always be parsed as strings . if the categories are numeric they can be converted using the to_numeric function, or as appropriate, another converter such as to_datetime.
column2687: bug in index creation from timestamp with mixed tz coerces to utc
column2688: bug in pd.eval when parsing strings with possible tokens like '&'
column2689: bug in to_datetime with an index argument that would drop the name from the result
column2690: for small series or dataframes, up to max_rows number of rows is shown .
column2693: using .iloc. here we will get the location of the a column, then use positional indexing to select things.
column2694: datetime accessor now supports series.dt.strftime to generate formatted strings for datetime-likes, and series.dt.total_seconds to generate each duration of the timedelta in seconds. see here
column2695: pd.read_csv can now read bz2-compressed files incrementally, and the c parser can read bz2-compressed files from aws s3 .
column2696: bug in slicing a multiindex with an empty list and at least one boolean indexer
column2697: deprecated slice-indexing on tz-aware datetimeindex with naive datetime objects, to match scalar indexing behavior
column2698: fixed issue in dataframe construction with passing a mixed list of mixed types could segfault.
column2699: in prior versions, categoricals that had an unspecified ordering were defaulted as ordered categoricals. going forward, the ordered keyword in the categorical constructor will default to false. ordering must now be explicit.
column2700: bug in setitem with a single value, multiindex and integer indices
column2701: series.iteritems is now lazy . this was the documented behavior prior to 0.14.
column2702: the corresponding writer functions are object methods that are accessed like df.to_csv
column2703: bug in localizing an ambiguous timezone when a boolean is passed
column2704: all sparse formats are supported, but matrices that are not in coordinate format will be converted, copying data as needed.
column2705: bug in dataframe.to_latex where the combination of an index name and the index_names=false option would result in incorrect output
column2706: fixed segfault in pandas.core.groupby.dataframegroupby.quantile when an invalid quantile was passed
column2707: rolling.mean and rolling.sum use kahan summation to calculate the mean to avoid numerical problems
column2708: bug in timestamp.replace when replacing tzinfo around dst changes
column2709: you can still change the axis along which the first positional argument is applied by supplying the axis keyword argument.
column2710: new keywords to turn on/off sharing of x/y-axis by subplots generated with pandas.dataframe.groupby.boxplot
column2711: dataframe.to_csv has deprecated the tupleize_cols argument. multiindex columns will be always written as rows in the csv file
column2712: the default is to infer the compression type from the extension :
column2713: bug in .median where non-float null values are not handled correctly
column2714: fixed bug that causes plotting to fail when the index is a datetimeindex with a fixed-offset timezone
column2715: fixed copy to shallow copy axes/indices as well and thereby keep separate metadata.
column2716: significant performance improvement when creating a dataframe with sparse values from scipy.sparse matrices using the dataframe.sparse.from_spmatrix constructor .
column2717: bug in output formatting when using an index of ambiguous times
column2718: fixed regression in to_csv opening codecs.streamwriter in binary mode instead of in text mode and ignoring user-provided mode
column2719: allow option 'truncate' for display.show_dimensions to only show the dimensions if the frame is truncated .
column2720: dataframe.to_sql now supports writing timestamp with time zone types for supported databases. for databases that don t support timezones, datetime data will be stored as timezone unaware local timestamps. see the datetime data types for implications .
column2721: the following new methods are accessible via .str accessor to apply the function to each values.
column2722: added a pandas.api.indexers.variableoffsetwindowindexer class to support rolling operations with non-fixed offsets
column2723: zerodivisionerror: integer division or modulo by zero
column2724: bug in pd.scatter_matrix could accept either color or c, but not both
column2725: accessing a non-existent attribute on a closed hdfstore will now raise an attributeerror rather than a closedfileerror
column2726: drop added as an optional parameter to dataframe.reset_index
column2727: pandas.api.types.infer_dtype will now return integer-na for integer and np.nan mix
column2728: bug in to_numeric in which invalid values for errors were being allowed
column2731: bug in dataframe.to_csv with multiindex columns in which a stray empty line was added
column2732: remove use of some deprecated numpy comparison operations, mainly in tests.
column2733: # note that this is deprecated as of 0.14.0
column2734: bug in dataframe.to_hdf where table format would raise a seemingly unrelated error for invalid column names. this is now explicitly forbidden.
column2735: bug preventing pandas being used on windows without c++ redistributable installed
column2736: bug in pd.read_csv for the c engine in which quotation marks were improperly parsed in skipped rows
column2737: added new writer for exporting stata dta files in version 117, statawriter117. this format supports exporting strings with lengths up to 2,000,000 characters
column2738: fixed a bug where dataframe.replace with a compiled regular expression in the to_replace argument wasn t working
column2739: performance improvement in pd.isin for inputs with more than 1e6 elements
column2740: series now has unary negation and inversion operators
column2741: there are bugs in the user-facing api with the nanosecond datetime64 unit in numpy 1.6. in particular, the string version of the array shows garbage values, and conversion to dtype=object is similarly broken.
column2742: series.str.split will now propagate nan values across all expanded columns instead of none
column2743: grouper and dataframe.resample now supports the arguments origin and offset. it let the user control the timestamp on which to adjust the grouping.
column2744: series.apply for category dtype now applies the passed function to each of the .categories , and returns a category dtype if possible
column2745: bug in usfederalholidaycalendar where usmemorialday and usmartinlutherkingjr were incorrect
column2746: valueerror: cannot mask with array containing na / nan values
column2747: read_json now avoids reading entire file into memory when chunksize is specified
column2748: bug in dataframegroupby.apply dropped values on nan group when returning the same axes with the original frame
column2749: added <na> to the list of default na values for read_csv
column2750: bug in dataframe flex arithmetic ) with a fill_value other than none failed to raise notimplementederror in corner cases where either the frame or other has length zero
column2751: positional slicing on a intervalindex now supports slices with step > 1
column2752: index + / - no longer used for set operations
column2753: index + / - no longer used for set operations
column2754: the series, categorical, and index classes have dropped the reshape method
column2755: bug in resample with extra bins when using an evenly divisible frequency
column2756: bug in constructing a series or index from a read-only numpy array with non-ns resolution which converted to object dtype instead of coercing to datetime64 dtype when within the timestamp bounds .
column2757: panel now supports the all and any aggregation functions. :
column2758: fixed regression in statareader which required chunksize to be manually set when using an iterator to read a dataset
column2759: fixed string methods for frozenndarray and frozenlist
column2760: you should specify all axes in the .loc specifier, meaning the indexer for the index and for the columns. their are some ambiguous cases where the passed indexer could be mis-interpreted as indexing both axes, rather than into say the muliindex for the rows.
column2761: bug in to_parquet was not raising permissionerror when writing to a private s3 bucket with invalid creds.
column2762: the drop method has gained index/columns keywords as an alternative to specifying the axis. this is similar to the behavior of reindex .
column2763: bug in io.common.get_filepath_or_buffer which caused reading of valid s3 files to fail if the bucket also contained keys for which the user does not have read permission
column2765: bug in groupby.count with float32 data type were nan values were not excluded .
column2766: pd.index has dropped the diff method in favor of difference
column2767: bug in getitem with a multiindex and iloc
column2768: removed the previously deprecated sheetname keyword in read_excel
column2769: bug in dataframe.replace where truthy values were being replaced .
column2770: series.to_json, dataframe.to_json, and read_json now implement time zone parsing when orient structure is table
column2771: series.last and dataframe.last will now raise a typeerror rather than notimplementederror when index is not a datetimeindex .
column2772: furthermore, this allows one to bin other data with these same bins, with nan representing a missing value similar to other dtypes.
column2773: bug in passing a datetimeindex with a timezone that was not being retained in dataframe construction from a dict
column2774: bug in printing pd.dataframe where unusual elements with the object dtype were causing segfaults
column2775: bug in to_datetime with invalid datetime format doesn t coerce input to nat even if errors='coerce'
column2776: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.shift, pandas.core.groupby.groupby.bfill and pandas.core.groupby.groupby.ffill where timezone information would be dropped
column2777: bug in dataframe.lookup incorrectly raising an attributeerror when frame.index or frame.columns is not unique; this will now raise a valueerror with a helpful error message
column2778: improved error message for dataframe.merge when there is no common merge key
column2779: new datetime64 representation speeds up join operations and data alignment, reduces memory usage, and improve serialization / deserialization performance significantly over datetime.datetime
column2780: dataframe.mask and series.mask now support same keywords as where
column2781: bug in dataframe.to_csv where values were truncated when the length of na_rep was shorter than the text input data.
column2782: expanded the tutorials section with a feature on modern pandas, courtesy of @tomaugsburger. .
column2783: removal of the previously deprecated module pandas.json
column2784: for backwards compatibility, inplace defaults to true if not specified. this will change in a future version of pandas. if your code depends on an inplace assignment you should update to explicitly set inplace=true
column2785: bug in series.resample.apply where an empty series modified the source index and did not return the name of a series
column2786: bug in read_html in which the error message was not displaying the valid flavors when an invalid one was provided
column2787: bug in index.difference when taking difference of an index with itself
column2788: support for nanosecond times as an offset
column2789: the as_indexer keyword of series.str.match has been deprecated .
column2790: bug in parallel_coordinates and radviz where reordering of class column caused possible color/class mismatch
column2791: dataframe.to_markdown and series.to_markdown now accept index argument as an alias for tabulate s showindex
column2792: bug in read_csv not raising an exception with nonexistent columns in usecols when it had the correct length
column2793: bug in index raises outofboundsdatetime if datetime exceeds datetime64 bounds, rather than coercing to object dtype
column2794: better error message when attempting to plot but matplotlib is not installed .
column2795: fixed bug in dataframe.to_excel where custom objects inside merged cells were not being converted into types safe for the excel writer
column2796: performance improvement in dataframe.replace when provided a list of values to replace
column2797: fixed bug where passing a series with datetime64 values into to_datetime results in bogus output values
column2798: the arg argument in pandas.core.groupby.dataframegroupby.agg has been renamed to func
column2799: the changes described here have been partially reverted. see the v0.22.0 whatsnew for more.
column2800: bug in putting a periodindex into a series would convert to int64 dtype, rather than object of periods
column2801: previously, when sparse=true was passed to get_dummies, the return value could be either a dataframe or a sparsedataframe, depending on whether all or a just a subset of the columns were dummy-encoded. now, a dataframe is always returned .
column2802: these are the changes in pandas 0.24.1. see release notes for a full changelog including other versions of pandas. see what s new in 0.24.0 for the 0.24.0 changelog.

column2804: fixed performance regression in series.asof when where is a scalar
column2805: multiindex constructed from levels and codes
column2806: line and kde plot with subplots=true now uses default colors, not all black. specify color='k' to draw all lines in black
column2807: bug in .rolling.quantile which incorrectly used different defaults than series.quantile and dataframe.quantile

column2809: these can accept a callable for the condition and other arguments.
column2810: pandas >= 0.18.0 no longer supports compatibility with python version 2.6 and 3.3
column2811: series, index, and dataframe have dropped the sort and order methods

column2814: added a more informative error message when plot arguments contain overlapping color and style arguments
column2815: improvements in dataframe.transform with ufuncs and built-in grouper functions for significant performance gains
column2816: improved the speed of nunique by calling unique instead of value_counts
column2817: categorical.argsort now places missing values at the end of the array, making it consistent with numpy and the rest of pandas .
column2818: bug in pd.read_stata which would use the wrong data types and missing values
column2819: arrays.integerarray now uses pandas.na rather than numpy.nan as its missing value marker .
column2820: supported by numexpr for the bool dtype, use '|' instead

column2831: see the full release notes or issue tracker on github for a complete list.
column2832: dataframe.plot now supports multiple columns to the y argument
column2833: note that the inconsistency in the return value for all-na series is still there for pandas 0.20.3 and earlier. avoiding pandas 0.21 will only help with the empty case.
column2834: # now it is not counted at all
column2835: the custombusinesshour is a mixture of businesshour and custombusinessday which allows you to specify arbitrary holidays. for details, see custom business hour
column2836: removed index.contains, use key in index instead
column2837: in 0.14.0 all ndframe based containers have undergone significant internal refactoring. before that each block of homogeneous data had its own labels and extra care was necessary to keep those in sync with the parent container s labels. this should not have any visible user/api behavior changes
column2838: bug in dataframe.to_records with converting a datetimeindex with a timezone
column2839: bug in dataframe.to_records which failed with unicode characters in column names
column2840: str.split has dropped the return_type parameter in favor of expand
column2841: the behaviour of assigning a column to an existing dataframe as df = i remains unchanged .
column2842: bug in read_csv where line comments were not handled correctly given a custom line terminator or delim_whitespace=true .
column2843: fixed regression in excelfile where the stream passed into the function was closed by the destructor.
column2844: bug in pct_change using periods and freq returned different length outputs
column2845: bug in pd.read_csv in the c engine where the null character was not being parsed as null
column2846: bug in series.loc and series.iloc setting all the values of an object series with those of a list-like extensionarray instead of inserting it
column2847: slicing and advanced/boolean indexing operations on index classes as well as index.delete and index.drop methods will no longer change the type of the resulting index
column2848: series and dataframe now have a mode method to calculate the statistical mode by axis/series.
column2849: bug in series.is_unique where single occurrences of nan were not considered unique
column2850: bug in pd.to_numeric with index returns np.ndarray, rather than index
column2851: bug in core.groupby.dataframegroupby.quantile raised typeerror for non-numeric types rather than dropping the columns
column2852: ensure only named functions can be used in eval
column2853: fixed a bug where plotting a column y and specifying a label would mutate the index name of the original dataframe
column2854: bug where dataframe column set to scalar extension type was considered an object type rather than the extension type
column2855: the string parsing of to_datetime, timestamp and datetimeindex has been made consistent.
column2856: bug in abcpanel in which panel4d was not being considered as a valid instance of this generic type
column2857: improved pandas.read_stata and pandas.io.stata.statareader to read incorrectly formatted 118 format files saved by stata
column2858: futurewarning: scalar indexers for index type int64index should be integers and not floating point
column2859: futurewarning: scalar indexers for index type int64index should be integers and not floating point
column2860: futurewarning: scalar indexers for index type int64index should be integers and not floating point
column2861: when converting to a numpy array missing values will be pd.na, which cannot be converted to a float. so calling np.asarray will now raise.
column2864: to_hdf was raising when passing both arguments append and table
column2865: regression in series with a multiindex via ix
column2866: bug in broadcasting with .div, integer dtypes and divide-by-zero
column2867: partially sort by only the specified levels of a multiindex with the sort_remaining boolean kwarg.
column2868: assignment to multiple columns of a dataframe when some of the columns do not exist would previously assign the values to the last column. now, new columns will be constructed with the right values.
column2869: bug in series.rename when called with a callable, incorrectly alters the name of the series, rather than the name of the index.
column2870: not coerce, and the values not compare equal to the 'datetime.date'.
column2871: bug in periodindex where comparisons against an array-like object with length 1 failed to raise valueerror
column2872: fixed various setitem with 1d ndarray that does not have a matching length to the indexer
column2873: fixed a performance regression for .loc indexing with an array or list-like .
column2874: this prevents pathological behavior where applying the reduction on a subset of columns could result in a larger series result. see .
column2875: fixed bug where filtering a grouped dataframe or series did not maintain the original ordering .
column2876: the raise_on_error argument to plotting functions is removed. instead, plotting functions raise a typeerror when the dtype of the object is object to remind you to avoid object arrays whenever possible and thus you should cast to an appropriate numeric dtype if you need to plot something.
column2877: bug in statawriter where encoding was ignored
column2879: bug in dataframe.dropna with duplicate indices
column2880: bug in series.cummin and series.cummax with timezone-aware dtype incorrectly dropping its timezone
column2881: bug where dataframe.itertuples would incorrectly determine whether or not namedtuples could be used for dataframes of 255 columns
column2882: pd.qcut has gained the duplicates='raise'|'drop' option to control whether to raise on duplicated edges
column2883: nameresolutionerror was removed because it isn t necessary anymore.
column2884: bug in recognizing out-of-bounds positional list indexers with iloc and a multi-axis tuple indexer
column2885: bug where merge was unable to join on non-unique categorical indices
column2886: hdfstore.select_as_multiple handles start and stop the same way as select
column2887: while the default float data type already supports missing values using np.nan, these new data types use pd.na as the missing value indicator, in line with the already existing nullable integer and boolean data types.
column2888: add level option to binary arithmetic functions on dataframe and series
column2889: bug in invalid attribute access on a timedeltaindex incorrectly raised valueerror instead of attributeerror
column2890: bug in .mode where mode was not returned if was only a single value
column2891: bug in to_datetime where utc=true was not respected when passing a timestamp
column2892: improved performance of read_csv by faster tokenizing and faster parsing of small float numbers
column2893: improved performance of pandas.core.groupby.groupby.rank when dealing with tied rankings
column2894: bug in dataframe.agg where applying multiple aggregation functions to a dataframe with duplicated column names would cause a stack overflow
column2895: there were too many simultaneous contributions to include a release note for each improvement, but this github search should give you an idea of how many docstrings were improved.
column2896: bug in timedeltaindex subtraction could incorrectly overflow when nat is present
column2897: bug in validating color parameter caused extra color to be appended to the given color array. this happened to multiple plotting functions using matplotlib.
column2898: bug in adding a businessday with nonzero offset to a non-scalar other
column2899: bug in dataframe.groupby with multiple groups where an indexerror would be raised if any group contained all na values
column2900: improved csv write performance generally by 2x
column2901: fixed segfault in c parser caused by passing more names than columns in the file.
column2902: bug in dataframegroupby.quantile couldn t handle with arraylike q when grouping by columns
column2903: indexing with a null key will raise a typeerror, instead of a valueerror
column2904: optimize scalar value lookups in the general case by 25% or more in series and dataframe
column2905: bug in groupby where apply returns different result depending on whether first result is none or not
column2906: add -nan and -nan to the default set of na values . see na values.
column2907: we are deprecating passing a dict to a grouped/rolled/resampled series. this allowed one to rename the resulting aggregation, but this had a completely different meaning than passing a dictionary to a grouped dataframe, which accepts column-to-aggregations.
column2908: added name attribute to series, now prints as part of series.__repr__
column2909: operations with the existing integer or boolean nullable data types that give float results will now also use the nullable floating data types .
column2910: to_msgpack and read_msgpack encoding now defaults to 'utf-8'.
column2911: bug in dataframe prevented list subclasses to be used to construction
column2912: development installed versions of pandas will now have pep440 compliant version strings
column2913: dataframe.explode and series.explode now support exploding of sets
column2914: bug in not treating nat as a missing value in datetimelikes when factorizing & with categoricals
column2915: the shift method now accepts fill_value as an argument, allowing the user to specify a value which will be used instead of na/nat in the empty periods.
column2916: bug in pd.core.util.hashing.hash_pandas_object where arrays containing tuples were incorrectly treated as non-hashable
column2917: bug in where causing incorrect results when upcasting was required
column2918: read_parquet now allows to specify the columns to read from a parquet file
column2919: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.rank with method='dense' and pct=true when a group has only one member would raise a zerodivisionerror .
column2920: fixed regression in .groupby aggregations with categorical dtype using cythonized reduction functions
column2921: bug in to_datetime with unit='ns' would drop timezone information from the parsed argument
column2922: column order is preserved when passing a list of dicts to dataframe
column2923: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.nth where column order was not always preserved
column2925: add support for aws_s3_host env variable when reading from s3
column2926: bug in .iloc and .loc with a boolean indexer not raising an indexerror when too few items are passed .

column2937: improved performance of shift, cumprod, and cumsum with groupby

column2944: bug in index where a numpy object array with a timezone aware timestamp and np.nan would not return a datetimeindex

column2950: so in v0.16.0, we are restoring the api to match that of datetime.timedelta. further, the component values are still available through the .components accessor. this affects the .seconds and .microseconds accessors, and removes the .hours, .minutes, .milliseconds accessors. these changes affect timedeltaindex and the series .dt accessor as well.

column2969: pandas now uses s3fs for handling s3 connections. this shouldn t break any code. however, since s3fs is not a required dependency, you will need to install it separately, like boto in prior versions of pandas. .
