column3217: prevent adding new attributes to the accessors .str, .dt and .cat. retrieving such a value was not possible, so error out on setting it.
column3218: a close of a hdfstore now will close that instance of the hdfstore but will only close the actual file if the ref count w.r.t. all of the open handles are 0. essentially you have a local instance of hdfstore referenced by a variable. once you close it, it will report closed. other references will continue to operate until they themselves are closed. performing an action on a closed file will raise closedfileerror
column3219: bug in pd.read_fwf where the skiprows parameter was not being respected during column width inference
column3220: add select_dtypes method to allow selection of columns based on dtype . see the docs.
column3221: pandas.read_excel error message when a specified sheetname does not exist is now uniform across engines
column3222: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.transform which caused missing values when the input function can accept a dataframe but renames it .
column3223: bug in dataframe.pivot_table with aggfunc='count' or aggfunc='sum' returning nan for missing categories when pivoted on a categorical. now returning 0
column3224: use series.array to extract the underlying array of intervals or periods from the series:
column3226: bug in fillna with method='bfill/ffill' and datetime64 dtype
column3227: the file parsers will not recognize non-string values arising from a converter function as na if passed in the na_values argument. it s better to do post-processing using the replace function instead.
column3228: a function union_categoricals has been added for combining categoricals, see unioning categoricals
column3229: bug where ndframe.replace didn t correctly replace objects with period values .
column3230: add update methods to series/dataframe for updating values in place
column3232: bug in assignment against int64 data with np.ndarray with float64 dtype may keep int64 dtype
column3233: bug in assignment against int64 data with np.ndarray with float64 dtype may keep int64 dtype
column3234: bug in dataframe.plot and series.plot may ignore rot and fontsize keywords
column3235: additionally, support has been dropped for python 3.4 .
column3236: bug in selecting from a categorical with .iloc
column3237: dataframe.corr and dataframe.cov use welford s method to avoid numerical issues
column3238: bug in comparing a timedelta object against an np.ndarray with timedelta64 dtype incorrectly viewing all entries as unequal
column3239: categorical.ravel will return a categorical instead of a np.ndarray
column3240: bug in groupby with mixed str/int under python3 fixed; argsort was failing
column3241: removed the previously deprecated keyword labels from multiindex.set_codes, multiindex.copy, multiindex.drop, use codes instead
column3242: bug in index constructor where an unhelpful error message was raised for numpy scalars
column3243: fixed regression in read_excel with engine="odf" caused unboundlocalerror in some cases where cells had nested child nodes
column3244: the datetime-related attributes of datetimeindex, periodindex and timedeltaindex previously returned numpy arrays. they will now return a new index object, except in the case of a boolean field, where the result will still be a boolean ndarray.
column3245: removed the previously deprecated frozenndarray class in pandas.core.indexes.frozen
column3246: bug in dataframe.hist where the order of column argument was ignored
column3247: bug in intervalindex constructors where creating an intervalindex from categorical data was not fully supported
column3248: bug in qcut where datetime and timedelta data with nat present raised a valueerror
column3249: fix return value/type signature of initobjtojson to be compatible with numpy s import_array
column3250: using the anchoring suffix, you can also specify the day of month to use instead of the 15th.
column3251: fixed bug where thousands operator was not handled correctly for floating point numbers in csv_import
column3252: fix boolean indexing on an empty series loses index names , infer_dtype works with empty arrays.
column3253: passing a scalar for indices is no longer allowed.
column3254: fixed bug where stringarray.isna would return false for na values when pandas.options.mode.use_inf_as_na was set to true
column3255: merge_asof now gives a more clear error message when merge keys are categoricals that are not equal
column3256: bug in using pathlib.path or py.path.local objects with io functions
column3257: bug in groupby.transform where int groups with a transform that didn t preserve the index were incorrectly truncated .
column3258: retrieving unique values in an indexable or data column.
column3259: bug in dataframe.where and series.where coerce numerics to string incorrectly
column3260: bug in dataframe.to_latex where bold_rows was wrongly specified to be true by default, whereas in reality row labels remained non-bold whatever parameter provided.
column3261: dataframe.to_dict has dropped the outtype parameter in favor of orient
column3262: bug in pd.read_csv in which the nrows argument was not properly validated for both engines
column3263: for pivoting operations, this behavior is already controlled by the dropna keyword:
column3265: fixed regression in pd.dataframe where constructor fails when given dict with none value
column3266: bug where nullable integers could not be compared to strings
column3267: parallel_coordinates has gained a sort_labels keyword argument that sorts class labels and the colors assigned to them
column3268: release the gil on most datetime field operations , normalization, and conversion to and from period, datetimeindex.to_period and periodindex.to_timestamp
column3269: ewma, ewmstd, ewmvol, ewmvar, ewmcov, and ewmcorr now interpret min_periods in the same manner that the rolling_* and expanding_* functions do: a given result entry will be nan if the window does not contain at least min_periods values. the previous behavior was to set to nan the min_periods entries starting with the first non- nan value.
column3271: bug in intervalindex.copy when copying and intervalindex with non-default closed
column3272: bug in period.end_time when a multiple of time period is requested
column3273: read_fwf now infers the column specifications from the first 100 rows of the file if the data has correctly separated and properly aligned columns using the delimiter provided to the function .
column3274: bug in crosstab when inputs are two series and have tuple names, the output will keep a dummy multiindex as columns.
column3275: pandas now supports storing array-like objects that aren t necessarily 1-d numpy arrays as columns in a dataframe or values in a series. this allows third-party libraries to implement extensions to numpy s types, similar to how pandas implemented categoricals, datetimes with timezones, periods, and intervals.
column3276: bug in infer_freq causing indices with 2-day gaps during the working week to be wrongly inferred as business daily
column3277: assigning values to none now considers the dtype when choosing an empty value .
column3278: timedelta will now accept nanoseconds keyword in constructor
column3279: bug in dataframe.nlargest and dataframe.nsmallest when the index had duplicate values
column3280: added inner join option to dataframe.join when joining on key
column3281: bug in dataframe.any with axis=1 and bool_only=true ignoring the bool_only keyword
column3282: fixed regression in to_csv where specifying an na_rep might truncate the values written
column3283: can index time series with datetime.time objects to select all data at particular time of day or between two times
column3284: series.rank and dataframe.rank now have the same signature
column3285: bug in .interpolate, where limit_direction was not respected when limit=none was passed
column3286: improved performance of series.dt.date and datetimeindex.date
column3287: s.dt.hour and other .dt accessors will now return np.nan for missing values ,
column3288: bug in dataframe.append when appending a row with different columns
column3289: dataframe.to_json now returns accurate type serialisation for each column for frames of mixed dtype
column3290: bug in dataframe.loc and dataframe.__getitem__ raising keyerror when columns were multiindex with only one level
column3291: passing floating dtype codes to categorical.from_codes is no longer supported, pass codes.astype instead
column3292: fix to ensure that tab-completion in an ipython console does not raise warnings for deprecated attributes .
column3293: bug in timedelta.round with negative values
column3294: bug in dataframe.groupby where grouper does not recognize level when frequency is specified
column3295: the html and plain text representations of dataframe now show a truncated view of the table once it exceeds a certain size, rather than switching to the short info view . this makes the representation more consistent as small dataframes get larger.
column3296: pandas.io.formats.style.styler now has method hide_columns to determine whether columns will be hidden in output
column3297: calling the .value_counts method on a series with a categorical dtype now returns a series with a categoricalindex
column3298: usually you simply want to know which values are null.
column3299: the pandas.io.wb and pandas.io.data stub modules have been removed
column3300: types int64 and bool support enhancements
column3301: types int64 and bool support enhancements
column3302: added module for reading and writing json format files: pandas.io.json accessible via read_json top-level function for reading, and to_json dataframe method for writing, see the docs various issues
column3303: bug in dataframe.clip when order of columns of dataframes doesn t match, result observed is wrong in numeric values
column3304: ensured that ordering of outputs in groupby aggregation functions is consistent across all versions of python
column3305: the documentation for pivot_table states that a dataframe is always returned. here a bug is fixed that allowed this to return a series under certain circumstance.
column3306: bug in dataframegroupby.ffill and dataframegroupby.bfill where a nan group would return filled values instead of nan when dropna=true
column3307: many read/write functions have acquired the storage_options optional argument, to pass a dictionary of parameters to the storage backend. this allows, for example, for passing credentials to s3 and gcs storage. the details of what parameters can be passed to which backends can be found in the documentation of the individual storage backends . see section reading/writing remote files.
column3308: removed value_range in favor of describe
column3309: fix running of stata io tests. now uses temporary files to write
column3311: operations on sparse structures within dataframes should preserve sparseness, merging type operations will convert to dense , so might be somewhat inefficient
column3312: bug in intervalindex where performing a scalar lookup fails for included right endpoints of non-overlapping monotonic decreasing indexes
column3314: df.to_csv will now return a string of the csv data if neither a target path nor a buffer is provided
column3315: upsampling data with a periodindex will result in a higher frequency timeseries that spans the original time window
column3316: added support for different delimiters in dataframe.to_csv
column3317: bug in pd.read_csv with engine='python' which raised errors when a numpy array was passed in for usecols
column3318: bug in groupby.pct_change and core.groupby.seriesgroupby.pct_change causes typeerror when fill_method is none
column3319: bug in the html repr of a truncated series or dataframe not showing the class name with the large_repr set to info
column3320: bug in read_csv with a date_parser that returned a datetime64 array of other time resolution than
column3321: bug in dataframe.to_html with index=false when both columns and row index are multiindex
column3322: interval and intervalindex have gained a length attribute
column3323: fixed regression in intervaldtype construction where passing an incorrect string with interval as a prefix could result in a recursionerror.
column3324: implement fast data ranking for series and dataframe, fast versions of scipy.stats.rankdata
column3325: sparsearray.get_values and sparsearray.to_dense have dropped the fill parameter
column3326: bug in datetimeindex, timedeltaindex addition and subtraction of zero-dimensional integer arrays gave incorrect results
column3327: bug in timestamp.floor datetimeindex.floor where time stamps far in the future and past were not rounded correctly
column3329: fixed regression in equality comparison of pd.nat with a non-datetimelike numpy array returning a scalar instead of an array
column3330: inconsistency in datetimearray, timedeltaarray, and periodarray method __setitem__ casting arrays of strings to datetime-like scalars but not scalar strings
column3331: bug in pd.set_eng_float_format that would prevent nan and inf from formatting
column3332: bug in subtracting timedeltaindex from period incorrectly raising typeerror in some cases where it should succeed and incompatiblefrequency in some cases where it should raise typeerror
column3333: cacheableoffset and weekday are no longer available in the pandas.tseries.offsets module
column3334: expand=true: it always returns a dataframe, which is more consistent and less confusing from the perspective of a user.
column3335: support for a datetime64 with timezones as a first-class dtype, see here
column3336: method drop now also accepts index/columns keywords
column3337: method drop now also accepts index/columns keywords
column3338: removal of the previously deprecated module pandas.core.datetools
column3340: plotting functions now raise a typeerror before trying to plot anything if the associated objects have a dtype of object , but they will try to convert object arrays to numeric arrays if possible so that you can still plot, for example, an object array with floats. this happens before any drawing takes place which eliminates any spurious plots from showing up.
column3341: these indexing function have been deprecated in the documentation since 0.11.0.
column3342: read_html now sports an encoding argument that is passed to the underlying parser library. you can use this to read non-ascii encoded web pages .
column3343: bug in dataframe.to_string that broke column alignment when index=false and width of first column s values is greater than the width of first column s header
column3344: bug in concat when concatenating a list of series with all-sparse values changing the fill_value and converting to a dense series
column3345: fixed bug in dataframe.replace where a nested dict wasn t being iterated over when regex=false
column3346: fixed regression in dataframegroupby.diff raising for int8 and int16 columns
column3347: # the levels are automatically included as data columns
column3348: improved performance of intervalindex.is_monotonic, intervalindex.is_monotonic_increasing and intervalindex.is_monotonic_decreasing by removing conversion to multiindex
column3349: bug in dataframe.loc returning empty result when indexer is a slice with negative step size
column3350: there are several libraries that are now recommended dependencies
column3351: in prior versions this would drop the timezone, now it retains the timezone, but gives a column of object dtype:
column3352: bug in dataframe.drop with an empty-list with non-unique indices
column3353: bug in groupby.quantile with multiple list-like q value and integer column names
column3354: bug in cache coherence with chained indexing and slicing; add _is_view property to ndframe to correctly predict views; mark is_copy on xs only if its an actual copy
column3355: bug in getting timezone data with dateutil on various platforms
column3356: fixed regression in categorical, where constructing it from a categorical series and an explicit categories= that differed from that in the series created an invalid object which could trigger segfaults.
column3357: fixed bug in concat when concatenating dataframe objects with non-overlapping columns resulting in object-dtype columns rather than preserving the extension dtype
column3358: bug in comparing dateoffset objects with non-dateoffset objects, particularly strings, raising valueerror instead of returning false for equality checks and true for not-equal checks
column3359: bug in datetimearray.__setitem__, timedeltaarray.__setitem__, periodarray.__setitem__ incorrectly allowing values with int64 dtype to be silently cast
column3360: added option to hide index in series.to_string
column3361: bug in dataframe.to_html, dataframe.to_string, and dataframe.to_latex ignoring the na_rep argument when float_format was also specified
column3362: bug in series.isin when called with a categorical
column3363: .swaplevel for series, dataframe, panel, and multiindex now features defaults for its first two parameters i and j that swap the two innermost levels of the index.
column3364: dataframe.plot now prints a title above each subplot if suplots=true and title is a list of strings
column3365: pd.api.types.union_categoricals gained the ignore_ordered argument to allow ignoring the ordered attribute of unioned categoricals . see the categorical union docs for more information.
column3366: fixed regression in groupby.apply if called with a function which returned a non-pandas non-scalar object
column3367: python csv parser now supports usecols
column3368: series.to_list and index.to_list are now aliases of series.tolist respectively index.tolist
column3369: to_csv, to_csv, to_json, and to_json now support compression='infer' to infer compression based on filename extension . the default compression for to_csv, to_json, and to_pickle methods has been updated to 'infer' .
column3370: clarified error message produced when passing an incorrect freq argument to datetimeindex with nat as the first entry in the passed data
column3371: improved error message and docstring in cut and qcut when labels=true
column3372: bug in easter returns incorrect date when offset is negative
column3373: series.str.contains now has a regex=false keyword which can be faster for plain string patterns.
column3374: bug in categorical.astype where nan values were handled incorrectly when casting to int
column3375: add kurt methods to series and dataframe for computing kurtosis
column3377: enable reading gzip compressed files via url, either by explicitly setting the compression parameter or by inferring from the presence of the http content-encoding header in the response
column3379: bug in to_sql using unicode column names giving unicodeencodeerror with .
column3380: using .ix will now show a deprecationwarning with a link to some examples of how to convert code here.
column3381: pandas has added a pyproject.toml file and will no longer include cythonized files in the source distribution uploaded to pypi . if you re installing a built distribution or via conda, this shouldn t have any effect on you. if you re building pandas from source, you should no longer need to install cython into your build environment before calling pip install pandas.
column3382: bug in dateoffset where attributes reconstructed from pickle files differ from original objects when input values exceed normal ranges
column3383: dataframe.astype and series.astype have renamed the raise_on_error argument to errors
column3384: fixed in pivot_table. margins did not compute if values is the index.
column3385: bug in dataframe.diff with axis=1 returning incorrect results with mixed dtypes
column3386: bug in dataframe.replace and series.replace where interval dtypes would be converted to object dtypes
column3387: fixed regression where custom hashable types could not be used as column keys in dataframe.set_index
column3388: pd.read_sql and to_sql can accept database uri as con parameter
column3389: the read_gbq method has gained the dialect argument to allow users to specify whether to use bigquery s legacy sql or bigquery s standard sql. see the docs for more details .
column3391: bug in pd.read_hdf where attempting to load an hdf file with a single dataset, that had one or more categorical columns, failed unless the key argument was set to the name of the dataset.
column3392: fixed regression in dataframe.astype and series.astype not casting to bytes dtype
column3393: fixed regression in pands.core.groupby.dataframegroupby.quantile raising when multiple quantiles are given
column3394: bug in .to_json where lines=true and contents contain escaped characters
column3395: bug in extension dtype creation where the created types were not is/identical
column3396: the sparsearray.values attribute is deprecated. you can use np.asarray or the sparsearray.to_dense method instead .
column3397: bug in pd.pivot_table where margins_name is ignored when aggfunc is a list
column3398: dataframe.plot will scatter plot x versus y by passing kind='scatter'
column3401: pandas.io.formats.style.styler now has method hide_index to determine whether the index will be rendered in output
column3402: bug in dataframe.duplicated with a large number of columns causing a maximum recursion depth exceeded .
column3403: fixed regression in dataframe.sum when min_count greater than the dataframe shape was passed resulted in a valueerror
column3404: bug in timedelta and pandas.to_timedelta that ignored the unit argument for string input
column3405: bug in interactions with qt when a qtapplication already exists
column3406: bug in indexing with partial string indexing with a len-1 dataframe
column3407: passing multiple levels to stack will now work when multiple level numbers are passed . see reshaping by stacking and unstacking.
column3408: value_range added as utility function to get min and max of a dataframe
column3409: keyerror now raises instead of valueerror in drop, drop, drop, drop when dropping a non-existent element in an axis with duplicates
column3410: timedeltaindex.astype and datetimeindex.astype will now return int64index instead of np.array
column3411: bug in datetimearray.date where a valueerror would be raised with a read-only backing array
column3412: starting with pandas 1.0.0, pandas will adopt a variant of semver to version releases. briefly,
column3413: lag parameter was added to the autocorrelation method of series, defaults to lag-1 autocorrelation
column3414: the previous or future behavior can be obtained, without any warnings, by specifying the dtype
column3415: bug in read_sas in which an incorrect error was raised on an invalid file format.
column3416: bug in series.rpow with object dtype nan for 1 ** na instead of 1 .
column3417: bug in compat with np.compress, surfaced in
column3418: added the ndframe.equals method to compare if two ndframes are equal have equal axes, dtypes, and values. added the array_equivalent function to compare if two ndarrays are equal. nans in identical locations are treated as equal. see also the docs for a motivating example.
column3419: added support for maskedarray data in dataframe, masked values converted to nan
column3420: index now supports the .where function for same shape indexing
column3421: add level keyword to drop for dropping values from a level
column3422: in previous versions most types could be compared to string column in a hdfstore usually resulting in an invalid comparison, returning an empty result frame. these comparisons will now raise a typeerror
column3423: improved performance of period constructor, additionally benefitting periodarray and periodindex creation
column3424: bug where calling series.replace on categorical data could return a series with incorrect dimensions
column3425: fixed regression where slicing datetimeindex raised assertionerror on irregular time series with pd.nat or on unsorted indices
column3427: read_excel will correctly show the deprecation warning for previously deprecated sheetname
column3428: bug in dataframe.merge in which merging using index objects as vectors raised an exception
column3429: bug in series.interpolate when using method=`index` with an unsorted index, would previously return incorrect results.
column3430: dataframe.hist and series.hist no longer allows figsize="default", specify figure size by passinig a tuple instead
column3431: the leading white spaces have been removed from the output of .to_string method
column3432: the following are now part of this api:
column3433: the following are now part of this api:
column3435: bug in groupby.nunique with a datetimelike-grouper where bins counts were incorrect
column3436: bug in describe dropping column names for hierarchical indexes
column3437: bug in timestamp returning utc based time/date attributes when a timezone was provided
column3438: testing statements updated to use specialized asserts
column3439: bug in unstack if called with a list of column as an argument, regardless of the dtypes of all columns, they get coerced to object
column3440: added support for writing datetime64 columns with to_sql for all database flavors .
column3441: bug in categoricalindex.get_indexer returning the wrong result when target was an unordered categorical that had the same categories as self but in a different order
column3442: bug in masking datetime-like arrays with a boolean mask of an incorrect length not raising an indexerror
column3443: add notimplementederror for simultaneous use of chunksize and nrows for read_csv .
column3444: allow dataframe.merge to handle combinatorial sizes too large for 64-bit integer
column3445: storing interval and period data in series and dataframe
column3446: some minimum supported versions of dependencies were updated . if installed, we now require:
column3447: some minimum supported versions of dependencies were updated . if installed, we now require:
column3448: some minimum supported versions of dependencies were updated . if installed, we now require:
column3449: in read_excel, the comment argument is now exposed as a named parameter
column3450: allow to pass multiple axes to dataframe.plot, hist and boxplot
column3451: bug in index.copy where name parameter was ignored
column3452: pie plots from series.plot and dataframe.plot with kind='pie' , see the docs.
column3453: datetimeindex.offset is deprecated. use datetimeindex.freq instead
column3454: deprecation of panel4d and panelnd. we recommend to represent these types of n-dimensional data with the xarray package.
column3455: bug in index with datetime64 dtype that did not localize integer data correctly
column3456: bug in merge when merging by index name would sometimes result in an incorrectly numbered index
column3457: fixed regression in setitem with a series getting aligned before setting the values
column3458: strings passed into dataframe.groupby that refer to both column and index levels will raise a valueerror
column3459: bug in read_csv that caused it to raise overflowerror when trying to use inf as na_value with integer index column
column3460: fixed a bug in dataframe/panel cache insertion and subsequent indexing
column3461: the outer method on numpy ufuncs, e.g. np.subtract.outer has been deprecated on series objects. convert the input to an array with series.array first
column3462: deprecated parameter dtype of method copy for all index subclasses. use the astype method instead for changing dtype
column3463: bug in series.str.contains for series containing only nan values of object dtype
column3464: bug in periodindex and period subtraction raises attributeerror
column3465: bug in expanding_cov, expanding_corr, rolling_cov, and rolling_corr for two arguments with mismatched index
column3466: fixed bug where get_data_famafrench wasn t using the correct file edges
column3467: fixed bug with pd.concat losing dtype information if all inputs are empty
column3468: improved the import time of pandas by about 2.25x.
column3469: bug preventing hash table creation with very large number of rows
column3470: prior to v0.17.0, timestamp and to_datetime may parse year-only datetime-string incorrectly using today s date, otherwise datetimeindex uses the beginning of the year. timestamp and to_datetime may raise valueerror in some types of datetime-string which datetimeindex can parse, such as a quarterly string.
column3472: these are api changes which make panel more consistent with dataframe
column3473: bug in dataframe.groupby dropped nan groups from result with dropna=false when grouping over a single column
column3474: disabled construction of a series where len > len = 1, which previously would broadcast the data item, and now raises a valueerror
column3475: as of v0.19.0, sparse data keeps the input dtype, and uses more appropriate fill_value defaults .
column3476: pandas.io.json.json_normalize gained the option errors='ignore'|'raise'; the default is errors='raise' which is backward compatible.
column3477: bug in dataframe.to_csv when the table had multiindex columns, and a list of strings was passed in for header
column3478: parsing datetime strings with the same utc offset will preserve the utc offset in the tz
column3479: bug in series.take with categorical data interpreting -1 in indices as missing value markers, rather than the last element of the series
column3480: note: set_printoptions/ reset_printoptions are now deprecated , the print options now live under display.xyz . for example:
column3481: >>> x + y # warning generated: should do x | y instead
column3482: # note that pandas.rpy was deprecated in v0.16.0
column3483: added axvlines boolean option to parallel_coordinates plot function, determines whether vertical lines will be printed, default is true
column3484: bug when indexing with .loc where the index was a categoricalindex with non-string categories didn t work
column3485: the dataframe constructor will now respect key ordering if a list of ordereddict objects are passed in
column3486: the sorting api has been revamped to remove some long-time inconsistencies, see here
column3487: bug in selection with missing values via .ix from a duplicate indexed dataframe failing
column3488: improved performance of series.map for dictionary mappers on categorical series by mapping the categories instead of mapping all values
column3489: bug in pandas.core.groupby.groupby.idxmax and pandas.core.groupby.groupby.idxmin with datetime column would return incorrect dtype
column3490: pandas.core.groupby.groupby.rank now raises a valueerror when an invalid value is passed for argument na_option
column3491: fixed an issue related to ticklocs/ticklabels with log scale bar plots across different versions of matplotlib
column3492: the display.precision option has been clarified to refer to decimal places .
column3493: # rows are now ordered as the requested keys
column3494: fixed regression in dataframe.apply where functions that altered the input in-place only operated on a single row
column3495: the internal index method _shallow_copy now copies cached attributes over to the new index, avoiding creating these again on the new index. this can speed up many operations that depend on creating copies of existing indexes
column3496: dataframe.values will now return float64 with a dataframe of mixed int64 and uint64 dtypes, conforming to np.find_common_type
column3497: bug in read_csv was causing a segfault when there were blank lines between the header and data rows
column3498: when used on a datetimeindex, timedeltaindex or periodindex, tolerance will coerced into a timedelta if possible. this allows you to specify tolerance with a string:
column3499: accept textfilereader in concat, which was affecting a common user idiom
column3500: fixed bug where dataframe.describe and series.describe on tz-aware datetimes did not show first and last result
column3501: fix construction of a dataframe with a duplicate index
column3502: ordered category: values are sorted by appearance order, categories keep existing order.
column3503: add tshift method for leading/lagging using the frequency of the index, as opposed to a naive lead/lag using shift
column3504: bug in categorical.equals returning the wrong result when comparing two unordered categorical arrays with the same categories, but in a different order
column3505: frozenlist has gained the .union and .difference methods. this functionality greatly simplifies groupby s that rely on explicitly excluding certain columns. see splitting an object into groups for more information .
column3506: fixed panel attribute naming conflict if item is named a
column3507: we are adding a standard module that exposes the public testing functions in pandas.testing . those functions can be used when writing tests for functionality using pandas objects.
column3508: dataframe.to_pickle and read_pickle now accept url
column3509: nat may represent either a datetime64 null or a timedelta64 null. given the ambiguity, it is treated as a timedelta64, which allows more operations to succeed.
column3510: small performance decrease to rolling.min and rolling.max for fixed windows
column3511: fixed regression in dataframegroupby.agg where a valueerror: buffer source array is read-only would be raised when the underlying array is read-only
column3512: dataframe.between_time and dataframe.at_time have gained the axis parameter
column3513: removed support for legacy hdf5 formats
column3514: dataframe.to_string now accepts decimal as an argument, allowing the user to specify which decimal separator should be used in the output.
column3515: bug in transform where applying a function to a timezone aware column would return a timezone naive result
column3516: bug in read_hdf in which reading a series saved to an hdf file in fixed format fails when an explicit mode='r' argument is supplied
column3517: bug in series.to_sparse with series already holding sparse data not constructing properly
column3518: bug in to_numeric raising a typeerror when attempting to convert a string dtype series containing only numeric strings and na
column3519: bug in index.drop when passing a list of both tuples and non-tuples
column3520: bug in crosstab where arguments with non-overlapping indexes would return a keyerror

column3523: some formerly public python/c/c++/cython extension modules have been moved and/or renamed. these are all removed from the public api. furthermore, the pandas.core, pandas.compat, and pandas.util top-level modules are now considered to be private. if indicated, a deprecation warning will be issued if you reference these modules.

column3527: bug where adding timestamp to a np.timedelta64 object would raise instead of returning a timestamp

column3535: bug where categorical comparison operator __ne__ would incorrectly evaluate to false when either element was missing
column3536: as a result of a change in yahoo s option page layout, when an expiry date is given, options methods now return data for a single expiry date. previously, methods returned all data for the selected month.

column3544: reindexing operations, will return a resulting index based on the type of the passed indexer, meaning that passing a list will return a plain-old-index; indexing with a categorical will return a categoricalindex, indexed according to the categories of the passed categorical dtype. this allows one to arbitrarily index these even with values not in the categories, similarly to how you can reindex any pandas index.

column3571: fixed issue in the xlsxwriter engine where it added a default general format to cells if no other format was applied. this prevented other row or column formatting being applied.

column3573: bug in rolling.apply where center=true was ignored when engine='numba' was specified

column3576: dataframe.to_html and dataframe.to_string s col_space parameter now accepts a list or dict to change only some specific columns width .

column3578: the default return type of boxplot will change from a dict to a matplotlib axes in a future release. you can use the future behavior now by passing return_type='axes' to boxplot.

column3583: the signature of series.to_csv has been uniformed to that of dataframe.to_csv: the name of the first argument is now path_or_buf, the order of subsequent arguments has changed, the header argument now defaults to true.

column3586: using these methods / indexers, you can chain data selection operations without using temporary variable.

column3589: additionally, the repr for dataframe and series can now publish this json table schema representation of the series or dataframe if you are using ipython . this gives frontends like the jupyter notebook and nteract more flexibility in how they display pandas objects, since they have more information about the data. you must enable this by setting the display.html.table_schema option to true.
column3590: added a keyword argument, cache, to to_datetime that improved the performance of converting duplicate datetime arguments

column3594: now using lxml to scrape html instead of beautifulsoup .

column3596: dataframe.cov and series.cov now support a new parameter ddof to support delta degrees of freedom as in the corresponding numpy methods .
column3597: if the function provided to groupby.apply returns a named series, the name of the series will be kept as the name of the column index of the dataframe returned by groupby.apply . this facilitates dataframe.stack operations where the name of the column index is used as the name of the inserted column containing the pivoted data.
column3598: the styler class has gained a pipe method. this provides a convenient way to apply users predefined styling functions, and can help reduce boilerplate when using dataframe styling functionality repeatedly within a notebook.
column3599: bug on inserting a boolean label into a dataframe with a numeric index columns incorrectly casting to integer

column3615: bug in timestamp constructor where passing an invalid timezone offset designator would not raise a valueerror

column3718: fixed valueerror raised by cummin/cummax when datetime64 series contains nat.
column3719: world bank data requests now will warn/raise based on an errors argument, as well as a list of hard-coded country codes and the world bank s json response. in prior versions, the error messages didn t look at the world bank s json response. problem-inducing input were simply dropped prior to the request. the issue was that many good countries were cropped in the hard-coded approach. all countries will work now, but some bad countries will raise exceptions because some edge cases break the entire response.

column3725: remove table keyword in hdfstore.put/append, in favor of using format=

column3728: better support for compressed urls in read_csv

column3812: fixed regression in to_timedelta with box=false incorrectly returning a datetime64 object instead of a timedelta64 object
column3813: bugs in to_excel with duplicate columns
column3814: bug in subplot with layout kw may show unnecessary warning
column3815: dataframe.to_json, dataframe.to_csv, dataframe.to_pickle, and other export methods now support tilde in path argument.
column3816: fixed bug with reading csv files from amazon s3 on python 3 raising a typeerror
column3817: added methods integerarray.prod, integerarray.min, and integerarray.max
column3818: bug in series.get for series using extensionarray and integer index
column3819: bug in dataframe.replace with a datetime64 and a non-compat to_replace
column3820: bug in dataframe.groupby.describe when grouping on index containing tuples
column3821: fix regression in assigning values to a single column of a dataframe with a multiindex columns .
column3822: bug in merge_asof when specifying multiple by columns where one is datetime64 dtype
column3823: bug causing elements with a null group to spill into the final group when grouping by a categorical
column3824: the pd.options.display.line_width configuration has been dropped
column3825: bug when initializing categorical series with a scalar value.
column3826: new dataframe default display for df.info to include memory usage, see memory usage
column3827: removed the hard-coded size limits on the dataframe html representation in the ipython notebook, and leave this to ipython itself . this eliminates the duplicate scroll bars that appeared in the notebook with large frames .
column3828: fixed an issue where duplicate indexes were raising when plotting
column3829: break reference cycle involving index and other index classes to allow garbage collection of index objects without running the gc.
column3830: the in operator now only returns true for exact matches to intervals in the intervalindex, whereas this would previously return true for any interval overlapping an interval in the intervalindex.
column3831: converting a series of timedelta objects to days, seconds, etc sped up through vectorization of underlying methods
column3832: bug in series.isin and dataframe.isin when using nan and a row length above 1,000,000
column3833: read_hdf now raises ioerror when a file that doesn t exist is passed in. previously, a new, empty file was created, and a keyerror raised .
column3834: pandas.core.groupby.rollinggroupby.agg and pandas.core.groupby.expandinggroupby.agg now support multiple aggregation functions as parameters
column3835: bug in dataframe.unstack where a valueerror was raised when unstacking timezone aware values
column3836: applying a binary ufunc like numpy.power now aligns the inputs when both are series .
column3837: we recommend explicitly using the string data type when working with strings. see text data types for more.
column3838: bug in dataframe.groupby where any, all, nunique and transform functions would incorrectly handle duplicate column labels
column3839: expand=false: it returns a series, index, or dataframe, depending on the subject and regular expression pattern .
column3840: bug in merge_ordered didn t raise when elements in left_by or right_by not exist in left columns or right columns
column3841: dataframe.to_html and dataframe.to_latex now accept a path for their first argument
column3842: bug in .read_csv where strings like '2e' are treated as valid floats
column3843: index.contains is deprecated. use key in index instead .
column3844: bug in series.replace and dataframe.replace when replacing timezone-aware timestamps using a dict-like replacer
column3845: fixed regression in series.fillna that raised recursionerror with datetime64 dtype
column3846: bug in arrays.sparsearray was returning the incorrect type when indexing a sparse dataframe with an iterable
column3847: fixed issue with sorting a duplicate multiindex that has multiple dtypes
column3853: in summary, extract always returns a dataframe with a row for every subject string, and a column for every capture group.
column3854: bug in timegrouper/resample when presented with a non-monotonic datetimeindex that would return invalid results.
column3855: accessing the values in a series or index
column3856: fixed bug in the parsing of microseconds when using the format argument in to_datetime
column3857: bug in series.str.get with a dictionary in the values and the index not in the keys, raising keyerror
column3858: fix regression in groupby.rolling.apply ignores args and kwargs parameters
column3859: dataframe.quantile and series.quantile now accept interpolation keyword .
column3860: in addition, .round, .floor and .ceil will be available through the .dt accessor of series.
column3861: bug in partial string indexing with a monotonic, but not strictly-monotonic, index incorrectly reversing the slice bounds
column3862: true: draw a table using the dataframe or series called plot method. data will be transposed to meet matplotlib s default layout.
column3863: series.fillna now accepts a series or a dict as a value for a categorical dtype
column3864: # set to not display the null counts
column3865: bug in pd.read_msgpack which did not allow loading of a dataframe with an index of type categoricalindex
column3866: sql code now safely escapes table and column names
column3867: the sparsepanel class has been removed
column3868: added justify argument to dataframe.to_string to allow different alignment of column headers
column3869: bug in series.__setitem__ incorrectly casting np.timedelta64 to np.datetime64 when inserting into a series with datetime64 dtype
column3870: passing a string alias like 'datetime64' as the unit parameter to datetimetzdtype is deprecated. use datetimetzdtype.construct_from_string instead .
column3871: bug in dataframe.plot with a single column and a list-like color
column3872: bug in series.astype, index.astype, and dataframe.astype failing to handle nat when casting to an integer dtype
column3873: specify the column label to use when writing the index with index_label.
column3875: vbench vastly improved performance of groupby on axes with a multiindex
column3876: bug in .rolling that allowed a negative integer window in construction of the rolling object, but would later fail on aggregation
column3878: here s an example of the first deprecation, passing a dict to a grouped series. this is a combination aggregation & renaming:
column3879: fixed regression where pandas.testing.assert_series_equal would raise an error when non-numeric dtypes were passed with check_exact=true
column3880: previous versions of pandas would permanently silence numpy s ufunc error handling when pandas was imported. pandas did this in order to silence the warnings that would arise from using numpy ufuncs on missing data, which are usually represented as nan s. unfortunately, this silenced legitimate warnings arising in non-pandas code in the application. starting with 0.19.0, pandas will use the numpy.errstate context manager to silence these warnings in a more fine-grained manner, only around where these operations are actually used in the pandas code base.
column3881: tests for basic reading of public s3 buckets now exist .
column3882: the keyword position has been added to set the position.
column3883: changes to the .loc slicing api to conform with the behavior of .ix see here

column2: mpd protocol commands consume and single are now supported along with updated semantics for repeat and previous and new fields for status. the bpd server now understands and ignores some additional commands. #3200 #800
column3: fuzzy search plugin: the fuzzy command was removed and replaced with a new query type. to perform fuzzy searches, use the ~ prefix with list or other commands. thanks to philippe mongeau.
column4: when autotagging, and is considered equal to & .
column5: the lyrics plugin, originally by peter brunner, is revamped and included with beets, making it easy to fetch song lyrics.
column6: fixed some bugs with encoding paths on windows. also, : is now replaced with - in path names for readability.
column7: the import logger has been improved for always-on use. first, it is now possible to specify a log file in .beetsconfig. also, logs are now appended rather than overwritten and contain timestamps.
column8: the release label for albums and tracks is now fetched from !musicbrainz, written to files, and stored in the database.
column9: the modify command is now better at parsing and formatting fields. you can assign to boolean fields like comp, for example, using either the words true or false or the numerals 1 and 0. any boolean-esque value is normalized to a real boolean. the update and write commands also got smarter at formatting and colorizing changes.
column10: prefer releases that are closest to the tagged year. tolerate files tagged with release or original year.
column11: album art in files with vorbis comments is now marked with the front cover type. thanks to jason lefley.
column12: and there are smaller new features too:
column13: fix a crash when an autotagging with an artist or album containing and or or .
column14: you can now customize the character substituted for path separators in filenames via path_sep_replace. the default is an underscore. use this setting with caution.
column15: alac files are now marked as alac instead of being conflated with aac audio. thanks to simon luijk.
column16: on python 3, the terminal_encoding setting is respected again for output and printing will no longer crash on systems configured with a limited encoding.
column17: beets now communicates with musicbrainz via the new next generation schema service via python-musicbrainzngs. the bindings are included with this version of beets, but a future version will make them an external dependency.
column18: bpd plugin: random and repeat modes are now supported .
column19: plugin architecture. add-on modules can now add new commands to the beets command-line interface. the bpd and dadd commands were removed from the beets core and turned into plugins; bpd is loaded by default. to load the non-default plugins, use the config options plugins and pluginpath . plugins are just python modules under the beetsplug namespace package containing subclasses of beets.plugins.beetsplugin. see the beetsplug directory for examples or plugins for instructions.
column20: this version adds a healthy helping of new features and fixes a critical mpeg-4 related bug. there are more lyrics sources, there new plugins for managing permissions and integrating with plex, and the importer has a new --pretend flag that shows which music would be imported.
column21: your library now keeps track of when music was added to it. the new added field is a timestamp reflecting when each item and album was imported and the new %time{} template function lets you format this timestamp for humans. thanks to lucas duailibe.
column22: duplicates plugin: spurious reports are now avoided for tracks with missing values . thanks to pedro silva.
column23: resizing image files with imagemagick now avoids problems on systems where there is a convert command that is not imagemagick s by using the magick executable when it is available. thanks to ababyduck. #2093 #3236
column24: the default replace sanitation options now remove leading whitespace by default. thanks to brilnius.
column25: also fix using id3v23 in conjunction with the scrub and embedart plugins. thanks to chris cogburn.
column26: this release features two major additions to the autotagger s functionality: album art fetching and musicbrainz id tags. it also contains some important under-the-hood improvements: a new plugin architecture is introduced and the database schema is extended with explicit support for albums.
column27: while this feature is nifty when used directly with the usual command-line suspects, it s especially useful for plugin authors and for future beets features. stay tuned for great things built on this flexible attribute infrastructure.
column28: bucket plugin: you can now customize the definition of alphanumeric ranges using regular expressions. and the heuristic for detecting years has been improved. thanks to sotho.
column29: interactive prompts are sent to stdout instead of stderr.
column30: beets 1.0b13 consists of a plethora of small but important fixes and refinements. a lyrics plugin is now included with beets; new audio properties are catalogged; the list command has been made more powerful; the autotagger is more tolerant of different tagging styles; and importing with original file deletion now cleans up after itself more thoroughly. many, many bugs including several crashers were fixed. this release lays the foundation for more features to come in the next couple of releases.
column31: the id3 apic tag now uses the latin-1 encoding when possible instead of a unicode encoding. this should increase compatibility with other software, especially with itunes and when using id3v2.3. thanks to lazka. #899 #2264 #2270
column32: the directory hierarchy can now be customized based on release type. in particular, the path_format setting in .beetsconfig has been replaced with a new section, which allows you to specify different path formats for normal and compilation releases as well as for each album type . the default path formats have been changed to use $albumartist instead of $artist.
column33: the importer now detects multi-disc albums and tags them together. using a heuristic based on the names of directories, certain structures are classified as multi-disc albums: for example, if a directory contains subdirectories labeled disc 1 and disc 2 , these subdirectories will be coalesced into a single album for tagging.
column34: the importer can now move files. previously, beets could only copy files and delete the originals, which is inefficient if the source and destination are on the same filesystem. use the import_move configuration option and see configuration for more details. thanks to domen ko ar.
column35: renamed plugins: the rdm plugin has been renamed to random and fuzzy_search has been renamed to fuzzy.
column36: local album art is now automatically discovered and copied from the imported directories when available.
column37: the new chromaprint/acoustid plugin uses the acoustid open-source acoustic fingerprinting service. this replaces the old lastid plugin, which used last.fm fingerprinting and is now deprecated. fingerprinting with this library should be faster and more reliable.
column38: web plugin: item and album counts are now exposed through the api for use with the tomahawk resolver. thanks to uwe l. korn.
column39: fix a crash when numeric metadata fields contain just a minus or plus sign with no following numbers. thanks to eigengrau. #2741
column40: bad files plugin: added a --verbose or -v option. results are now displayed only for corrupted files by default and for all the files when the verbose option is set. #1654 #2434
column41: reorganized import config options: the various import_* options are now organized under an import: heading and their prefixes have been removed.
column42: filenames are normalized with unicode normal form d on mac os x and nfc on all other platforms.
column43: this release adds two new standard plugins to beets: one for synchronizing last.fm listening data and one for integrating with linux desktops. and at long last, imports can now create symbolic links to music files instead of copying or moving them. we also gained the ability to search for album art on the itunes store and a new way to compute replaygain levels.
column44: this is a short-term release that adds some great new stuff to beets. there s support for tracking and calculating musical keys, the replaygain plugin was expanded to work with more music formats via gstreamer, we can now import directly from compressed archives, and the lyrics plugin is more robust.
column45: as part of the above, plugins can now extend the query syntax and new kinds of matching capabilities to beets. see extend the query syntax. thanks again to philippe mongeau.
column46: the deprecated list_format_album and list_format_item configuration options have been removed .
column47: sort missing and unmatched tracks by index and title and group them together for better readability.
column48: the modify command can now accept query arguments that contain = signs. an argument is considered a query part when a : appears before any =s. thanks to mook.
column49: echonest_tempo: if the echo nest api limit is exceeded or a communication error occurs, the plugin now waits and tries again instead of crashing. thanks to zach denton.
column50: pathlib is now an optional test dependency on python 3.4+, removing the need for a debian patch. #3275
column51: beets should now be better at guessing the appropriate output encoding on windows. a bug was also fixed where beets would ignore the locale settings and use utf-8 by default. #1419
column52: with this release candidate, beets 1.0 is feature-complete. we ll be fixing bugs on the road to 1.0 but no new features will be added. concurrently, work begins today on features for version 1.1.
column53: when importing with the delete option and importing files that are already at their destination, files could be deleted . this is fixed.
column54: a new from_scratch configuration option makes the importer remove old metadata before applying new metadata. this new feature complements the zero and scrub plugins but is slightly different: beets clears out all the old tags it knows about and only keeps the new data it gets from the remote metadata source. thanks to tummychow. #934 #2755
column55: fix a crash when importing with both of the group_albums and incremental options enabled. thanks to geigerzaehler.
column56: resuming is automatically disabled when the importer is in quiet mode. progress is still saved, however, and the -p flag can be used to force resuming.
column57: the replaygain plugin, written by peter brunner, has been merged into the core beets distribution. use it to analyze audio and adjust playback levels in replaygain-aware music players.
column58: languages controls the preferred languages when selecting an alias from musicbrainz. this feature requires python-musicbrainzngs 0.3 or later. thanks to sam doshi.
column59: avoid some error cases in the update command and the embedart and mbsync plugins. invalid or missing files now cause error logs instead of crashing beets. thanks to lucas duailibe.
column60: artist sort names are now fetched from musicbrainz. there are two new data fields, artist_sort and albumartist_sort, that contain sortable artist names like beatles, the . these fields are also used to sort albums and items when using the list command. thanks to paul provost.
column61: a new import_resume configuration option can be used to disable the importer s resuming feature or force it to resume without asking. this option may be either yes, no, or ask, with the obvious meanings. the -p and -p command-line flags override this setting and correspond to the yes and no settings.
column62: possibly allow flexible attributes to be used with the %aunique template function. #1775
column63: fix several uses of deprecated standard-library features on python 3.7. thanks to arcresu. #3197
column64: lyrics plugin: the genius backend is now more robust to communication errors. the backend has also been disabled by default, since the api it depends on is currently down. #1770
column65: the default filename character substitutions were changed to be more conservative. the windows reserved characters are substituted by default even on unix platforms . to customize your character substitutions, see the replace config option.
column66: when previewing changes during import, differences in track duration are now shown as 2:50 vs. 3:10 rather than separated with -> like track numbers. this should clarify that beets isn t doing anything to modify lengths.
column67: the modify command now skips confirmation and prints a message if no changes are necessary. thanks to brilnius.
column68: duplicates plugin: the move and copy destination arguments are now treated as directories. thanks to pedro silva.
column69: the top 3 distance penalties are now displayed on the release listing, and all album and track penalties are now displayed on the track changes list. this should make it clear exactly which metadata is contributing to a low similarity score.
column70: play plugin: when relative_to is set, the plugin correctly emits relative paths even when querying for albums rather than tracks. thanks to j000. #2702
column71: the centerpiece of this beets release is the graceful handling of similarly-named albums. it s now possible to import two albums with the same artist and title and to keep them from conflicting in the filesystem. many other awesome new features were contributed by the beets community, including regular expression queries, artist sort names, moving files on import. there are three new plugins: random song/album selection; musicbrainz collection integration; and a plugin for interoperability with other music library systems.
column72: fix errors on windows for certain unicode characters that can t be represented in the mbcs encoding. this required a change to the way that paths are represented in the database on windows; if you find that beets paths are out of sync with your filesystem with this release, delete and recreate your database with beet import -awc /path/to/music.
column73: the importer now ignores certain clutter files like .appledouble directories and ._* files. the list of ignored patterns is configurable via the ignore setting; see configuration.
column74: new plugin: convert plugin transcodes music and embeds album art while copying to a separate directory. thanks to jakob schnitzer and andrew g. dunn.
column75: when a match isn t great but is either better than all the others or the only match, it is given a low recommendation.
column76: accents and other unicode decorators on characters are now treated more fairly by the autotagger. for example, if you re missing the acute accent on the e in caf , that change won t be penalized. this introduces a new dependency on the unidecode python module.
column77: fix a crash when unicode queries were used with import -l re-imports.
column78: this is mainly a bugfix release, but we also have a nifty new plugin for ipfs and a bunch of new configuration options.
column79: there is no prompt default when matches are bad: low or none recommendations or when choosing a candidate other than the first.
column80: use a nicer error message when input is requested but stdin is closed.
column81: this version of beets focuses on increasing the accuracy of the autotagger. the main addition is an included plugin that uses acoustic fingerprinting to match based on the audio content . additional heuristics were also added to the metadata-based tagger as well that should make it more reliable. this release also greatly expands the capabilities of beets plugin api. a host of other little features and fixes are also rolled into this release.
column82: this release boasts a host of new little features, many of them contributed by beets amazing and prolific community. it adds support for opus files, transcoding to any format, and two new plugins: one that guesses metadata for blank files based on their filenames and one that moves featured artists into the title field.
column83: a new field, composer_sort, is now supported and fetched from musicbrainz. thanks to dosoe. #2519 #2529
column84: the new echonest plugin plugin can fetch a wide range of acoustic attributes from the echo nest, including the speechiness and liveness of each track. the new plugin supersedes an older version that only fetched the bpm field. thanks to pedro silva and peter schnebel.
column85: the default output format for the beet list command is now configurable via the format_item and format_album config options. thanks to fabrice laporte.
column86: albums are now tagged with their original release date rather than the date of any reissue, remaster, special edition , or the like.
column87: as a consequence of adding album art, the database was significantly refactored to keep track of some information at an album granularity. databases created with earlier versions of beets should work fine, but they won t have any albums in them they ll just be a bag of items. this means that commands like beet ls -a and beet rm -a won t match anything. to upgrade your database, you can use the included albumify plugin. running beets albumify with the plugin activated will group all your items into albums, making beets behave more or less as it did before.
column88: filename substitutions are now configurable via the replace config value. you can choose which characters you think should be allowed in your directory and music file names. see configuration.
column89: smart playlist plugin: playlists can now be generated from multiple queries . album-level queries are also now possible and automatic playlist regeneration can now be disabled. thanks to brilnius.
column90: the output of the update, remove, and modify commands now respects the format_album and format_item config options. thanks to mike kazantsev.
column91: the new lastgenre plugin automatically assigns genres to imported albums and items based on last.fm tags and an internal whitelist.
column92: in the replace configuration option, we now replace a leading hyphen with an underscore. #549 #2509
column93: the preferred collection of settings specifies a sorted list of preferred countries and media types, or prioritizes releases closest to the original year for an album.
column94: there are now multiple levels of output verbosity. on the command line, you can make beets somewhat verbose with -v or very verbose with -vv. for the importer especially, this makes the first verbose mode much more manageable, while still preserving an option for overwhelmingly verbose debug output. #1244
column95: discogs plugin: subtracks are now detected and combined into a single track, two-sided mediums are treated as single discs, and tracks have media, medium_total and medium set correctly. #2222 #2228.
column96: embedart plugin: in auto mode , the plugin now respects the write config option under import. if this is disabled, album art is no longer embedded on import in order to leave files untouched in effect, auto is implicitly disabled. #1427
column97: importing without autotagging is now faster and doesn t print out a bunch of whitespace. it also lets you specify single files on the command line .
column98: after fifteen betas and two release candidates, beets has finally hit one-point-oh. congratulations to everybody involved. this version of beets will remain stable and receive only bug fixes from here on out. new development is ongoing in the betas of version 1.1.
column99: date tags that use slashes instead of dashes as separators are now interpreted correctly. and wma files now map the comments field to the description tag . thanks to matthias kiefer. #1043
column100: when there s a parse error in a query , beets now stops with an error instead of silently ignoring the query component.
column101: when an exception is raised while reading a file, the path of the file in question is now logged .
column102: this release has one major backwards-incompatibility. because of the new way beets handles albums in the library, databases created with an old version of beets might have trouble with operations that deal with albums . to upgrade an old database, you can use the included albumify plugin .
column103: smart playlist plugin: queries are now split using shell-like syntax instead of just whitespace, so you can now construct terms that contain spaces.
column104: values for the replace option can now be empty .
column105: album-level flexible attributes and plugin-provided attributes can now be used in path formats .
column106: track titles in the importer ui s difference display are now either aligned vertically or broken across two lines for readability. thanks to tai lee.
column107: the modify command now allows removing flexible attributes. for example, beet modify artist:beatles oldies! deletes the oldies attribute from matching items. thanks to brilnius.
column108: queries can now use or logic: if you use a comma to separate parts of a query, items and albums will match either side of the comma. for example, beet ls foo , bar will get all the items matching foo or matching bar. see combining keywords. #1423
column109: detail enables a mode where all tracks are listed in the importer ui, as opposed to only changed tracks.
column110: in addition to prefix-based field queries, plugins can now define named queries that are not associated with any specific field. for example, the new playlist plugin supports queries like playlist:name although there is no field named playlist. see extend the query syntax for details.
column111: this release focuses on high-priority fixes and conspicuously missing features. highlights include support for two new audio formats and an option to log untaggable albums during import.
column112: this thrilling new release of beets focuses on making the tagger more usable in a variety of ways. first and foremost, it should now be much faster: the tagger now uses a multithreaded algorithm by default . second, the tagger output now uses a little bit of ansi terminal coloring to make changes stand out. this way, it should be faster to decide what to do with a proposed match: the more red you see, the worse the match is. finally, the tagger can be safely interrupted and restarted later at the same point. just enter b for abort at any prompt to stop the tagging process and save its progress.
column113: the config file and library databases are now given better names and locations on windows. namely, both files now reside in %appdata%; the config file is named beetsconfig.ini and the database is called beetslibrary.blb . for backwards compatibility, beets will check the old locations first.
column114: when the importer finds duplicate albums, you can now merge all the tracks old and new together and try importing them as a single, combined album. thanks to udiboy1209. #112 #2725
column115: lyrics plugin: lyrics should now be found for more songs. searching is now sensitive to featured artists and parenthesized title suffixes. when a song has multiple titles, lyrics from all the named songs are now concatenated. thanks to fabrice laporte and paul phillips.
column116: fixed a crash when imported album art was also marked as clutter where the art would be deleted before it could be moved into place. this led to a image.jpg not found during copy error. now clutter is removed much later in the process, after the import_task_files hook.
column117: this release is far too long in coming, but it s a good one. there is the usual torrent of new features and a ridiculously long line of fixes, but there are also some crucial maintenance changes. we officially support python 3.7 and 3.8, and some performance optimizations can make listing your library more than three times faster than in the previous version.
column118: this release entirely revamps beets configuration system. the configuration file is now a yaml document and is located, along with other support files, in a common directory .
column119: fetchart plugin: when loading art from the filesystem, we now prioritize covers with more keywords in them. this means that cover-front.jpg will now be taken before cover-back.jpg because it contains two keywords rather than one. thanks to fabrice laporte.
column120: restore itunes store album art source, and remove the dependency on python-itunes, which had gone unmaintained and was not python-3-compatible. thanks to ocelma for creating python-itunes in the first place. thanks to nathdwek. #2371 #2551 #2718
column121: this third beta of beets 1.1 brings a hodgepodge of little new features . there are new options for getting metadata in a particular language and seeing more detail during the import process. there s also a new plugin for synchronizing your metadata with musicbrainz. under the hood, plugins can now extend the query syntax.
column122: added a --move or -m option to the importer so that the files can be moved to the library instead of being copied or added in place. #2252 #2429
column123: this release of beets fixes all the bugs, and you can be confident that you will never again find any bugs in beets, ever. it also adds support for plain old aiff files and adds three more plugins, including a nifty one that lets you measure a song s tempo by tapping out the beat on your keyboard. the importer deals more elegantly with duplicates and you can broaden your cover art search to the entire web with google image search.
column124: the %asciify{} path formatting function and the asciify_paths setting properly substitute path separators generated by converting some unicode characters, such as and , into ascii.
column125: and then query your music based on that field:
column126: the distance number, which quantifies how different an album s current and proposed metadata are, is now displayed as similarity instead. this should be less noisy and confusing; you ll now see 99.5% instead of 0.00489323.
column127: a new plugin event, item_moved, is sent when files are moved on disk. thanks to dsedivec.
column128: list_format_album and list_format_album have respectively been renamed format_album and format_item. the old names still work but each triggers a warning message. #1271
column129: play plugin: fix $args getting passed verbatim to the play command if it was set in the configuration but -a or --args was omitted.
column130: fix a race in the importer that could cause files to be deleted before they were imported. this happened when importing one album, importing a duplicate album, and then asking for the first album to be replaced with the second. the situation could only arise when importing music from the library directory and when the two albums are imported close in time.
column131: beta 7 s focus is on better support for various artists releases. these albums can be treated differently via the new config section and the autotagger is better at handling them. it also includes a number of oft-requested improvements to the beet command-line tool, including several new configuration options and the ability to clean up empty directory subtrees.
column132: the importer can also now tag incomplete albums when you re missing a few tracks from a given release. two other new plugins are also included with this release: one for assigning genres and another for replaygain analysis.
column133: fix an assertion failure while importing with moving enabled when the file was already at its destination.
column134: version 1.4 has alpha-level python 3 support. thanks to the heroic efforts of jrobeson, beets should run both under python 2.7, as before, and now under python 3.4 and above. the support is still new: it undoubtedly contains bugs, so it may replace all your music with limp bizkit but if you re brave and you have backups, please try installing on python 3. let us know how it goes.
column135: fixed fields in album and item objects are now more strict about translating missing values into type-specific null-like values. this should help in cases where a string field is unexpectedly none sometimes instead of just showing up as an empty string. #2605
column136: parallel tagger. the autotagger has been reimplemented to use multiple threads. this means that it can concurrently read files from disk, talk to the user, communicate with musicbrainz, and write data back to disk. not only does this make the tagger much faster because independent work may be performed in parallel, but it makes the tagging process much more pleasant for large imports. the user can let albums queue up in the background while making a decision rather than waiting for beets between each question it asks. the parallel tagger is on by default but a sequential version is still available by setting the threaded config value to no .
column137: importfeeds plugin: an option was added to use absolute, rather than relative, paths. thanks to lucas duailibe.
column138: the importer now supports matching of pregap or htoa tracks when they are listed in musicbrainz. thanks to ruippeixotog. #1104 #1493
column139: prompts in the importer interface are now colorized for easy reading. the default option is always highlighted.
column140: fetchart plugin: complain when the enforce_ratio or min_width options are enabled but no local imaging backend is available to carry them out. #1460
column141: filename extensions are now always lower-cased when copying and moving files.
column142: null values in the database can now be matched with the empty-string regular expression, ^$.
column143: when writing id3 tags for replaygain normalization, tags are written with both upper-case and lower-case txxx frame descriptions. previous versions of beets used only the upper-case style, which seems to be more standard, but some players seem to only use lower-case names.
column144: support for musicbrainz id tags. the autotagger now keeps track of the musicbrainz track, album, and artist ids it matched for each file. it also looks for album ids in new files it s importing and uses those to look up data in musicbrainz. furthermore, track ids are used as a component of the tagger s distance metric now. tangentially, this change required the database code to support a lightweight form of migrations so that new columns could be added to old databases this is a delicate feature, so it would be very wise to make a backup of your database before upgrading to this version.
column145: a new import_task_created event lets you manipulate import tasks immediately after they are initialized. it s also possible to replace the originally created tasks by returning new ones using this event.
column146: replaygain tags on mpeg-4/aac files are now supported. and, even more astonishingly, replaygain values in mp3 and aac files are now compatible with itunes sound check. thanks to dave hayes.
column147: album art fetching and plugin events are each now run in separate pipeline stages during imports. this should bring additional performance when using album art plugins like embedart or beets-lyrics.
column148: when choosing the as-is import album , every album either has an album artist set or is marked as a compilation . the choice is made based on the homogeneity of the tracks artists. this prevents compilations that are imported as-is from being scattered across many directories after they are imported.
column149: importing with import_delete enabled now cleans up empty directories that contained deleting imported music files.
column150: track changes are highlighted in yellow when they indicate a change in format to or from the style of per_disc_numbering.
column151: duplicates plugin: duplicate resolution now uses an ordering to prioritize duplicates. by default, it prefers music with more complete metadata, but you can configure it to use any list of attributes.
column152: resuming imports and beginning incremental imports should now be much faster when there is a lot of previously-imported music to skip.
column153: this release of beets brings two significant new features. first, beets now has first-class support for singleton tracks. previously, it was only really meant to manage whole albums, but many of us have lots of non-album tracks to keep track of alongside our collections of albums. so now beets makes it easy to tag, catalog, and manipulate your individual tracks. second, beets can now embed album art directly into file metadata rather than only storing it in a file on the side. check out the embedart plugin for that functionality.
column154: missing plugin: missing is now treated as an integer, allowing the use of ranges in queries.
column155: this update brings new plugins for fetching acoustic metrics and listening statistics, many more options for the duplicate detection plugin, and flexible options for fetching multiple genres.
column156: the new bucket plugin provides a %bucket{} function for path formatting to generate folder names representing ranges of years or initial letter. thanks to fabrice laporte.
column157: the default ignore settings now ignore all files beginning with a dot.
