column2: new alt.concat function that is similar to alt.hconcat and alt.vconcat, but allows for more general wrapped concatenation
column3: new facet encoding that is similar to the row and column encoding, but allows for wrapped facets
column4: it is the first version of altair to drop python 2 compatibility, and is tested on python 3.5 and newer.
column5: new chart.show method replaces chart.serve, and relies on altair_viewer to allow offline viewing of charts .
column6: update to vega-lite 1.2.1 and add its supported features
column7: alt.chart.facet now accepts a wrapped facet encoding as a first positional argument, rather than a row encoding. the following are examples of old invocations, and the equivalent new invocations:
column8: all inline datasets are now converted to named datasets and stored at the top level of the chart. this behavior can be disabled by setting alt.data_transformers.consolidate_datasets = false
column9: check for missing and misspelled column names upon exporting or rendering, and raise fielderror if any problems are found. this can be disabled by setting chart.validated_columns=false.
column10: new default html renderer, directly compatible with jupyter notebook and jupyterlab without the need for frontend extensions, as well as tools like nbviewer and nbconvert, and related notebook environments such as zeppelin, colab, kaggle kernels, and databricks. to enable the old default renderer, use:
column11: altair now uses black and flake8 for maintaining code quality & consistency.
column12: data context is propagated when encodings are specified as lists
column13: data argument is now properly handled by chart.properties
column14: selector values can be used directly in expressions
column15: new encoding channels are properly parsed
column16: add chart.serve and chart.display methods for more flexibility in displaying charts
column17: following are changes to altair in addition to those that came with vl 3.4:
column18: allow multiple fields to be passed to encodings such as tooltip and detail
column19: avoid selenium import until it is actually needed
column20: compound charts now move data to the top level by default. in particular, this means that the facet method can now be called directly on a layered chart without having to change how data is specified.
column21: top-level chart repr is now truncated to improve readability of error messages
column22: update includes full compatibility with version 3.3 of vega-lite.
column23: add altair.expr machinery to specify transformations and filterings
column24: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column25: align, center, spacing, and columns are no longer valid chart properties, but are moved to the encoding classes to which they refer.
column26: make to_json and to_csv have deterministic filenames, so in json mode a single datasets will lead to a single on-disk serialization
column27: includes many reworked examples in the example gallery.
column28: fix issue with duplicate chart divs in html renderer
column29: only api change is internal: alt.markproperties is now alt.markconfig
column30: raise maxrowsexceeded if the number of rows in the dataset is larger than chart.max_rows to guard against sending large datasets to the browser.
column31: move the vega-lite 1.x api into altair.v1 to make it easier for us to migrate to vega-lite 2.x and continue to support 1.x. no import change are needed as altair.v1 is aliased to altair in this releasealtair.v1 .
column32: support pickle and copy.deepcopy for chart objects
column33: strokedash encoding can now be used to control line styles
column34: change default import in all code and docs to import altair as alt
column35: unsupported mark_* methods removed from layerchart
column36: several of the encoding channels added in 3.0 have had their capitalization corrected to better match the names used in the schema:
column37: tooltips can now be automatically populated using the tooltip mark configuration.
column38: new columns keyword that allows wrapped faceting, repeating, and concatenation.
column39: added support for vega themes via alt.themes.enable
column40: improved user-facing warnings/errors around layering and faceting .
column41: make sure default mark is a point .
column42: minimum python version is now 3.6
column43: add an add_selection method to add selections to charts
column44: set up travis to run conda & pip; and to build documentation
column45: add a scale_factor argument to chart.save to allow the size/resolution of saved figures to be adjusted.
column46: fix incompatibility with pandas version 0.24
column47: better handling of datetimes and timezones
column48: selection predicates now recognize all valid entries
column49: top-level add_selection methods now delegate to sub-charts. previously they produced invalid charts
column50: more streamlined shorthand syntax for window transforms
column51: moved the example notebooks into a separate repository .
column52: added kaggle renderer & more html output options
column53: sort-by-field can now use the field name directly. so instead of:
column54: times and dates in altair
column55: add chart.savechart method, which can output json, html, and png and svg. see link
column56: in each case, the new invocations are compatible back to altair 2.x.
column57: add html renderer which works across frontends
column58: make timeunit specifications more succinct, by parsing them in a manner similar to aggregates
column59: scale and guide resolution
column60: added an alt.renderers.disable_max_rows method for disabling the maximum rows check
column61: fixed serialization of logical operands on selections within transform_filter:
column62: the rangestep argument to scale and chart.configure_scale is deprecated. instead, use chart.properties or chart.configure_view.
column63: update to vega-lite 3.2 and vega 5.3 & support all new features. see link for vega-lite feature lists.
column64: support for jupyterlab/nteract through mime based rendering. enable this by calling enable_mime_rendering before rendering visualizations .
column65: version 4.0.0 is based on vega-lite version 4.0, which you can read about at link
column66: support pandas nullable ints and string types
column67: alt.layerchart now supports mark_* methods. if a layer specifies a mark at the top level, all child charts will inherit it .
column68: added support & ci testing for python 3.7
column69: getting started
column70: this version of altair is based on vega-lite 1.2.1.

column2: concurrent_requests_per_spider setting has been deprecated and replaced by:
column3: the previously bundled scrapy.xlib.pydispatch library was deprecated and replaced by pydispatcher.
column4: replaced default spider manager with one with similar functionality but not depending on twisted plugins
column5: deprecated settings.overrides and settings.defaults attributes are removed .
column6: chunkedtransfermiddleware is deprecated and removed from the default downloader middlewares.
column7: using environment variables prefixed with scrapy_ to override settings is deprecated
column8: scrapy now supports anonymous ftp sessions with customizable user and password via the new ftp_user and ftp_password settings. and if you re using twisted version 17.1.0 or above, ftp is now available with python 3.
column9: the noconnect query string argument of proxy urls is deprecated and should be removed from proxy urls
column10: redirects to urls starting with 3 slashes are now supported
column11: the following deprecated apis have been removed :
column12: the feed_format and feed_uri settings have been deprecated in favor of the new feeds setting
column13: fix deprecated crawlersettings and increase backward compatibility with .defaults attribute
column14: deprecated crawlersettings class is removed .
column15: new features and enhancements
column16: the following deprecated settings have also been removed :
column17: new features and settings
column18: new features and improvements
column19: new features and improvements
column20: new features and improvements
column21: replaced chain with chain.from_iterable
column22: add signal to be sent when request is dropped by the scheduler
column23: the correct encoding is now used for attach names in mailsender
column24: pem file is used by mockserver and required by scrapy bench
column25: when using pypy, pypy 7.2.0 or greater is now required
column26: documented autothrottle extension and added to extensions installed by default. you still need to enable it with autothrottle_enabled
column27: the spiders property has been removed from crawler, use crawlerrunner.spider_loader or instantiate spider_loader_class with your settings instead
column28: use a mutable mapping to proxy deprecated settings.overrides and settings.defaults attribute
column29: removed all code that was deprecated in 1.7.0 and had not already been removed in 2.4.0.
column30: make spiderloader raise importerror again by default for missing dependencies and wrong spider_modules. these exceptions were silenced as warnings since 1.3.0. a new setting is introduced to toggle between warning or exception if needed ; see spider_loader_warn_only for details.
column31: old domain argument has been deprecated and will be removed in 0.9. for spiders, you should always use the spider argument and pass spider references. if you really want to pass a string, use the component argument instead.
column32: zope.interface 5.0.0 and later versions are now supported
column33: use of the undocumented scrapy_pickled_settings_to_override environment variable is deprecated
column34: google cloud storage is supported in filespipeline and imagespipeline.
column35: sending emails is not supported
column36: compatibility with python 3.6, pypy and pypy3 is improved; pypy and pypy3 are now supported officially, by running tests on ci.
column37: drop libxml2 and multi selector s backend support, lxml is required from now on.
column38: process_spider_exception is now also invoked for generators
column39: the following datatypes were deprecated :
column40: telnet console is not supported
column41: additional new features and enhancements
column42: link extractors are also improved. they work similarly to what a regular modern browser would do: leading and trailing whitespace are removed from attributes (think href=" link when building link objects. this whitespace-stripping also happens for action attributes with formrequest.
column43: code rearranged and removed
column44: lxml is now the default selectors backend instead of libxml2
column45: most visible change is that .get and .getall selector methods are now preferred over .extract_first and .extract. we feel that these new methods result in a more concise and readable code. see extract and extract_first for more details.
column46: scrapy may very well work with older versions of these packages but it is not guaranteed .
column47: support for python 3.5.0 and 3.5.1 has been dropped; scrapy now refuses to run with a python version lower than 3.5.2, which introduced typing.type
column48: the processing of ansi escape sequences in enabled in windows 10.0.14393 and later, where it is required for colored output
column49: an empty string is now used for submit buttons without a value
column50: python 3.6 or greater is now required; support for python 3.5 has been dropped
column51: filespipeline.file_path and imagespipeline.file_path no longer choose file extensions that are not registered with iana
column52: the scrapy.utils.python.retry_on_eintr function is now deprecated
column53: there s been a large rearrangement of modules trying to improve the general structure of scrapy. main changes were separating various subpackages into new projects and dissolving both scrapy.contrib and scrapy.contrib_exp into top level packages. backward compatibility was kept among internal relocations, while importing deprecated modules expect warnings indicating their new place.
column54: fixed deprecated uses of the twisted api.
column55: binary mode is required for exporters
column56: using your browser s developer tools for scraping is a new tutorial which replaces old firefox and firebug tutorials .
column57: the scrapy.utils.py36 module is now deprecated in favor of scrapy.utils.asyncgen.
column58: remove concurrency limitation when using download delays and still ensure inter-request delays are enforced
column59: mailsender now accepts single strings as values for to and cc arguments
column60: a new robotstxt_parser setting allows choosing which robots.txt parser to use. it includes built-in support for robotfileparser, protego , reppy, and robotexclusionrulesparser, and allows you to implement support for additional parsers
column61: jsonrequest is now called jsonrequest for consistency with similar classes
column62: spider subclass instances were never meant to work, and they were not working as one would expect: instead of using the passed spider subclass instance, their from_crawler method was called to generate a new instance.
column63: our documentation policies now cover usage of sphinx s versionadded and versionchanged directives, and we have removed usages referencing scrapy 1.4.0 and earlier versions
column64: added partial support for python s coroutine syntax and experimental support for asyncio and asyncio-powered libraries
column65: the fix is backward incompatible, it enables telnet user-password authentication by default with a random generated password. if you can t upgrade right away, please consider setting telnetconsole_port out of its default value.
column66: exceptions from itemloader input and output processors are now more verbose
column67: the serialize attribute has been removed
column68: add test for webclient with post method and no body given
column69: this includes also settings where only part of its value is made of an import path, such as downloader_middlewares or download_handlers.
column70: new selector s api including css selectors ,
column71: make sure you install scrapy 1.7.1. the scrapy 1.7.0 package in pypi is the result of an erroneous commit tagging and does not include all the changes described below.
column72: zstd-compressed responses are now supported if zstandard is installed
column73: this release comes rather soon after 1.2.2 for one main reason: it was found out that releases since 0.18 up to 1.2.2 use some backported code from twisted , even if newer twisted modules are available. scrapy now uses twisted.web.client and twisted.internet.endpoints directly.
column74: assertionerror exceptions triggered by assert statements have been replaced by new exception types, to support running python in optimized mode without changing scrapy s behavior in any unexpected ways.
column75: simplified and improved response encoding support
column76: the scrapy.utils.python.weakkeycache class is now deprecated
column77: last but not least, scrapy now has the option to make json and xml items more human-readable, with newlines between items and even custom indenting offset, using the new feed_export_indent setting.
column78: scrapy.utils.datatypes.caselessdict now accepts mapping instances and not only dicts
column79: make filespipeline and imagespipeline backward compatible again regarding the use of legacy class attributes for customization
column80: test the parse command locally instead of against an external url
column81: from_crawler support is added to feed exporters and feed storages. this, among other things, allows to access scrapy settings from custom feed storages and exporters .
column82: the leveldb storage backend of httpcachemiddleware is deprecated
column83: bear in mind this feature is still under development and its api may change until it reaches a stable status.
column84: lower versions of these optional requirements may work, but it is not guaranteed
column85: request.from_curl and curl_to_request_kwargs now set the request method to post when a request body is specified and no request method is specified
column86: docs are re-written to suggest .get/.getall api instead of .extract/.extract_first. also, selectors docs are updated and re-structured to match latest parsel docs; they now contain more topics, such as selecting element attributes or extensions to css selectors .
column87: response.encoding is now the detected encoding
column88: selectors were extracted to the parsel library . this means you can use scrapy selectors without scrapy and also upgrade the selectors engine without needing to upgrade scrapy.
column89: ftp download handler is not supported
column90: added installation notes about using conda for windows and other oses.
column91: as a consequence, we got rid of scrapy.xlib.tx.* modules, which copied some of twisted code for users stuck with an old twisted version
column92: there is not support for python3 yet
column93: filespipeline and imagespipeline settings are now instance attributes instead of class attributes, enabling spider-specific behaviors .
column94: added support for dynamically adjusting download delay and maximum concurrent requests
column95: instances of downstream_queue_cls should be created using the new scrapypriorityqueue.qfactory or downloaderawarepriorityqueue.pqfactory methods.
column96: removed deprecated core.signals.domain_open signal - use core.signals.domain_opened instead
column97: when a response is larger than download_maxsize, the logged message is now a warning, instead of an error
column98: linkextractor now strips leading and trailing whitespaces from attributes
column99: url and body attributes of request objects are now read-only
column100: scrapy is imported by default when using shell tools .
column101: when uploading files or images to s3 , the default acl policy is now private instead of public warning: backward incompatible!. you can use files_store_s3_acl to change it.
column102: leveldb support has been removed
column103: for amazon s3 storage support in feed exports or media pipelines, botocore 1.4.87 or greater is now required
column104: new feed_export_encoding setting to customize the encoding used when writing items to a file. this can be used to turn off \uxxxx escapes in json output. this is also useful for those wanting something else than utf-8 for xml or csv output .
column105: mention issue with formrequest.from_response due to bug in lxml
column106: spider.make_requests_from_url is deprecated .
column107: added to_bytes and to_unicode, deprecated str_to_unicode and unicode_to_str functions .
column108: dont_filter=true is used for contract requests, which allows to test different callbacks with the same url ;
column109: documentation examples are now checked as part of our test suite and we have fixed some of the issues detected
column110: the following changes affect specifically the scrapypriorityqueue and downloaderawarepriorityqueue classes from scrapy.core.scheduler and may affect subclasses:
column111: for those of you wanting more control on the referer: header that scrapy sends when following links, you can set your own referrer policy. prior to scrapy 1.4, the default referermiddleware would simply and blindly set it to the url of the response that generated the http request . by default, scrapy now behaves much like your regular browser does. and this policy is fully customizable with w3c standard values . see referrer_policy for details.
column112: removed references to unsupported versions of twisted
column113: a new keyword parameter has been added: key. it is a string that is always an empty string for memory queues and indicates the job_dir value for disk queues.
column114: updated test requirements to reflect an incompatibility with pytest 5.4 and 5.4.1
column115: obey request method when scrapy deploy is redirected to a new endpoint
column116: the urllengthmiddleware spider middleware now logs ignored urls with info logging level instead of debug, and it now includes the following entry into stats to keep track of the number of ignored urls:
column117: collections.deque is used to store middlewaremanager methods instead of a list
column118: spider objects now raise an attributeerror exception if they do not have a start_urls attribute nor reimplement start_requests, but have a start_url attribute
column119: robots.txt compliance is now enabled by default for newly-created projects . scrapy will also wait for robots.txt to be downloaded before proceeding with the crawl . if you want to disable this behavior, update robotstxt_obey in settings.py file after creating a new project.
column120: linkextractors and new crawlspider now handle relative base tag urls
column121: deprecations and backward incompatible changes
column122: update other places where w3lib version is mentioned
column123: new persistent scheduler that stores requests on disk, allowing to suspend and resume crawls
column124: media downloads, with filespipeline or imagespipeline, can now optionally handle http redirects using the new media_allow_redirects setting
column125: added support for sphinx 3.0 and later
column126: the new response.follow_all method offers the same functionality as response.follow but supports an iterable of urls as input and returns an iterable of requests
column127: original item_scraped signal was removed
column128: this is needed to allow adding values to existing fields ).
column129: 429 is now part of the retry_http_codes setting by default
column130: replace unencodable codepoints with html entities. fixes #562 and #285
column131: cookies with an empty value are no longer considered invalid cookies
column132: if you are using a custom context factory , its __init__ method must accept two new parameters: tls_verbose_logging and tls_ciphers
column133: requests with private callbacks are now correctly unserialized from disk
column134: verbose logging and new stats counters for dupefilter
column135: optional pretty-printing of json and xml items via feed_export_indent setting
column136: request serialization no longer breaks for callbacks that are spider attributes which are assigned a function with a different name
column137: qfactory was instantiated with a priority value .
column138: new filepipeline and mediapipeline features
column139: new filespipeline with functionality factored out from imagespipeline
column140: to use the images pipeline, pillow 4.0.0 or greater is now required
column141: it is now possible to set the new overwrite feed option to false to append to an existing file instead of overwriting it
column142: add notes about scrapy not working on windows with python 3
column143: ported s3imagesstore to use boto and threads
column144: removed scheduler middleware to simplify architecture. duplicates filter is now done in the scheduler itself, using the same dupe fltering class as before
column145: exporters now work on unicode, instead of bytes by default . if you use pythonitemexporter, you may want to update your code to disable binary mode which is now deprecated.
column146: remove extra import added by cherry picked changes
column147: replace alternative macos install workaround with virtualenv
column148: note in install docs about pip being already included in python>=2.7.9
column149: response.follow now supports a flags parameter, for consistency with request
column150: nested items now fully supported in json and jsonlines exporters
column151: added precise to supported ubuntu distros
column152: overridden settings are now logged in a different format. this is more in line with similar information logged at startup
column153: troubleshooting section is added to install instructions ;
column154: linkextractor now ignores m4v extension by default, this is change in behavior.
column155: removed deprecated scrapy.item.scrapeditem class - use scrapy.item.item instead
column156: please also note that link extractors do not canonicalize urls by default anymore. this was puzzling users every now and then, and it s not what browsers do in fact, so we removed that extra transformation on extracted links.
column157: scrapy.http.cookies.cookiejar.clear accepts domain , path and name optional arguments .
column158: a few fixed typos and clarifications
column159: scrapy logs a warning when it detects a request callback or errback that uses yield but also returns a value, since the returned value would be lost
column160: spider callbacks defined using coroutine syntax no longer need to return an iterable, and may instead return a request object, an item, or none
column161: new features
column162: new features
column163: new features
column164: new features
column165: new features
column166: new features
column167: new features
column168: new features
column169: new features
column170: new features
column171: new features
column172: new features
column173: new features
column174: new features
column175: new features
column176: removed deprecated scrapysettings_module environment variable - use scrapy_settings_module instead
column177: o gzip decompression issue which affected python 3 and pypy is fixed ;
column178: removed code that added support for old versions of twisted that we no longer support
column179: the __init__ method of csvitemexporter now supports an errors parameter to indicate how to handle encoding errors
column180: clarified that one extension instance is created per crawler.
column181: the following changes affect specifically the downloaderawarepriorityqueue class and may affect subclasses:
column182: added flags argument and attribute to request objects
column183: while these are not changes in scrapy itself, but rather in the parsel library which scrapy uses for xpath/css selectors, these changes are worth mentioning here. scrapy now depends on parsel >= 1.5, and scrapy documentation is updated to follow recent parsel api conventions.
column184: added flake8 style checks to our test suite and applied many of the corresponding changes
column185: fix for selected callbacks when using crawlspider with scrapy parse .
column186: feed exporters with pluggable backends
column187: the runspider command now supports files with the .pyw file extension
column188: css selectors are cached in parsel >= 1.5, which makes them faster when the same css path is used many times. this is very common in case of scrapy spiders: callbacks are usually called several times, on different pages.
column189: warnings, exception and logging messages are improved to make debugging easier.
column190: added options -o and -t to the runspider command
column191: this is a maintenance release with important bug fixes, but no new features:
column192: add note about html entities decoding with .re/.re_first .
column193: python 3.5.2+ is required now
column194: the response is handled by the callback of that custom request object, instead of being handled by the callback of the original request object
column195: fix logging of settings overridden by custom_settings; this is technically backward-incompatible because the logger changes from to , so please update your log parsers if needed
column196: improved cookies middleware by making cookies_debug nicer and documenting it
column197: linkextractor now ignores m4v extension by default
column198: .pps links are now ignored by default in link extractors .
column199: the new headers_received signal gives early access to response headers and allows stopping downloads.
column200: minimum versions of optional scrapy requirements that are covered by continuous integration tests have been updated:
column201: updated references to scrapinghub, which is now called zyte.
column202: it is used in push to make up for the removal of its priority parameter.
column203: scrapy.bat is not needed anymore
column204: request.copy and request.replace now also copies their callback and errback attributes
column205: added marshal to formats supported by feed exports
column206: the genspider command no longer overwrites existing files unless the --force option is used
column207: remove deprecated code from feedexporter
column208: tests: remove temp files and folders , fixed projectutilstest on macos , use portable pypy for linux on travis ci
column209: clarified that logging.basicconfig should not be used when also using crawlerprocess
column210: the base implementation of item loaders has been moved into a separate library, itemloaders, allowing usage from outside scrapy and a separate release schedule
column211: make handling of gzipped responses more robust . now scrapy will try and decompress as much as possible from a gzipped response, instead of failing with an ioerror.
column212: github templates for bug reports and feature requests
column213: security bugfix: telnet console extension can be easily exploited by rogue websites posting content to http://localhost:6023, we haven t found a way to exploit it from scrapy, but it is very easy to trick a browser to do so and elevates the risk for local development environment.
column214: a new keep_fragments parameter of scrapy.utils.request.request_fingerprint allows to generate different fingerprints for requests with different fragments in their url
column215: default per-command settings are now specified in the default_settings attribute of command object class
column216: moved persistent queues to a separate project which scrapy now depends on
column217: bugfix cookie merging by hostname and not by netloc
column218: in settings, where the import path of a class is required, it is now possible to pass a class object instead .
column219: a warning is now issued when a value in allowed_domains includes a port
column220: new scrapy command which replaces the old scrapy-ctl.py - there is only one global scrapy command now, instead of one scrapy-ctl.py per project - added scrapy.bat script for running more conveniently from windows
column221: as a result, when an item loader is initialized with an item, itemloader.load_item once again makes later calls to itemloader.get_output_value or itemloader.load_item return empty data.
column222: sitemapspider: added support for sitemap urls ending in .xml and .xml.gz, even if they advertise a wrong content type
column223: include_package_data is required to build wheels from published sources
column224: the next method of scrapy.utils.python.mutablechain is deprecated, use the global next function or mutablechain.__next__ instead
column225: python 3.4 is no longer supported, and some of the minimum requirements of scrapy have also changed:
column226: this 1.1 release brings a lot of interesting features and bug fixes:
column227: improve and correct documentation
column228: fixed an inconsistency between code and output in scrapy at a glance
column229: fixed broken tests and refactored some tests
column230: add omitted self arguments in default project middleware template
column231: you will find a lot of new features and bugfixes in this major release. make sure to check our updated overview to get a glance of some of the changes, along with our brushed tutorial.
column232: stats are now dumped to scrapy log . this is to make scrapy users more aware of scrapy stats and the data that is collected there.
column233: the parameter that used to contain a factory function, qfactory, is now passed as a keyword parameter named downstream_queue_cls.
column234: from_crawler support is added to dupefilters ; this allows to access e.g. settings or a spider from a dupefilter.
column235: added debian packages for ubuntu quantal and raring
column236: by default, logger names now use a long-form path, e.g. , instead of the shorter top-level variant of prior releases ; this is backward incompatible if you have log parsers expecting the short logger name part. you can switch back to short logger names using log_short_names set to true.
column237: old log lines passed item... were renamed to scraped item... lines and downgraded to debug level
column239: there are currently no plans to deprecate .extract and .extract_first methods.
column240: real support for returning iterators on start_requests method. the iterator is now consumed during the crawl when the spider is getting idle
column241: dbm is now the default storage backend for http cache middleware
column242: a common situation where you will face these changes is while running scrapy from scripts. here s a quick example of how to run a spider manually with the new api:
column243: json encoder now supports serialization of set instances .
column244: in addition to absolute and relative urls it supports selectors; for <a> elements it can also extract their href values.
column245: removed a warning about importing stringtransport from twisted.test.proto_helpers in twisted 19.7.0 or newer
column248: temporary data folder for ftp and s3 feed storages can be customized using a new feed_tempdir setting .
column249: improved the documentation about linkextractor.extract_links and simplified link extractors
column250: sgmllinkextractor - fix for parsing <area> tag with unicode present
column252: add note to ubuntu install section about debian compatibility
column253: rule.process_request no longer admits callables which expect a single request parameter, rather than both request and response
column254: when inspecting a callback to check if it is a generator that also returns a value, an exception is no longer raised if the callback has a docstring with lower indentation than the following code.
column255: updated deprecated cgi.parse_qsl to use six s parse_qsl
column256: editor environment variable now takes precedence over editor option defined in settings.py ; scrapy default settings no longer depend on environment variables. this is technically a backward incompatible change.
column257: scheduler disk and memory queues may now use the class methods from_crawler or from_settings
column260: the crawl and runspider commands now support specifying an output format by appending :<format> to the output file
column261: changed default representation of items to pretty-printed dicts. . this improves default logging by making log more readable in the default case, for both scraped and dropped lines.
column262: downloading and processing files and images
column263: when feeds defines multiple uris, log messages about items being stored now contain information from the corresponding feed, instead of always containing information about only one of the feeds
column264: another useful new feature is the introduction of selector.attrib and selectorlist.attrib properties, which make it easier to get attributes of html elements. see selecting element attributes.
column265: the parse command now allows specifying an output file
column268: some parts of the documentation that were confusing or misleading are now clearer
column269: fix start_requests laziness and early hangs
column270: the new scrapy.downloadermiddlewares.retry.get_retry_request function may be used from spider callbacks or middlewares to handle the retrying of a request beyond the scenarios that retrymiddleware supports.
column271: the following changes affect specifically the scrapypriorityqueue class and may affect subclasses:
column272: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column273: dump stacks for all running threads and fix engine status dumped by stacktracedump extension
column274: support for bpython and configure preferred python shell via scrapy_python_shell .
column275: added support for adding variables to telnet console
column276: add a setting to control what class is instantiated as downloader component
column277: add information and example on errbacks
column278: binary_is_text is introduced, to replace use of isbinarytext
column279: added two new methods to item pipeline open_spider, close_spider with deferred support
column280: request_reached_downloader is fired when downloader gets a new request; this signal can be useful e.g. for custom schedulers .
column281: httperrormiddleware now logs errors with info level instead of debug; this is technically backward incompatible so please check your log parsers.
column284: scrapy s new requirements baseline is debian 8 jessie . it was previously ubuntu 12.04 precise. what this means in practice is that we run continuous integration tests with these packages versions at a minimum: twisted 14.0, pyopenssl 0.14, lxml 3.4.
column285: the sum up of travis-ci builds are taking like 50min to complete
column286: dataclass objects and attrs objects are now valid item types, and a new itemadapter library makes it easy to write code that supports any item type
column287: encode invalid xpath with unicode_escape under py2
column288: a new request_left_downloader signal is sent when a request leaves the downloader
column289: removed backslashes preceding *args and **kwargs in some function and method signatures
column290: per-request retry times with the new max_retry_times meta key
column291: a new scraper_slot_max_active_size setting allows configuring the existing soft limit that pauses request downloads when the total response data being processed is too high
column292: also, stats signals were renamed and now pass around spider references . here s a summary of the changes:
column294: original item_passed signal was renamed to item_scraped
column295: removed track_refs setting, now trackrefs is always enabled
column296: request no longer requires a callback parameter when an errback parameter is specified
column297: selector does not allow passing both response and text anymore .
column298: changed stats api to use spiders instead of domains
column299: added quantal & raring to support ubuntu releases
column300: crawling with proxy servers becomes more efficient, as connections to proxies can be reused now.
column302: update crawlspider template with selector changes
column303: show warning when a url is put to spider.allowed_domains instead of a domain .
column305: the serialize parameter is no longer passed. the disk queue class must take care of request serialization on its own before writing to disk, using the request_to_dict and request_from_dict functions from the scrapy.utils.reqser module.
column306: the first spider middleware now also processes exceptions raised from callbacks that are generators
column307: improve request delay and concurrency handling
column309: a future version of scrapy will include a new, better implementation of the reverted bug fix.
column310: removed top-level reactor imports to prevent errors about the wrong twisted reactor being installed when setting a different twisted reactor using twisted_reactor
column312: download handlers may now use the from_settings and from_crawler class methods that other scrapy components already supported
column313: crawler, crawlerrunner.crawl and crawlerrunner.create_crawler now fail gracefully if they receive a spider subclass instance instead of the subclass itself
column314: fix offsite middleware case on urls with no hostnames
column315: added new command to edit spiders: scrapy edit and -e flag to genspider command that uses it
column316: support for overriding default request headers per spider
column317: checks for generator callbacks with a return statement no longer warn about return statements in nested functions
column318: a much improved completion definition is now available for zsh
column319: removed warnings about using old, removed settings
column320: fixed bug in json-rpc webservice reported in link also removed no longer supported run command from extras/scrapy-ws.py
column321: the ftp password can now be omitted if it is not necessary
column322: flags are now preserved when copying requests ;
column323: modified the tox configuration to allow running tests with any python version, run bandit and flake8 tests by default, and enforce a minimum tox version programmatically
column324: the feed_uri_params setting is now documented
column325: the documentation now covers how to define and configure a custom log format
column326: new item exporter using native python types with nesting support
column328: be more responsive with io operations
column329: configured travis ci to also run the tests with python 3.5.2
column330: there is now a scrapy server command to start a scrapyd server of the current project
column331: tests and docs for request_fingerprint function
column332: the parameter for disk queues that contains data from the previous crawl, startprios or slot_startprios, is now passed as a keyword parameter named startprios.
column334: removed the following classes and their parent modules from scrapy.linkextractors:
column335: clarified the requirements for request objects when using persistence
column336: ftp passwords in feed_uri containing percent-escaped characters are now properly decoded
column337: this release brings small new features and improvements across the codebase. some highlights:
column338: when using asyncio, it is now possible to set a custom asyncio loop
column339: stopped using python 2 unicode literal syntax
column340: improved the documentation of link extractors with an usage example from a spider callback and reference documentation for the link class
column341: a memory-handling and error-handling issue in scrapy.utils.ssl.get_temp_key_info has been fixed
column342: a new redirect_reasons request meta key exposes the reason behind every followed redirect
column343: added new scrapy-ctl view command - to view url in the browser, as seen by scrapy
column344: improved code sharing between the crawl and runspider commands
column345: callbacks that receive keyword arguments can now be tested using the new @cb_kwargs spider contract
column346: a minimal web ui was added, available at http://localhost:6800 by default
column347: last google summer of code project accomplished an important redesign of the mechanism used for populating settings, introducing explicit priorities to override any given setting. as an extension of that goal, we included a new level of priority for settings that act exclusively for a single spider, allowing them to redefine project settings.
column348: deprecated scrapy.interfaces.ispidermanager is removed; please use scrapy.interfaces.ispiderloader.
column349: new persistent spider queue , available by default, which allows to start scrapy in server mode and then schedule spiders to run.
column350: new chunkedtransfermiddleware to support chunked transfer encoding
column351: another milestone for last google summer of code was a refactoring of the internal api, seeking a simpler and easier usage. check new core interface in: core api
column352: refactored close spider behavior to wait for all downloads to finish and be processed by spiders, before closing the spider
column353: doc fixed httpcache_storage typo in the default value which is now filesystem instead dbm.
column354: the scrapy_check variable is now set to the true string during runs of the check command, which allows detecting contract check runs from code
column356: backport scrapy check command fixes and backward compatible multi crawler process
column357: removed support for the scrapy_pickled_settings_to_override environment variable, deprecated in 1.8.0.
column358: class attributes for subclasses of imagespipeline and filespipeline work as they did before 1.1.1
column359: added system tests with mock server
column360: declaring and returning scrapy items is no longer necessary to collect the scraped data from your spider, you can now return explicit dictionaries instead.
column361: updated the description of the screenshot pipeline example, which now uses coroutine syntax instead of returning a deferred
column362: travis-ci now tests scrapy changes against development versions of w3lib and queuelib python packages.
column363: split redirection middleware into status and meta based middlewares
column364: switched to formatted string literals where possible
column365: closespider and spiderstate extensions now get disabled if no relevant setting is set .
column366: fixed logic issues, broken links and typos
column367: textresponse.body_as_unicode is now deprecated, use textresponse.text instead
column368: fix deprecated settings api in tests
column370: statscollector was changed to receive spider references in its methods .
column371: in settings, where the import path of a class is required, it is now possible to pass a class object instead.
column372: an additional crawler parameter has been added to the __init__ method of the scheduler class. custom scheduler subclasses which don t accept arbitrary parameters in their __init__ method might break because of this change.
column374: s3downloadhandler: fix auth for requests with quoted paths/query params
column375: a new setting, feeds, allows configuring multiple output feeds with different settings each
column376: improved encoding detection by adding support for html5 meta charset declaration
column377: scrapy parse command now allows to set custom request meta via --meta argument.
column378: pylinted, pep8 and removed old-style exceptions from source
column379: itemloader now turns the values of its input item into lists:
column380: skipping of tls validation errors is improved ;
column381: a new feed_storage_ftp_active setting allows using ftp s active connection mode for feeds exported to ftp servers
column382: automated tests now pass on the latest pypy version for supported python versions in our continuous integration system
column383: started reporting slowest tests, and improved the performance of some of them
column384: enforce numeric values for components order in spider_middlewares, downloader_middlewares, extensions and spider_contracts .
column385: support kwargs with response.xpath to use xpath variables and ad-hoc namespaces declarations ; this requires at least parsel v1.1 .
column386: scrapy.utils.python.mutablechain.__iter__ now returns self, allowing it to be used as a sequence
column387: spider.make_requests_from_url, deprecated in scrapy 1.4.0, now issues a warning when used
column388: update docstring in project template to avoid confusion with genspider command, which may be considered as an advanced feature. refs #107
column389: http cache extension and plugins that use the .scrapy data directory now work outside projects . warning: this is technically backward incompatible, though we consider this a bug fix.
column391: a new bytes_received signal allows monitoring response download progress and stopping downloads
column392: stats now include the following entries that indicate the number of successes and failures in storing feeds:
column393: system exceptions like keyboardinterrupt are no longer caught
column394: the redirect_max_metarefresh_delay setting is no longer supported, use metarefresh_maxdelay instead
column395: simplified the code example in working with dataclass items
column396: added support for passing custom settings to scrapyd schedule.json api
column397: a new metarefresh_ignore_tags setting allows overriding which html tags are ignored when searching a response for html meta tags that trigger a redirect
column398: dropped signals singleton. signals should now be accessed through the crawler.signals attribute. see the signals documentation for more info.
column399: fixed some external links, typos, and so on.
column400: if a downloader middleware returns a response object from process_response or process_exception with a custom request object assigned to response.request:
column401: decoupled encoding detection code to w3lib.encoding, and ported scrapy code to use that module
column402: it is again possible to download the documentation for offline reading
column403: telnet console now binds to 127.0.0.1 by default
column404: removed outdated debian package build files
column405: add scrapy commands using external libraries
column406: scrapy 1.0 has moved away from twisted logging to support python built in s as default logging system. we re maintaining backward compatibility for most of the old custom interface to call logging functions, but you ll get warnings to switch to the python logging api entirely.
column407: new extension for keeping persistent spider contexts among different runs
column408: major stats collection refactoring: removed separation of global/per-spider stats, removed stats-related signals . stats are much simpler now, backward compatibility is kept on the stats collector api and signals.
column409: removed obsolete scrapy.utils.markup.remove_escape_chars function - use scrapy.utils.markup.replace_escape_chars instead
column410: in request errbacks, offending requests are now received in failure.request attribute
column411: deprecated queue command in favor of using scrapyd schedule.json api. see also: scrapyd changes
column412: updated shell docs with the crawler reference and fixed the actual shell output.
column413: the crawl and runspider commands now support multiple -o parameters
column414: default scrapy user-agent now uses https link to scrapy.org . this is technically backward-incompatible; override user_agent if you relied on old value.
column415: default scrapy user-agent now uses https link to scrapy.org . this is technically backward-incompatible; override user_agent if you relied on old value.
column416: replace unencodeable codepoints with html entities in sgmllinkextractor
column417: merged item passed and item scraped concepts, as they have often proved confusing in the past. this means:
column418: renewed the localhost certificate used for ssl tests
column419: fix typos in news.rst and remove header
column421: scrapy.extensions.feedexport.s3feedstorage no longer reads the values of access_key and secret_key from the running project settings when they are not passed to its __init__ method; you must either pass those parameters to its __init__ method or use s3feedstorage.from_crawler
column422: you can now choose whether feed exports overwrite or append to the output file.
column423: fixed a typo in the message of the valueerror exception raised when scrapy.utils.misc.create_instance gets both settings and crawler set to none
column425: http cache now stored by default in the project data dir
column426: stopped using a backlash for line continuation
column427: logging of settings overridden by custom_settings is fixed; this is technically backward-incompatible because the logger changes from to . if you re parsing scrapy logs, please update your log parsers .
column428: http cache middleware has been heavilty refactored, retaining the same functionality except for the domain sectorization which was removed.
column429: made use of set literals in tests
column430: use single quotes uniformly in templates
column431: dataclass objects and attrs objects are now valid item types
column432: link extraction improvements: ftp is added to scheme list ; flv is added to common video extensions
column433: added tests to ensure that coroutine support is tested.
column434: the __init__ and from_crawler methods of feed storage backend classes now receive a new keyword-only parameter, feed_options, which is a dictionary of feed options
column435: put a blurb about support channels in contributing
column436: httperrormiddleware now returns none or raises an exception
column437: formrequest.from_response now handles invalid methods like major web browsers
column438: add verification to check if request callback is callable
column439: remove dead code supporting old twisted versions .
column441: we have refactored the scrapy.core.scheduler.scheduler class and related queue classes to make it easier to implement custom scheduler queue classes. see changes to scheduler queue classes below for details.
column442: fixed so it refers to the correct folder
column443: made our tests run with the new pip resolver.
column444: google cloud storage support for filespipeline and imagespipeline .
column445: redirectmiddleware now skips the status codes from handle_httpstatus_list on spider attribute or in request s meta key .
column446: implemented code refactorings, style fixes and cleanups.
column447: support link rel attribute with multiple values .
column448: removed from coroutines the warning about the api being experimental
column449: keep reading for more details on other improvements and bug fixes.
column452: scrapy now requires twisted >= 13.1 which is the case for many linux distributions already.
column453: removed references to python 2 s unicode type
column454: in custom feed storage backend classes, __init__ method signatures that do not accept a keyword-only feed_options parameter are now deprecated
column455: that custom request object is now sent as the request argument to the response_received signal, instead of the original request object
column456: renamed request_handlers to download_handlers and make download handlers classes
column457: lot of bugfixes to retry middleware under disconnections using http 1.1 download handler
column458: covered how to deal with long lists of allowed domains in the faq.
column459: partial coroutine syntax support and experimental asyncio support
column460: replace import image by more standard from pil import image . closes #88
column461: scrapy.item.dictitem is deprecated, use item instead
column462: improve testsuite comparing csv and xml exporters
column463: it is now possible to run all tests from the same tox environment in parallel; the documentation now covers this and other ways to run tests
column464: backport master fixes to json exporter
column465: exceptions in contracts code are handled better ;
column466: the scrapy.utils.boto.is_botocore function is now deprecated, use scrapy.utils.boto.is_botocore_available instead
column467: serialized requests now support callbacks that are spider methods that delegate on other callable
column468: added xpathselector.remove_namespaces which allows to remove all namespaces from xml documents for convenience . documented in selectors.
column469: scrapy.mail.mailsender now can connect over tls or upgrade using starttls
column470: allow to disable a downloader handler just like any other component
column471: you can use the overwrite key in the feeds setting to configure whether to overwrite the output file or append to its content
column472: the following class attributes have been added:
column473: startproject command now supports an optional destination directory to override the default one based on the project name .
column474: promote startup info on settings and middleware to info level
column475: if you re using custom selector or selectorlist subclasses, a backward incompatible change in parsel may affect your code. see parsel changelog for a detailed description, as well as for the full list of improvements.
column476: when using google cloud storage for a media pipeline, a warning is now logged if the configured credentials do not grant the required permissions
column477: the httpcompressionmiddleware downloader middleware now logs the number of decompressed responses and the total count of resulting bytes:
column478: deprecated runserver command in favor of server command which starts a scrapyd server. see also: scrapyd changes
column479: rule now accepts an errback parameter
column480: add a middleware to crawl ajax crawleable pages as defined by google
column481: the logstats_interval setting , the filespipeline.file_path and imagespipeline.file_path methods and the crawler.stop method are now documented
column482: fixed installation on pypy installing pydispatcher in addition to pypydispatcher, which could prevent scrapy from working depending on which package got imported.
column483: do not fail handling unicode xpaths in libxml2 backed selectors
column484: a new pqueues attribute offers a mapping of downloader slot names to the corresponding instances of downstream_queue_cls.
column485: when using the crawl or runspider commands, you can use the -o option instead of -o to overwrite the output file
column486: fix wrong checks on subclassing of deprecated classes
column487: link extractors are now serializable, as long as you do not use lambdas for parameters; for example, you can now pass link extractors in request.cb_kwargs or request.meta when persisting scheduled requests
column488: the httpproxymiddleware middleware now simply ignores unsupported proxy values
column489: fix duplicate content-length header for post requests with empty body
column490: added instructions to install scrapy in windows using pip.
column491: scrapy.utils.misc.create_instance now raises a typeerror exception if the resulting instance is none
column492: upgraded the pickle protocol that scrapy uses from protocol 2 to protocol 4, improving serialization capabilities and performance
column493: scrapy.item.baseitem is now deprecated, use scrapy.item.item instead
column494: changed item pipeline to use spiders instead of domains
column495: revert the fix for issue 3804 , which has a few undesired side effects .
column496: a new robotstxt_user_agent setting allows defining a separate user agent string to use for robots.txt parsing
column497: improved consistency when referring to the __init__ method of an object
column498: removed some obsolete remaining code related to sqlite support in scrapy
column499: in custom media pipelines, signatures that do not accept a keyword-only item parameter in any of the methods that now support this parameter are now deprecated
column501: connections to proxy servers are reused
column502: we decided to revert this bug fix, introduced in scrapy 2.2.0, because it was reported that the current implementation could break existing code.
column503: handle a regression introduced in python 2.7.5 that affects xmlitemexporter
column505: broad crawls now features information about memory usage
column506: dropped support for python 2.5. see link
column507: set context factory implementation based on twisted version
column508: item_error is fired when an error happens in a pipeline ;
column509: a new dns_resolver setting allows enabling ipv6 support
column510: the dictionaries in the result list of a media pipeline now include a new key, status, which indicates if the file was downloaded or, if the file was not downloaded, why it was not downloaded; see filespipeline.get_media_requests for more information
column511: passed item is now sent in the item argument of the item_passed
column512: item_pipelines is now defined as a dict
column513: refactored execution queue in a common base code and pluggable backends called spider queues
column514: basesgmllinkextractor: added unit test of a link with an inner tag
column515: it also serves as a workaround for delayed file delivery, which causes scrapy to only start item delivery after the crawl has finished when using certain storage backends .
column516: there s a new response.follow method for creating requests; it is now a recommended way to create requests in scrapy spiders. this method makes it easier to write correct spiders; response.follow has several advantages over creating scrapy.request objects directly:
column517: tons of documentation updates and related fixes .
column518: imagespipeline: fixed processing of transparent png images with palette
column519: scrapy does not work on windows with python 3
column520: py3: use six for robotparser and urlparse
column522: better error message when an exporter is disabled ;
column524: thanks to everyone who contribute to this release. here is a list of contributors sorted by number of commits:
column525: when feeds defines multiple uris, feed_store_empty is false and the crawl yields no items, scrapy no longer stops feed exports after the first uri
column526: the list of request.meta keys is now sorted alphabetically.
column527: doc removed pywin32 from install instructions as it s already declared as dependency.
column528: replaced memory usage acounting with resource module, removed scrapy.utils.memory module
column529: defaultrequestheaders middleware now runs before useragent middleware . warning: this is technically backward incompatible, though we consider this a bug fix.
column530: selectors register exslt namespaces by default
column532: the scrapy.utils.datatypes.mergedict class is deprecated for python 3 code bases. use chainmap instead.
column533: a new feed_storage_s3_acl setting allows defining a custom acl for feeds exported to amazon s3
column534: added comment about why we disable ssl on boto images upload
column535: include openssl s more permissive default ciphers when establishing tls/ssl connections .
column536: add openssl version to version command
column538: response.follow_all now supports an empty url iterable as input
column539: the signature of the __init__ method is now __init__.
column540: logging with spiders remains the same, but on top of the log method you ll have access to a custom logger created for the spider to issue log events:
column541: the following changes may impact custom disk and memory queue classes:
column543: don t retry bad requests by default . if you need the old behavior, add 400 to retry_http_codes.
column544: find form nodes in invalid html5 documents
column545: fix engine to support filtered start requests
column546: fix for invalid json and xml files when spider yields no items .
column547: it is now possible to generate an api documentation coverage report
column548: the crawl command now also exits with exit code 1 when an exception happens before the crawling starts
column549: new headers_received signal that allows stopping downloads early
column550: for example, when using the crawl or runspider commands, you can use the -o option instead of -o to overwrite the output file.
column552: fixed errback handling in contracts, e.g. for cases where a contract is executed for url which returns non-200 response .
column553: improved the documentation about signals that allow their handlers to return a deferred
column554: the new item_export_kwargs key of the feeds setting allows to define keyword parameters to pass to item exporter classes
column555: the new item_export_kwargs key of the feeds setting allows to define keyword parameters to pass to item exporter classes
column556: fixed logging of wrong callback name with scrapy parse .
column557: default to canonicalize=false in scrapy.linkextractors.linkextractor : warning, this is technically backward-incompatible
column558: a new twisted_reactor setting allows customizing the reactor that scrapy uses, allowing to enable asyncio support or deal with a common macos issue
column559: custom log formats can now drop messages by having the corresponding methods of the configured log_formatter return none
column560: ajax crawling wasn t expanding for unicode urls
