column562: do no include responsefailed if http11 handler is not enabled
column563: fixed the output of the genspider command showing placeholders instead of the import path of the generated spider module
column565: fix: retrymiddleware is now robust to non-standard http status codes
column566: use the new downloader_client_tls_ciphers setting to customize the tls/ssl ciphers used by the default http/1.1 downloader
column567: restore filesystem based cache as default for http cache middleware
column568: request.from_curl and curl_to_request_kwargs now also support --data-raw
column569: overview and tutorial rewritten to use link websites .
column570: additional files are included to sdist ;
column571: the base implementation of item loaders has been moved into itemloaders
column572: update extensions ignored by link extractors
column573: new feeds setting to export to multiple feeds
column574: the display-on-hover behavior of internal documentation references now also covers links to commands, request.meta keys, settings and signals
column575: the metarefresh_ignore_tags setting is now an empty list by default, following web browser behavior
column577: splitted debian package into two packages - the library and the service
column578: the optional_features set has been removed .
column579: enable memusage extension by default ; this is technically backward-incompatible so please check if you have any non-default memusage_*** options set.
column580: disable scrapy.telnet if twisted.conch is not available
column581: remove pep8 warnings in project and spider templates
column582: mention how to disable request filtering in documentation of dupefilter_class setting
column583: https+connect tunnels could get mixed up when using multiple proxies to same remote host .
column584: scrapy fetch url, scrapy shell url and fetch inside scrapy shell now follow http redirections by default ; see fetch and shell for details.
column585: a new class for json requests
column586: doc bring ubuntu and archlinux outside of windows subsection
column587: fix broken links; use https:// for external links
column588: item loader processors can now be regular functions, they no longer need to be methods
column589: added a mention to contributors in the readme.

column2: middleware from werkzeug.wsgi has moved to separate modules under werkzeug.middleware, along with the middleware moved from werkzeug.contrib. the old werkzeug.wsgi imports are deprecated and will be removed in version 1.0.
column3: cookie values are now also permitted to include slashes and equal signs without quoting.
column4: unicode errors in hosts are now better caught or converted into bad request errors.
column5: cgirootfix no longer modifies path_info for very old versions of lighttpd. lighttpdcgirootfix was renamed to cgirootfix in 0.9. both are deprecated and will be removed in version 1.0.
column6: optional request log highlighting with the development server is handled by click instead of termcolor. #1235
column7: the environ keys request_uri and raw_uri contain the raw path before it was percent-decoded. this is non-standard, but many wsgi servers add them. middleware could replace path_info with this to route based on the raw value.
column8: fixed a bug with parsing http digest headers. it rejected headers with missing nc and nonce params.
column9: removed support for deprecated fix_headers.
column10: atom is deprecated. this did not fit in with the rest of werkzeug, and is better served by a dedicated library in the community.
column11: werkzeug.wsgi.make_chunk_iter and werkzeug.wsgi.make_line_iter now support processing of iterators and streams.
column12: added support for alternative encoding error handling and the new httpunicodeerror which behaves like a badrequest.
column13: when using an adhoc ssl cert with run_simple, the cert is shown as self-signed rather than signed by an invalid authority.
column14: if cookies are sent without values they are now assumed to have an empty value and the parser accepts this. previously this could have corrupted cookies that followed the value.
column15: the deprecated num_proxies argument to proxyfix sets x_for, x_proto, and x_host to match 0.14 behavior. this is intended to make intermediate upgrades less disruptive, but the argument will still be removed in 1.0. #1630
column16: the response generated by unauthorized produces one www-authenticate header per value in www_authenticate, rather than joining them into a single value, to improve interoperability with browsers and other clients. #1755
column17: the contrib modules are deprecated and will either be moved into werkzeug core or removed completely in version 1.0. some modules that already issued deprecation warnings have been removed. be sure to run or test your code with python -w default::deprecationwarning to catch any deprecated code you re using.
column18: the default url converter correctly encodes bytes to string rather than representing them with b''.
column19: deprecate support for python 2.6 and 3.3. ci tests will not run for these versions, and support will be dropped completely in the next version.
column20: memcache client now no longer uses the buggy cmemcache module and supports pylibmc. gae is not tried automatically and the dedicated class is no longer necessary.
column21: test.environbuilder and test.client take a json argument instead of manually passing data and content_type. this is serialized using the test.environbuilder.json_dumps method.
column22: environbuilder was added and unifies the previous distinct create_environ, client and baserequest.from_values. they all work the same now which is less confusing.
column23: fixed an issue with the filesystem session support s prune function and concurrent usage.
column24: limiter is removed. its specific use is handled by werkzeug directly, but stream limiting is better handled by the wsgi server in general.
column25: new sans-io base classes for request and response have been extracted to contain all the behavior that is not wsgi or io dependent. these are not a public api, they are part of an ongoing refactor to let asgi frameworks use werkzeug. #2005
column26: 412 responses once again include entity headers and an error message in the body. they were originally omitted when implementing if-match , but the spec doesn t seem to disallow it.
column27: is_resource_modified will run for methods other than get and head, rather than always returning false. #409
column28: heavily improved local objects. should pick up standalone greenlet builds now and support proxies to free callables as well. there is also a stacked local now that makes it possible to invoke the same application from within itself by pushing current request/response on top of the stack.
column29: added support for parsing of the content-range header of responses and provided an accessor object for it and werkzeug.datastructures.contentrange).
column30: using multidict when building urls is now not supported again. the behavior introduced several regressions.
column31: added a favicon to the debugger which fixes problem with state changes being triggered through a request to /favicon.ico in google chrome. this should fix some problems with flask and other frameworks that use context local objects on a stack with context preservation on errors.
column32: added support for parsing of the range header and werkzeug.datastructures.range).
column33: optional ad-hoc tls support for the development server is handled by cryptography instead of pyopenssl. #1555
column34: deprecate most top-level attributes provided by the werkzeug module in favor of direct imports. the deprecated imports will be removed in version 1.0.
column35: fixed another issue with werkzeug.wsgi.make_line_iter where lines longer than the buffer size were not handled properly.
column36: for unknown http methods the request stream is now always limited instead of being empty. this makes it easier to implement dav and other protocols on top of werkzeug.
column37: sets server_port and modifies http_host based on x-forwarded-port.
column38: http exceptions are now automatically caught by request.application.
column39: merge all request and response wrapper mixin code into single request and response classes. using the mixin classes is no longer necessary and will show a deprecation warning. checking isinstance or issubclass against baserequest and baseresponse will show a deprecation warning and check against request or response instead. #1963
column40: werkzeug.urls.url_fix now doesn t crash on malformed urls anymore, but returns them unmodified. this is a cheap workaround for #582, the proper fix is included in version 0.10.
column41: implemented pin based authentication for the debugger. this can optionally be disabled but is discouraged. this change was necessary as it has been discovered that too many people run the debugger in production.
column42: fixed a problem with newer versions of ipython.
column43: in addition to that there is now a flag for the .get_data method that controls what should happen with form data parsing and the form parser will honor cached data. this makes dealing with custom form data more consistent.
column44: fixed an issue with integers no longer being accepted in certain parts of the routing system or url quoting functions.
column45: cookie names are no longer unquoted. this was against rfc 6265 and potentially allowed setting __secure prefixed cookies. #1965
column46: added mimeaccept and charsetaccept that work like the regular accept but have extra special normalization for mimetypes and charsets and extra convenience methods.
column47: for conditional responses the content length is no longer set when it is already there and added if missing.
column48: improved reloader to track added files and to recover from broken sys.modules setups with syntax errors in packages.
column49: fixed an issue with url_quote_plus not quoting + correctly.
column50: headers is more compatible with wsgiref now.
column51: multidict copies now instead of revealing internal lists to the caller for getlist and iteration functions that return lists.
column52: werkzeug now uses a new method to check that the length of incoming data is complete and will raise io errors by itself if the server fails to do so.
column53: removed support for deprecated parameter for iter_encoded.
column54: an exception is raised when an encoded cookie is larger than, by default, 4093 bytes. browsers may silently ignore cookies larger than this. baseresponse has a new attribute max_cookie_size and dump_cookie has a new argument max_size to configure this.
column55: overhauled the utilization of the input stream to be easier to use and better to extend. the detection of content payload on the input side is now more compliant with http by detecting off the content type header instead of the request method. this also now means that the stream property on the request class is always available instead of just when the parsing fails.
column56: removed support for deprecated header_list.
column57: for example, instead of import werkzeug; werkzeug.url_quote, do from werkzeug.urls import url_quote. a deprecation warning will show the correct import to use. werkzeug.exceptions and werkzeug.routing should also be imported instead of accessed, but for technical reasons can t show a warning.
column58: added wsgi.get_query_string, wsgi.get_path_info and wsgi.get_script_name and made the wsgi.pop_path_info and wsgi.peek_path_info functions perform unicode decoding. this was necessary to avoid having to expose the wsgi encoding dance on python 3.
column59: url_encode and url_decode now accept a separator argument to switch between & and ; as pair separator. the magic switch is no longer in place.
column60: the werkzeug.wrappers module has been converted to a package, and its various classes have been organized into separate modules. any previously documented classes, understood to be the existing public api, are still importable from werkzeug.wrappers, or may be imported from their specific modules.
column61: the multipart parser works better with hand-crafted multipart requests now that have extra newlines added. this fixes a bug with setuptools uploads not handled properly
column62: the debugger is now generating private pastes on lodgeit.
column63: fix a bug in parse_options_header where an invalid content type starting with comma or semi-colon would result in an invalid return value, see issue #995.
column64: fix issues with eventlet s monkeypatching and the builtin server .
column65: test support was refactored, semi-undocumented werkzeug.test.file was replaced by werkzeug.filestorage.
column66: the routing request redirect exception s code attribute is now used properly.
column67: requestredirect is now a subclass of httpexception and uses a 301 status code instead of 302.
column68: use stdlib ssl module instead of openssl for the builtin server . this means that openssl contexts are not supported anymore, but instead ssl.sslcontext from the stdlib.
column69: added support for parsing of the if-range header and werkzeug.datastructures.ifrange).
column70: the version of jquery used by the debugger is updated to 3.3.1.
column71: url_encode and all interfaces that call it, support ordering of options now which however is disabled by default.
column72: http.parse_cookie ignores empty segments rather than producing a cookie with no key or value.
column73: mimetype parameters on request and response classes are now always converted to lowercase.
column74: add a response.cache_control.immutable flag. keep in mind that browser support for this cache-control header option is still experimental and may not be implemented. #1185
column75: use sha-1 instead of md5 for generating etags and the debugger pin, and in some tests. md5 is not available in some environments, such as fips 140. this may invalidate some caches since the etag will be different. #1897
column76: fixed a bug in the form parser that caused the last character to be dropped off if certain values in multipart data are used.
column77: switched from the default ignore to the better replace unicode error handling mode.
column78: soft deprecated the data descriptors for request and response objects.
column79: fixed an issue for python 2.7.1 and higher that broke copying of multidicts with copy.copy.
column80: response objects are no longer modified in place when they are evaluated as wsgi applications. for backwards compatibility the fix_headers function is still called in case it was overridden. you should however change your application to use get_wsgi_headers if you need header modifications before responses are sent as the backwards compatibility support will go away in future versions.
column81: added the fixers module with various fixes for webserver bugs and hosting setup side-effects.
column82: deprecated werkzeug.contrib.kickstart and werkzeug.contrib.testtools
column83: fixed a problem with unicode keys appearing in headers on 2.x.
column84: fixed a few unicode issues with non-ascii characters being hardcoded in url rules.
column85: added a safe conversion for iri to uri conversion and use that internally to work around issues with spec violations for protocols such as itms-service.
column86: send_file can be called with etag="string" to set a custom etag instead of generating one. etag replaces flask s add_etags. #1868
column87: reloader: correctly detect file changes made by moving temporary files over the original, which is e.g. the case with pycharm .
column88: builderrors are now more informative. they come with a complete sentence as error message, and also provide suggestions .
column89: fixed regression with multiple query values for urls .
column90: changed host lookup logic for forwarded hosts to allow lists of hosts in which case only the first one is picked up.
column91: fix an issue where sys.path would change between reloads when running with python -m app. the reloader can detect that a module was run with -m and reconstructs that instead of the file path in sys.argv when reloading.
column92: fixed an issue with copy operations not working against proxies.
column93: fixed an issue with the new multipart parser that happened when a linebreak happened to be on the chunk limit.
column94: uri_to_iri does not unquote ascii characters in the unreserved class, such as space, and leaves invalid bytes quoted when decoding. iri_to_uri does not quote reserved characters. see rfc 3987 for these character classes.
column95: map and rule have a merge_slashes option to collapse multiple slashes into one, similar to how many http servers behave. this is enabled by default. #1286, #1694
column96: fixed another regression with ssl wrapping similar to the fix in 0.11.2 but for a different code path.
column97: if localproxy s wrapped object is a function, refer to it with __wrapped__ attribute.
column98: the url builder supports dropping of unexpected arguments now. previously they were always appended to the url as query string.
column99: improved performance of make_line_iter and the multipart parser for binary uploads.
column100: fixed an issue with shareddatamiddleware not reading the path correctly and breaking on etag generation in some cases.
column101: added support for using the reloader with console scripts on windows.
column102: get_content_type appends a charset for any mimetype that ends with +xml, not just those that start with application/. known text types such as application/javascript are also given charsets.
column103: the content-length header is removed for 1xx and 204 responses. this fixes a previous change where no body would be sent, but the header would still be present. the new behavior matches rfc 7230.
column104: fixed an issue with debuggers running on a different url than the url root.
column105: temporary files for form data are opened in rb+ instead of wb+ mode for better compatibility with some libraries. #1961
column106: moved limitedstream from the contrib package into the regular werkzeug one and changed the default behavior to raise exceptions rather than stopping without warning. the old class will stick in the module until 0.6.
column107: request objects are now enforced to be read only for all collections.
column108: the qop parameter for www-authenticate headers is now always quoted, as required by rfc 2617 .
column109: badrequestkeyerror adds the keyerror message to the description if e.show_exception is set to true. this is a more secure default than the original 0.15.0 behavior and makes it easier to control without losing information. #1592
column110: if url maps are now bound to environments the query arguments are properly decoded from it for redirects.
column111: added content_encoding and content_md5 to the request object s common request descriptor mixin.
column112: if the development server is started with an sslcontext configured to verify client certificates, the certificate in pem format will be available as environ. #1469
column113: added etag support to the shareddatamiddleware and added an option to disable caching.
column114: fixed a bug in boolean attribute handling of html and xhtml.
column115: the test client removes the cookie header if there are no persisted cookies. this fixes an issue introduced in 0.15.0 where the cookies from the original request were used for redirects, causing functions such as logout to fail.
column116: localproxy matches the current python data model special methods, including all r-ops, in-place ops, and async. __class__ is proxied, so the proxy will look like the object in more cases, including isinstance. use issubclass, localproxy) to check if an object is actually a proxy. #1754
column117: send_file sets conditional=true and max_age=none by default. cache-control is set to no-cache if max_age is not set, otherwise public. this tells browsers to validate conditional requests instead of using a timed cache. max_age=none replaces flask s cache_timeout=43200. #1882
column118: request.values does not include form for get requests . this prevents bad caching proxies from caching form data instead of query strings. #2037
column119: accept values are no longer ordered alphabetically for equal quality tags. instead the initial order is preserved. #1686
column120: implemented experimental multipart parser that replaces the old cgi hack.
column121: the environ_property is now read-only by default
column122: fixed a bug with href query parameter handling. previously the last item of a call to href was not handled properly if it was a dict.
column123: routing.rule.empty now works correctly with subclasses of rule .
column124: the built-in dev server supports receiving requests with chunked transfer encoding.
column125: the platform for crosswalk on android is correctly reported as android instead of chromeos .
column126: werkzeug.contrib.cache.memcached accepts now objects that implement the memcache.client interface as alternative to a list of strings with server addresses. there is also now a gaememcachedcache that connects to the google appengine cache.
column127: headers are now assumed to be latin1 for better compatibility with python 3 once we have support.
column128: parsing multipart/form-data has been refactored to use sans-io patterns. this should also make parsing forms with large binary file uploads significantly faster. #1788, #875
column129: when passing a headers object to a test client method or environbuilder, multiple values for a key are joined into one comma separated value. this matches the http spec on multi-value headers. #1655
column130: the user agent for opera 60 on mac is correctly reported as opera instead of chrome . #1556
column131: added as_bytes operations to some of the headers to simplify working with things like cookies.
column132: recognize seamonkey browser name and version correctly
column133: added support for using werkzeug.wrappers.baseresponse in a with statement.
column134: fixed an issue with multipart parsing that could cause memory exhaustion.
column135: fixed a regression with setting of content types through the headers dictionary instead with the content type parameter.
column136: added reloader_paths option to run_simple and other functions in werkzeug.serving. this allows the user to completely override the python module watching of werkzeug with custom paths.
column137: the interactive debugger highlights frames that come from user code to make them easy to pick out in a long stack trace. note that if an env was created with virtualenv instead of venv, the debugger may incorrectly classify some frames.
column138: redirect function s status code assertion now allows 201 to be used as redirection code. while it s not a real redirect, it shares enough with redirects for the function to still be useful.
column139: if a nested importerror occurs from import_string the traceback mentions the nested import. removes an untested code path for handling modules not yet set up by the parent.
column140: securecookie and sessions have been extracted into a separate project, secure-cookie. the version in werkzeug is deprecated.
column141: url routing now can be passed the url arguments to keep them for redirects. in the future matching on url arguments might also be possible.
column142: fixed an url generation bug that caused urls to be invalid if a generated component contains a colon.
column143: bytes may be used as keys in headers, they will be decoded as latin-1 like values are.
column144: range requests that span an entire file respond with 206 instead of 200, to be more compliant with rfc 7233. this may help serving media to older browsers. #410, #1704
column145: fixed a problem with external url generation discarding the port.
column146: proxyfix is refactored to support more headers, multiple values, and more secure configuration.
column147: building a url when host_matching is enabled takes into account the current host when there are duplicate endpoints with different hosts. #488
column148: head is now implicitly added as method in the routing system if get is present. not doing that was considered a bug because often code assumed that this is the case and in web servers that do not normalize head to get this could break head requests.
column149: restored behavior of the data descriptor of the request class to pre 0.9 behavior. this now also means that .data and .get_data have different behavior. new code should use .get_data always.
column150: added support for status code 451 and 423
column151: the development server adds the underlying socket to environ as werkzeug.socket. this is non-standard and specific to the dev server, other servers may expose this under their own key. it is useful for handling a websocket upgrade request. #2052
column152: directive keys for the set-cookie response header are not ignored when parsing the cookie request header. this allows cookies with names such as expires and version .
column153: script root and path are correctly distinguished when redirecting to a path under the root.
column154: refactored form parsing into a form parser class that makes it possible to hook into individual parts of the parsing process for debugging and extending.
column155: shareddatamiddleware returns 404 rather than 500 when trying to access a directory instead of a file with the package loader. the dependency on setuptools and pkg_resources is removed. #1599
column156: werkzeug.test.environbuilder now doesn t use the request method anymore to guess the content type, and purely relies on the form, files and input_stream properties .
column157: added the ability to suppress some auto corrections in the wrappers that are now controlled via autocorrect_location_header and automatically_set_content_length on the response objects.
column158: bind_to_environ now doesn t differentiate between implicit and explicit default port numbers in http_host .
column159: changed the error handling of and improved testsuite for the caches in contrib.cache.
column160: added support for ssl to the builtin development server.
column161: wsgi.get_current_url is now ascii safe for browsers sending non-ascii data in query strings.
column162: refactored request and response objects into base objects, mixins and full featured subclasses that implement all mixins.
column163: authorization.qop is a string instead of a set, to comply with rfc 2617.
column164: added support for redirecting in url routing.
column165: removed support for previous dummy writable parameter on the cached property.
column166: improved the pin based protection for the debugger to make it harder to brute force via trying cookies. please keep in mind that the debugger is not intended for running on production environments
column167: colors in the development server log are displayed if colorama is installed on windows. for all platforms, style support no longer requires click. #1832
column168: fixed a typo in the multipart parser that caused content-type to not be picked up properly.
column169: added proper ipv6 support for the builtin server.
column170: changed hashing methodology of immutable ordered multi dicts for a potential problem with alternative python implementations.
column171: cookies are now set properly if ports are in use. a runtime error is raised if one tries to set a cookie for a domain without a dot.
column172: fixed an xss problem with redirect targets coming from untrusted sources.
column173: the test client request methods always return an instance of testresponse. in addition to the normal behavior of response, this class provides request with the request that produced the response, and history to track intermediate responses when follow_redirects is used. #763, #1894
column174: the debugger detects cycles in chained exceptions and does not time out in that case.
column175: fixed bug with shareddatamiddleware.
column176: the development server logs the unquoted iri rather than the raw request line, to make it easier to work with unicode in request paths during development.
column177: make_line_iter now requires a limit that is not higher than the length the stream can provide.
column178: fix timeouts greater than 2592000 being misinterpreted as unix timestamps in werkzeug.contrib.cache.memcachedcache .
column179: fixed a problem with request handling of the builtin server not responding to socket errors properly.
column180: added options and trace to the test client.
column181: improved ssl interface of the devserver so that it can generate certificates easily and load them from files.
column182: environbuilder doesn t set content_type or content_length in the environ if they aren t set. previously these used default values if they weren t set. now it s possible to distinguish between empty and unset values.
column183: simplified exception interface to no longer require environments to be passed to receive the response object.
column184: call_on_close now can be used as a decorator.
column185: fix a bug in the user agent parser where safari s build number instead of version would be extracted .
column186: the redirect environ is copied from the initial request environ.
column187: fixed valueerrors being raised on calls to best_match on mimeaccept objects when invalid user data was supplied.
column188: fixed a bug where log lines will be duplicated if an application uses logging.basicconfig
column189: added support for filename* filename attributes according to rfc 2231
column190: the development server accepts paths that start with two slashes, rather than stripping off the first path segment. #491
column191: sets server_name and server_port based on x-forwarded-host.
column192: each header supports multiple values. the trusted number of proxies is configured separately for each header. the num_proxies argument is deprecated.
column193: baseresponse.calculate_content_length now correctly works for unicode responses on python 3. it first encodes using iter_encoded.
column194: added support for specifying a response subclass to use when calling redirect.
column195: url_encode treats lists and tuples in dicts passed to it as multiple values for the same key so that one doesn t have to pass a multidict to the function.
column196: added support for host based matching in the routing system.
column197: fixed an issue with scrolling up in the debugger.
column198: added authorization and authorizationmixin
column199: new custom routing parser and better ordering.
column200: headers are tested for equality independent of the header key case, such that x-foo is the same as x-foo. #1605
column201: deprecate the useragents module and the built-in user agent parser. use a dedicated parser library instead by subclassing user_agent.useragent and setting request.user_agent_class. #2078
column202: werkzeug.routing.mapadapter.match now recognizes the difference between the path / and an empty one .
column203: the builtin server now adds a function named werkzeug.server.shutdown into the wsgi env to initiate a shutdown. this currently only works in python 2.6 and later.
column204: restore stdout after debug console finished executing so that the debugger can be used on gae better.
column205: fixed an issue with the safe string compare function on python 2.7.7 and python 3.4.
column206: the filenames generated by profilermiddleware can be customized.
column207: http header values without encoding can contain single quotes.
column208: fixed a bug with unicode strings in the test builder.
column209: test.client now properly handles location headers with relative urls, see pull request #879.
column210: added support for static weights in url rules.
column211: fixed an issue with python 3.3 and an edge case in cookie parsing.
column212: fix a bug in typeconversiondict where errors are not propagated when using the converter.
column213: the form data parser will now look at the filename instead the content type to figure out if it should treat the upload as regular form data or file upload. this fixes a bug with google chrome.
column214: improved the session support for more efficient session storing on the filesystem. also added support for listing of sessions currently stored in the filesystem session store.
column215: response.age is parsed as a timedelta. previously, it was incorrectly treated as a datetime. the header value is an integer number of seconds, not a date string.
column216: rule templates properly work with submounts, subdomains and other rule factories now.
column217: fixed an issue with template.from_file not working for file descriptors.
column218: changed repr of exceptions to be less magical.
column219: fixed a problem with proxies not forwarding some rarely used special methods properly.
column220: resolved an issue where machine id for the reloader pin was not read accurately on windows.
column221: the description field of http exceptions is now always escaped. use markup objects to disable that.
column222: the environheaders object now skips over empty content type and lengths if they are set to falsy values.
column223: all datetime values are timezone-aware with tzinfo=timezone.utc. this applies to anything using http.parse_date: request.date, .if_modified_since, .if_unmodified_since; response.date, .expires, .last_modified, .retry_after; parse_if_range_header, and ifrange.date. when comparing values, the other values must also be aware, or these values must be made naive. when passing parameters or setting attributes, naive values are still assumed to be in utc. #2040
column224: the development server recognizes connectionerror on python 3 to silence client disconnects, and does not silence other oserrors that may have been raised inside the application.
column225: location autocorrection in response.get_wsgi_headers is relative to the current path rather than the root path.
column226: change accept datastructure to sort by specificity first, allowing for more accurate results when using best_match for mime types
column227: multi-value test-client posts from a standard dictionary are now supported. previously you had to use a multi dict.
column228: the routing system now also accepts strings instead of dictionaries for the query_args parameter since we re only passing them through for redirects.
column229: werkzeug.wrappers.json.jsonmixin has been replaced with flask s implementation. check the docs for the full api.
column230: removed support for deprecated non-silent usage of the limited stream object.
column231: sys.path is now printed from the testapp.
column232: rule code generation uses a filename that coverage will ignore. the previous value, generated , was causing coverage to fail.
column233: fixed a path quoting bug in environbuilder that caused path_info and script_name to end up in the environ unquoted.
column234: profiler now writes to the correct stream.
column235: intermediate response bodies are iterated over even when buffered=false to ensure iterator middleware can run cleanup code safely. only the last response is not buffered.
column236: it s now possible to initialize requests as shallow requests which causes runtime errors if the request object tries to consume the input stream.
column237: headers are passed to the new request for all codes, following what browsers do.
column238: use native strings for memcached keys to work with python 3 client .
column239: environheaders contain content-type and content-length now
column240: the werkzeug.routing.map now has a class attribute with the default converter mapping. this helps subclasses to override the converters without passing them to the constructor.
column241: the test client request methods takes an auth parameter to add an authorization header. it can be an authorization object or a tuple for basic auth. #1809
column242: fixed `extra_files` parameter for reloader to not cause startup to crash when included in server params
column243: 307 and 308 codes preserve the method and body. all others ignore the body and related headers.
column244: the local manager can now accept custom ident functions in the constructor that are forwarded to the wrapped local objects.
column245: mapadapter.build can be passed a multidict to represent multiple values for a key. it already did this when passing a dict with a list value.
column246: werkzeug no longer utilizes the python time module for parsing which means that dates in a broader range can be parsed.
column247: improved rule.empty by providing a `get_empty_kwargs to allow setting custom kwargs without having to override entire empty method.
column248: werkzeug.test.client can now run the application buffered in which case the application is properly closed automatically.
column249: corrected an issue that caused the debugger not to use the machine guid on posix systems.
column250: fixed an issue with the memcache not working properly.
column251: fixed a bug in the secure cookie that made server-side expiration on servers with a local time that was not set to utc impossible.
column252: shared data middleware accepts a list instead of a dict of static locations to preserve lookup order.
column253: fixed an issue with url_quote not producing the right escape codes for single digit codepoints.
column254: run_simple tries to show a valid ip address when binding to all addresses, instead of 0.0.0.0 or ::. it also warns about not running the development server in production in this case. #1964
column255: headers now support a pop operation to better work with environ properties.
column256: renamed the attribute implicit_seqence_conversion attribute of the request object to implicit_sequence_conversion.
column257: fixed an issue with the forking server not starting any longer.
column258: werkzeug.urls.url_fix now properly encodes hostnames with idna encoding . it also doesn t crash on malformed urls anymore .
column259: fixed a bug that occurs when running on python 2.6 and using a broken locale. see pull request #912.
column260: remove most top-level attributes provided by the werkzeug module in favor of direct imports. for example, instead of import werkzeug; werkzeug.url_quote, do from werkzeug.urls import url_quote. install version 0.16 first to see deprecation warnings while upgrading. #2, #1640
column261: added a workaround for syntax errors in init files in the reloader.
column262: the head method is not changed to get.
column263: added a more list like interface to headers
column264: fixed a bug with shutdowns on windows.
column265: add send_from_directory function to safely serve an untrusted path within a trusted directory. adapted from flask s implementation. #1880
column266: mapadapter.match now accepts a return_rule keyword argument that returns the matched rule instead of just the endpoint
column268: werkzeug.import_string now works with partially set up packages properly.
column270: werkzeug now automatically sets the content length immediately when the data attribute is set for efficiency and simplicity reasons.
column271: cached_property is generic over its return type, properties decorated with it report the correct type. #2113
column272: added support for tell on the limited stream.
column273: changed filestorage filename fallback logic to skip special filenames that python uses for marking special files like stdin.
column274: added support for platforms that lack spooledtemporaryfile.
column276: combinedmultidict.copy returns a shallow mutable copy as a multidict. the copy no longer reflects changes to the combined dicts, but is more generally useful.
column277: added stream based url decoding. this reduces memory usage on large transmitted form data that is url decoded since werkzeug will no longer load all the unparsed data into memory.
column278: werkzeug.utils.import_string now fails with much better error messages that pinpoint to the problem.
column280: request cookies are parsed into a multidict to capture all values for cookies with the same key. cookies returns the first value rather than the last. use cookies.getlist to get all values. parse_cookie also defaults to a multidict. #1562, #1458
column281: languageaccept will fall back to matching en for en-us or en-us for en to better support clients or translations that only match at the primary language tag. #450, #1507
column282: test client works correctly with multiple cookies now.
column283: work around a bug in pip that caused the reloader to fail on windows when the script was an entry point. this fixes the issue with flask s flask run command failing with no module named scriptsflask . #1614
column284: fix bug where werkzeug.exceptions.abort would raise an arbitrary subclass of the expected class .
column285: fixed an rfc 2068 incompatibility with cookie value quoting.
column286: resolved a regression with status code handling in the integrated development server.
column288: the interactive debugger handles outer variables in nested scopes such as lambdas and comprehensions. #913, #1037, #1532
column289: disable autocorrect and spellchecker in the debugger middleware s python prompt, see pull request #994.
column290: partially revert change to class hierarchy of headers. see #1084.
column291: the shareddatamiddleware default fallback_mimetype is application/octet-stream. if a filename looks like a text mimetype, the utf-8 charset is added to it. this matches the behavior of baseresponse and flask s send_file. #1689
column292: properly handle expect: 100-continue in the development server to resolve issues with curl.
column293: add arguments to delete_cookie to match set_cookie and the attributes modern browsers expect. #1889
column294: fixed an issue where crlf line endings could be split into two by the line iter function, causing problems with multipart file uploads.
column295: support matching and building websocket rules in the routing system, for use by async frameworks. #1709
column296: corrected the timestamp verification in the pin debug code. without this fix the pin was remembered for too long.
column297: the defaults of generate_password_hash have been changed to more secure ones, see pull request #753.
column298: the test client and environbuilder now support mimetypes like the request object does.
column299: changed cache so that cache never expires if timeout is 0. this also fixes an issue with redis setex
column300: removed support for is_behind_proxy. use a wsgi middleware instead that rewrites the remote_addr according to your setup. also see the werkzeug.contrib.fixers.proxyfix for a drop-in replacement.
column301: fixed a bug on python 3, that caused make_ssl_devcert to fail with an exception.
column302: introduced get_data and set_data methods for responses.
column303: fixed a problem with the machine guid detection code on os x on python 3.
column304: added a plain request type that disables all form parsing to only leave the stream behind.
column306: the debugger security pin is unique in containers managed by podman. #1661
column307: added support for stdlib pbkdf2 hmac if a compatible digest is found.
column308: unauthorized takes a www_authenticate parameter to set the www-authenticate header for the response, which is technically required for a valid 401 response.
column309: the secure cookie works properly in load balanced environments with different cpu architectures now.
column310: added support for edge as browser.
column311: cachecontrol.no_cache and cachecontrol.private behavior changed to reflect the possibilities of the http rfc. setting these attributes to none or true now sets the value to the empty value . more details in the documentation.
column312: routing.map.bind_to_environ raises a more correct error message now if the map was bound to an invalid wsgi environment.
column313: fixed ssl wrapping on platforms that supported opening sockets by file descriptor.
column314: the default securecookie.serialization_method will change from pickle to json in 1.0. to upgrade existing tokens, override unquote to try pickle if json fails.
column315: shareddatamiddleware uses wrap_file now and has a configurable cache timeout.
column316: header encoding changed from utf-8 to latin1 to support a port to python 3. bytestrings passed to the object stay untouched which makes it possible to have utf-8 cookies. this is a part where the python 3 version will later change in that it will always operate on latin1 values.
column318: fix bug in werkzeug.contrib.cache.simplecache with python 3 where add/set may throw an exception when pruning old entries from the cache .
column319: etags now is nonzero if it contains at least one etag of any kind, including weak ones.
column321: multidict.items and mutidict.iteritems now accept an argument to return a pair for each value of each key.
column322: raise typeerror when port is not an integer.
column323: conditional request handling or access to the data property on responses no longer ignores direct passthrough mode.
column324: fixed a bug with client cookie header parsing being case sensitive.
column326: range validates that list of range tuples passed to it would produce a valid range header.
column327: fixed a problem with deepcopy not working for multi dicts.
column328: int and float converters in url rules will handle negative values if passed the signed=true parameter. for example, /jump/<int:count>.
column329: a range request for an empty file will return a 200 response with the empty file instead of a 416 error. #1937
column330: werkzeug.test.client now uses the original request method when resolving 307 redirects .
column331: basereporterstream is now part of the werkzeug contrib module. from werkzeug 0.3 onwards you will have to import it from there.
column332: baseresponse.make_conditional now always returns self. previously it didn t for post requests and such.
column333: corrected a unicode error on python 3 for the debugger s pin usage.
column334: fixed a bug with the __setitem__ method of headers that didn t properly remove all keys on replacing.
column335: multidict, combinedmultidict, headers, and environheaders raise special key errors now that are subclasses of badrequest so if you don t catch them they give meaningful http responses.
column337: added utils.invalidate_cached_property to invalidate cached properties.

column2: entity.query_by_values has been removed and replaced by entityset.query_by_values with an added entity_id parameter to specify which entity in the entityset should be used for the query.
column3: text variable type has been replaced with naturallanguage
column4: the text variable type has been deprecated and been replaced with the naturallanguage variable type. the text variable type will be removed in a future release.
column5: added load_features and save_features to persist and reload features
column6: the libraries used for downloading or uploading from s3 or urls are now optional and will no longer be installed by default. to use this functionality they will need to be installed separately.
column7: fix errors with equals and notequals primitives when comparing categoricals or different dtypes
column8: fix duplicate label column generation when labels are passed in cutoff times and approximate is being used
column9: fix issue with converting to pickle or parquet after adding interesting features
column10: fix feature visualization for features with > or < in name
column11: improve how files are copied and written
column12: load and save features from open files and strings
column13: replace pd.timedelta time units that were deprecated
column14: removing type casting in equals and notequals primitives
column15: ft.dfs will no longer build features from transform primitives where one of the inputs is a transform feature, a groupbytransform feature, or a direct feature of a transform / groupbytransform feature. this will make some features that would previously be generated by ft.dfs only possible if explicitly specified in seed_features.
column16: fix hyperlinks in docs and docstrings with updated address
column17: handle primitives with same function being applied to same column
column18: encode features with unknown class in categorical
column19: add words and chars primitives
column20: remove unnecessary pd.series and pd.datetimeindex calls from primitives
column21: fix issue with missing instance ids and categorical entity index
column22: generate transform features of direct features
column23: * when passing multiple instances of a primitive built with make_trans_primitive or maxe_agg_primitive, those instances must have the same relative order when passed to dfs to ensure a consistent ordering of features.
column24: change type of features calculated on index features to categorical
column25: add dtype to interesting_values to fix deprecated empty series with no dtype
column26: fix bug in encode_features that created duplicate columns of features with multiple outputs
column27: add primitive.get_filepath and example of primitive loading data from external files
column28: allow featureoutputslice features to be serialized
column29: determine calculate_feature_matrix behavior with approximate and a cutoff df that is a subclass of a pandas dataframe
column30: renamed features have names correctly serialized
column31: added approximate parameter to calculate_feature_matrix and dfs
column32: related to the above change, cumulative transform features are now defined using a new feature class, groupbytransformfeature.
column33: added return values to dfs and calculate_feature_matrix
column34: numtrue primitive added and docstring of other primitives updated
column35: added serializing and deserializing from s3 and deserializing from urls
column36: add master, and release tests for premium primitives
column37: feature calculations will return in the order of instance ids provided instead of the order of time points instances are calculated at.
column38: fixed hash issue with same base features
column39: add age primitive, and make it a default transform primitive for dfs
column40: removed time remaining from displayed progress bar in dfs and calculate_feature_matrix
column41: install data and dependencies
column42: calls to featuretools.dfs or featuretools.calculate_feature_matrix that use a cutoff time dataframe, but do not label the time column with either the target entity time index variable name or as time, will now result in an attributeerror. previously, the time column was selected to be the first column that was not the instance id column. with this update, the position of the column in the dataframe is no longer used to determine the time column. now, both instance id columns and time columns in a cutoff time dataframe can be in any order as long as they are named properly.
column43: remove unnecessary check no related instances call and refactor
column44: switch which csv is associated with which variable
column45: fix inconsistent ordering of features between kernel restarts
column46: prevent dfs from creating identity features of globally ignored variables
column47: add example of using dask to parallelize to docs
column48: automatically generate feature name for controllable primitives
column49: ft.dfs now has a groupby_trans_primitives parameter that dfs uses to automatically construct features that group by an id column and then apply a transform primitive to search group. this change applies to the following primitives: cumsum, cumcount, cummean, cummin, and cummax.
column50: normalized type_strings of variable classes so that the find_variable_types function produces a dictionary with a clear key to name transition
column51: add associative attribute to primitives
column52: use more consistent and uniform warnings
column53: add graph_feature to generate a feature lineage graph for a given feature
column54: update primitive options to check reversed inputs if primitive is commutative
column55: performance improvements for approximate in calculate_feature_matrix and dfs
column56: use logger.warning to fix deprecated logger.warn
column57: add list_variable_types and graph_variable_types for variable types
column58: add feature selection functions for null, correlated, and single value features
column59: fix bug and improve tests for entityset.__eq__ and entity.__eq__
column60: the fix to how the diff primitive is calculated may slow down the overall calculation time of feature lists that use this primitive.
column61: add ability to install optional add on libraries
column62: add describe_feature to generate an english language feature description for a given feature
column63: enable specifying primitives on a per column or per entity basis
column64: don t calculate dependencies of unnecessary features
column65: fix multi-output features not created when there is no child data
column66: raise typeerror if improper input is supplied to entity.delete_variables
column67: add pyspark and koalas to automated dependency checks
column68: allow where clauses on direct features in deep feature synthesis
column69: allow boolean variable types to be used in the multiply primitive
column70: add ability to use primitive classes and instances as keys in primitive_options dictionary
column71: fix issue where some primitive options would not be applied
column72: added error message when datetimeindex is a variable but not set as the time_index
column73: use s3 demo csv with better column names
column74: added support for pandas dateoffsets in dfs and timedelta
column75: fix boolean dtype mismatch between encode_features and dfs and calculate_feature_matrix
column76: only calculate features for instances before cutoff
column77: add commutative argument to subtractnumeric and dividenumeric primitives
column78: add page on variable types to describe some variable types, and util functions
column79: fix github links with correct organizations
column80: add modulo to override tests
column81: added ipaddress and emailaddress variable types
column82: fixed faq question with multiple question marks
column83: split requirements to separate files and pin to latest versions
column84: ensure config dir is writable
column85: update release doc for clarity and to add future release template
column86: reorganize and clean up tests
column87: use circleci matrix jobs in config to trigger multiple runs of same job with different parameters
column88: normalize_entity specifies error when make_time_index is an invalid string
column89: add seed features later in dfs process
column90: warn python 3.6 users support will be dropped in future release
column91: change feature calculation to return in order of instance ids provided
column92: fix encode_features converting excluded feature columns to a numeric dtype
column93: add support for building and uploading conda package
column94: uses full entity update for dependencies of uses_full_entity features
column95: update how standard primitives are imported internally
column96: removed feature.get_names, feature.get_feature_names should be used instead
column97: add names for binary
column98: warn user if supplied primitives are not used during dfs
column99: resolve bug preventing using first column as index by default
column100: calculate direct features uses default value if parent missing
column101: allow variables_types to be referenced by their type_string for the entity_from_dataframe function
column102: add include_cutoff_time arg - control whether data at cutoff times are included in feature calculations
column103: renamed feature submodule to primitives
column104: handle transform features that need access to all values of entity
column105: don t run changelog check for release prs or automated dependency prs
column106: improve cutoff time handling when a single value or no value is passed
column107: minor updates to work with koalas version 1.7.0
column108: allow variable descriptions to be set directly on variable
column109: changed order and text of arguments in make_trans_primitive docstring
column110: parallel verbose fixes
column111: handle return type when creating features from id variables
column112: entityset repr to use get_name rather than id

column114: add guide for feature selection functions

column116: allow user to pass in desired feature return types
column117: more informative n jobs prints and warnings

column120: using training windows in feature calculations can result in different values than previous versions. this was done to prevent consecutive training windows from overlapping by excluding data at the oldest point in time. for example, if we use a cutoff time at the first minute of the hour with a one hour training window, the first minute of the previous hour will no longer be included in the feature calculation.
column121: handle no child data when calculating aggregation features with multiple arguments
column122: improved chunking when calculating feature matrices

column124: fixed cumcount and other group-by transform primitives that take id as input

column142: make median agg primitives ignore nans by default
column143: add readme to pypi

column145: update properties of cumulative transform primitives
column146: entity.query_by_values now preserves row order of underlying data
column147: make id an optional parameter of entityset constructor
column148: updates timesinceprevious and diff primitives
column149: fix readme.md badge with correct link
column150: update spark config in test fixtures and docs
column151: add conda install instructions
column152: use new version of pull request github action
column153: keep dataframe sorted by time during feature calculation
column154: update agg primitives to use more efficient functions
column155: use multiple cpus to run tests on ci
column156: support calling a primitive instance s function directly
column157: added percentile transform primitive
column158: add first primitive to api reference docs
column159: improve performance of all feature calculations
column160: reset index of cutoff times in calculate feature matrix
column161: the list_primitives function returns valid input types and the return type
column162: add development install instructions to contributing.md

column174: remove usage of ravel to resolve unexpected warning with pandas 1.2.0

column2: note this has been tested on linux , macos, and windows. it hasn t been tested on other platforms, so results are unknown for them. the c-ares support, in particular, is using some additional socket functions and defines. please let the maintainers know if this introduces issues.
column3: note that cygwin is not an officially supported platform of upstream libuv and is not tested by gevent, so the actual working status is unknown, and this may bitrot in future releases.
column4: make worker threads created by gevent.threadpool.threadpool install the threading.setprofile and threading.settrace hooks while tasks are running. this provides visibility to profiling and tracing tools like yappi.
column5: it is now possible to build and use the embedded libuv on a cygwin platform.
column6: the embedded libev is now asked to detect the availability of clock_gettime and use the realtime and/or monotonic clocks, if they are available.
column7: at the same time, asyncresult is tuned to behave more like it did in older versions, meaning that the hang is once again much less likely. if you were getting lucky and using asyncresult successfully across threads, this may restore your luck. in addition, cross-thread wakeups are faster. note that the gevent hub now uses an extra file descriptor to implement this.
column8: make zope.interface, zope.event and setuptools required dependencies. the events install extra now does nothing and will be removed in 2021. see issue #1619.
column9: make gevent locks that are monkey-patched usually work across native threads as well as across greenlets within a single thread. locks that are only used in a single thread do not take a performance hit. while cross-thread locking is relatively expensive, and not a recommended programming pattern, it can happen unwittingly, for example when using the threadpool and logging.
