column30: the libev extension was incompatible with this. as part of this, certain internal, undocumented names have been changed.
column31: asyncresult has never been safe to use from multiple threads. it, like most gevent objects, is intended to work with greenlets from a single thread. using asyncresult from multiple threads has undefined semantics. the safest way to communicate between threads is using an event loop async watcher.
column32: make gevent.pywsgi stop trying to enforce the rules for reading chunked input or content-length terminated input when the connection is being upgraded, for example to a websocket connection. likewise, if the protocol was switched by returning a 101 status, stop trying to automatically chunk the responses.
column33: this was a difference from the way the standard library behaved . it was added to gevent during early testing of openssl 1.1 and tls 1.3. see issue #1637.
column34: improve the ability to use monkey-patched locks, and gevent.lock.boundedsemaphore, across threads, especially when the various threads might not have a gevent hub or any other active greenlets. in particular, this handles some cases that previously raised loopexit or would hang. note that this may not be reliable on pypy on windows; such an environment is not currently recommended.
column35: previously it was pinned to 5.6.3 for pypy2, except for on windows, where it was excluded. it is now treated the same as cpython again. see issue #1643.
column36: any ip address is no longer subject to an extra call to getaddrinfo. depending on the resolver in use, this is likely to change the number and order of greenlet switches. see issue #1634.
column37: a few minor errors and discrepancies were fixed as well, such as gethostbyaddr working on python 3 and failing on python 2. the dnspython resolver now raises the expected typeerror in more cases instead of an attributeerror. see issue #1012.
column38: let ci build and upload release wheels for windows, macos and manylinux. as part of this, gevent s tests can run if the standard library s test.support module has been stripped. see issue #1555.
column39: the c-ares and dnspython resolvers now raise exceptions much more consistently with the standard resolver. types and errnos are substantially more likely to match what the standard library produces.
column40: this is available on python 2 if the selectors2 backport is installed. when monkey-patching, selectors is made available as an alias to this module. see issue #1532.
column41: joining a hub also cleans up some memory resources that might have stuck around for longer before as well. see issue #1601.
column42: fix destroying the libuv default loop and then using the default loop again. see issue #1580.
column43: make gevent s semaphore objects properly handle native thread identifiers larger than can be stored in a c long on python 3, instead of raising an overflowerror.
column44: fix some potential crashes under libuv when using gevent.signal_handler. the crashes were seen running the test suite and were non-deterministic. see issue #1606.
column45: destroying a hub after joining it didn t necessarily clean up all resources associated with the hub, especially if the hub had been created in a secondary thread that was exiting. the hub and its parent greenlet could be kept alive.
column46: before, cross-thread lock uses might succeed, or, if the lock was contended, raise greenlet.error. now, in the contended case, if the lock has been acquired by the main thread at least once, it should correctly block in any thread, cooperating with the event loop of both threads. in certain cases, it might be possible for contended case to raise loopexit when previously it would have raised greenlet.error; if these cases are a practical concern, please open an issue.
column47: depending on the system and configuration, results may not match exactly, at least with dnspython. there are still some rare cases where the system resolver can raise herror but dnspython will raise gaierror or vice versa. there doesn t seem to be a deterministic way to account for this. on pypy, getnameinfo can produce results when cpython raises socket.error, and gevent s dnspython resolver also raises socket.error.
column48: gevent s ci is now tested on ubuntu 18.04 , an upgrade from 16.04 . see issue #1623.
column49: rename gevent s c accelerator extension modules using a prefix to avoid clashing with other c extensions. see issue #1480.
column50: make gevent.greenlet objects function as context managers. when the with suite finishes, execution doesn t continue until the greenlet is finished. this can be a simpler alternative to a gevent.pool.group when the lifetime of greenlets can be lexically scoped.
column51: now, destroying a hub drops the reference to the hub and ensures it cannot be switched to again.
column52: now, when asyncresult detects a situation that would hang, it prints a warning to stderr. note that this is best-effort, and hangs are still possible, especially under pypy 7.3.3.
column53: incorrectly passing an exception instance instead of an exception type to gevent.greenlet.kill or gevent.killall no longer prints an exception to stderr. see issue #1663.
column54: also, the underlying semaphore always behaves in an atomic fashion when pure_python is set. previously, it only correctly did so on pypy. see issue #1437.
column55: if your application appears to hang acquiring semaphores, but adding a call to gevent.get_hub in the thread attempting to acquire the semaphore before doing so fixes it, please file an issue. see issue #1698.
column56: deprecations and removals
column57: deprecations and removals
column58: caution this currently means that it can be imported. but it cannot yet be used. gevent has a pinned dependency on dnspython < 2 for now.
column59: the dummythread objects created automatically by certain operations when the standard library threading module is monkey-patched now match the naming convention the standard library uses . previously they used dummythread-12345 . see issue #1659.
column60: use ares_getaddrinfo instead of a manual lookup.
column61: add gevent.selectors containing geventselector. this selector implementation uses gevent details to attempt to reduce overhead when polling many file descriptors, only some of which become ready at any given time.
column62: in addition, several other small discrepancies were addressed, including handling of localhost and broadcast host names.
column63: forking a process that had use the threadpool to run tasks that created their own hub would fail to clean up the threadpool by raising greenlet.error. see issue #1631.
column64: previous: installation and requirements
column65: as part of this, certain parts of the c-ares extension were adapted to use modern cython idioms.
column66: on cpython, depend on greenlet >= 0.4.17. this version is binary incompatible with earlier releases on cpython 3.7 and later.
column67: fix compatibility with dnspython 2.
column68: as part of this, exceptions raised in the main greenlet will now include a more complete traceback from the failing greenlet. see issue #1540.
column69: python 3 gevent.ssl.sslsocket objects no longer attempt to catch connectionreseterror and treat it the same as an sslerror with ssl_error_eof .
column70: fix a spurious warning about watchers and resource leaks on libuv on windows. reported by st phane rainville. see issue #1564.
column71: gevent.socket.create_connection and gevent.socket.socket.connect no longer ignore ipv6 scope ids.
column72: on python 3.7 and above, the module gevent.contextvars is no longer monkey-patched into the standard library. contextvars are now both greenlet and asyncio task local. see issue #1656. see issue #1674.
column73: the name remains accessible after the file object is closed.
column74: objects opened from a file descriptor integer have that integer as their name. have the string <fdopen> as their name , but here gevent always follows python 3.)
column75: make destroying a hub try harder to more forcibly stop loop processing when there are outstanding callbacks or io operations scheduled.
column76: the semaphore tries to avoid creating a hub if it seems unnecessary, automatically creating one in the single-threaded case when it would block, but not in the multi-threaded case. while the differences should be correctly detected, it s possible there are corner cases where they might not be.
column77: similar changes apply to gevent.event.event .
column78: pypy no longer uses the python allocation functions for libuv and libev allocations. see issue #1569.
column79: on linux, this can reduce the number of system calls libev makes. originally provided by josh snyder. see issue #1648.
column80: update tested pypy version from 7.2.0 on windows to 7.3.1. see issue #1569.
column81: make it possible to monkey-patch contextvars before python 3.7 if a non-standard backport that uses the same name as the standard library does is installed. previously this would raise an error. reported by simon davy. see issue #1572.
column82: add support for python 3.9.
column83: python 2: make gevent.subprocess.popen.stdin objects have a write method that guarantees to write the entire argument in binary, unbuffered mode. this may require multiple trips around the event loop, but more closely matches the behaviour of the python 2 standard library . the number of bytes written is still returned . see issue #1711.
column84: waiters on event and semaphore objects that call wait or acquire, respectively, that find the event already set, or the semaphore available, no longer cut in line and run before any previously scheduled greenlets. they now run in the order in which they arrived, just as waiters that had to block in those methods do. see issue #1520.
column85: gevent.pywsgi: avoid printing an extra traceback to standard error on certain invalid client requests.
column86: gevent can now be built using cython 3.0a5 and newer. the pypi distribution uses this version.
column87: as part of this refactoring, share more common socket code between python 2 and python 3. see issue #1724.
column88: make monkey-patching properly remove select.epoll and select.kqueue. reported by kirill smelkov. see issue #1570.
column89: make gevent.event.asyncresult print a warning when it detects improper cross-thread usage instead of hanging.
column90: depend on greenlet >= 0.4.16. this is required for cpython 3.9 and 3.10a0. see issue #1627.
column91: older releases
column92: older releases
column93: using gevent.wait on an event more than once, when that event is already set, could previously raise an assertionerror.
column94: reported by dan milon. see issue #1704.
column95: thanks to berkakinci for the patch. see issue #1645.
column96: those undefined semantics changed in recent gevent versions, making it more likely that an abused asyncresult would misbehave in ways that could cause the program to hang.
column97: update all the bundled config.guess and config.sub scripts. see issue #1589.
column98: fix a typeerror on startup on python 2 with zope.schema installed. reported by josh zuech.
column99: for full information on older versions, see information about older releases.

column2: marshmallow.pprint is deprecated and will be removed in marshmallow 4 .
column3: backwards-incompatible: only and exclude are bound by declared and additional fields. a valueerror is raised if invalid fields are passed . thanks @jan-23 for reporting. thanks @ikilledthecat and @deckar01 for the prs.
column4: error_handler and accessor options are replaced with the handle_error and get_attribute methods #284.
column5: exclude parameter is respected when used together with only parameter . thanks @lustdante for the catch and patch.
column6: passing field metadata via keyword arguments is deprecated and will be removed in marshmallow 4 . use the explicit metadata=... argument instead. thanks @sirosen.
column7: fix passing only and exclude to nested with an ordered schema . thanks @juannorris for the pr.
column8: add warnings for api that is deprecated or changed to help users prepare for marshmallow 3 .
column9: allow only and exclude parameters to take nested fields, using dot-delimited syntax . thanks @tim-erwin and @deckar01 for the discussion and implementation.
column10: if a field s default is fields.missing and its serialized value is none, it will not be included in the final serialized result.
column11: dump_only and load_only for function and method are set based on serialize and deserialize arguments .
column12: fix deprecated functions compatibility with python 2 . thanks @airstandley for the catch and patch.
column13: add strict parameter and option: causes serializer to raise an error if invalid data are passed in, rather than storing errors.
column14: fix behavior of many argument passed to dump and load. thanks @svenstaro for reporting and helping with this.
column15: func and method_name are still present for backwards-compatibility, but they will both be removed in marshmallow 3.0.
column16: the behavior to apply when encountering unknown fields while deserializing can be controlled with the unknown option . it makes it possible to either include , exclude , or raise . thanks @tuukkamustonen for the suggestion and thanks @ramnes for the pr.
column17: major reworking and simplification of the public api, centered around support for deserialization, improved validation, and a less stateful schema class.
column18: error messages for validators can be interpolated with {input} and other values .
column19: many=true no longer iterates over str and collections.abc.mapping objects and instead raises a validationerror with {'_schema': } .
column20: use internal util functions instead of conditionally using dateutil for parsing iso 8601 datetimes, dates and times. timezone info is now correctly deserialized whether or not dateutil is installed.
column21: prefix parameter or schema class is removed . the same can be achieved using a @post_dump method.
column22: backwards-incompatible: many is passed as a keyword argument to methods decorated with pre_load, post_load, pre_dump, post_dump, and validates_schema. partial is passed as a keyword argument to methods decorated with pre_load, post_load and validates_schema. **kwargs should be added to all decorated methods.
column23: methods decorated with the pre_*, post_*, and validates_* decorators must be instance methods. class methods and instance methods are not supported at this time.
column24: when unknown is not passed to nested, default to nested schema unknown meta option rather than raise . thanks @vgavro for the pr.
column25: fix @validates behavior when used when attribute is specified and strict=true . thanks @density for reporting.
column26: marshallingerror and unmarshallingerror error are deprecated in favor of a single validationerror .
column27: if an invalid type is passed to schema and strict=false, store a _schema error in the errors dict rather than raise an exception . thanks @density for reporting.
column28: backwards-incompatible: missing and default values are passed in deserialized form . thanks @chadrik for the suggestion and thanks @lafrech for the pr.
column29: propagate only and exclude parameters to nested fields within list and dict .
column30: fix bug that raised typeerror when invalid data type is passed to a nested schema with @validates .
column31: fields.list works as expected with generators and sets . thanks @sergey-aganezov-jr.
column32: make_object is only called after all validators and postprocessors have finished . thanks @sunsongxp for reporting.
column33: the select/enum field is deprecated in favor of using validate.oneof validator .
column34: if a date format string is passed to a datetime field, it is always used for deserialization . thanks @bartaelterman and @praveen-p.
column35: fix strict behavior when errors are raised in pre_dump/post_dump processors . thanks @tvuotila for the catch and patch.
column36: allow strict class meta option to be overriden by constructor . thanks @douglas-treadwell for reporting and thanks @podhmo for the pr.
column37: use email.utils.parsedate_to_datetime instead of conditionally using dateutil for parsing rfc dates .
column38: backwards-incompatible: when pass_original=true is passed to one of the decorators and a collection is being serialized, the original_data argument will be a single object unless pass_many=true is also passed to the decorator . thanks @stj for the pr.
column39: queryselect and queryselectlist are deprecated . these fields will be removed in version 2.1.
column40: includes bug fixes from releases 2.13.5 and 2.13.6.
column41: make allow_null=true the default for nested fields. this will make none serialize to none rather than a dictionary with empty values . thanks @nickrellack for the suggestion.
column42: backwards-incompatible: when many=true, the errors dictionary returned by dump and load will be keyed on the indices of invalid items in the serialized collection . add index_errors=false on a schema s class meta options to disable this behavior.
column43: fix list of nullable nested fields list . because this fix reverts an optimization introduced to speed-up serialization and deserialization of lists of nested fields, a negative impact on performance in this specific case is expected.
column44: a valueerror is raised when the missing parameter is passed for required fields .
column45: backwards-incompatible: email and url fields don t validate on serialization . this makes them more consistent with the other fields and improves serialization performance. thanks again @lafrech.
column46: improve default error messages for oneof and containsonly . thanks @mcgfeller for the suggestion and @maxalbert for the pr.
column47: fix usage of @validates with a nested field when many=true . thanks @nelfin for the catch and patch.
column48: fix propagating dot-delimited only and exclude parameters to nested schema instances .
column49: if required=true validation is violated for a given field, it will raise an error message that is different from the message specified by the error argument. thanks @asteinlein.
column50: raise validationerror instead of typeerror when non-iterable types are validated with many=true .
column51: improved performance and stability.
column52: these fixes were backported from 3.0.0b15 and 3.0.0b16.
column53: errors raised by pre/post-load/dump methods will be added to a schema s errors dictionary . thanks @dbertouille for the suggestion and for the pr.
column54: add support for partial deserialization with the partial argument to schema and schema.load . thanks @taion.
column55: backwards-incompatible: change the signature of utils.get_value and schema.get_attribute for consistency with python builtins . thanks @stas for reporting and thanks @deckar01 for the pr.
column56: make @validates consistent with field validator behavior: if validation fails, the field will not be included in the deserialized output . thanks @martinstein for reporting and thanks @vuonghv for the fix.
column57: object serialization and deserialization, lightweight and fluffy.
column58: fix serialization of datetime.time objects with microseconds . thanks @tim-erwin for reporting and thanks @vuonghv for the fix.
column59: prevent duplicate error messages when validating nested collections . thanks @alexmorken for the catch and patch.
column60: date fields correctly deserializes to a datetime.date object when python-dateutil is not installed . thanks @malexer for the catch and patch.
column61: passing string arguments to required and allow_none is deprecated. pass the error_messages argument instead. this api will be removed in version 2.2.
column62: make_object is only called when input data are completely valid . thanks @kissgyorgy for reporting.
column63: the arbitrary, price, and fixed fields are deprecated in favor of the decimal field .
column64: only add schemas to class registry if a class name is provided. this allows schemas to be constructed dynamically using the type constructor without getting added to the class registry .
column65: handle empty sqlalchemy lazy lists gracefully when dumping . thanks @vke-code for the catch and @yuriheupa for the patch.
column66: backwards-incompatible with previous 3.x versions: change ordering of keys and values arguments to fields.dict.
column67: fix behavior of exclude parameter when passed from parent to nested schemas . thanks @timc13 for reporting and @deckar01 for the fix.
column68: schema.loads correctly defaults to use the value of self.many rather than defaulting to false . thanks @davidism for the catch and patch.
column69: raise a stringnotcollectionerror if only or exclude is passed as a string . thanks @paulocheque for reporting.
column70: url and email fields are validated upon serialization.
column71: remove unnecessary call to utils.get_value for function and method fields . thanks @jmcarp.
column72: serializing an iterator will not drop the first item . thanks @jmcarp for the patch. thanks @edgarallang and @jmcarp for reporting.
column73: add warnings for functions in marshmallow.utils that are removed in marshmallow 3.
column74: cve-2018-17175: fix behavior when an empty list is passed as the only argument . thanks @deckar01 for reporting and thanks @lafrech for the fix.
column75: allow error message for fields.boolean to be customized with the error parameter .
column76: fix behavior for serializing missing data with number fields when as_string=true is passed . thanks @jessemyers for reporting.
column77: backwards-incompatible: validate.containsonly allows empty and duplicate values . thanks @maximkulkin for the suggestion and thanks @lafrech for the pr.
column78: deserializing none or the empty string with either a datetime, date, time or timedelta results in the correct unmarshalling errors . thanks @svenstaro for reporting and helping with this.
column79: backwards-incompatible: validators.length is no longer a subclass of validators.range . thanks @deckar01 for the catch and patch.
column80: email validator permits email addresses with non-ascii characters, as per rfc 6530 . thanks @lextoumbourou for reporting and @mwstobo for sending the patch.
column81: schema validators can take an optional raw_data argument which contains raw input data, incl. data not specified in the schema . thanks @ryanlowe0.
column82: ensure that errors dictionary is correctly cleared on each call to schema.dump and schema.load.
column83: backwards-incompatible: allow nesting a serializer within itself recursively. use exclude or only to prevent infinite recursion.
column84: copying missing with copy.copy or copy.deepcopy will not duplicate it .
column85: fix bug that raised an attributeerror when instantiating a schema with a field named parent . thanks @flying-sheep for reporting and helping with the fix.
column86: add allow_none parameter to fields.field. if false , validation fails when the field s value is none . if allow_none is true, none is considered valid and will deserialize to none.
column87: add example of schema inheritance in docs . thanks @martinstein for the suggestion and @juanrossi for the pr.
column88: backwards-incompatible: multiple errors can be stored for a single field. the errors dictionary returned by load and dump have lists of error messages keyed by field name.
column89: remove the error parameter and attribute of field.
column90: the serialize function passed to fields.function is optional . thanks again @damianheard.
column91: upgrade syntax with pyupgrade in pre-commit . thanks again @hugovk.
column92: includes bug fixes from 2.16.2 and 2.16.3.
column93: includes features from release 2.14.0.
column94: fix serialization of collections for which iter will modify position, e.g. pymongo cursors . thanks @mise for the catch and patch.
column95: fix typeerror when serializing none with pluck . thanks @toffan for the catch and patch.
column96: backwards-incompatible: a field's default parameter is only used if explicitly set and the field s value is missing in the input to schema.dump. if not set, the key will not be present in the serialized output for missing values . this is the behavior for all fields. fields.str no longer defaults to '', fields.int no longer defaults to 0, etc. . thanks @jmcarp for the feedback.
column97: add only and exclude parameters to serializer constructor.
column98: includes bug fixes from 2.19.4 and 2.19.5.
column99: allow non-field names to be passed to validationerror . thanks @evgeny-sureev for the catch and patch.
column100: raise a stringnotcollectionerror if only or exclude is passed as a string to fields.nested .
column101: add context param to serializer. allows accessing arbitrary objects in function and method fields.
column102: includes bug fixes from 1.2.6.
column103: allow partially-valid data to be returned for nested fields . thanks @jomag for the suggestion.
column104: fix method resolution for __init__ method of fields.email and fields.url . thanks @dursk for the catch and patch.
column105: restore backwards-compatibility of schemaopts constructor . thanks @wesmania for reporting and thanks @frol for the fix.
column106: fix error message consistency for invalid input types on nested fields . this is a backport of the fix in #857. thanks @cristi23 for the thorough bug report and the pr.
column107: the only argument passed to a schema is bounded by the fields option . thanks @lustdante for the suggestion.
column108: marshallingerror stores its underlying exception as an instance variable. this is useful for inspecting errors.
column109: fixes validationerror.valid_data when a nested field contains errors . this bug was introduced in 3.0.0b3. thanks @lafrech.
column110: fix passing only as a string to nested when the passed field defines dump_to . thanks @deckar01 for the catch and patch.
column111: backwards-incompatible: when a schema error is raised with a dict as payload, the dict overwrites any existing error list. before this change, it would be appended to the list.
column112: add pre_load, post_load, pre_dump, and post_dump schema method decorators for defining pre- and post- processing routines . thanks @davidism, @taion, and @jmcarp for the suggestions and feedback. thanks @taion for the implementation.
column113: the default for unknown will be changed to raise in the next release.
column114: tested on python 3.4 and pypy.
column115: add format argument to fields.time and timeformat class meta option . thanks @bennyalex for the suggestion and thanks @infinityxxx for the pr.
column116: documentation: improve custom fields example . thanks @pablospizzamiglio for reporting the problem with the old example and thanks @resinderate for the pr.
column117: add schema.validate method which validates input data against a schema. similar to schema.load, but does not call make_object and only returns the errors dictionary.
column118: fix default value for fixed and price fields.
column119: backwards-incompatible: add data_key parameter to fields for specifying the key in the input and output data dict. this parameter replaces both load_from and dump_to . thanks @lafrech.
column120: add decimal field which is safe to use when dealing with precise numbers .
column121: fix integer field default. it is now 0 instead of 0.0. thanks @kalasjocke.
column122: change default error messages for url and email validators so that they don t include user input .
column123: improve error message if a list of dicts is not passed to a nested field for which many=true. thanks again @max-orhai.
column124: backwards-incompatible: don t recursively check nested required fields when the nested field s key is missing . this reverts #235. thanks @chekunkov reporting and thanks @lafrech for the pr.
column125: fix bug with including an object property in fields meta option.
column126: add include class meta option to support field names which are python keywords . thanks @nickretallack for the suggestion.
column127: function field works with callables that use python 3 type annotations . thanks @martinstein for reporting and thanks @sabinem, @lafrech, and @maximkulkin for the work on the pr.
column128: fix serializing keyed tuple types with class meta options.
column129: prevent memory leak when dynamically creating classes with type . thanks @asmodehn for writing the tests to reproduce this issue.
column130: fix behavior when a non-list collection is passed to the validate argument of fields.email and fields.url .
column131: the serialize function passed to fields.method is optional . thanks @justanr.
column132: remove marshmallow.compat.plain_function since it is no longer used.
column133: include tests and docs in release tarballs .
column134: fix behavior when a nested field is composed within a list field . thanks @avish for reporting and @yuriheupa for the pr.
column135: declaring serializers just got easier. the class meta paradigm allows you to specify fields more concisely. can specify fields and exclude options.
column136: cast to mapping type in mapping.serialize and mapping.deserialize .
column137: store field name and instance on exceptions raised in strict mode.
column138: add exceptions.forcederror which allows errors to be raised during serialization .
column139: includes changes from release 2.13.2.
column140: fix a race condition in validation when concurrent threads use the same schema instance . thanks @yupeng0921 and @lafrech for the fix.
column141: fix bug that raised an uncaught error when passing both a schema instance and only to nested . this bug also affected passing a schema instance to fields.pluck.
column142: allow passing nested attributes to the dump_only and load_only parameters of schema . thanks @yuriheupa for the pr.
column143: add naivedatetime and awaredatetime to enforce timezone awareness .
column144: remove skip_missing class meta option. by default, missing inputs are excluded from serialized output .
column145: add equal argument to validate.length. thanks @daniloakamine.
column146: fix bug where nested would skip first element when serializing a generator . thanks @khvn26 for the catch and patch.
column147: if a field corresponds to a callable attribute, it will be called upon serialization. thanks @alexmorken.
column148: skip field validators for fields that aren t included in only . thanks @carlos-alberto for reporting and @eprikazc for the pr.
column149: add more type annotations . type information is distributed per pep 561 . thanks @fuhrysteve for helping with this.
column150: python 2.6 is no longer officially supported .
column151: see also
column152: add register class meta option to allow bypassing marshmallow s internal class registry when memory usage is critical .
column153: fix treatment of dotted keys when unknown=include . thanks @rbu for reporting and thanks @sirosen for the fix .
column154: backwards-incompatible: utils.from_iso is deprecated in favor of utils.from_iso_datetime . thanks @sklarsa.
column155: backwards-incompatible: remove serializer.factory method. it is no longer necessary with the dump method.
column156: drop support for python 2.6 and 3.3.
column157: allow input value to be included in error messages for a number of fields . thanks @hdoupe for the pr.
column158: a removedinmarshmallow3 warning is raised when using fields.formattedstring. use fields.method or fields.function instead .
column159: add support for structured dictionaries by providing values and keys arguments to the dict field s constructor. this mirrors the list field s ability to validate its items . thanks @deckar01.
column160: add require_tld parameter to validate.url . thanks @sduthil for the suggestion and the pr.
column161: backwards-incompatible: rework validationerror api. it now expects a single field name, and error structures are merged in the final validationerror raised when validation completes. this allows schema-level validators to raise errors for individual fields . thanks @maximkulkin for writing the original merge_errors implementation in #442 and thanks @lafrech for completing the implementation in #1026.
column162: fix typing for data param of schema.load and validationerror . thanks @mehdigmira for reporting and thanks @dfirst for the pr.
column163: use fixed-point notation rather than engineering notation when serializing with decimal . thanks @gdub.
column164: includes the bugfix from 2.15.1.
column165: prevent typeerror when a non-collection is passed to a schema with many=true. instead, raise validationerror with {'_schema': } .
column166: backwards-incompatible: field classes implement _serialize and _deserialize methods. serialize and deserialize comprise the public api for a field. field.format and field.output have been removed.
column167: add fields.pluck for serializing a single field from a nested object . thanks @timc13 for the feedback and @deckar01 for the implementation.
column168: fields nested within dict correctly inherit context from their parent schema . thanks @rosanneze for reporting and @deckar01 for the pr.
column169: includes bug fix from 2.18.0.
column170: use the schema.dump and schema.load methods for serializing and deserializing, respectively.
column171: fix validation of nested fields on dumping . thanks again @tvuotila.
column172: copyright year in docs uses changelog.rst s modified date for reproducible builds . thanks @bmwiedemann.
column173: the validator functions in the validate module are deprecated in favor of the class-based validators .
column174: dump and load can receive the many argument.
column175: deserializing none returns none rather than raising an attributeerror . thanks @realsalmon for the catch and patch.
column176: the extra param of schema is deprecated. add extra data in a post_load method instead.
column177: backwards-incompatible: field name is not checked when load_from is specified . thanks @lafrech.
column178: serializing a collection without passing many=true will not result in an error. be very careful to pass the many argument when necessary.
column179: adds new features, speed improvements, better error handling, and updated documentation.
column180: respect the many value on schema instances passed to nested . thanks @kamforka for reporting.
column181: if nested field only parameter is a field name, only return a single value for the nested object or a flat list of values.
column182: use raise from error for better stack traces . thanks @fuhrysteve.
column183: function and method fields raise marshallingerror if their argument is uncallable.
column184: backwards-incompatible: nested field now defaults to unknown=raise instead of exclude. this harmonizes behavior with schema that already defaults to raise . thanks @tuukkamustonen.
column185: fix serializing values from keyed tuple types . thanks @makmanalp for reporting.
column186: add dict field for arbitrary mapping data . thanks @dwieeb for adding this and @dowwie for the suggestion.
column187: schema.accessor and schema.error_handler decorators are deprecated. define the accessor and error_handler class meta options instead.
column188: includes bug fix from 2.19.3.
column189: allow accessor function to be configured via the schema.accessor decorator or the __accessor__ class member.
column190: allow a field's attribute to be modified during deserialization . thanks @floqqi.
column191: add fields.ipinterface, fields.ipv4interface, and ipv6interface . thanks @madeinoz67 for the suggestion and the pr.
column192: validationerror.fields is removed . access field instances from schema.fields.
column193: if load_from is used on deserialization, the value of load_from is used as the key in the errors dict . thanks @alexmorken.
column194: fix inheritance of ordered option when schema subclasses define class meta . thanks @frol.
column195: context argument passed to method fields is deprecated. use self.context instead .
column196: fix behavior of as_string on fields.integer . thanks @taion for the catch and patch.
column197: fix validation of invalid types passed to a nested field when many=true . thanks @juanrossi for reporting.
column198: professionally-supported marshmallow is available with the tidelift subscription.
column199: passing of strings to required and allow_none is removed. pass the error_messages argument instead.
column200: add valid_data attribute to validationerror.
column201: a changedinmarshmallow3warning is no longer raised when strict=false . thanks @aegdesil for reporting.
column202: errored fields will not appear in serialized output dictionaries .
column203: remove optional context parameter that gets passed to methods for method fields.
column204: includes bug fix from 2.19.2.
column205: includes bug fixes from release 2.13.4.
column206: fix bug that raised an uncaught error when a nested schema instance had an unpickleable object in its context . thanks @metheoryt for reporting.
column207: if a nested field is passed many=true, none serializes to an empty list. thanks @nickretallack for reporting.
column208: use raise from more uniformly to improve stack traces .
column209: backwards-incompatible: fields.field._deserialize now takes attr and data as arguments . thanks @alexmic and @kevinastone for the suggestion.
column210: add require_tld argument to fields.url . thanks @denerkup for reporting and thanks @surik00 for the pr.
column211: unbound fields return none rather returning the field itself. this fixes a corner case introduced in #572. thanks @touilleman for reporting and @yuriheupa for the fix.
column212: add required option to fields . thanks @deacondesperado.
column213: allow date formats to be changed by passing format parameter to datetime field constructor. can either be "rfc" , "iso", or a date format string.
column214: fix behavior when using validate.equal . thanks @pktangyue for reporting and thanks @tuukkamustonen for the fix.
column215: add truthy and falsy params to fields.boolean . thanks @zwack for the pr. note: this is potentially a breaking change if your code passes the default parameter positionally. pass default as a keyword argument instead, e.g. fields.boolean.
column216: localdatetime is removed .
column217: handle when data_key is an empty string . thanks @jtrakk for reporting.
column218: remove unused attributes root, parent, and name from schemaabc . thanks @tim-erwin for the pr.
column219: add schema.preprocessor and schema.validator decorators for registering preprocessing and schema-level validation functions respectively.
column220: add fields.__all__ and marshmallow.__all__ so that the modules can be more easily extended.
column221: remove spurious warning about implicit collection handling . thanks @lalvarezguillen for reporting.
column222: fix bug that could cause an attributeerror when nesting schemas with schema-level validators . thanks @vovanbo for reporting.
column223: add support for millisecond, minute, hour, and week precisions to fields.timedelta . thanks @fedalto for the suggestion and the pr.
column224: fix bug where nested fields in meta.exclude would not work on multiple instantiations . thanks @mhannila for reporting.
column225: fix typo in exception message . thanks @wonderbeyond for reporting and thanks @yoichi for the pr.
column226: fields.timedelta always serializes to an integer value in order to avoid rounding errors . thanks @philtay.
column227: if you find marshmallow useful, please consider supporting the team with a donation:
column228: errors reported by a schema-level validator for a field in a nested field are stored under corresponding field name, not _schema key .
column229: thanks @lafrech for implementing these changes. special thanks to @michalkononenko, @douglas-treadwell, and @maximkulkin for the discussions on these changes.
column230: fix behavior of the required parameter on nested fields.
column231: make_object is deprecated. use a post_load method instead . this method will be removed in the final 2.0 release.
column232: validators, data handlers, and preprocessors are no longer shared between schema subclasses . thanks @amikholap for reporting.
column233: fix error handling when deserializing invalid uuids . thanks @vesauimonen for the catch and patch.
column234: allow binding of extra data to a serialized object by passing the extra param when initializing a serializer.
column235: backwards-incompatible: remove support for python 2 . only python>=3.5 is supported. thank you @rooterkyberian for the suggestion and the pr.
column236: backwards-incompatible: schema.load and schema.dump return data instead of a tuple .
column237: prevent warning about importing from collections on python 3.7 . thanks @nkonin for reporting and @jmargeta for the pr.
column239: fix root attribute for nested container fields on inheriting schemas . thanks @bmcbu for reporting.
column241: add strict parameter to integer . thanks @yoichi.
column242: add several validation functions to the validate module. thanks @philtay.
column243: remove make_object. use a post_load method instead .
column244: fix bug that raised error when passing extra data together with many=true. thanks @buttsicles for reporting.
column245: fix error format for nested fields when many=true. thanks @alexmorken.
column246: add schemameta.get_declared_fields class method to support adding additional declared fields.
column247: marshaller, unmarshaller were moved to marshmallow.marshalling. these should be considered private api .
column248: remove validated decorator. validation occurs within field methods.
column249: backwards-incompatible: by default, nan, infinity, and -infinity are invalid values for fields.decimal. pass allow_nan=true to allow these values. thanks @philtay.
column250: fix behavior of skip_missing and accessor options when many=true . thanks @3rdcycle.
column251: add fields.mapping, which makes it easier to support other mapping types . thank @sayanarijit for the suggestion and the pr.
column252: expose serializer.options_class as a class variable so that options defaults can be overridden.
column253: documentation: split up api reference into multiple pages and add summary tables . thanks @epicwink for the pr.
column254: in strict mode, a validationerror is raised. error messages are accessed via the validationerror's messages attribute .
column255: fix root attribute for nested container fields on list on inheriting schemas . thanks @bmcbu for reporting.
column256: let fields be accessed by name as schema attributes .
column257: fix bug letting dict pass invalid dict on deserialization when no key or value field is specified .
column258: documentation: improve example in validating original input data . thanks @altaurog.
column259: backwards-incompatible: schema output is no longer an ordereddict by default. if you want ordered field output, you must explicitly set the ordered option to true.
column260: if a nested field is required, recursively validate any required fields in the nested schema . thanks @max-orhai.
column261: handle unicodedecodeerror when deserializing bytes with a string field . thanks @dan-blanchard for the suggestion and thanks @4lissonsilveira for the pr.
column262: boolean field serializes none to none, for consistency with other fields . thanks @cmanallen for reporting.

column2: 1.0.1 2020-04-27 this is a maintenance release of stanza. it features new support for jieba as chinese tokenizer, faster lemmatizer implementation, improved compatibility with corenlp v4.0.0, and several bugfixes including correct character offsets in ner output and correct vietnamese tokenization outputs .
column3: 0.2.0 2019-05-16 this release introduces substantially reduced model size, substantial lemmatizer speed up and more options for customizing server start up and requests .
column4: 1.1.1 2020-08-13 this release features support for extending the capability of the stanza pipeline with customized processors, a new sentiment analysis tool for english/german/chinese, improvements to the corenlpclient functionality , new models for a few languages , new biomedical and clinical english packages, alternative servers for downloading resource files, and various improvements and bugfixes .
column5: 1.0.0 2020-03-17 this release introduces new multi-lingual named entity recognition support for 8 languages, expanded ud pipeline coverage of 66 languages, improved download and pipeline interfaces, improved document object interfaces, anaconda installation support, improved neural lemmatizer, spacy tokenization integration, and various other enhancements and bugfixes .
column6: stanza is created by the stanford nlp group. this site is based on a jekyll theme just the docs.
column7: note that prior to version 1.0.0, the stanza library was named as stanfordnlp . to install historical versions prior to to v1.0.0, you ll need to run pip install stanfordnlp.
column8: 0.1.2 2019-02-26 this release introduces support for pretokenized text, speed ups in the pos/feats tagger and various bug fixes .
column9: frequently asked questions

column1: Change log — Docker SDK for Python 5.0.0 documentation
column2: documentation for classes and methods is now included alongside the code as docstrings.
column3: the invalid networks argument in dockerclient.containers.run has been replaced with a singular network argument.
column4: added support for adding and dropping capabilities
column5: .dockerignore rules should now be respected as defined by the spec, including respect for last-line precedence and proper handling of absolute paths
column6: client.execute is being deprecated in favor of the more dev-friendly client.exec_start and client.exec_create. it will be removed in 1.3.0
column7: added support for connecting to the docker engine over ssh. additional dependencies for this feature can be installed with pip install "docker"
column8: installation with pip 10.0.0 and above no longer fails
column9: docker.utils.create_host_config is deprecated in favor of client.create_host_config.
column10: create_host_config, create_ipam_pool and create_ipam_config have been removed from docker.utils. they have been replaced by the following classes in docker.types: hostconfig, ipampool and ipamconfig.
column11: fixed a bug where commands containing unicode characters would be incorrectly handled by client.create_container.
column12: client.timeout is now a public attribute, and users are encouraged to use it when request timeouts need to be changed at runtime.
column13: replace use of deprecated filter argument on docker/api/image
column14: the docker.utils.types module was removed in favor of docker.types, but some applications imported it explicitly. it has been re-added with an import warning advising to use the new module path.
column15: endpoint_config in create_service and update_service has been deprecated in favor of endpoint_spec
column16: fixed an issue with ssl connections behaving improperly when pyopenssl was installed in the same environment.
column17: added support for verbose parameter in apiclient.inspect_network and dockerclient.networks.get.
column18: passing dns or volumes_from in client.start with api version < 1.10 will now raise an exception
column19: placement preferences for swarm services are better validated on the client and documentation has been updated accordingly
column20: fixed an issue where lists of networks in create_service and update_service wouldn t be properly converted for the engine.
column21: fixed a bug where the networks data provided to create_service and update_service would be sent incorrectly to the engine with api < 1.25
column22: default api version is now 1.9
column23: default api version has been bumped to 1.17
column24: fixed a bug where the decoded apiclient.events stream would sometimes raise an exception when a container is stopped or restarted.
column25: added support for the filters param in images and containers
column26: default api version has been bumped to 1.18
column27: bumped version of pyopenssl in requirements.txt and setup.py to prevent installation of a vulnerable version
column28: added support for the runtime parameter in apiclient.create_container and dockerclient.containers.run.
column29: changed the way the ports and volumes are provided in client.start and client.create_container to make them simpler and more intuitive.
column30: fixed a bug where the package would fail with an importerror if requests was installed using apt-get
column31: fixed a bug where specifying volume binds with unicode characters would fail.
column32: fixed a bug where environment values with unicode characters weren t handled properly in create_container.
column33: docker-py is now unit-tested, and travis-ci has been enabled on the source repository.
column34: default api version has been bumped to 1.26
column35: the minimum supported api version is now 1.21
column36: added support for memory_limit and memswap_limit in host config to comply with recent deprecations.
column37: support for python 3.3 and python 3.4 has been dropped
column38: kwargs_from_env now supports an optional environment parameter. if present, values will be fetched from this dictionary instead of os.environ
column39: added an endpointspec class to docker.types to be used in create_service and update_service.
column40: updated the docker-pycreds dependency as it was causing issues for some users with dependency resolution in applications using docker-py.
column41: added support for init and init_path parameters in hostconfig and dockerclient.containers.run
column42: the name of the pip package is now docker . new versions of this library will only be published as docker from now on.
column43: fixed a bug where specifying volumes with windows drives would cause incorrect parsing in dockerclient.containers.run
column44: fixed a bug where detach was being ignored by exec_start.
column45: fixed a bug where patterns ending with ** in .dockerignore would raise an exception
column46: fixed a bug where handling http errors with no body would cause an unexpected exception to be thrown while generating an apierror object.
column47: fixed a bug where builds on windows with a context path using the \\?\ prefix would fail with some relative dockerfile paths.
column48: added fetch_current_spec to apiclient.update_service and service.update that will retrieve the current configuration of the service and merge it with the provided parameters to determine the new configuration.
column49: fixed a bug that caused auth values in config files written using one of the legacy formats to be ignored
column50: fixed an issue where context files were bundled with the wrong permissions when calling build on windows.
column51: fix ssh connection bug where the hostname was incorrectly trimmed and the error was hidden
column52: apiclient.inspect_distribution now correctly sets the authentication headers on the request, allowing it to be used with private repositories this change also applies to dockerclient.get_registry_data
column53: fixed a bug where an empty string would be considered a valid container id or image id.
column54: fixed a bug where using attach with the stream argument set to false would raise an exception
column55: apiclient.logs and container.logs now raise an exception if the since argument uses an unsupported type instead of ignoring the value.
column56: added new methods client.get_image and client.load_image
column57: error management overhaul. the new version should be more consistent and
column58: added extra requirements for better tls support on some platforms. these can be installed or required through the docker notation.
column59: fixed a bug preventing removal of networks with names containing a space.
column60: fixed a bug where values in environment files would be parsed incorrectly if they contained an equal sign.
column61: fixed a bug where authentication through login was being ignored if the sdk was configured to use a credential store.

column102: fixed an issue where pinging a v2 private registry wasn t working properly, preventing users from pushing and pulling.
column103: the client has been updated to support requests 2.x. requests==2.2.1 is now the recommended version.
column104: fixed a bug where files with a negative mtime value would cause errors when included in a build context
column105: added support for the target and network_mode parameters in apiclient.build and dockerclient.images.build.
column106: datetime arguments passed to client.events parameters since and until are now always considered to be utc.
column107: added support for a changes parameter in client.import_image.
column108: fixed a bug where invalid image ids / container ids could be provided to bypass or reroute request urls
column109: fixed resolve_authconfig issues by bringing it closer to docker engine s behavior. this should fix all issues encountered with private registry auth
column110: added support for driver in apiclient.create_secret and dockerclient.secrets.create.
column111: client.build can now be provided with a custom context using the custom_context parameter.
column112: mock has been removed from the runtime requirements.
column113: fixed a bug where using dockerclient.images.pull to pull an image by digest would lead to an exception being raised.
column114: added support for the decode param in client.push and client.pull
column115: the client now tries to load the auth config from ~/.dockercfg. this is necessary to use the push command if api version is >1.0
column116: client.logs now uses the logs endpoint when api version is sufficient
column117: fixed an issue where endpoint_config in create_service and update_service would be ignored.
column118: added support for the environment parameter in apiclient.exec_create and container.exec_run
column119: added support for the named parameter in image.save, which may be used to ensure the resulting tarball retains the image s name on save.
column120: fixed an issue that caused builds to fail when an in-context dockerfile would be specified using its absolute path
column121: added support for the condition argument in apiclient.wait and container.wait
column122: fixed an issue where url-quoting in docker-py was inconsistent with the quoting done by the docker cli client.
column123: fixed a bug where the priority protocol returned by client.port would be udp instead of the expected tcp.
column124: build context files are now ordered by filename when creating the archive
column125: the command parameter in client.create_container is now optional
column126: fixed a bug with api version checks.
column127: fixed an issue where passwords containing a colon weren t being handled properly.
column128: added support for the volumes api introduced in docker 1.9.0 .
column129: fixed a bug on python 3 installations preventing the use of the attach and exec_run methods.
column130: added support for add command in builder
column131: default api version is now 1.12
column132: added support for the follow param in client.logs
column133: added support for the changes param in client.commit
column134: generators returned by attach, logs and events now have a cancel method to let consumers stop the iteration client-side.
column135: fixed a bug that caused a user value of 0 to be ignored in apiclient.create_container and dockerclient.containers.create
column136: added support for hostname parameter in containerspec and dockerclient.service.create
column137: the package structure has been flattened in certain cases, which may affect import for docker.auth and docker.utils.ports
column138: fixed a bug that led to a dockerfile not being included in the build context in some situations when the dockerfile s path was prefixed with ./
column139: added pause and unpause commands.
column140: client.insert is deprecated in api version > 1.11
column141: fixed a bug in client.create_container on python 2.6 where unicode commands would fail to be parsed
column142: mode parameter in create_service is now properly converted to a valid data type for the engine api. use servicemode for advanced configurations.
column143: added support for stop_timeout in apiclient.create_container and dockerclient.containers.run
column144: added support for mounts in apiclient.create_host_config and dockerclient.containers.run
column145: default api version is now 1.21
column146: the docker python sdk is now officially supported on python 3.6
column147: improve exception messages for server and client errors
column148: connection timeout for stop and restart now gets properly adjusted to allow for the operation to finish in the specified time
column149: added support for scope in apiclient.inspect_network and apiclient.create_network, and their dockerclient equivalent.
column150: the plugin_privileges method can now be called for plugins requiring authentication to access
column151: use shlex to parse plain string commands when creating a container
column152: added support for labels and enable_ipv6 in client.create_network.
column153: fixed a bug where exec_inspect would allow invocation when the api version was too low.
column154: support for python 3.3 will be dropped in the 4.0.0 release
column155: fixed an issue with the handling of ** patterns in .dockerignore
column156: as announced in the 1.2.0 release, client.execute has been removed in favor of client.exec_create and client.exec_start.
column157: added decode parameter to client.stats and client.events to decode json objects on the fly .
column158: made name parameter optional in apiclient.create_volume and dockerclient.volumes.create
column159: volume binds can now also be specified as a list of strings.
column160: default api version is now 1.22
column161: fixed a bug where generated images would be removed after a successful build
column162: added support for advanced modes in volume binds
column163: fixed a bug where calling create_service or update_service with task_template as a dict would raise an exception.
column164: added support for contextual builds
column165: fixed a bug where credential stores weren t queried for relevant registry credentials with certain variations of the config.json file.
column166: it is now possible to provide sctp ports for port mappings
column167: credential helpers are now properly leveraged by the build method
column168: fixed a bug where parameters passed to client.exec_resize would be ignored
column169: 404 api status now raises docker.errors.notfound. this exception inherits apierror which was used previously.
column170: client.attach has been reworked to work similarly to client.logs minus the historical data.
column171: fixed an issue where network.connect and network.disconnect would not accept some of the documented parameters.
column172: added pid_mode param support to utils.create_host_config and client.start
column173: fixed a bug with builds not properly identifying dockerfile paths relative to the build context
column174: fixed an issue where setting a npipesocket instance to blocking mode would put it in non-blocking mode and vice-versa.
column175: the minimum requirement for the requests dependency has been bumped to 2.20.0
column176: client.build now uses tempfiles to store build context instead of storing it in memory
column177: fixed ssl not working due to an incorrect version comparison
column178: added support for timestamps parameter in logs
column179: added commands client.top and client.copy
column180: default base_url now adapts depending on the os
column181: installation of the package now fails if the docker-py package is installed in order to prevent obscure naming conflicts when both packages co-exist.
column182: added support for the force parameter in apiclient.remove_volume and volume.remove
column183: added scale method to the service model ; this method is a shorthand that calls update_service with the required number of replicas
column184: added support for the networking api introduced in docker 1.9.0 .
column185: docker.client has been renamed to docker.apiclient
column186: docs fixes and improvements
column187: fixed a bug where a list of mounts provided to apiclient.create_service would sometimes be parsed incorrectly.
column188: fixed a bug where inclusion patterns in .dockerignore would cause some excluded files to appear in the build context on windows.
column189: added support for the until parameter in apiclient.logs and container.logs
column190: fixed an issue where concurrent attempts to access to a named pipe by the client would sometimes cause recoverable exceptions to be raised.
column191: fixed a bug where .dockerignore patterns starting with a slash were ignored.
column192: added support for the isolation parameter in containerspec, dockerclient.services.create and service.update
column193: fixed a bug where forward slashes in some .dockerignore patterns weren t being parsed correctly on windows
column194: fixed a bug where the filters parameter in client.volumes would not be applied properly.
column195: fixed a bug where auth config credentials containing unicode characters would cause failures when pushing / pulling images.
column196: fixed a bug with docker 1.7.x where the wrong auth headers were being passed in client.build, failing builds that depended on private images.
column197: fixed a bug where streaming data over https would sometimes behave incorrectly with python 3.x
column198: added support for the since param in client.logs
column199: added support for the squash parameter in apiclient.build and dockerclient.images.build.
column200: fixed pushing / pulling to v2 registries
column201: added support for the internal param in client.create_network.
column202: auth credentials are provided to the docker daemon when using client.build
column203: docker-py will now look for login configuration under the new config path, and fall back to the old ~/.dockercfg path if not present.
column204: bumped requests version requirement, which should fix most of the ssl issues encountered recently.
column205: fixed a bug where using the read_only parameter when creating a service using the dockerclient was being ignored
column206: added support for max_failure_ratio and monitor in updateconfig
column207: fixed a bug where getting logs from tty-enabled containers wasn t working properly with more recent versions of docker
column208: fixed an issue with integration tests being run inside a container
column209: broke up client code into several files to facilitate maintenance and contribution.
column210: apiclient.wait and container.wait now return a dict representing the api s response instead of returning the status code directly.
column211: added a greedy parameter to dockerclient.networks.list, yielding additional details about the listed networks.
column212: added insecure_registry parameter in client.push and client.pull. it defaults to false and code pushing to non-https private registries might break as a result.
column213: fixed an issue that was preventing the dockerclient.swarm.init method to take into account arguments passed to it.
column214: default api version is now 1.8
column215: fixed several bugs in client.login. it should now work with api versions 1.4, 1.5.
column216: adds a basehttpadapter with a close method to ensure that the pools is clean on close
column217: fixed a bug where dockerfile would sometimes be excluded from the build context.
column218: user guides and tutorials
column219: fixed a number of issues tied with named pipe transport on windows.
column220: added support for ipv4_address and ipv6_address in utils function create_endpoint_config.
column221: fixed an issue in create_host_config where empty sequences wouldn t be interpreted properly
column222: added support for host devices
column223: fixed a bug where calling login against the default registry would fail with the 1.10.x engine
column224: disable compression by default when using container.get_archive method
column225: fixed a bug that caused placement preferences to be ignored when provided to dockerclient.services.create
column226: added support for force and noprune parameters in remove_image
column227: links can now be specified as tuples in client.start
column228: please note that client.login currently doesn t write auth to the .dockercfg file, thus auth is not persistent when using this method.
column229: fixed a bug where providing timeout=none to client.stop would result in an exception despite the usecase being valid.
column230: added support for the workdir argument in apiclient.exec_create and container.exec_run
column231: added api version support
column232: fixed a bug where empty directories weren t correctly included when providing a context to client.build.
column233: added support for insert_defaults in apiclient.inspect_service and dockerclient.services.get.
column234: added support for the ingress parameter in apiclient.create_network and dockerclient.networks.create.
column235: fixed an issue where auth info would not be retrieved from its default location on windows.
column236: fixed a bug where the status_code attribute of apierror exceptions would not reflect the expected value.
column237: added support for a version parameter in client.from_env.
column238: fixed an issue where dockerclient.image.build wouldn t return an image object even when the build was successful
column239: added labels property to the image and container classes.
column240: integration tests are now run as part of our continuous integration.
column241: when a resource identifier is passed to a client method, we now check for none values to avoid crashing
column243: fixed an issue where dockerclient.images.pull would fail to return the corresponding image object if a tag was set.
column244: added support for attachable in create_network
column245: fixed an issue where the default tls version in tlsconfig would break in some environments. docker-py now uses tlsv1 by default this setting can be overridden using the ssl_version param in kwargs_from_env or the tlsconfig constructor
column246: added the df method to apiclient and dockerclient
column248: add support for docker contexts through docker.contextapi
column249: fixed a bug that caused custom dockerfile paths in a subfolder of the build context to be invalidated, preventing these builds from working
column250: docker.apierror has been moved to the new docker.errors module as well.
column251: pulling all tags from a repository with no latest tag using the dockerclient will no longer raise a notfound exception
column252: fixed a bug where apiclient.login didn t populate the _auth_configs dictionary properly, causing subsequent pull and push operations to fail
column253: remove_image now supports a dict containing an id key as its id parameter
column254: added support for the stream param in client.stats
column255: fixed a bug that caused .dockerignore comments to be read as exclusion patterns
column256: fixed an issue with some exclusion patterns in build.
column257: when no tag is provided, dockerclient.images.pull now returns a list of images associated to the pulled repository instead of just the latest image.
column258: apiclient.insert has been removed. users may use apiclient.put_archive combined with apiclient.commit to replicate the method s behavior.
column259: add option on when to use tls on context constructor
column261: the websocket-client dependency has been updated to a more recent version. this new version also supports python 3.x, making attach_socket available on those versions as well.
column262: added new mkdocs documentation. currently hosted on readthedocs
column263: fixed a bug where some files in .dockerignore weren t being handled properly
column264: name in dockerclient.images.pull is now repository
column265: fixed a bug where the build method tried to include inaccessible files in the context, leading to obscure errors during the build phase .
column266: port specifications including ipv6 endpoints are now supported.
column267: fixed a bug where docker-py would crash if the docker daemon was stopped while reading a streaming response
column269: fixed the handling of tty-enabled containers in attach and exec_run.
column270: fixed a bug where some build context files were incorrectly recognized as being inaccessible.
column271: fixed a bug where some errors wouldn t be properly constructed in client.py, leading to unhelpful exceptions bubbling up
column272: added support for labels and shmsize in build.
column273: fixed a bug where private registries on https weren t handled properly
column274: added tag support for the builder
column275: dockerclient.images.build now returns a tuple of instead of just the image object.
column276: added a assert_hostname option to tlsconfig which can be used to disable verification of hostnames.
column277: in apiclient.build and dockerclient.images.build, the use_config_proxy parameter now defaults to true
column278: added read_only param support to utils.create_host_config and client.start
column279: added support for ignore_removed parameter in dockerclient.containers.list
column280: fixed a bug where mount.parse_mount_string would incorrectly mark host binds as being of volume type.
column281: fixed a bug where some methods would raise a nullresource exception when the resource id was provided using a keyword argument.
column282: fixed an issue where explicit relative paths in .dockerignore files were not being recognized.
column283: fixed an issue where pulls made with the dockerclient would fail when setting the stream parameter to true.
column284: docker.utils.types has been moved to docker.types
column285: fixed a bug where memory limits would parse to incorrect values.
