column175: simplify implementation of primitive traps like wait_task_rescheduled
column176: trio sockets have a new method is_readable that allows you to check whether a socket is readable. this is useful for http/1.1 clients.
column177: on macos and bsds, explicitly close our wakeup socketpair when we re done with it.
column178: fixed several bugs in the new unix subprocess pipe support, where operations on a closed pipe could accidentally affect another unrelated pipe due to internal file-descriptor reuse, in very rare circumstances, two tasks calling send_all on the same pipe at the same time could end up with intermingled data instead of a busyresourceerror.
column179: trio can now be imported when sys.excepthook is a functools.partial instance, which might occur in a pytest-qt test function.
column180: multierror.catch now correctly preserves __context__, despite python s best attempts to stop us
column181: remove the deprecated trio.hazmat module.
column182: added a comprehensive api for async filesystem i/o: see asynchronous filesystem i/o
column183: openssl has a bug in its handling of tls 1.3 session tickets that can cause deadlocks or data loss in some rare edge cases. these edge cases most frequently happen during tests. trio.sslstream now works around this issue, so you don t have to worry about it.
column184: this is only supported if you are running python >= 3.6.4. you can refer to this github pr for details.
column185: the triotoken class can now be used as a target of a weak reference.
column186: it turns out that it s better to treat subprocess spawning as an async operation. therefore, direct construction of process objects has been deprecated. use trio.open_process instead.
column187: trio.socket now handles non-ascii domain names using the modern idna 2008 standard instead of the obsolete idna 2003 standard
column188: remove deprecated max_refill_bytes from sslstream.
column189: previously, on windows, trio programs using thousands of sockets at the same time could trigger extreme slowdowns in the windows kernel. now, trio works around this issue, so you should be able to use as many sockets as you want.
column190: trio.socket no longer attempts to normalize or modernize socket options across different platforms. the high-level networking api now handles that, freeing trio.socket to focus on giving you raw, unadulterated bsd sockets.
column191: it s generally true that if you re using trio you have to use trio functions, if you re using asyncio you have to use asyncio functions, and so forth. so for example, this isn t going to work:
column192: trio now avoids creating cyclic garbage as often. this should have a minimal impact on most programs, but can slightly reduce how often the cycle collector gc runs on cpython, which can reduce latency spikes.
column193: if you have a receivestream object, you can now use async for data in stream: ... instead of calling receive_some. each iteration gives an arbitrary sized chunk of bytes. and the best part is, the loop automatically exits when you reach eof, so you don t have to check for it yourself anymore. relatedly, you no longer need to pick a magic buffer size value before calling receive_some; you can await stream.receive_some with no arguments, and the stream will automatically pick a reasonable size for you.
column194: attempting to explicitly raise trio.cancelled will cause a runtimeerror. cancel_scope.cancel should be used instead.

column2: safety_excludes and unsafe have been deprecated
column3: replaced the --enforce-whitespace option with --ignore-whitespace to restore original behavior of strict whitespace by default
column4: for consistency with other tools -v now is shorthand for verbose and -v is shorthand for version. see issue: #1067.
column5: potentially interface breaking: - the -r option for removing imports has been renamed -rm to avoid accidental deletions and confusion with the -rc recursive option. - __init__.py has been removed from the default ignore list. the default ignore list is now empty - with all items needing to be explicitly ignored. - isort will now by default ignore .tox / venv folders in an effort to be "safe". you can disable this behaviour by setting the "--unsafe" flag, this is separate from any skip or not skip rules you may have in place. - isort now allows for files missing closing newlines in whitespace check - distutils support has been removed to simplify setup.py
column6: added warning for deprecated cli flags and linked to upgrade guide.
column7: fixed imports with a tailing '\' and no space in-between getting removed
column8: fixed issue #496: import* imports now get successfully identified and reformatted instead of deleted
column9: fixed #1469: --diff option is ignored when input is from stdin.
column10: implemented #1684: added support for extending skips with --extend-skip and --extend-skip-glob.
column11: new module placement logic and module fully replaces old finders. old approach is still available via --old-finders.
column12: removed always showing isort banner, keeping it for when the version is requested, verbose is used, or show_logo setting is set.
column13: completely new python api, old version is removed and no longer accessible.
column14: implemented #960: support for respecting git ignore via "--gitignore" or "skip_gitignore=true".
column15: since there is no longer composition negative form settings are no longer required and have been removed.
column16: fixed issue #484 & #472: consistent output with imports of same spelling but different case
column17: fixed #1339: extra indent is not preserved when isort:skip is used in nested imports.
column18: fixed #557: force_alphabetical_sort and force_sort_within_sections can now be utilized together without extra new lines
column19: fixed issue #1333: use of wrap_length raises an exception about it not being lower or equal to line_length.
column20: fixed #1192: -k or --keep-direct-and-as-imports option has been deprecated as it is now always on.
column21: this is the final python 2.x release of isort, and includes the following major changes:
column22: fixed an issue with parsing files that contain unicode characters in python 2
column23: fixed an issue that caused python files with 2 top comments not to be sorted
column24: fixed #1612: in rare circumstances an extra comma is added after import and before comment.
column25: isort now does nothing, beyond giving instructions and exiting status code 0, when ran with no arguments.
column26: improved handling of deprecated single line variables for usage with visual studio code
column27: implemented #1604: allow toggling section comments on and off for indented import sections.
column28: fixed issue #651: add imports option is broken
column29: implemented #1596: provide ways for extension formatting and file paths to be specified when using streaming input from cli.
column30: fixed issue #284: sticky comments above first import are now supported
column31: fixed #1523: in rare cases isort can ignore direct from import if as import is also on same line.
column32: fixed issue #511: all command line options with an underscore, have had the underscore replaced with a dash for consistency. this effects: multi-line, add-import, remove-import, force-adds, --force-single-line-imports, and length-sort.
column33: added experimental support for sorting and deduping groupings of assignments.
column34: fixed #1525: some warnings can't be disabled with --quiet.
column35: config now includes as default full set of safety directories defined by safety excludes.
column36: improve upgrade warnings to be less noisy and point to error codes for easy interoperability with visual studio code .
column37: fixed a bug that led to an incompatibility with black: #831
column38: allow imports to be sorted by module, independent of import_type, when force_sort_within_sections option is set
column39: config files are no longer composed on-top of each-other. instead the first config file found is used.
column40: fixed #1548: on rare occasions an unecessary empty line can be added when an import is marked as skipped.
column41: fixed the inability to accurately determine import section when a mix of conda and virtual environments are used.
column42: fixed #1383: known other does not work anymore with .editorconfig.
column43: isort now requires python 3.6+ to run but continues to support formatting on all versions of python including python 2 code.
column44: fixed issue #433: no longer incorrectly add an extra new-line when comment between imports and function definition
column45: fixed #1427: noqa comment is moved from star import to constant import.
column46: setting not_skip will no longer immediately fail but instead give user a warning and direct to upgrade docs.
column47: --apply option has been removed as it is the default behaviour.
column48: fixed #1366: spurious errors when combining skip with --gitignore.
column49: fixed #1488: in rare cases isort can mangle yield from or raise from statements.
column50: fixes: - improved black compatibility. - isort will now detect files in the cwd as first-party. - fixed several cases where '-ns' or 'not_skip' was being incorrectly ignored. - fixed sorting of relative path imports . - fixed bugs caused by a failure to maintain order when loading iterables from config files. - correctly handle cpython compiled imports and others that need ext_suffix to correctly identify. - fixed handling of symbolic links to follow them when walking the path. - fixed handling of relative known_paths. - fixed lack of access to all wrap modes from the cli. - fixed handling of fifo files. - fixed a bug that could result in multiple imports being inserted on the same line.
column51: added support for running isort recursively, simply with a standalone isort command
column52: isort now throws an exception if an invalid settings path is given .
column53: fixed #1356: return status when arguments are passed in without files or a content stream.
column54: fixed #1315: extra newline before comment with -n + --fss.
column55: implemented #1688: auto identification and skipping of some invalid import statements.
column56: isort now utilizes mypy and typing to filter out typing related issues before deployment.
column57: implemented support for automatic redundant alias removal .
column58: fixed an issue that caused modules to inccorectly be matched as thirdparty when they simply had src in the leading path, even if they weren't withing $virtualenv/src #414
column59: implemented #1511: support for easily seeing all files isort will be ran against using isort . --show-files.
column60: a new --interactive flag has been added to enable the old style behaviour.
column61: fixed "pycharm" profile to always add 2 lines to be consistent with what pycharm "optimize imports" does.
column62: fixed issue #260: # encoding lines at the top of the file are now correctly supported
column63: fixed a regression with handling streaming input from pipes
column64: fixed #1396: comments in imports with ";" can keep isort from recognizing import line.
column65: implemented issue #301: readme is now natively in rst format, making it easier for python tooling to pick up
column66: improved api consistency, returning a boolean value for all modification api calls to indicate if changes were made.
column67: added example usage gif to readme
column68: implemented ability to treat all or select comments as code
column69: fixed some output being printed even when --quiet mode is enabled.
column70: new: - official python 3.7 compatibility. - support for using requirements files to auto determine third-paty section if pipreqs & requirementslib are installed. - added support for using pyproject.toml if toml is installed. - added support for xdg_home if appdirs is installed. - an option has been added to enable ignoring trailing comments defaulting to false. - added support to enable line length sorting for only specific sections - added a correctly_sorted property on the sortsimport to enable more intuitive programmatic checking.
column71: # isort: split can now be used at the end of an import line.
column72: length_sort_{section_name} config usage has been deprecated. instead length_sort_sections list can be used to specify a list of sections that need to be length sorted.
column73: fixed issue #909 - skip and skip-glob are not enforced when using settings-path.
column74: fixed #1264: a regression with comment handling and force_sort_within_sections config option
column75: implemented #1669: parallel now defaults to number of cpu cores if no value is provided.
column76: implemented #1583: ability to output and diff within a single api call to isort.file.
column77: implemented ability to use different configs for different file extensions
column78: ~~isort now formats all nested "as" imports in the "from" form. import x.y as a becomes from x import y as a.~~ note: this was undone in version 5.1.0 due to feedback it caused issues with some project conventions.
column79: fixed #1499: isort gets confused by single line, multi-line style comments when using float-to-top.
column80: fixed issue #1322: occasionally two extra newlines before comment with -n & --fss.
column81: initial hypothesmith powered test to help catch unexpected syntax parsing and output errors
column82: fixed #1447: isort5 throws error when stdin used on windows with deprecated args.
column83: added experimental support for sorting literals
column84: powered by portray. you too can portray your python project well using automatic documentation.
column85: fixed "no_lines_before" to also be respected from previous empty sections.
column86: implemented experimental support for floating all imports to the top of a file
column87: implemented #1433: provide helpful feedback in case a custom config file is specified without a configuration.
column88: implemented #1504: added ability to push star imports to the top to avoid overriding explicitly defined imports.
column89: implemented #1638 / #1644: provide a flag --overwrite-in-place to ensure same file handle is used after sorting.
column90: fixed #1380: as imports removed when combine_star is set.
column91: fixed #1456 and #1415: noqa comment moved to where flake8 cant see it.
column92: much much more. there is some difficulty in fully capturing the extent of changes in this release - just because of how all encompassing the release is. see: github issues for more.
column93: fixed (link added imports being added to doc string in some cases.
column94: fixed a bug that led to the recursive option not always been available from the command line.
column95: fixed performance issue when running on project with lots of skipped directories
column96: fixed #590: import as mucks with alphabetical sorting
column97: fixed #1302: comments and --trailing-comma can generate invalid code.
column98: fixed #1454: ensure indented import sections with import heading and a preceding comment don't cause import sorting loops.
column99: fixed issue #471: imports that wrap the maximum line length and contain comments on the last line are no longer rendered incorrectly
column100: fixed issue #1156: bug related to isort:skip usage followed by a multiline comment block
column101: important note: this will be the last release with python 2.6 support, subsequent releases will be 2.7+ only - fixed certain one line imports not being successfully wrapped
column102: implemented #1353: added support for output formatting plugins.
column103: fixed #553: check only and --diff now work together again
column104: fixed an issue that caused module that contained functions before doc strings, to incorrectly place imports
column105: fixed #1429: --check doesn't print to stderr as the documentation says. this means if you were looking for error: messages for files that contain incorrect imports within stdout you will now need to look in stderr.
column106: added option for forcing imports into a single bucket: no_sections
column107: implemented #1397: added support for specifying config file when using git hook .
column108: implemented #1261: by popular demand, filter_files can now be set in the config option.
column109: fixed #1290: unecessary blank lines above nested imports when import comments turned on.
column110: implemented #1668: added a safeguard against accidental usage against /.
column111: added --enforce-whitespace option to go along with --check-only for more exact checks
column112: give an error message when isort is unable to determine where to place a module
column113: fixed #1298: cli help out of date with isort 5.
column114: fixed a regression with /directory/.py style patterns
column115: fixed #1389: ensure_newline_before_comments doesn't work if comment is at top of section and sections don't have lines between them.
column116: added support for partial file match skips
column117: fixed #1359: --skip-gitignore does not honor ignored symlink
column118: fixed issue #316: isort added new lines incorrectly when a top-of line comment is present
column119: fixed issue #890 interoperability with pycharm by allowing case sensitive non type grouped sorting.
column120: fixed #1539: in extremely rare cases isort 5.5.4 introduces syntax error by removing closing paren.
column121: implemented ability to specify the types of imports
column122: implemented ability to dedup import headings
column123: fixed issue #957 - long aliases and use_parentheses generates invalid syntax
column124: fixed issue #876: confused by symlinks pointing to virtualenv gives firstparty not thirdparty
column125: update precommit to default to filtering files that are defined in skip.
column126: implemented #1502: improved float-to-top behavior when there is an existing import section present at top-of-file.
column127: toml is now installed as a vendorized module, meaning pyproject.toml based config is always supported.
column128: fixed #1667: extra newline added with float-to-top, after skip, in some cases.
column129: fixed #1293: extra new line in indented imports, when immediately followed by a comment.
column130: implemented issue #292: skip setting now supports glob patterns
column131: added support for --quiet option to only show errors when running isort
column132: improved interoperability with toml configuration files
column133: isort now utilizes black internally to ensure more consistent formatting.
column134: implemented #1487: improved handling of encoding errors.
column135: fixed #559 & #565: added missing standard library imports
column136: skip files even when file_contents is provided if they are explicitly in skip list
column137: fixed issue #665: tabs turned into single spaces
column138: fixed issue #1329: fix comments duplicated when --fass option is set.
column139: implemented #1575: support for automatically fixing mixed indentation of import sections.
column140: implemented #1434: new multi-line grid mode without parentheses.
column141: added option for new lines between import types : lines_between_sections
column142: started keeping a log of all changes between releases
column143: fixed #1631: as import comments can in some cases be duplicated.

column2: browser and statefulbrowser can now be configured to raise a linknotfound exception when encountering a 404 not found error. this is activated by passing raise_on_404=true to the constructor. it is disabled by default for backward compatibility, but is highly recommended.
column3: the form class was restructured and has a new api. the behavior of existing code is unchanged, but a new collection of methods has been added for clarity and consistency with the set method:
column4: constructing a form instance from a bs4.element.tag whose tag name is not form will now emit a warning, and may be deprecated in the future.
column5: private methods browser._build_request and browser._prepare_request have been replaced by a single method browser._request.
column6: when a form containing a file input field is submitted without choosing a file, an empty filename & content will be sent just like in a real browser.
column7: improve handling of button submit elements. will now correctly ignore buttons of type button and reset during form submission, since they are not considered to be submit elements.
column8: statefulbrowser.select_form can now be called without argument, and defaults to "form" in this case. it also has a new argument, nr , which can be used to specify the index of the form to select if multiple forms match the selection criteria.
column9: the user agent can now be customized. the default includes mechanicalsoup and its version.
column10: the params and data kwargs passed to submit will now properly be forwarded to the underlying request for get methods .
column11: form controls with the disabled attribute will no longer be submitted to improve compliance with the html standard. if you were relying on this bug to submit disabled elements, you can still achieve this by deleting the disabled attribute from the element in the form object directly.
column12: the optional url_regex argument to follow_link and download_link was fixed so that it is no longer ignored.
column13: improve consistency of query string construction between mechanicalsoup and web browsers in edge cases where form elements have duplicate name attributes. this prevents errors in valid use cases, and also makes mechanicalsoup more tolerant of invalid html.
column14: tests are now run against the local version of mechanicalsoup, not against the installed version.
column15: browser.submit and statefulbrowser.submit_selected accept a larger number of keyword arguments. arguments are forwarded to requests.session.request.
column16: the choose_submit method has been fixed, and the btnname argument of statefulbrowser.submit_selected is now a shortcut for using choose_submit.
column17: statefulbrowser has new properties page, form, and url, which can be used in place of the methods get_current_page, get_current_form and get_url respectively ). these methods may be deprecated in a future release.
column18: set_select is new
column19: the testsuite has been further improved and reached 100% coverage.
column20: improve handling of form enctype to behave like a real browser.
column21: browser.add_soup will now always attach a soup-attribute. if the response is not text/html, then soup is set to none.
column22: decompose <select> elements with the same name when adding a new input element to a form.
column23: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column24: the coverage of the testsuite is now measured with codecov.io. the results can be viewed on: link
column25: html type attributes are no longer required to be lowercase.
column26: statefulbrowser.choose_submit will now ignore input elements that are missing a name-attribute instead of raising a keyerror.
column27: checking checkboxes with browser = now unchecks all checkbox except the ones explicitly specified.
column28: breaking change: linknotfounderror now derives from exception instead of baseexception. while this will bring the behavior in line with most people s expectations, it may affect the behavior of your code if you were heavily relying on this implementation detail in your exception handling.
column29: the github url moved from link to link @moy and @hemberger are now officially administrators of the project in addition to @hickford, the original author.
column30: added ability to submit a form without updating statefulbrowser internal state: submit_selected. this means you get a response from the form submission, but your browser stays on the same page. useful for handling forms that result in a file download or open a new tab.
column31: <option> tags without a value attribute will now use their text as the value.
column32: we now use requirement files. you can install the dependencies of mechanicalsoup with e.g.:
column33: allow duplicate submit elements instead of raising a linknotfounderror.
column34: this release focuses on fixing bugs related to uncommon http/html scenarios and on improving the documentation.
column35: added support for python 3.8 and 3.9.
column36: statefulbrowser.submit_selected and statefulbrowser.open now reset __current_page to none when the result is not an html page. this fixes a bug where __current_page was still the previous page.
column37: this is the last mechanicalsoup version supporting python 2.6 and 3.3.
column38: the selector argument of browser.select_form can now be a bs4.element.tag in addition to a css selector.
column39: added statefulbrowser.refresh to reload the current page with the same request.
column40: changes in official python version support: added 3.7 and dropped 3.4.
column41: we now have a requires.io badge to help us tracking issues with dependencies. the report can be viewed on: link
column42: form.new_control now correctly overrides existing elements.
column43: we now have a documentation site: link the api is now fully documented, and we have included a tutorial, several more code examples, and a faq.
column44: a link object can now be passed to follow_link.
column45: set_checkbox and set_radio together deprecate check
column46: added method statefulbrowser.download_link, which will download the contents of a link to a file without changing the state of the browser.
column47: statefulbrowser.form will raise an attributeerror instead of returning none if no form has been selected yet. note that statefulbrowser.get_current_form still returns none for backward compatibility.
column48: we do not rely on beautifulsoup s default choice of html parser. instead, we now specify lxml as default. as a consequence, the default setting requires lxml as a dependency.
column49: the version number now appears in a single place in the source code.
column50: statefulbrowser.follow_link, statefulbrowser.submit_selected and the new statefulbrowser.download_link now sets the referer: http header to the page from which the link is followed.
column51: python 2.6 and 3.3 are no longer supported.

column2: the onehottransactions has been deprecated and replaced by the transactionencoder. (#332
column3: a refit parameter was added to stacking classes , to support classifiers and regressors that follow the scikit-learn api but are not compatible with scikit-learn's clone function.
column4: parallel execution in mlxtend.feature_selection.sequentialfeatureselector and mlxtend.feature_selection.exhaustivefeatureselector is now performed over different feature subsets instead of the different cross-validation folds to better utilize machines with multiple processors if the number of features is large .
column5: the same change mentioned above is now applied to other stacking estimators, including stackingclassifier, stackingcvclassifier and stackingregressor.
column6: added support for merging the meta features with the original input features in stackingregressor like it is already supported in the other stacking classes.
column7: replaced old neuralnetmlp by more streamlined multilayerperceptron ; now also with softmax in the output layer and categorical cross-entropy loss.
column8: sequential feature selection algorithms were unified into a single sequentialfeatureselector class with parameters to enable floating selection and toggle between forward and backward selection.
column9: a meaningful error message is now raised when a cross-validation generator is used with sequentialfeatureselector.
column10: the sequentialfeatureselector is now also compatible with pandas dataframes and uses dataframe column-names for more interpretable feature subset reports.
column11: the stackingclassifier has a new parameter average_probas that is set to true by default to maintain the current behavior. a deprecation warning was added though, and it will default to false in future releases ; average_probas=false will result in stacking of the level-1 predicted probabilities rather than averaging these.
column12: the plot_confusion_matrix function now has the ability to show normalized confusion matrix coefficients in addition to or instead of absolute confusion matrix coefficients with or without a colorbar. the text display method has been changed so that the full range of the colormap is used. the default size is also now set based on the number of classes.
column13: improved mlxtend.text.generalize_duplcheck to remove duplicates and prevent endless looping issue.
column14: the previously deprecated onehottransactions has been removed in favor of the transactionencoder.
column15: the sequentialfeatureselector estimator in mlxtend.feature_selection now is safely stoppable mid-process by control+c, and deprecated print_progress in favor of a more tunable verbose parameter
column16: the n_folds parameter of the stackingcvclassifier was changed to cv and can now accept any kind of cross validation technique that is available from scikit-learn. for example, stackingcvclassifier) or stackingcvclassifier) .
column17: replaced .rstrip in mlxtend.file_io.find_filegroups with more robust regex.
column18: fixed an issue with learning curves that caused the performance metrics to be reversed
column19: the 'support' column returned by frequent_patterns.association_rules was changed to compute the support of "antecedant union consequent", and new antecedant support' and 'consequent support' column were added to avoid ambiguity.
column20: improve the runtime performance for the apriori frequent itemset generating function when low_memory=true. setting low_memory=false is still faster for small itemsets, but low_memory=true can be much faster for large itemsets and requires less memory. also, input validation for apriori, fpgrowthandfpmaxtakes a significant amount of time when input pandas dataframe is large; this is now dramatically reduced when input contains boolean values , which is the case when usingtransactionencoder`.
column21: allow the onehottransactions to be cloned via scikit-learn's clone function, which is required by e.g., scikit-learn's featureunion or gridsearchcv .
column22: mean_centering function is now a class that creates meancenterer objects that can be used to fit data via the fit method, and center data at the column means via the transform and fit_transform method.
column23: the tensorflow estimator have been removed from mlxtend, since tensorflow has now very convenient ways to build on estimators, which render those implementations obsolete.
column24: all plotting functions have been moved to mlxtend.plotting for compatibility reasons with continuous integration services and to make the installation of matplotlib optional for users of mlxtend's core functionality
column25: because of complications in pr , python 2.7 was now dropped; since official support for python 2.7 by the python software foundation is ending in approx. 12 months anyways, this re-focussing will hopefully free up some developer time with regard to not having to worry about backward compatibility
column26: sequentialfeatureselecor's k_features now accepts a string argument "best" or "parsimonious" for more "automated" feature selection. for instance, if "best" is provided, the feature selector will return the feature subset with the best cross-validation performance. if "parsimonious" is provided as an argument, the smallest feature subset that is within one standard error of the cross-validation performance will be selected. #238
column27: itemsets generated with apriori are now frozensets
column28: two new functions, vectorspace_orthonormalization and vectorspace_dimensionality were added to mlxtend.math to use the gram-schmidt process to convert a set of linearly independent vectors into a set of orthonormal basis vectors, and to compute the dimensionality of a vectorspace, respectively.
column29: apriori code is faster due to optimization in onehot transformation and the amount of candidates generated by the apriori algorithm.
column30: the onehottransactions class is now more memory efficient as it uses boolean arrays instead of integer arrays. in addition, the onehottransactions class can be now be provided with sparse argument to generate sparse representations of the onehot matrix to further improve memory efficiency.
column31: correct handling of input arguments markers and colors
column32: raises a more informative error if a sparsedataframe is passed to apriori and the dataframe has integer column names that don't start with 0 due to current limitations of the sparsedataframe implementation in pandas.
column33: the eigenvectors maybe have not been sorted in certain edge cases if solver was 'eigen' in principalcomponentanalysis and lineardiscriminantanalysis.
column34: the skip_if_stuck parameter was removed from sequentialfeatureselector in favor of a more efficient implementation comparing the conditional inclusion/exclusion results to the performances of previously sampled feature sets that were cached #237
column35: fixed a bug in classifier.softmaxregression where the mean values of the offsets were used to update the bias units rather than their sum
column36: changes to stackingcvclassifier and stackingcvregressor such that first-level models are allowed to generate output of non-numeric type.
column37: mlxtend.pandas.standardizing became mlxtend.preprocessing.standardizing and now supports both numpy arrays and pandas dataframes; also, now ddof parameters to set the degrees of freedom when calculating the standard deviation
column38: raises an informative error message if predict or predict_meta_features is called prior to calling the fit method in stackingregressor and stackingcvregressor.
column39: renamed the refit parameter of both the stackingclassifier and stackingcvclassifier to use_clones to be more explicit and less misleading.
column40: an association_rules function is implemented that allows to generate rules based on a list of frequent itemsets .
column41: the fit method of the exhaustivefeatureselector now optionally accepts **fit_params for the estimator that is used for the feature selection.
column42: densetransformer now doesn't raise and error if the input array is not sparse
column43: the plot_decision_regions function now automatically determines the optimal setting based on the feature dimensions and supports anti-aliasing. the old res parameter has been deprecated.
column44: new features
column45: new features
column46: new features
column47: new features
column48: new features
column49: new features
column50: new features
column51: new features
column52: new features
column53: new features
column54: new features
column55: new features
column56: new features
column57: new features
column58: new features
column59: new features
column60: new features
column61: new features
column62: new features
column63: new features
column64: new features
column65: new features
column66: new features
column67: new features
column68: dataset are now saved as compressed .txt or .csv files rather than being imported as python objects
column69: utils.counter now accepts a name variable to help distinguish between multiple counters, time precision can be set with the 'precision' kwarg and the new attribute end_time holds the time the last iteration completed.
column70: stackingclassifier and stackingcvclassifiernow have a decision_function method, which serves as a preferred choice over predict_proba in calculating roc_auc and average_precision scores when the meta estimator is a linear model or support vector classifier.
column71: nose is not required to use the library
column72: the fit method of the sequentialfeatureselector now optionally accepts **fit_params for the estimator that is used for the feature selection.
column73: replaced plot_decision_regions colors by a colorblind-friendly palette and adds contour lines for decision regions.
column74: added new tensorflow variable initialization syntax to guarantee compatibility with tensorflow 1.0
column75: allow stackingcvclassifier to work with sparse matrices when use_features_in_secondary=true
column76: the sequentialfeatureselector now accepts custom feature names via the fit method for more interpretable feature subset reports.
column77: fixed an issue with a missing import in mlxtend.plotting.plot_confusion_matrix.
column78: mlxtend.pandas.minmax_scaling became mlxtend.preprocessing.minmax_scaling and also supports numpy arrays now
column79: fixes bug to allow the correct use of refit=false in stackingregressor and stackingcvregressor by selay01)
column80: fixed a bug where the sequentialfeatureselector selected a feature subset larger than then specified via the k_features tuple max-value #213
column81: made math.num_combinations and math.num_permutations numerically stable for large numbers of combinations and permutations .
column82: fixes and issue in mlxtend.plotting.plot_confusion_matrix, where the font-color choice for medium-dark cells was not ideal and hard to read. #588 via sohrabtowfighi)
column83: fixed a problem when a tuple-range was provided as argument to the sequentialfeatureselector's k_features parameter and the scoring metric was more negative than -1 (wahutch](link
column84: added a support_only to the association_rules function, which allow constructing association rules for cropped input dataframes that don't contain a complete set of antecedent and consequent support values.
column85: added preprocessing.copytransformer, a mock class that returns copies of imput arrays via transform and fit_transform
column86: stackingcvclassifier and stackingcvregressor now have a new drop_last_proba parameter. it drops the last "probability" column in the feature set since if true, because it is redundant: p = 1 - p + p + ... + p. this can be useful for meta-classifiers that are sensitive to perfectly collinear features.
column87: default parameter to ignore invisible files for mlxtend.file_io.find.
column88: the plot_confusion_matrix.py now also accepts a matplotlib figure and axis as input to which the confusion matrix plot can be added.
column89: overall performance improvements of estimators due to code clean-up and refactoring
column90: raise a attributeerror with "not fitted" message in sequentialfeatureselector if transform or get_metric_dict are called prior to fit
column91: the parameters for stackingclassifier, stackingcvclassifier, stackingregressor, stackingcvregressor, and ensemblevoteclassifier can now be tuned using scikit-learn's gridsearchcv
column92: cast selected feature subsets in the sequentialfeautureselector as sets to prevent the iterator from getting stuck if the k_idx are different permutations of the same combination .
column93: added shuffle and random seed parameter to stochastic gradient descent classifier.
column94: implemented both use_clones and fit_base_estimators for ensemblevoteclassifier and stackingclassifier.
column95: new function for creating multiple 2x2 contigency from model predictions arrays that can be used in multiple mcnemar tests or cochran's q or f tests, etc.
column96: gradient descent and stochastic gradient descent perceptron was changed to adaline
column97: fixes a bug in mlxtend.plotting.plot_pca_correlation_graph that caused the explaind variances not summing up to 1. also, improves the runtime performance of the correlation computation and adds a missing function argument for the explained variances if users provide their own principal components.
column98: raise meaningful error messages if pandas dataframes or python lists of lists are fed into the stackingcvclassifer as a fit arguments .
column99: now uses the latest joblib library under the hood for multiprocessing instead of sklearn.externals.joblib.
column100: make sure that if the 'svd' mode is used in pca, the number of eigenvalues is the same as when using 'eigen'
column101: the new store_train_meta_features attribute and pred_meta_features method for the stackingcvregressor were also added to the stackingregressor, stackingclassifier, and stackingcvclassifier
column102: new print_progress parameter for all generalized models and multi-layer neural networks for printing time elapsed, eta, and the current cost of the current epoch
column103: sequentialfeatureselector now correctly accepts a none argument for the scoring parameter to infer the default scoring metric from scikit-learn classifiers and regressors .
column104: allow stackingclassifier to work with sparse matrices when use_features_in_secondary=true
column105: plot_decision_regions now supports plotting decision regions for more than 2 training features #189, via james bourbeau).
column106: the bias_variance_decomp function now supports optional fit_params for the estimators that are fit on bootstrap samples.
column107: due to refactoring of the estimator classes, the init_weights parameter of the fit methods was globally renamed to init_params
column108: accept an existing axes via the ax argument
column109: feature_selection.sequentialfeatureselector now supports the selection of k_features using a tuple to specify a "min-max" k_features range
column110: a new feature_importance_permuation function to compute the feature importance in classifiers and regressors via the permutation importance method
column111: added parameters linestyles and markers to mlxtend.matplotlib.enrichment_plot
column112: added an optional decay parameter to the tf_classifier.tfmultilayerperceptron classifier for adaptive learning via an exponential decay of the learning rate eta
column113: adds new mlxtend.classifier.onerclassifier class, a simple rule-based classifier that is often used as a performance baseline or simple interpretable model. (#726
column114: fixed documentation of iris_data under iris.py by adding a note about differences in the iris data in r and uci machine learning repo.
column115: added confusion matrix functions to create and plot confusion matrices
column116: the columnselector now has a drop_axis argument to use it in pipelines with countvectorizers.
column117: the changelog for the current development version is available at link
column118: fixed issue when class labels were provided to the ensemblevoteclassifier when refit was set to false.
column119: changed the default solver in principalcomponentanalysis to 'svd' instead of 'eigen' to improve numerical stability.
column120: allow stackingcvregressor to work with sparse matrices when use_features_in_secondary=true
column121: fixed typos in autompg and wine datasets .
column122: due to new features, restructuring, and better scikit-learn support the stackingcvregressor's meta regressor is now being accessed via 'meta_regressor__* in the parameter grid. e.g., if a randomforestregressor as meta- egressor was previously tuned via 'randomforestregressor__n_estimators', this has now changed to 'meta_regressor__n_estimators'.
column123: added ignore_substring parameter to mlxtend.file_io.find_filegroups and find_files.
column124: mlxtend.evaluate.feature_importance_permutation now correctly accepts scoring functions with proper function signature as metric argument. #528
column125: the feature_selection.columnselector now also supports column names of type int if the input is a pandas dataframe. (#500 via tetrar124
column126: adds a pca.e_vals_normalized_ attribute to pca for storing the eigenvalues also in normalized form; this is commonly referred to as variance explained ratios. #545
column127: unified init_params parameter for fit functions to continue training where the algorithm left off
column128: new style parameter and improved axis scaling in mlxtend.evaluate.plot_learning_curves
column129: added a new mlxtend.evaluate.ftest function to perform an f-test for comparing the accuracies of two or more classification models.
column130: automatically performs mean centering for pca solver 'svd' such that using svd is always equal to using the covariance matrix approach #545
column131: the mlxtend.preprocessing.standardize function now optionally returns the parameters, which are estimated from the array, for re-use. a further improvement makes the standardize function smarter in order to avoid zero-division errors
column132: adds a new function, mlxtend.evaluate.bias_variance_decomp that decomposes the loss of a regressor or classifier into bias and variance terms.
column133: added text utilities with name generalization function.
column134: added combinations and permutations estimators.
column135: all feature index tuples in sequentialfeatureselector or now in sorted order.
column136: adds new create_counterfactual method for creating counterfactuals to explain model predictions.
column137: added option for random weight initialization to logistic regression classifier and updated l2 regularization
column138: the loss in logisticregression for logging purposes didn't include the l2 penalty for the first weight in the weight vector . however, since this loss function was only used for logging purposes, and the gradient remains correct, this does not have an effect on the main code.
column139: added numerically stable ols methods which uses qr decomposition and singular value decomposition methods to linearregression in mlxtend.regressor.linear_regression.
column140: added optional groups parameter to sequentialfeatureselector and exhaustivefeatureselector fit methods for forwarding to sklearn cv
column141: fixes a bug where the stackingcvclassifier's meta features were not stored in the original order when shuffle=true
column142: new tfsoftmaxregression classifier using tensorflow
column143: the dataframe index of apriori results are now unique and ordered.
column144: the vectors from svd in principalcomponentanalysis are now being scaled so that the eigenvalues via solver='eigen' and solver='svd' now store eigenvalues that have the same magnitudes.
column145: mlxtend.regression.lin_regplot automatically adds np.newaxis and works w. python lists
column146: adds a whitening parameter to principalcomponentanalysis, to optionally whiten the transformed data such that the features have unit variance.
column147: added a function to score predicted vs. target class labels evaluate.scoring
column148: all stacking estimators now raise nonfittederrors if any method for inference is called prior to fitting the estimator.
column149: added several additional checks for correct array types and more meaningful exception messages
column150: adds multiprocessing support to stackingcvregressor.
column151: new low_memory option for the apriori frequent itemset generating function. setting low_memory=false uses a substantially optimized version of the algorithm that is 3-6x faster than the original implementation .
column152: function now handles class y-class labels correctly if array is of type float
column153: exhaustivefeatureselector was modified to consume substantially less memory #195
column154: improvements to mlxtend.text.generalize_names to handle certain dutch last name prefixes .
column155: documentation built with mkdocs.
column156: added optional dropout to the tf_classifier.tfmultilayerperceptron classifier for regularization
column157: fix unreadable labels in plot_confusion_matrix for imbalanced datasets if show_absolute=true and show_normed=true.
column158: added transform and fit_transform to the ensembleclassifier.
column159: the sequentialfeatureselector now supports using pre-specified feature sets via the fixed_features parameter.
column160: other stacking estimators, including stackingclassifier, stackingcvclassifier and stackingregressor, support grid search over the regressors and even a single base regressor.
column161: permutation_test s corrected to give the proportion of permutations whose statistic is at least as extreme as the one observed.
column162: added a loadings_ attribute to principalcomponentanalysis to compute the factor loadings of the features on the principal components.
column163: added a new lift_score function in evaluate to compute lift score .
column164: the svd mode of mlxtend.feature_extraction.principalcomponentanalysis now also n-1 degrees of freedom instead of n d.o.f. when computing the eigenvalues to match the behavior of eigen. #595
column165: minibatch learning for classifier.logisticregression, classifier.adaline, and regressor.linearregression plus streamlined api
column166: new tensorflow estimator for linear regression
column167: added a zoom_factor parameter to the mlxten.plotting.plot_decision_region function that allows users to zoom in and out of the decision region plots.
column168: fixes an issue with using meshgrid in no_information_rate function used by the bootstrap_point632_score function for the .632+ estimate.
column169: fixes an issue in fpmax that could lead to incorrect support values.
column170: the plot_decision_regions function now has three new parameters, scatter_kwargs, contourf_kwargs, and scatter_highlight_kwargs, that can be used to modify the plotting style.
column171: new exhaustivefeatureselector estimator in mlxtend.feature_selection for evaluating all feature combinations in a specified range
column172: fixed ensembleclassifier to return correct class labels if class labels are not integers from 0 to n.
column173: new sfs features such as the generation of pandas dataframe results tables and plotting functions
column174: the ensemblevoteclassifier has a new refit attribute that prevents refitting classifiers if refit=false to save computational time.
column175: changed regularization & lambda parameters in logisticregression to single parameter l2_lambda
column176: sequentialfeatureselector now uses np.nanmean over normal mean to support scorers that may return np.nan #211
column177: the sequentialfeatureselector now runs the continuation of the floating inclusion/exclusion as described in novovicova & kittler . note that this didn't cause any difference in performance on any of the test scenarios but could lead to better performance in certain edge cases.
column178: adds a new transformer class to mlxtend.image, eyepadalign, that aligns face images based on the location of the eyes.
column179: let fpgrowth and fpmax directly work on sparse dataframe, they were previously converted into dense numpy arrays.
column180: fpmax returns an empty data frame now instead of raising an error if the frequent itemset set is empty.
column181: added rstrip parameter to mlxtend.file_io.find_filegroups to allow trimming of base names.
column182: disable input validation for stackingcvclassifier because it causes issues if pipelines are used as input. #606
column183: added sequential backward selection
column184: new mcnemar_table and mcnemar functions in evaluate to compute 2x2 contingency tables and mcnemar's test
column185: stackingcvclassifier and stackingcvregressor now support random_state parameter, which, together with shuffle, controls the randomness in the cv splitting.
column186: new onehottransactions encoder class added to the preprocessing submodule for transforming transaction data into a one-hot encoded array
column187: new function for performing cochran's q test to compare the accuracy of multiple classifiers.
column188: added an optional clone_estimator parameter to the sequentialfeatureselector that defaults to true, avoiding the modification of the original estimator objects
column189: now, the stackingcvregressor also enables grid search over the regressors and even a single base regressor. when there are level-mixed parameters, gridsearchcv will try to replace hyperparameters in a top-down order .
column190: about
column191: stackingclassifier has a new use_features_in_secondary attribute like stackingcvclassifier.
column192: added mlxtend.text.generalize_name_duplcheck function to apply mlxtend.text.generalize_names function to a pandas dataframe without creating duplicates.
column193: improved random weight initialization in perceptron, adaline, linearregression, and logisticregression
column194: switched to using raw strings for regex in mlxtend.text to prevent deprecation warning in python 3.8
column195: adds an optional class_name parameter to the confusion matrix function to display class names on the axis as tick marks.
column196: adds multiprocessing support to stackingcvclassifier.
column197: stackingclassifier and stackingregressor support multivariate targets if the underlying models do .
column198: slice data in sequential forward selection before sending to parallel backend, reducing memory consumption.
column199: use small, positive bias units in tfmultilayerperceptron's hidden layer if the activations are relus in order to avoid dead neurons
column200: added an enhancement to the existing iris_data such that both the uci repository version of the iris dataset as well as the corrected, original version of the dataset can be loaded, which has a slight difference in two data points .
column201: added a new mlxtend.evaluate.combined_ftest_5x2cv function to perform an combined 5x2cv f-test for comparing the performance of two models.
column202: fixes the mcnemar confusion matrix layout to match the convention , swapping the upper left and lower right cells.
column203: allow mlxtend estimators to be cloned via scikit-learn's clone function.
column204: fixed setup.py bug caused by the missing readme.html file
column205: new make_multiplexer_dataset function that creates a dataset generated by a n-bit boolean multiplexer for evaluating supervised learning algorithms.
column206: changed learning parameter of mlxtend.classifier.adaline to solver and added "normal equation" as closed-form solution solver
column207: new stackingcvclassifier estimator in 'mlxtend.classifier' for implementing a stacking ensemble that uses cross-validation techniques for training the meta-estimator to avoid overfitting
column208: added densetransformer for pipelines and grid search.
column209: mlxtend.frequent_patterns.apriori now supports pandas sparsedataframes to generate frequent itemsets.
column210: mlxtend.plotting.plot_decision_regions now draws decision regions correctly if more than 4 class labels are present
column211: fixed rare bug in mlp _layer_mapping functions that caused a swap between the random number generation seed when initializing weights and biases
column212: added ordinary least square regression using different solvers
column213: fixed a bug that could occur in the sequentialfeatureselector if there are similarly-well performing subsets in the floating variants .
column214: various changes in the documentation and documentation tools to fix formatting issues
column215: added support for regression estimators in sfs
column216: new function for one-hot encoding of class labels
column217: fixes a bug in bias_variance_decomp where when the mse loss was used, downcasting to integers caused imprecise results for small numbers.
column218: added adaptive learning rate to mlxtend.classifier.neuralnetmlp.
column219: the mlxtend.image.extract_face_landmarks now returns none if no facial landmarks were detected instead of an array of all zeros.
column220: added a new convenience function extract_face_landmarks based on dlib to mlxtend.image.
column221: new max_len parameter for the frequent itemset generation via the apriori function to allow for early stopping.
column222: added evaluate.permutation_test, a permutation test for hypothesis testing to test if two samples come from the same distribution. or in other words, a procedure to test the null hypothesis that that two groups are not significantly different .
column223: added a mlxtend.evaluate.bootstrap that implements the ordinary nonparametric bootstrap to bootstrap a single statistic #232
column224: fixed bug that raised an indexing error if the number of items was <= 1 when computing association rules using the conviction metric.
column225: added preprocessing module and mean_centering function.
column226: added a new mlxtend.evaluate.difference_proportions test for comparing two proportions
column227: allow arrays with 16-bit and 32-bit precision in plot_decision_regions function.
column228: added a randomholdoutsplit class to perform a random train/valid split without rotation in sequentialfeatureselector, scikit-learn gridsearchcv etc.
column229: adds a black edgecolor to plots via plotting.plot_decision_regions to make markers more distinguishable from the background in matplotlib>=2.0.
column230: fixed an deprecation error that occured with mcnemar test when using scipy 1.0.
column231: the ensemblevoteclassifier now raises a notfittederror if the estimator wasn't fit before calling predict.
column232: added a compatibility layer for scikit-learn 0.18 using the new model_selection module while maintaining backwards compatibility to scikit-learn 0.17.
column233: more rigorous type and shape checks in the evaluate.plot_decision_regions function
column234: added recursive search parameter to mlxtend.file_io.find_files.
column235: simplified code for columnselector.
column236: added mlxtend.evaluate.bootstrap_point632_score to evaluate the performance of estimators using the .632 bootstrap.
column237: adds a verbose parameter to apriori to show the current iteration number as well as the itemset size currently being sampled. (#519
column238: added rosenblatt, gradient descent, and stochastic gradient descent perceptrons.
column239: fixed an attributeerror issue when verbose > 1 in stackingclassifier
column240: new function implementing the resampled paired t-test procedure to compare the performance of two models.
column241: new function implementing the 5x2cv paired t-test procedure proposed by dieterrich to compare the performance of two models.
column242: raise attributeerror in plot_decision_regions when the x_higlight argument is a 1d array
column243: added a function fpgrowth that implements the fp-growth algorithm for mining frequent itemsets as a drop-in replacement for the existing apriori algorithm.

column2: fixed regression introduced in 3.5.2: class methods were mistaken for instance methods and thus were broken during serialization
column3: added a workaround for the importerror when used with pyinstaller and the likes
column4: adding jobs is now done exclusively through add_job the shortcuts to triggers were removed
column5: fixed a problem where bound methods added as jobs via textual references were called with an unwanted extra self argument
column6: ensured that jitter is always non-negative to prevent triggers from firing more often than intended
column7: dropped the max_runs option and run counting of jobs since it could not be implemented reliably
column8: it is now possible to add a job directly to an executor without scheduling, by omitting the trigger argument
column9: split the old scheduler class into blockingscheduler and backgroundscheduler and added integration for asyncio , gevent, tornado, twisted and qt event loops
column10: fixed regression: add_cron_job in scheduler was creating a crontrigger with the wrong parameters
column11: added better validation for the steps and ranges of different expressions in crontrigger
column12: fixed methods inherited from base class could not be executed by processpool executor
column13: fixed iso 8601 utc offset information being silently discarded from string formatted datetimes by adding support for parsing them
column14: raise a typeerror when fields with invalid names are passed to crontrigger
column15: positional weekdays are now used with the day field, not weekday.
column16: dropped official support for cpython 2.6 and 3.2 and pypy3
column17: fixed blockingscheduler and backgroundscheduler shutdown hanging after the user has erroneously tried to start it twice
column18: added the jitter options to intervaltrigger and crontrigger
column19: fixed inability to schedule wrapped functions with extra arguments when the wrapped function cannot accept them but the wrapper can
column20: added the end_date parameter to cron and interval triggers
column21: fixed _run_job_error being called with the incorrect number of arguments in most executors
column22: added the ability to pause and unpause the scheduler
column23: replaced the thread pool with a pluggable executor system
column24: added combining triggers
column25: fixed endless loop with crontrigger that may occur when the computer s clock resolution is too
column26: added __repr__ implementations to expressions, fields, triggers, and jobs to help with debugging
column27: changed defaults for cron-style jobs to be more intuitive it will now default to all minimum values for fields lower than the least significant explicitly defined field
column28: fixed a bug in cron expression lists that could cause valid firing times to be missed
column29: fixed brokenpoolerror in processpoolexecutor so that it will automatically replace the broken pool with a fresh instance
column30: the scheduler now closes the job store that is being removed, and all job stores on shutdown by default
column31: allowed jobs to be explicitly named
column32: fixed crontrigger sometimes producing fire times beyond end_date when jitter is enabled
column33: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column34: added optional job execution coalescing for situations where several executions of the job are due
column35: fixed a v1.x design flaw that caused jobs to be executed twice when the scheduler thread was woken up while still within the allowable range of their previous execution time
column36: fixed: if the scheduler is restarted, clear the stopped flag to allow jobs to be scheduled again
column37: changed asyncioscheduler to obtain the event loop in start instead of __init__, to prevent situations where the scheduler won t run because it s using a different event loop than then one currently running
column38: pinned tzlocal to a version compatible with pytz
column39: improved import logic in ref_to_obj to avoid errors in cases where traversing the path with getattr would not work
column40: fixed positional weekday expressions not working except in some edge cases
column41: added the event_job_max_instances event that indicates a job s execution was skipped due to its maximum number of concurrently running instances being reached
column42: made basescheduler.start raise a runtimeerror if running under uwsgi with threads disabled
column43: fixed @scheduled_job not working when serialization is required
column44: migrated to setuptools_scm for versioning
column45: added configurable job stores with several persistent back-ends
column46: added the time zone to the repr output of crontrigger and intervaltrigger
column47: added support for timezones
column48: fixed infinite loop in the cron trigger when an out-of-bounds value was given in an expression
column49: fixed handling of partial wrapped coroutine functions in asyncioexecutor and tornadoexecutor
column50: added an option to limit the maximum number of concurrently executing instances of the job
column51: added setuptools as an explicit requirement in install requirements
column52: made it possible to create weak references to job instances
column53: made the schedulers explicitly raise a descriptive typeerror when serialization is attempted
column54: fixed deprecation warnings on the mongodb job store and increased the minimum pymongo version to 3.0
column55: fixed builtin id erroneously used in mongodbjobstore s joblookuperror
column56: fixed zookeeper job store using backslashes instead of forward slashes for paths on windows
column57: fixed a corner case where the combination of hour and day_of_week parameters would cause incorrect timing for a cron trigger
column58: added support for creating a crontrigger from a crontab expression
column59: fixed pickling problems with persistent jobs when upgrading from 3.0.x
column60: fixed valueerror when the target callable has a default keyword argument that wasn t overridden
column61: added the event_job_submitted event that indicates a job has been submitted to its executor.
column62: fixed time difference calculation to take into account shifts to and from daylight saving time
column63: fixed crontrigger s range expressions sometimes allowing values outside the given range
column64: dropped the shelve job store because it could not work with the new job store system
column65: all triggers now accept dates in string form
column66: allowed unicode function references in python 2
column67: added the possibility to listen for job events on a scheduler
column68: a wider variety of target callables can now be scheduled so that the jobs are still serializable
column69: fixed cron trigger always coalescing missed run times into a single run time
column70: removed autogenerated api documentation for modules which are not part of the public api, as it might confuse some users
column71: fixed start date getting set too far in the future with a timezone different from the local one
column72: fixed debug logging displaying the next wakeup time in the utc timezone instead of the scheduler s configured timezone
column73: fixed overflowerror on qt scheduler when the wait time is very long
column74: fixed compatibility with pymongo 3.0
column75: dropped support for python 3.4
column76: fixed overflowerror on windows when the wait time is too long
column77: added support for named months in crontrigger month expressions
column78: to find out how to migrate your application from a previous version of apscheduler, see the migration section.
column79: added a standalone mode that runs the scheduler in the calling thread
column80: fixed memory leak due to a cyclic reference when jobs raise exceptions
column81: dropped support for python 3.3
column82: cancel all pending futures when asyncioexecutor is shut down
column83: switched to pypy 1.9 for pypy compatibility testing
column84: fixed callable name detection for methods in old style classes
column85: updated setup.cfg for compatibility with distutils2/packaging
column86: added an optional start time for cron-style jobs
column87: fixed table creation with sqlalchemyjobstore on mysql/innodb
column88: fixed output from scheduler.print_jobs which did not previously output a line ending at the end
column89: changed crontrigger constructor argument names to match those in scheduler
column90: the tornado scheduler now uses tornadoexecutor as its default executor
column91: fixed potential where clause error in the sqlalchemy job store when a subclass uses more than one search condition
column92: added the ability to modify, reschedule, pause and resume jobs
column93: fixed wrong run time being set for date trigger when the timezone isn t the same as the local one
column94: the asyncio and tornado schedulers can now run jobs targeting coroutine functions are supported)
column95: attempting to serialize a non-serializable job now raises a helpful exception during serialization. thanks to jeremy morgan for pointing this out.
column96: allowed configuration of misfire grace times on a per-job basis
column97: examples, documentation sources and unit tests are now packaged in the source distribution
column98: fixed some events missing from apscheduler.events.__all__ and apscheduler.events.events_all
column99: fixed scheduling of bound methods on persistent job stores
column100: maximum run count can be configured for all jobs, not just those using interval-based scheduling
column101: fixed cron style jobs getting wrong default values
column102: deprecated the various version related variables in the apscheduler module
column103: fixed the persistent.py example by shutting down the scheduler on ctrl+c
column104: added the ability to specify the table schema for sqlalchemyjobstore
column105: edit on github
column106: resume_job methods in basescheduler and the corresponding methods in the job class
column107: added the week option for cron schedules

column2: reorganized and extended documentation.
column3: for backwards compatibility, functions are still mostly supported, but mixing functions and coroutines won t work in some inheritance scenarios.
column4: renamed serve and connect s klass argument to create_protocol to reflect that it can also be a callable. for backwards compatibility, klass is still supported.
column5: rewrote http handling for simplicity and performance.
column6: in order to avoid stranding projects built upon an earlier version, the previous behavior can be restored by passing legacy_recv=true to serve, connect, websocketserverprotocol, or websocketclientprotocol. legacy_recv isn t documented in their signatures but isn t scheduled for deprecation either.
column7: connect supports overriding host and port.
column8: in august 2017, firefox and chrome support it, but not safari and ie.
column9: added support for customizing handling of incoming connections with process_request.
column10: updated documentation with await and async syntax from python 3.5.
column11: fixed creating a client or a server with an existing unix socket.
column12: added process_request and select_subprotocol arguments to serve and websocketserverprotocol to customize process_request and select_subprotocol without subclassing websocketserverprotocol.
column13: use local_address in servers and remote_address in clients instead of host and port.
column14: convenience imports from the websockets module are performed lazily. while this is supported by python, static code analysis tools such as mypy are unable to understand the behavior.
column15: changed the origins argument to represent the lack of an origin with none rather than ''.
column16: the ping as in ping = await websocket.ping used to be canceled when the connection is closed, so that await ping raised cancellederror. now await ping raises connectionclosed like other public apis.
column17: serve can be used as an asynchronous context manager on python 3.5.1.
column18: fixed a regression in 5.0 that broke some invocations of serve and connect.
column19: version 6.0 introduces the headers class for managing http headers and changes several public apis:
column20: added support for providing and checking origin.
column21: added host, port and secure attributes on protocols.
column22: when a release contains backwards-incompatible api changes, the major version is increased, else the minor version is increased. patch versions are only for fixing regressions shortly after a release.
column23: version 8.0 deprecates the host , port , and secure attributes of websocketcommonprotocol.
column24: improved support for sending fragmented messages by accepting asynchronous iterators in send.
column25: if you re passing a process_request argument to serve or websocketserverprotocol, or if you re overriding process_request in a subclass, define it with async def instead of def.
column26: when implementing a server, which is the more popular use case, there s no strong reason to handle such exceptions. let them bubble up, terminate the handler coroutine, and the server will simply ignore them.
column27: since headers and http.client.httpmessage provide similar apis, this change won t affect most of the code dealing with http headers.
column28: updated documentation with new features from python 3.6.
column29: version 8.0 drops compatibility with python 3.4 and 3.5.
column30: a library for building websocket servers and clients in python with a focus on correctness and simplicity.
column31: headers and multiplevalueserror were moved from websockets.http to websockets.datastructures. if you re using them, you should adjust the import path.
column32: added connectionclosedok and connectionclosederror subclasses of connectionclosed to tell apart normal connection termination from errors.
column33: stopped leaking pending tasks when cancel is called on a connection while it s being closed.
column34: connect can be used as an asynchronous context manager on python 3.5.1.
column35: improved handling of multiple http headers with the same name.
column36: compression should improve performance but it increases ram and cpu use.
column37: the client, server, protocol, and auth modules were moved from the websockets package to websockets.legacy sub-package, as part of an upcoming refactoring. despite the name, they re still fully supported. the refactoring should be a transparent upgrade for most uses when it s available. the legacy implementation will be preserved according to the backwards-compatibility policy.
column38: added loop argument to connect and serve.
column39: added timeout, max_size, and max_queue arguments to connect and serve.
column40: ping and pong support data passed as str in addition to bytes.
column41: if you want to disable compression, add compression=none when calling serve or connect.
column42: this prevents confusion with ping_timeout.
column43: a plain http request now receives a 426 upgrade required response and doesn t log a stack trace.
column44: only documented apis are public. undocumented apis are considered private. they may change at any time.
column45: the request_headers and response_headers attributes of websocketcommonprotocol are headers instead of http.client.httpmessage.
column46: added compatibility with python 3.5.
column47: functions defined in the http module now return http headers as headers instead of lists of pairs.
column48: added compatibility with python 3.9.
column49: added new examples in the documentation.
column50: websockets is intended for production use. therefore, stability is a goal.
column51: allowed customizing handshake request and response http headers.
column52: unix_serve can be used as an asynchronous context manager on python 3.5.1.
column53: added compatibility with python 3.7.
column54: iterating on incoming messages no longer raises an exception when the connection terminates with close code 1001 .
column55: if you depend on such tools, use the real import path, which can be found in the api documentation:
column56: version 7.0 renames the timeout argument of serve and connect to close_timeout .
column57: version 7.0 changes how a server terminates connections when it s closed with websocketserver.close .
column58: for backwards compatibility, timeout is still supported.
column59: added support for iris in addition to uris.
column60: functions defined in the handshake module now receive headers in argument instead of get_header or set_header functions. this affects libraries that rely on low-level apis.
column61: if you re upgrading from 2.x or earlier, please read this carefully.
column62: allowed extra_headers to override server and user-agent headers.
column63: now it raises a connectionclosed exception instead. this is more pythonic. the previous code can be simplified to:
column64: an invalid response status code during connect now raises invalidstatuscode with a code attribute.
column65: restored compatibility with mypy.
column66: improved error messages when a required http header is missing.
column67: version 9.0 moves or deprecates several apis.
column68: added compatibility with python 3.8.
column69: added support for sending fragmented messages.
column70: if you re upgrading from 1.x or earlier, please read this carefully.
column71: changed websocketserver.close to perform a proper closing handshake instead of failing the connection.
column72: websockets now sends ping frames at regular intervals and closes the connection if it doesn t receive a matching pong frame.
column73: added the sockets attribute to the return value of serve.
column74: added an optional c extension to speed up low-level operations.
column75: restored the ability to pass a socket with the sock parameter of serve.
column76: made read and write buffer sizes configurable.
column77: prevented processing of incoming frames after failing the connection.
column78: when possible with reasonable effort, we preserve backwards-compatibility for five years after the release that introduced the change.
column79: concurrent calls lead to non-deterministic behavior because there are no guarantees about which coroutine will receive which message.
column80: previously, it could be a function or a coroutine.
column81: added local_address and remote_address attributes on protocols.
column82: clarified that the closing handshake can be initiated by the client.
column83: closed open connections with code 1001 when a server shuts down.
column84: added close codes 1012, 1013, and 1014.
column85: previously, connections handlers were canceled. now, connections are closed with close code 1001 . from the perspective of the connection handler, this is the same as if the remote endpoint was disconnecting. this removes the need to prepare for cancellederror in connection handlers.
column86: provided access to handshake request and response http headers.
column87: version 4.0 was vulnerable to denial of service by memory exhaustion because it didn t enforce max_size when decompressing compressed messages .
column88: ensured compatibility with python 3.6.
column89: these apis used to be functions. now they re coroutines.
column90: fixed issues with the packaging of the 9.0 release.
column91: version 4.0 enables compression with the permessage-deflate extension.
column92: added support for limiting message size.
column93: the framing, handshake, headers, http, and uri modules in the websockets package are deprecated. these modules provided low-level apis for reuse by other websocket implementations, but that never happened. keeping these apis public makes it more difficult to improve websockets for no actual benefit.
column94: professionally-supported websockets is available with the tidelift subscription.
column95: websocketcommonprotocol instances can be used as asynchronous iterators on python 3.6. they yield incoming messages.
column96: use protocol.state.name instead of protocol.state_name.
column97: while we value stability, we value progress more. when an improvement requires changing a public api, we make the change and document it in this changelog.
column98: connect performs http basic auth when the uri contains credentials.
column99: avoided crashing on concurrent writes on slow connections.
column100: prevented spurious log messages about connectionclosed exceptions in keepalive ping task. if you were using ping_timeout=none as a workaround, you can remove it.
column101: getting started
column102: aligned maximum cookie size with popular web browsers.
column103: version 8.0 adds the reason phrase to the return type of the low-level api read_response .
column104: version 4.0 drops compatibility with python 3.3.
column105: added unix_connect for connecting to unix sockets.
column106: version 7.0 changes how a ping that hasn t received a pong yet behaves when the connection is closed.
column107: fixed host header sent when connecting to an ipv6 address.
column108: improved api documentation.
column109: restored the ability to import websocketprotocolerror from websockets.
column110: send, ping, and pong support bytes-like types bytearray and memoryview in addition to bytes.
column111: for enterprise
column112: version 2.0 introduces a backwards-incompatible change in the send, ping, and pong apis.
column113: fixed issues with the packaging of the 4.0 release.
column114: you can restore the previous behavior by adding the following line at the beginning of connection handlers:
column115: aliases provide backwards compatibility for all previously public apis.
column116: added support for subprotocols.
column117: added basic_auth_protocol_factory to enforce http basic auth on the server side.
column118: added unix_serve for listening on unix sockets.
column119: connect handles redirects from the server during the handshake.
column120: added a faq to the documentation.
