column121: reduced noise in logs caused by connection resets.
column122: added flow control for outgoing data.
column123: set the close code and reason more consistently.
column124: process_request now receives a headers instead of a http.client.httpmessage in the request_headers argument.
column125: improved documentation.
column126: improved documentation.
column127: version 5.0 fixes a security issue introduced in version 4.0.
column128: version 9.0 may require changes if you use static code analysis tools.
column129: added the closed property to protocols.
column130: version 8.0 expects process_request to be a coroutine.
column131: strengthened connection termination by simplifying the implementation.
column132: documented how to optimize memory usage.
column133: the raw_request_headers and raw_response_headers attributes of websocketcommonprotocol are removed. use raw_items instead.

column1: Changelog - LSP Mode - LSP support for Emacs
column2: lsp-define-stdio-client and lsp-define-tcp-client are replaced with lsp-register-client
column3: imenu support is now handled asynchronously .
column4: breaking change: bindings for commands under s were moved under w for better compatibility with spacemacs
column5: performed several fixes to make sure lsp-mode is working fine with emacs 28 native compilation.
column6: lsp automatically enables and configures company-lsp, lsp-ui, yasnippet, or flymake if they are present so no additional configuration is needed except installing the packages. that behavior could be disabled by setting lsp-auto-configure to nil.
column7: perform willsavewaituntil synchronously and with shorter timeout
column8: lsp rely on projectile or project.el now only for suggesting project root. once you open new file in a project and start lsp it will provide several options. once you select a root it will be persisted and used for the next sessions.
column9: language servers can now be disabled with the variable lsp-disabled-clients.
column10: support for theia-based semantic highlighting has been removed in favor of the semantictokens protocol specified by lsp 3.16. to enable it, set lsp-enable-semantic-highlighting to t.
column11: introduced new command lsp-describe-session which replaces the existing one lsp-capabilities. the command lists the folders that are part of the workspace and the servers that are associated with the corresponding folder.
column12: dropped support for company-lsp, the suggested provider is company-capf.
column13: add default keybindings and which-key integration
column14: add support for textdocument/preparerename. if supported by the language server, all renaming operations will be tested for validity.
column15: lsp-mode ships with several predefined servers located in lsp-clients.el which does not require additional package. for the more complex language servers like eclipse jdt, ccls, cquery and haskell we still require separate package due to relatively high code base.
column16: lsp-mode now logs to buffer *lsp-log*, instead of *messages*. this can be controlled with the variable lsp-log-max .
column17: added lsp-modeline-workspace-status-mode and option to disable it via lsp-modeline-workspace-status-enable.
column18: lsp-mode now have single entry point lsp for all language and based on the major mode starts the corresponding language servers.
column19: lsp autoconfiguration adds company-lsp to the list of company backends instead of overriding it.
column20: implement unified way to handle recurring lsp features
column21: add variable lsp-enabled-clients, which lets users set which defined clients are allowed to be used.
column22: add lsp-dired-mode - integration between dired and lsp-mode
column23: implement deferred semantic highlighting
column24: started new set of integration tests without using ecukes
column25: accommodate the new :end-column and :end-column from flycheck
column26: the variable lsp-print-io, when non-nil will cause lsp-mode to log all messages to and from the server to a unique *lsp-io* buffer for every project root. these logs can be saved to a file and viewed using the lsp inspector.
column27: implement automatic downloading facilities and implemented auto-download for typescript-language-server, javascript-typescript-stdio and json-language-server.
column28: add api level support for folding ranges. folding support for origami.el support is implemented by package lsp-origami.
column29: made with material for mkdocs
column30: breaking change: use alist instead of hast-tables for lsp-gopls-env and lsp-yaml-schemas.
column31: add basic support for style semantic highlighting
column32: add breadcrumb on headerline . disabled by default, can be enabled via lsp-headerline-breadcrumb-enable
column33: tramp implementation now uses tramp process instead of tcp sockets .
column34: support for multiple language servers per single file and workspace.
column35: add variable lsp-symbol-highlighting-skip-current, which lets the user skip the current symbol when a given symbol is being highlighted.
column36: if lsp-print-performance is non-nil, lsp-mode will log a corresponding performance trace to *lsp-log* for every message to and from the server.
column37: reimplemented textdocument/signaturehelp - now the signature is displayed in lv buffer.
column38: added lsp-find-definition-mouse and bound to c-<down-mouse-1>
column39: moved completion features to lsp-completion.el
column40: removed support for theia semantic highlighting protocol
column41: add hook lsp-after-uninitialized-hook, which stores the list of functions called after a language server has been uninitialized.
column42: lsp-mode displays information about the running server and it's status in the modeline.
column43: lsp-mode handles automatically server failures by asking the user whether he/she wants to restart the server.
column44: added support for r language server
column45: implemented client side bindings for the protocol.
column46: implemented special handling of clangd echo area.
column47: add lsp-headerline-breadcrumb-mode which shows a breadcrumb with the document symbols on headerline when enabled.
column48: support document links. this can be controlled using the variable lsp-enable-links.
column49: added support for hdl checker server to lsp-vhdl
column50: add lsp-headerline-breadcrumb-icons-enable to disable breadcrumb icons.
column51: add new function lsp-disconnect.
column52: add modeline code actions support . enabled by default, use lsp-modeline-code-actions-enable to disable it.
column53: fixed xref support for emacs 27+
column54: add support for insert/replace when performing completion. when using company pressing c-u ret will perform the alternative action .
column55: improve lsp-mode completion performance by suppressing non completion related features when completion is active.
column56: added support for powershell language server.
column57: enable headerline breadcrumb by default
column58: added setting to disable additional text edits .
column59: removed all synchronous calls from the server startup.
column60: support multiple signatures while displaying eldoc text. add variable lsp-signature-render-all, which when non-nil forces lsp-mode to only show the current active signature.
column61: used view mode for metals doctor buffer
column62: added emacs 26.x to ci
column63: add support for workspace/configuration.
column64: add lua language server, lua-lsp and improve emmylua.
column65: add support for crystal via scry .
column66: added support for passing environment variables to language servers
column67: if available, using the native json api introduced in emacs 27.1.
column68: implemented debug adapter protocol support for metals
column69: changed flymake to report the errors immediately after they arrive instead of waiting flymake to call lsp-mode.
column70: migrated lsp-mode to use plists.
column71: introduced lsp-diagnostics-mode.
column72: add debounce when server does not support incremental updates.
column73: add lsp-auto-save-changed-buffers which save the changed buffers after any text edit operation by lsp-mode.
column74: implemented inlay hints for rust analyzer .
column75: implemented support for running the language server in docker container over local files.
column76: created an integration test suite for lsp-mode .
column77: added erlang support via erlangls
column78: changed lsp-mode settings to more sensible defaults.

column239: dali offers both performance and flexibility of accelerating different data pipelines , as a single library, that can be easily integrated into different deep learning training and inference applications.
column240: improved support for labels in videoreader - now the user can provide labels for selected frame ranges as well as obtain frame numbers and timestamps.
column241: dali supports multiple input data formats that are commonly used in computer vision deep learning applications, for example, jpeg images, raw formats, lightning memory-mapped database , recordio and tfrecord. the flexibility of input data formats allows portability of training workflows across different frameworks and models, and helps to avoid intermediate data conversion steps. dali enables better code reuse and maintainability with optimized building blocks and support for different data formats.
column242: removed the deprecated use of ltrb in bboxrandomcrop .

column321: nvidia data loading library accelerates the preprocessing of input data for deep learning applications. by offloading augmentations onto gpus, dali addresses performance bottlenecks in today s computer vision deep learning applications that include complex, multi-stage data augmentation steps. with dali beta release, deep learning researchers can scale training performance on image classification models such as resnet-50 with mxnet, tensorflow, and pytorch across amazon web services p3 8 gpu instances or dgx-1 systems with volta architecture. framework developers will have less duplication due to better code reuse and maintainability.

column357: on dense gpu systems, deep learning applications can be significantly bottlenecked on the cpu, limiting the overall performance and scalability of training and inference tasks. dali enables offloading key deep learning augmentation steps on to gpus, alleviating cpu bottleneck on the deep learning preprocessing pipelines. this results in out-of-box performance of overall training workflow and efficient utilization of multi-gpu resources on the system.
column358: to upgrade to dali 0.24.0 from an older version of dali, follow the installation and usage information in the dali user guide.
column359: improved the resize operator to support bilinear and triangular resampling. this improves the quality during aggressive down-scaling.

column370: added the images argument for the cocoreader, which allows for the custom ordering of images and fixed a bug in the segmentation data parsing .

column2: deprecated
column3: deprecated
column4: actor message received and completed in x ms log messages are now logged with the debug level instead of info level. this improves throughput and makes logging much less verbose.
column5: windows is now supported !
column6: pending interrupt messages are now removed from pika s queue before cancel is called. this fixes an issue where an atrributeerror was sometimes raised on worker shutdown.
column7: rabbitmq and watch extra dependencies are only installed when they are explicitly required now.
column8: sys.std{err,out} are now redirected to stderr and line-buffered.
column9: pika is now pinned to >=0.10,<0.12.
column10: logging statements before and after an actor is called.
column11: urlrabbitmqbroker is now a factory function that creates instances of rabbitmqbroker.
column12: exec is now used to reload the main process on source code changes when the --watch flag is enabled.
column13: support for forking and running arbitrary functions .
column14: pip install dramatiq now installs rabbitmq and watch deps.
column15: dramatiq is now licensed under the lgpl.
column16: changed the default max retries value from none to 20, meaning tasks are now retried for up to about 30 days before they re dead-lettered by default.
column17: module import path is now prepended to search path rather than appended. this fixes an issue where importing modules with the same name as modules from site-packages would end up importing the modules from site-packages.
column18: lua files are now properly distributed with the package.
column19: bumped pika to version 0.12. because of this change, the interrupt method on broker and its usages within worker have been dropped.
column20: uncaught exceptions within workers are now logged as errors rather than warnings.
column21: urlrabbitmqbroker is deprecated. the rabbitmqbroker takes a url parameter so use that instead. urlrabbitmqbroker will be removed in version 2.0.
column22: a race condition with calls to cas in the memcached rate limiter backend.
column23: support for expected exceptions via the throws actor option.
column24: join now takes optional min_successes and idle_time parameters.
column25: stubbroker.join and worker.join are now more reliable.
column26: support for changing the consumer class in the rabbitmq and redis brokers.
column27: an issue with delaying pipelines.
column28: an issue where the redisbroker could sometimes prefetch more messages than it was configured to.
column29: support for eagerly raising actor exceptions in the joining thread with the stubbroker.
column30: the cli now supports referencing a callable to set up the broker on worker startup.
column31: dot characters are now allowed in queue names.
column32: updated allowed version range for prometheus-client.
column33: an issue where the max_age parameter to callbacks was being ignored.
column34: the cli now returns code 1 when one of the workers is killed by an unhandled signal.
column35: an issue where an indexerror would be raised when multiple middlewre containing fork functions were defined.
column36: removed
column37: before and after arguments to add_middleware.
column38: the redisbroker now takes the max lua stack size into account. this should fix certain heisenbugs that folks have encountered with that broker.
column39: consumer reconnect backoff factor has been lowered from 10s to 100ms.
column40: messages are no longer assigned new ids when they are re-enqueued. this makes tracking messages using middleware significantly easier.
column41: cli.main now takes an optional argument namespace so that users may define their own entrypoints.
column42: changed license classifier to the correct license. this is why you shouldn t publish changed before you ve had coffee, folks!
column43: an issue where workers would fail and never recover after the connection to redis was severed.
column44: brokers can now be passed an empty list of middleware.
column45: pipelines no longer continue when a message is failed.
column46: message priority can now be changed in before_enqueue hooks.
column47: consumers now wait exactly 3 seconds between retries after a connection error, rather than using exponential backoff.
column48: support for accessing the current message from an actor via currentmessage.

column75: all notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.
column76: the cli raises an error when the --watch flag is set on unsupported platforms.
column77: an issue with potentially drifting keys in the windowratelimiter.
column78: support for accessing nested broker instances from the cli.
column79: the timelimit middleware no longer uses signals to trigger time limit handling. instead it uses a background thread per worker process.
column80: reloading now uses sys.executable when exec ing workers that were started with python -m dramatiq.

column106: fileno has been added to streamablepipe.
column107: the rabbitmq broker dead message ttl can now be configured via the dramatiq_dead_message_ttl environment variable.
column108: tests are now run on windows.
column109: the prometheus middleware no longer depends on file locking to start its exposition server. instead, it uses the new fork functions functionality to start the server in a separate, unique process. the middleware no longer takes any parameters. while this would normally be a breaking change, it appears those parameters were previously ignored anyway.
column110: consumers are now stopped after workers finish running their tasks.
column111: a race condition between worker processes and fork processes during boot.
column112: timelimit middleware now uses a monotonic clock.
column113: allow pipe_ignore option to be set at the actor level.
column114: an issue that caused logging to fail when non-utf-8 characters were printed to stdout/err.
column115: timelimitexceeded is now a subclass of interrupt.
column116: autoreload now works under gevent.
column117: pipe_ignore has been fixed to apply to the next message in line within a pipeline.
column118: prometheus middleware no longer wipes the prometheus data directory on startup. this fixes an issue with exporting application metrics along with worker metrics.
column119: generic actors can now be passed custom actor registires.
column120: pinned pika version 0.11 to avoid an issue where passing heartbeat to rabbitmqbroker in get_broker would raise a typeerror.
column121: reworked scheduled messages to improve fairness. messages are now re-enqueued on the broker once they hit their eta.
column122: prometheus-client has been pinned to version 0.0.20.
column123: messages now support pluggable encoders.
column124: consumers now use the same idle timeout as workers.
column125: stubbroker stubbroker.flush and stubbroker.flush_all.
column126: rabbitmq enqueue is now resilient to disconnects.
column127: rabbitmqbroker now supports multiple connection uris to be passed in via its url parameter.
column128: support for specifying the actor class to actor.
column129: redis result backend is now considerably more resource-efficient .
column130: result encoder now defaults to the global encoder.
column131: signal handling from the master process on freebsd 10.3.
column132: a custom redis connection can now be passed to the redis broker via the new client keyword argument.
column133: support for redis-py 3.x.
column134: the stubbroker now flushes its dead letter queue when its flush_all method is called.
column135: implementation of the window rate limiter has been streamlined.
column136: connection and import errors that occur during process boot now log stack traces .
column137: pip install dramatiq installs all deps.
column138: unhandled errors within workers now print the full stack trace.
column139: a memory bloat issue with tasks that raise exceptions.
column140: an assertionerror after starting the consumer if rabbitmq is not running .

column1: Cerberus Changelog — Cerberus is a lightweight and extensible data validation library for Python
column2: validate_update is deprecated and will be removed with next release. use validate with update=true instead. closes #21.
column3: the rules keyschema and valueschema are renamed to keysrules and valuesrules; the old names are deprecated and will not be available in the next major release of cerbers
column4: the validator rule is renamed to check_with. the old name is deprecated and will not be available in the next major release of cerberus
column5: instead a runtimeerror is thrown when python is running with optimization level 2
column6: replaced deprecated rule name validator with check_with in the docs
column7: update readme with elaborations on versioning and testing
column8: nullable rule added to allow for null field values to be accepted in validations. this is different than required in that you can actively change a value to none instead of omitting or ignoring it. it is essentially the ignore_none_values, allowing for more fine grained control down to the field level .
column9: change: custom validator methods: replace calls to self._error with return true , or false, or none.
column10: add feature freeze note to contributing and note on python support in readme
column11: validation schemas are now validated up-front. when you pass a schema to the validator it will be validated against the supported ruleset . closes #39.
column12: validator options like allow_unknown and ignore_none_values are now taken into consideration when validating sub-dictionaries. closes #40.
column13: change allowed rule to use containers instead of lists
column14: change: custom validator methods: invert the logic of the conditional clauses where is tested what a value is not / has not.
column15: python 2.6 and 3.3 are no longer supported
column16: convert self.assert method calls to plain assert calls supported by pytest. addresses #213 .
column17: new: support arbitrary types with max and min .
column18: fix: required is always evaluated, independent of eventual missing dependencies. this changes the previous behaviour whereas a required field with dependencies would only be reported as missing if all dependencies were met. a missing required field will always be reported. also see the discussion in link
column19: cerberus is a lightweight and extensible data validation library for python
column20: validator instances are now callable. instead of validated = validator.validate you can now choose to do validated = validator .
column21: several relevant breaking changes have been introduced with this release. for the inside scoop, please see the upgrade notes.
column22: if dependencies are precised for a required field, then the presence of the field is only validated if all dependencies are present .
column23: validator.errors now returns a dictionary where keys are document fields and values are lists of validation errors for the field.
column24: fixed the expansion of the deprecated rule names keyschema and valueschema
column25: fix: when items is applied to a list, field name is used as key for validator.errors , and offending field indexes are used as keys for field errors type can be a list of valid types.
column26: when a list item fails, its offset is now returned along with the list name.
column27: various micro optimizations and safety belts that were inspired by adding type annotations to a branch of the code base
column28: this is a major release which breaks backward compatibility in several ways. don t worry, these changes are for the better. however, if you are upgrading, then you should really take the time to read the list of breaking changes and consider their impact on your codebase. for your convenience, some upgrade notes have been included.
column29: change: removed context -argument from validate -method as this is set upon the creation of a child-validator.
column30: use the unconcernedvalidator when the python interpreter is executed with an optimization flag
column31: added support for running tests with py.test
column32: defaults are applied to undefined fields from an allow_unknown definition
column33: fix: validate with update=true does not work when required fields are in a list of subdicts.
column34: fix misspellings and missing pronouns
column35: fields with empty definitions in schema were reported as non-existent. now they are considered as valid, whatever their value is .
column36: remove redundant hint from *of-rules.
column37: added support for addition and validation of custom data types.
column38: docs: explain that normalization and coercion are performed on a copy of the original document
column39: items is now deprecated. use the upgraded schema rule instead.
column40: the changes.rst document is properly included in the package
column41: docs: examples were added for the min- and maxlength rules.
column42: fix: raise schemaerror when an unallowed type is used in conjunction with schema rule .
column43: allow_unknown can also be set to a validation schema, in which case unknown fields will be validated against it. closes pyeve/eve:issue:405.
column44: min and max now apply to floats and numbers too. closes #30.
column45: add maintainer and maintainer_email to setup.py
column46: all fields that are defined as readonly are removed from a document when a validator has the purge_readonly flag set to true
column47: docs: clarifications concerning dependencies and unique rules.
column48: omit warning when no schema for meta rule constraint is available
column49: new: allow applying of empty rule to sequences and mappings. closes #270.
column50: added number data type, which validates against both float and integer values .
column51: add require_all rule and validator argument
column52: several fixes and refinements of the docs
column53: adds a benchmark to observe overall performance between code changes
column54: change: use str.format in error messages so if someone wants to override them does not get an exception if arguments are not passed. closes #105.
column55: add travis_retry to pip install in case of network issues
column56: fixed schema validation for rules specifications with space
column57: use allowed field for integer just like for string .
column58: fix: correctly handle nested logic and group errors. closes #278 and #299.
column59: minlenght and maxlength now apply to lists as well .
column60: new: validator.document_path and validator.schema_path properties can be used to determine the relation of the currently validating document to the root_document / root_schema .
column61: fix bug when _error is calld twice for a field .
column62: new: custom rule s method docstrings can contain an expression to validate constraints for that rule when a schema is validated. .
column63: fix: simplify the tests with docker by using a volume for tox environments.
column64: the continuous integration now runs on github actions
column65: change: replace validate_update method with update keywork argument.
column66: fix: a dependency is not considered satisfied if it has a null value. closes #305.
column67: the contains rule

column2: sqlalchemy integrations has been removed from authlib. developers should define the database by themselves.
column3: bug fixes and enhancements in this release:
column4: 1. the parameter algorithms in jsonwebsignature and jsonwebencryption are changed. usually you don t have to care about it since you won t use it directly. 2. whole json web key is refactored, please check json web key .
column5: fix oauthtoken when expires_at or expires_in is 0 via pr#227.
column6: jwe has been renamed to jsonwebencryption
column7: quick fix for legacy imports of flask and django clients
column8: allow leeway option in client parse id token via pr#228.
column9: jwk has been renamed to jsonwebkey
column10: allow user given nonce via issue#180.
column11: rfc8037: cfrg elliptic curve diffie-hellman and signatures in json object signing and encryption
column12: we also fixed bugs for integrations:
column13: get started
column14: the whole framework client integrations have been restructured, if you are using the client properly, e.g. oauth.register, it would work as before.
column15: professionally-supported authlib is available with the tidelift subscription.
column16: this is the last release before v1.0. in this release, we added more rfcs implementations and did some refactors for jose:
column17: in this release, authlib has introduced a new way to write framework integrations for clients.
column18: fixed support for httpx>=0.14.3

column2: there is now a formatter config option to format values as specified. the formatter callable may or may not take chart, serie and index as argument. the default value formatting is now chart dependent and is value_formatter for most graph but could be a combination of value_formatter and x_value_formatter for dual charts.
column3: css can now be inline with the inline: prefix
column4: maps are now plugins, they are removed from pygal core and moved to packages
column5: fix crash with no values when the print_values_position param is set
column6: add support for n separated multiline titles
column7: add new box plot modes and outliers and set extremes as default
column8: _this is a micro release and i have very little time on my hands right now sorry_
column9: add show_x_labels option to remove them and the x axis.
column10: add defs config option to allow adding gradients and patterns.
column11: add value_label_font_family and value_label_font_size style options for print_labels.
column12: new call api: chart = line; chart.add; chart.render can now be replaced with line.render
column13: adds an extra class to horizontal guides if the label is 0
column14: add french maps by department and region
column15: dot now supports negative values
column16: add tooltip_fancy_mode to revert to old tooltips
column17: remove stroke style in style and set it as a global / serie configuration.
column18: refactor label processing in a _compute_x_labels and _compute_y_labels method. handle both string and numbers for all charts. create a dual base chart for dual axis charts.
column19: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column20: finally allow call chains on add
column21: avoid x label formatting when label is a string
column22: mode option has been renamed to a less generic name: box_mode
column23: transform min_scale and max_scale as options
column24: remove datey and replace it by real xy datetime, date, time and timedelta support.
column25: add xlink in desc to show on tooltip
column26: bar print value positioning with print_values_position. can be top, center or bottom ci doc
column27: support colors in rgb / rgba for parametric styles
column28: use custom xml_declaration avoiding conflict with processing instructions
column29: add options to customize major labels
column30: add tooltip support in metadata to add a title .
column31: fix wrong label colors when there are more series than colors
column32: fix no data for graphs with only zeroes
column33: fix x_labels and y_labels behaviour for xy like
column34: fix the missing title on x_labels with labels.
column35: auto cast to str x labels in non dual charts
column36: fixing to checks breaking rendering of datetimeline and timedeltaline
column37: allow a color and a style parameter to value metadata.
column38: add guide_stroke_dasharray and guide_stroke_dasharray in style to customize guides
column39: add legend_at_bottom_columns option to specify number of columns in legend when at bottom.
column40: add per serie configuration
column41: handle ellipsis in list type configs to auto-extend parent.
column42: installing
column43: fix transposable_node in case all attributes are not there. .
column44: rework the ghost mechanism to come back to a more object oriented behavior, storing all state in a state object which is created on every render.
column45: the human_readable option has been removed. now you have to use the pygal.formatters.human_readable formatter
column46: avoid http 301 moved permanently
column47: add secondary_range option to set range for secondary values.
column48: add inverse_y_axis options to reverse graph
column49: show y guides in horizontal chart
column50: read the docs: private repos and priority support. try read the docs for business today!
column51: don t forget secondary series in table rendering
column52: fix nomenclature of taiwan

column2: eli5.explain_weights uses gain for xgbclassifier and xgbregressor feature importances by default; this method is a better indication of what s going, and it makes results more compatible with feature importances displayed for scikit-learn gradient boosting methods.
column3: doc and vec arguments are swapped in explain_prediction function; vec can now be omitted if an example is already vectorized;
column4: fix for permutation importance with sample_weight and cross-validation.
column5: fixed eli5.explain_weights for lasso regression with a single feature and no intercept.
column6: fixed an issue with eli5.explain_prediction for xgboost models trained on pandas.dataframe when feature names contain dots;
column7: eli5.explain_weights and eli5.explain_prediction works with xgboost.booster, not only with sklearn-like apis;
column8: eli5.explain_weights allows to customize the way feature importances are computed for xgbclassifier and xgbregressor using importance_type argument ;
column9: lightgbm support: eli5.explain_prediction and eli5.explain_weights are now supported for lgbmclassifier and lgbmregressor .
column10: a number of remaining feature importances is shown when the feature importance table is truncated;
column11: candidate features in eli5.sklearn.invertablehashingvectorizer are ordered by their frequency, first candidate is always positive.
column12: add an option to pass coefficient scaling array; it is useful if you want to compare coefficients for features which scale or sign is different in the input;
column13: backwards incompatible: dataframe objects with explanations no longer use indexes and pivot tables, they are now just plain dataframes;
column14: better scikit-learn pipeline support in eli5.explain_weights: it is now possible to pass a pipeline object directly. curently only selectormixin-based transformers, featureunion and transformers with get_feature_names are supported, but users can register other transformers; built-in list of supported transformers will be expanded in future. see transformation pipelines for more.
column15: eli5.sklearn.invertablehashingvectorizer and eli5.sklearn.featureunhasher allow to recover feature names for pipelines which use hashingvectorizer or featurehasher;
column16: eli5.explain_prediction: new top_targets argument allows to display only predictions with highest or lowest scores;
column17: inverting of hashingvectorizer is now supported inside featureunion via eli5.sklearn.unhashing.invert_hashing_and_fit. see reversing hashing trick.
column18: fixed issue with dense feature vectors;
column19: feature name guessing is fixed for scikit-learn ensemble estimators;
column20: zero and negative feature importances are no longer hidden;
column21: eli5.explain_weights supports feature_filter in addition to feature_re for filtering features, and eli5.explain_prediction now also supports both of these arguments;
column22: targets argument allows to show a subset of targets/classes and change their display order;
column23: styling of feature importances tables is fixed;
column24: new method for inspection black-box models is added ;
column25: it is now possible to customize formatting output - show/hide sections, change layout;
column26: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column27: vectorized argument for sklearn.explain_prediction; it allows to pass example which is already vectorized;
column28: text-based formatting of decision trees is changed: for binary classification trees only a probability of true class is printed, not both probabilities as it was before.
column29: bug fix: eli5 should remain importable if xgboost is available, but not installed correctly.
column30: fixed compatibility with lightgbm master ;
column31: std deviation of feature importances is no longer printed as zero if it is not available.
column32: hashingvectorizer is supported for regression tasks;
column33: eli5.explain_prediction now shows predicted class for binary classifiers ;
column34: fixed tests with recent numpy;
column35: fixed eli5.explain_weights for lightgbm estimators in python 2 when importance_type is split or weight ;
column36: fixed an issue with analyzer= char_wb highlighting at the start of the text.
column37: weight column is renamed to contribution in the output of eli5.explain_prediction;
column38: classifier name is no longer printed by default;
column39: rendering performance is improved;
column40: catch exceptions from improperly installed lightgbm
column41: tutorial is updated to use xgboost 0.81;
column42: eli5.explain_prediction supports targets= now for binary classifiers; e.g. to show result as seen for negative class, you can use eli5.explain_prediction;
column43: new show_feature_values=true formatter argument allows to display input feature values;
column44: support any black-box classifier using lime (link algorithm; text data support is built-in;
column45: supported libraries
column46: support classifiers without get_feature_names method using auto-generated feature names.
column47: added support for scikit-learn linear regression models ;
column48: don t use deprecated getargspec function.
column49: eli5.formatters.as_dict.format_as_dict is now available as eli5.format_as_dict;
column50: feature_re argument allows to show only a subset of features;
column51: fixed compatibility with scikit-learn 0.19;
column52: new textexplainer class allows to explain predictions of black-box text classification pipelines using lime algorithm; many improvements in eli5.lime.
column53: tests moved to github actions.
column54: target_names argument allows to change display names of targets/classes;
column55: better pandas support in eli5.explain_prediction for xgboost, sklearn, lightgbm and lightning.
column56: performance improvements - feature names are lazy;
column57: support eli5.explain_prediction and eli5.explain_weights for libsvm-based linear estimators from sklearn.svm: svc , nusvc , svr, nusvr, oneclasssvm;
column58: feature contribution calculation fixed for eli5.xgboost.explain_prediction_xgboost
column59: top argument of explain_prediction can be a tuple ;
column60: bug fix: classifier weights are no longer changed by eli5 functions.
column61: packaging fixes: require attrs > 16.0.0, fixed readme rendering
column62: documentation and testing improvements.
column63: added conda install instructions ;
column64: read the docs: private repos and priority support. try read the docs for business today!
column65: eli5.explain_weights and eli5.explain_prediction functions;
column66: packaging fix: scikit-learn is added to install_requires in setup.py.
column67: dropped support for scikit-learn < 0.18;
column68: edit on github
column69: python 3.8 and 3.9 tested on gi, python 3.4 not tested any more.
column70: fixed eli5.explain_prediction for recent lightgbm versions;
column71: type checks now use latest mypy;
column72: transfor_feature_names is implemented for sklearn s minmaxscaler, standardscaler, maxabsscaler and robustscaler;

column15: * fix issue 466: avoid initializing with y if x is set
column16: * new `.gemm` method on numpyops and cupyops classes, allowing matrix and vector multiplication to be handled with a simple function. example usage:
column17: * use (link for serialization. we now provide a single package with forks of our preferred serialisation libraries specifically, `msgpack`, `ujson` and `cloudpickle`. this allows us to provide a single binary wheel for these dependencies, and to maintain better control of our dependency tree, preventing breakages.
column18: - **super lightweight:** small and easy to install with very few required dependencies, available on pip and conda for linux, macos and windows. simple source with a consistent api.
column19: * allow support for (link v3.0.0, which includes some bug fixes when items are deleted from the table, and also features bloom filters.
column20: * update versions of `cymem`, `preshed` and `murmurhash`. thinc is compiled against our memory pool and hash table libraries, `cymem` and `preshed`. changing these build-time dependencies requires thinc to be recompiled. this is one reason the major version number needed to be incremented for this release.
column21: previous versions of thinc have relied on numpy for matrix multiplications. when numpy is installed via wheel using pip , numpy will usually be linked against a suboptimal matrix multiplication kernel. this made it difficult to ensure that thinc was well optimized for the target machine.
column22: * add = mish`. cuda and cython kernels are included to make the activation efficient.
column23: * fix installation with cuda 9.
column24: * add experimental support for (link to the optimizer. enable it by setting the keyword argument `lookahead_k` to a positive integer. in preliminary testing, it helps if you're not using parameter averaging, but with averaging it's a bit worse.
column25: * add experimental support for lars to the optimizer. enable it by setting `use_lars` to `true`. in preliminary testing, this hasn't worked well at all possibly our implementation is broken.
column26: * fix issue with creating `model` instances in child threads with operator overloading.
column27: * fix bug that caused incorrect data types to be produced by `featureextracter`.
column28: > this version of thinc has been rewritten from the ground up and will be used to power the upcoming (link the new thinc v8.0 is a **lightweight deep learning library** that offers an elegant, type-checked, functional-programming api for **composing models**, with support for layers defined in other frameworks such as **pytorch**, **tensorflow** or **mxnet**. you can use thinc as an interface layer, a standalone toolkit or a flexible way to develop new models. **for more details, see the (link
column29: - **config system:** configuration is a major pain for ml. thinc lets you describe trees of objects with references to your own functions, so you can stop passing around blobs of settings. it's simple, clean, and it works for both research and production.
column30: thanks to dvsrepo, justindujardin, alephmelo and darkdreamingdan for the pull requests and contributions.
column31: pipfiles and docker
column32: * thinc v7.0 drops support for python 2.7 on windows. python 2.7 remains supported on linux and osx. support could be restored in future. we're currently unable to build our new dependency, (link for windows on python 2.7. if you can assist with this, please let us know.
column33: * update dependencies to be able to provide binary wheels.
column34: you can now require gpu capability using the pip "extras" syntax. thinc also now expects cuda to be installed at `/usr/local/cuda` by default. if you've installed it elsewhere, you can specify the location with the cuda_home environment variable. once thinc is able to find cuda, you can tell pip to install thinc with cupy, as follows:
column35: thanks to rupsaijna and koichiyasuoka for the pull requests!
column36: * add experimental support for (link to the optimizer. enable it with the keyword argument `use_radam` to `true`. in preliminary testing, it's a small change that's worth enabling.
column37: * fix import errors introduced when dropping dependencies in v7.0.0.
column38: documentation and examples
column39: thanks to giannisdaras, simonhkswan, chssch and svlandeg for the pull requests and contributions.
column40: * fix incorrect calculation of `min_density` in `thinc.search.beam` class. previously the beam was pruned based on the raw logit scores, instead of normalized probabilities.
column41: * improve gpu support and pytorch wrapper.
column42: * fix issue 487: require `catalogue>=2.0.3` due to performance regressions related to `importlib-metadata`
column43: * use `collections.abc` when possible and avoid deprecation warning.
column44: * use (link for matrix multiplication. previous versions delegated matrix multiplication to platform-specific libraries via numpy. this led to inconsistent results, especially around multi-threading. we now provide a standalone package, with the blis linear algebra routines. importantly, we've built blis to be **single-threaded**. this makes it much easier to do efficient inference, as the library will no longer spawn threads underneath you.
column45: * dynamically include `numpy` headers and add `numpy` build constraints.
column46: * `thinc.neural.util.get_ops` now understands device integers, e.g. `0` for gpu 0, as well as strings like `"cpu"` and `"cupy"`.
column47: big thanks to digantamisra98 for the (link activation, especially the extensive experiments and simple gradient calculation. we expect to be using the activation in the next round of spacy models.
column48: if you're installing thinc from a local wheel file, the syntax for adding an "extras" specifier is a bit unintuitive. the trick is to make the file path into a url, so you can use an `egg` clause, as follows:
column49: if you want to link against the intel mkl instead of openblas, the easiest way is to install miniconda. for instance, if you installed miniconda to `/opt/miniconda', the command to install thinc linked against mkl would be:
column50: * models now reliably distinguish predict vs. train modes, using the convention `drop=none`. previously, layers such as `batchnorm` relied on having their `predict` method called, which didn't work they were called by layers which didn't implement a `predict` method. we now set `drop=none` to make this more reliable.
column51: * thinc now vendorizes openblas's `cblas_sgemm` function, and delegates matrix multiplications to it by default. the provided function is single-threaded, making it easy to call thinc from multiple processes. the default sgemm function can be overridden using the `thinc_blas` environment variable --- see below.
column52: * fix murmurhash on platforms where long type was not 64 bit
column53: - **use any framework:** switch between pytorch, tensorflow and mxnet models without changing your application, or even create mutant hybrids using zero-copy array interchange.
column54: * fix issue explosion/spacy2995: pin `msgpack` to version `<0.6.0`, to avoid the low message-length limit introduced in v0.6.0, which breaks spacy. we will relax the pin once spacy is updated to set the `max_xx_len` argument to `msgpack.dumps`
column55: * remove detailed `numpy` build constraints from `pyproject.toml`.
column56: * fix issue 488: fix config override & interpolate interaction
column57: gratitude to the (link community for their crowd-sourced experiments, and especially to users lessw2020, mgrankin and others for their optimizer implementations, which we referenced heavily when implementing the optimizers for thinc. more importantly, it's super helpful to have a community filtering the deluge of papers for techniques that work on a few different datasets. (link on optimization research was particularly helpful.
column58: * fix regression in `linearmodel` class introduced in v7.0.5.
column59: - concise functional-programming approach to model definition using composition rather than inheritance.
column60: - **type checking:** develop faster and catch bugs sooner with sophisticated type checking. trying to pass a 1-dimensional array into a model that expects two dimensions? that s a type error. your editor can pick it up as the code leaves your fingers.
column61: * update `murmurhash` pin to accept newer version.
column62: * ditch `thinc_gpu_ops` for simpler gpu install.
column63: send a mail to and we'll get back to you shortly.
column64: * only install old `pathlib` backport on python 2 .
column65: - first-class support for variable-length sequences: multiple built-in sequence representations and your layers can use any object.
column66: a changelog finder and parser.
column67: * restrict compatible `cupy` versions to `<8.0.0`.
column68: * update for compatibility with `cupy` v8.
column69: if the library file ends in a .a extension, it is linked statically; if it ends in .so, it's linked dynamically. make sure you have the directory on your `ld_library_path` at runtime if you use the dynamic linking.
column70: * use `msgpack` instead of `msgpack-python`.
column71: * avoid allocating a negative shape for ngrams.

column2: improved xreadlines, it is now a generator function that yields lines as they are received . however xreadlines is deprecated and not available when the io module is used. use for line in serial: instead.
column3: win32: setrts and setdtr can be called before the port is opened and it will set the initial state on port open.
column4: miniterm.py has a new feature to send a file and configurable special characters for exit and upload. refactored internals to class based structure
column5: poll based implementation for read is in a separate class posixpollserial, as it is not supported well on all platforms .
column6: url handlers for serial_for_url are now imported dynamically. this allows to add protocols w/o editing files. the list serial.protocol_handler_packages can be used to add or remove user packages with protocol handlers .
column7: add cancel_read and cancel_write to win32 and posix implementations
column8: removed dgux entry which actually had a wrong comment and is probably not in use anywhere.
column9: moved some of the examples to serial.tools so that they can be used with python -m
column10: url handlers now require the proper format for arguments instead of /
column11: starting from this release, only python 2.7 and 3.2 are supported. the source code is compatible to the 2.x and 3.x series without any changes. the support for earlier python versions than 2.7 is removed, please refer to the pyserial-legacy series if older python versions are a requirement).

column13: posix: fix posixpollserial with timeout=none and add cancel support
column14: added implementation of ri and corrected rts/cts on win32
column15: crlf handling of miniterm.py should be more consistent on win32 and others. added lf only command line option
column16: name for com10 was not built correctly, found by norm davis.
column17: jython support is currently broken as jython does not have a python 2.2 compatible release out yet
column18: dsrdtr should default to false dsrdtr parameter default value changed from none to false. this means rtscts=true enables hardware flow control on rts/cts but no longer also on dtr/dsr. this change mostly affects win32 as on other platforms, that setting was ignored anyway.
column19: new implementation only supports python 2.2+, backwards compatibility should be maintained almost everywhere. the os handles were prefixed with an underscore. the different names stay, as anyone that uses one of these has to write platform specific code anyway.
column20: support for win32 is now written on the top of ctypes instead of pywin32 .
column21: bugfix of timeouts brought up by markus hoffrogge
column22: ensure working with bytes in write calls
column23: each serial class and instance has a list of supported values: baudrates, bytesizes, parities, stopbits``ggg these values can be used to fill in value sin gui dialogs etc.
column24: miniterm: fix double use of ctrl-t + s use z for suspend instead
column25: changed error handling in read so that disconnected devices are detected.
column26: spurious write fails with error_success
column27: list_ports and device for bsd updated
column28: readline, readlines, writelines and flush are now supported see readme.txt for deatils.
column29: iterator interface. for line in serial: ... is now possible suggested by bernhard bender
column30: serial scan as a module with mac support
column31: instances of serial.serial have baudrate, bytesize, timeout etc. attributes implemented as properties, all can be set while the port is opened. it will then be reconfigured.
column32: creating a serial object without port spec returns an unconfigured, closed port. useful if a gui dialog should take a port and configure it.
column33: same as 1.1 but added missing files.
column34: a port can be opened and closed as many times as desired.
column35: _update_dtr_state throws inappropriate ioctl for virtual serial port created by socat on os x
column36: freebsd now uses cuadx instead of cuaax
column37: add bytesize and stopbits argument parser to tcp_serial_redirect
column38: fix bad super call and duplicate old-style __init__ call
column39: added recursive search for device usb serial number to support composite devices
column40: dynamically lookup baudrates and some cleanups
column41: posix: remove "number_to_device" which is not called anymore
column42: mac and bsd fix _update_break_state
column43: added alternate way for enabling rtscts if port opening fails, a serialexception is raised on all platforms
column44: serial port cannot be specified by number on windows
column45: refactor: raise new instances for portnotopenerror and serialtimeoutexception
column46: on windows in tools global name 'getlasterror' is not defined
column47: add client mode to example tcp_serial_redirect.py
column49: remove python 3.2 and 3.3 from test
column50: posix: ignore more blocking errors and eintr, timeout only applies to blocking i/o
column51: calling open on an already open port now raises an exception
column52: see above for what's all new in this release
column53: cannot configure port, some setting was wrong. can leave port handle open but port not accessible
column54: miniterm.py is now installed as "script"
column55: miniterm: use exclusive access for native serial ports by default
column56: protocol_socket: sync error handling with posix version
column57: use a poll based implementation on posix, instead of a select based, provides better error handling .
column58: use unicode api for list_ports
column59: list_ports: option to include symlinked devices
column60: test.py produces exception with python 3.1
column61: add getsettingsdict and applysettingsdict serial object methods
column62: style: use .format in various places instead of "%" formatting
column63: added serial.parity_names . this dictionary can be used to convert parity constants to meaningful strings.
column64: bug in serial.threaded.packetizer with easy fix
column65: check for string in write function. using unicode causes errors, this helps catching errors early
column66: small bugfix on posix with get* methods .
column67: deprecate nonblocking method on posix, the port is already in this mode.
column68: list_ports: use hardcoded path to library on osx
column69: allow calling cancel functions w/o error if port is closed
column70: improve support for freebsd
column71: added examples to archive added non-blocking mode for timeout=0
column72: parity_none, parity_even, parity_odd constants changed and all these constants moved to serialutil.py
column73: added terminal application for wxpython with wxglade design file to the examples.
column74: serial number support for composite usb devices
column75: remove the mapping of flush to the destructive flushoutput as this is not the expected behaviour.
column76: readline: eol character for lines can be chosen idea by john florian.
column77: documentation update, now written with sphinx/rest
column78: add support to xr-usb-serial ports
column79: patch: native rs485 is never enabled
column80: new url handler alt:// to select alternative implementations
column81: list_ports_windows: support devices with only vid
column82: compatible with python io library
column83: use of monotonic clock for timeouts, when available
column84: don't open port if self.port is not set while entering context manager
column85: examples: refactor wx example, use bind to avoid deprecated warnings, ischecked, unichr
column86: applysettingsdict throws an error if the settings dictionary is not complete
column87: added jython support
column88: : device strings cannot be unicode
column89: fix disregard read timeout if there is more data
column90: about
column91: rfc2217: fix auto-open use case when port is given as parameter
column92: process hang forever under xp
column93: option for low latency mode on linux
column94: reading from socket with timeout=none causes typeerror
column95: check for write timeout, even if eagain was raised
column96: serial.write without a timeout uses 100% cpu on posix
column97: exception while cancel in miniterm
column98: don't use dos device names for ports > 9.
column99: outwaiting implemented
column100: move linux specific constants to not break other platforms
column101: use absolute import everywhere
column102: in read, count length of converted data
column103: ignore exception raised by setcommtimeout in close.
column104: don't recreate overlapped structures and events on each read/write.
column105: the serialposix module does not throw an exception on unsupported platforms, the message is still printed. the idea that it may still work even if the platform itself s not known, it simply tries to do the posix stuff anyway .
column106: list_ports: return name if product is none, fix for #54
column107: fix for
column108: fixes for rts/dtr handling on open
column109: initial state of rts/dtr: ignore error when setting on open posix
column110: silly mix of two versions in win32 code corrected
column111: hcomport doesn't get initialized for serial
column112: test each and every constant for it's existence in termios module, use default if not existent
column113: see 3.2.1, this one missed a merge request related to removing aio.
column114: setrts/setdtr reference to non existing local "on"
column115: added serialutil which provides a base class for the serial objects.
column116: remove obsolete examples.
column117: removed debug messages
column118: add scanlinux.py example
column119: support bluetooth serial port discovery on linux
column120: linux: module list_ports for linux should include the product information as description.
column121: socket: use non-blocking socket and new timeout class
column122: improvements to port_publisher.py example
column123: updated miniterm.py example
column124: posix: fix custom baud rate to not temporarily set 38400 baud rates on linux
column125: update wxserialconfigdialog.py and wxterminal.py compatibility with wxpython 2.8
column126: aio: catch errors and close connection
column127: list_ports: set default name attribute
column128: class serial in protocol_loop.py references variable before assigning to it
column129: added serial.device for all platforms
column130: serial port enumeration now included as serial.tools.list_ports
column131: improve and fix tcp_serial_redirector example.
column132: fixed flush_input_buffer for situations where the remote end has closed the socket.
column133: threaded: added new module implementing a reader thread
column134: the jython backend tries javax.comm and gnu.io
column135: propagate exceptions raised in serialposix _reconfigure
column136: posixserial.open raises oserror rather than serialexception when port open fails
column137: arbitrary baud rate support for bsd family
column138: update version variable
column139: wrong exception on nonexistent ports with /dev file. bug report by louis cordier
column140: rs485 support changed
column141: setting non standard baud rates on darwin
column142: fix: nameerror: global name 'base' is not defined
column143: miniterm.py fails to exit on failed serial port
column144: win32: fix exception for composite serial number search on windows
column145: implement write timeouts
column146: win32 does now return the remaining characters on timeout
column147: minor fixes to setup.py , inter_byte_timeout , rfc2217 , list_ports , loop://, renamed readerthread
column148: multithreading fixes to wxterminal.py
column149: context manager automatically opens port on __enter__
column150: tests live in their own directory now
column151: : keep rts/cts state on port setting changes
column152: fixed issue with 0 timeout on windows 10
column153: serial.serial should not raise ioerror.
column154: reset_input_buffer can hang on sockets
column155: list_ports_linux: correct "interface" property on linux hosts
column156: win32 handles \.comx format automatically for com ports of higher number
column157: the serial class in the .net/mono backend does not implement the _reconfigure_port method
column158: compatibility to win9x improved
column159: fix return value of write
column160: list_ports: workaround for special characters in port names
column161: nonblocking error - unix platform
column162: new url type: hwgrep://<regexp> uses list_ports module to search for ports by their description
