column2: bargraph and progressbar can now display data more accurately by using the utf-8 vertical and horizontal eighth characters. this behavior will be enabled when the utf-8 encoding is detected and smoothed attributes are passed to the bargraph or progressbar constructors.
column3: some new shift+arrow and numpad input sequences from rxvt and xterm are now recognized
column4: use comparison with a string instead of is test with a literal
column5: use reactor.stop in twistedeventloop and document that twisted s reactor is not designed to be stopped then restarted
column6: replaced all tabs with 4 spaces, code is now more aerodynamic
column7: external event loops may now be used with the raw_display module. the new methods get_input_descriptors and get_input_nonblocking should be used instead of get_input to allow input processing without blocking.
column8: shared command_map instance is now stored as widget._command_map class attribute and may be overridden in subclasses or individual widgets for more control over special keystrokes
column9: register_palette and register_palette_entry now accept default as foreground and/or background. if the terminal s default attributes cannot be detected black on light gray will be used to accommodate terminals with always-black cursors.
column10: new support for 256 and 88 color terminals with raw_display and html_fragment display modules
column11: some unicode characters are now converted to use the g1 alternate character set with dec special and line drawing characters. these unicode characters should now just work in almost all terminals and encodings.
column12: new support for python 3.2 from the same 2.x code base, requires distribute instead of setuptools everything except twistedeventloop and glibeventloop is supported
column13: new support for utf-8 encoding. unicode strings may be used and will be converted to the current encoding when output. regular strings in the current encoding may still be used.
column14: new support for utf-8 encoding including input, display and editing of narrow and wide characters.
column15: pile and columns now accept given instead of fixed for cases where the number of rows or columns are specified by the container options
column16: padding widget now defaults to instead of pack so that left and right parameters are more useful and more child widgets are supported
column17: new lcd_display module with support for cf635 usb lcd panel and lcd_cf635.py example program with menus, slider controls and a custom font
column18: new bigtext class that draws text with fonts made of grids of character cells. bigtext is a fixed widget and doesn t do any alignment or wrapping. it is intended for banners and number readouts that need to stand out on the screen.
column19: removed util.register_align_mode and util.register_wrap_mode. their functionality has been replaced by the new layout classes.
column20: added saving of stdin and stdout in raw_display module allowing the originals to be redirected
column21: fixed unicode conversion and locale issues when using urwid with python < 2.4. the graph.py example program should now work properly with older versions of python.
column22: fix for suspend and resume applications with ^z
column23: curses_display.screen.get_input may now return double width characters. text and edit classes will work with a mix of regular and double width characters.
column24: new supports_unicode function to query if unicode strings with characters outside the ascii range may be used with the current encoding.
column25: edit widget now supports a mask , has an insert_text_result method for full-field validation and normalizes input text to unicode or bytes based on the caption type used
column26: fix tutorial examples use of textcanvas and switch to using unicode literals
column27: fixed a bug in the handling of invalid utf-8 data. all invalid characters are now replaced with ? characters when displayed.
column28: all display modules now have start and stop methods that may be used instead of calling run_wrapper.
column29: new left and right values may be specified in padding widgets
column30: don t use deprecated inspect.getargspec with python3
column31: curses_display now supports attrspec and external event loops just like raw_display
column32: updated tutorial with mainloop usage and improved examples
column33: fixed a canvascache with render used in both a widget and its superclass bug
column34: fix for widgetwrap and attrmap not working with fixed widgets
column35: new twisted_serve_ssh.py example that serves multiple displays over ssh from the same application using twisted and the twistedeventloop
column36: replaced the custom align and wrap modes in example program calc.py with a new layout class.
column37: fix for final output not appearing on exit with some terminals now that extra newline was removed
column38: fix for pile and graphvscale when rendered with no contents
column39: when urwid is run with the utf-8 encoding the characters are left as utf-8 and not converted.
column40: preliminary mouse support was added to the raw_display and curses_display modules. a new screen.set_mouse_tracking method was added to enable mouse tracking. mouse events are returned alongside keystrokes from the screen.get_input method.
column41: filler now has top and bottom parameters like padding s left and right parameters and accepts pack instead of none as a height value for widgets that calculate their own number of rows
column42: default is now the default for text with no attributes. this means that areas with no attributes will change from light grey on black to black on light gray or the terminal s default.
column43: widget now has a default focus_position property that raises an indexerror when read to be consistent with new common container api
column44: signals now support using weakly referenced arguments to help avoid leaking objects when a signal consumer is no longer referenced
column45: right-to-left input and display are not implemented.
column46: new glibeventloop allows running urwid applications with glib
column47: new pollinglistwalker class is now the default list walker that is used when passing a simple list to the listbox constructor. this class is intended for backwards compatibility only. when this class is used the listbox object is unable to cache its render method.
column48: new list walker simplefocuslistwalker like simplelistwalker but updates focus position as items are inserted or removed
column49: pile widgets now support selectable items, focus changing with up and down keys and setting the cursor position.
column50: fix for systems with gpm_mev installed but not running gpm
column51: new tty_signal_keys method of raw_display.screen and curses_display.screen allows changing or disabling the keys used to send signals to the application
column52: avoids use of bold text in xterm and gnome-terminal for improved text legibility.
column53: new experimental terminal widget with xterm emulation and terminal.py example program
column54: preliminary combining character support is included, but full support will require terminal behavior detection.
column55: canvas classes have been reorganized: canvas has been renamed to textcanvas and canvas is now the base class for all canvases. new canvas classes include blankcanvas, solidcanvas and compositecanvas.
column56: fix for listbox snapping to selectable widgets taller than the listbox itself
column57: simplelistwalker now behaves as a list and supports all list operations. this class now detects when changes are made to the list and notifies the listbox object. new code should use this class to wrap lists of widgets before passing them to the listbox constructor.
column58: boxwidget, flowwidget and fixedwidget are deprecated, instead use the sizing function or _sizing attribute to specify the supported sizing modes for your custom widgets
column59: avoid hogging cpu on gradual window resize and fix for slow resize with cygwin s broken curses implementation.
column60: fixed a text layout bug affecting clipped text with blank lines, and another related to wrapped text starting with a space character.
column61: new widget base class for all widgets. it includes automatic caching of rows and render methods. it also adds a new __super attribute for accessing methods in superclasses.
column62: new textlayout and standardtextlayout classes to perform text wrapping and alignment. text widgets now have a layout parameter to allow use of custom textlayout objects.
column63: new widgetdecoration base class for attrmap, boxadapter, padding, filler and linebox widgets creates a common method for accessing and updating their contained widgets
column64: fixed a newly introduced incompatibility with python < 2.3.
column65: pile class may now be used as a box widget and contain a mix of box and flow widgets.
column66: progressbar text content and alignment may now be overridden
column67: new popuplauncher and popuptarget widgets and mainloop option for creating pop-ups and drop-downs, and new pop_up.py example program
column68: new attrspec class for specifying specific colors instead of using attributes defined in the screen s palette
column69: extended numerical editing: integers and floats
column70: the raw_display module now uses an alternate buffer so that the original screen can be restored on exit. the old behaviour is available by setting the alternate_buffer parameter of start or run_wrapper to false.
column71: new twistedeventloop allows running urwid with a twisted reactor
column72: make columns and pile selectable when any child widget is
column73: fixed a missing symbol in curses_display when python is linked against libcurses.
column74: deprecated classes
column75: raw_display switching to alternate buffer now works properly with terminal.app
column76: supports font/window resizing, keepalive for long-lived connections, limiting maximum concurrent connections, polling and connected update methods. tested with mozilla firefox and internet explorer.
column77: overlay widget parameters may now be adjusted after creation with set_overlay_parameters method
column78: fix for padding.align and width change not invalidating
column79: new mainloop.watch_pipe method for subprocess or threaded communication with the process/thread updating the ui, and new subproc.py example demonstrating its use
column80: columns widgets now support fixed width and relative width columns, a minimum width for all columns, selectable items within columns containing flow widgets , focus changing with left and right keys and setting the cursor position.
column81: pile and columns now accepts pack instead of flow for widgets that calculate their own number of rows or columns
column82: new raw_display module that handles console display without relying on external libraries. this module was written as a work around for the lack of utf-8 support in the standard version of ncurses.
column83: new signals class that will be used to improve the existing event callbacks. currently it is used for listwalker objects to notify their listbox when their content has changed.
column84: selectableicon selectable text widget used by button widgets is now documented
column85: support for home and end keys in listbox
column86: selectableicon using cursor_position=0 by default instead of 1.
column87: new list walker api version 2 that is simpler for many list walker uses; api version 1 will still continue to be supported
column88: replaced hashbangs to use proper python binary
column89: please note: there are issues related to displaying utf-8 characters with the curses_display module that have not yet been resolved.
column90: fixes for examples compatibility with python 3
column91: prevent listboxes from selecting 0-height selectable widgets when moving up or down
column92: fixed a bug in text.pack that caused an infinite loop when the text contained a newline. this function is not currently used by urwid.
column93: columns.set_focus will now accept an integer or a widget as its parameter.
column94: listbox now includes a get_cursor_coords method, allowing nested listbox widgets
column95: fix for a listbox contents too long error with very large edit widgets
column96: fix support for negative indexes with monitoredfocuslist
column97: improved support for cyrillic and other simple 8-bit encodings.
column98: the edit and intedit classes now use their set_edit_text and set_edit_pos functions when handling keypresses, so those functions may be overridden to catch text modification.
column99: new function get_all_fonts may be used to get a list of the available fonts.
column100: fixed bugs in padding and overlay widgets introduced in 0.9.7.
column101: fix input of utf-8 in tour.py example by converting captions to unicode
column102: new overlay class for drawing widgets that obscure parts of other widgets. may be used for drop down menus, combo boxes, overlapping windows , caption text etc.
column103: allow disabling and re-enabling of mouse tracking
column104: fix for a bug with large flow widgets used in an overlay
column105: fixed graph example cpu usage when animation is stopped
column106: new curses_display input handling with better esc key detection and broader escape code support.
column107: fix terminal select not retrying when interrupted by signal
column108: added widgetwrap class for extending existing widgets without inheriting their complete namespace.
column109: fix for raw_display clear-right escape not working with standout attribute on some terminals
column110: frame widgets now support selectable items in the header and footer.
column111: add support for double and triple click mouse events
column112: modified examples to not use black as background of edit widgets.
column113: disable curses_display external event loop support: screen resizing and gpm events are not properly supported
column114: use new method edit.set_edit_text instead of edit.update_text.
column115: fix use of ignore_focus, for widgets inheriting from text
column116: attrspec objects are now comparable
column117: fixed a bug preventing use of utf-8 characters with divider widgets.
column118: columns widget contents may now be marked to always be treated as flow widgets for mixing flow and box widgets more easily
column119: added initial support for fixed widgets - widgets that have a fixed size on screen. fixed widgets expect a size parameter equal to . fixed widgets must implement the pack function to return their size.
column120: new raw_display.signal_init and raw_display.signal_restore methods that may be overridden by threaded applications that need to call signal.signal from their main thread.
column121: fix for registering high palette entries in the form hx where x > 15 so that basic colors are applied in 88-color mode
column122: fixes for incorrect handling of box columns in a number of columns methods when that column is selectable
column123: fixed incompatibilities with python 2.6
column124: new treewidget, treenode, parentnode, treewalker and treelistbox classes for lazy expanding/collapsing tree views factored out of browse.py example program, with new treesample.py example program
column125: fix crash with ellipsis clipping for py2 tour.py works with py2 now typo in tour.py
column126: fixed incompatibilities with python 2.3
column127: add support for bright backgrounds on linux console
column128: improved performance in utf-8 mode when ascii text is used.
column129: fix for a padding rows bug when used with width=pack
column130: improved the smoothness of resizing with raw_display module. the module will now try to stop updating the screen when a resize event occurs during the update.
column131: fixed minor cjk problem and curs_set crash under macosx and cygwin.
column132: pile and columns widgets now accept any iterable to their __init__ methods
column133: add support for input encoding in terminal widget
column134: new decoration widget widgetdisable to disable interaction with the widgets it wraps
column135: overlay class can now accept a fixed widget as the widget to display on top .
column136: fixed mouse handling bugs in the frame and overlay classes.
column137: a new convenience function is_mouse_event was added to help in separating mouse events from keystrokes.
column138: renamed widgetwrap.w to _w, indicating its intended use as a way to implement a widget with other widgets, not necessarily as a container for other widgets
column139: new layout structure replaces line translation structure. layout structure now allows arbitrary reordering/positioning of text segments, inclusion of utf-8 characters and insertion of text not found in the original text string.
column140: add installation instruction to readme
column141: new sphinx-based documentation now included in source: tutorial rewritten, manual revised and new reference based on updated docstrings
column142: fix for alarms when used with a screen event loop
column143: fix for alarms when used with a screen event loop
column144: mouse drag events are now reported by raw_display in terminals that provide button event tracking and on the console with gpm. note that gpm may report coordinates off the screen if the user drags the mouse off the edge.
column145: the widget interface does not yet include mouse handling. this will be addressed in the next release.
column146: fix for tmux and screen missing colors on right bug
column147: updated tour.py example program to show new widget types and features.
column148: proper handling & customization of os signals by glib event loop
column149: added new docstrings and doctests to many widget classes
column150: new method for configuring keyboard input timeouts and delays: curses_display.screen.set_input_timeouts.
column151: word wrapping mode space will wrap on edges of double width characters. wrapping and clipping will not split double width characters.
column152: test coverage is now collected
column153: added a new example program input_test.py. this program displays the keyboard and mouse input it receives. it may be run as a cgi script or from the command line. on the command line it defaults to using the curses_display module, use input_test.py raw to use the raw_display module instead.
column154: fix for terminal widget input handling with python 3
column155: add workaround for #386
column156: rendering is now significantly faster.
column157: improved widget and list walker interface documentation.
column158: expanded tutorial to cover advanced listbox usage, custom widget classes and the pile, boxadapter, columns, gridflow and overlay classes.
column159: raw_display and curses_display now support the ibmpc character set
column160: fix for screen not getting reset on exception regression
column161: button release events now report which button was released if that information is available, currently only on the console with gpm.
column162: fix for a doctest failure under powerpc
column163: the columns, pile and listbox widgets now choose their first selectable child widget as the focus widget by default.
column164: fix underlining for padded text
column165: do not call wait_readable with a closed fd in trioeventloop
column166: list walkers may now allow iteration from the absolute top or bottom of the list if they provide a positions method
column167: automate testing with python 2.6, 2.7, 3.2, 3.3 and pypy using travis-ci
column168: fix the asyncio example, and make the raw screen work without real files
column169: #261: fix issues with unicode characters in progressbar
column170: the set_state functions in the checkbox and radiobutton classes now have a do_callback parameter that determines if the callback function registered will be called.
column171: fix for bug when entering unicode text into edit widget with bytes caption
column172: fix for page up and page down in listbox when having focusable children
column173: added new functions to simplify taking screenshots: html_fragment.screenshot_init and html_fragment.screenshot_collect
column174: to disable caching in a widget set the class variable no_cache to a list that includes the string render .
column175: fix a number of bugs caused by 0-height widgets in a listbox
column176: added support for monochrome terminals. see curses_display.screen.register_palette_entry and example programs. set term=xterm-mono to test programs in monochrome mode.
column177: fix for a lock up when attempting to wrap text containing wide characters into a single character column
column178: fix frame mouse_event when footer is trimmed
column179: new bargraph, graphvscale and progressbar classes for graphical display of data in urwid applications.
column180: raw_display now erases to the end of the line with el escape sequence to improve copy+paste behavior for some terminals
column181: mainloop now calls draw_screen just before going idle, so extra calls to draw_screen in user code may now be removed
column182: #221: fix for raw display should release file descriptors
column183: overlay.calculate_padding_filler and padding.padding_values now include focus parameters.
column184: add support for python 3.7 and 3.8, drop support for python 3.3
column185: example fixes
column186: linebox widgets may now include title text
column187: new example program graph.py demonstrates use of bargraph, linebox, progressbar and solidfill.
column188: new command_map for specifying which keys cause actions such as clicking button widgets and scrolling listbox widgets
column189: fixed a simplelistwalker with emptied list bug
column190: ignore resetting to invalid locale
column191: added detection for rxvt s home and end escape sequences.
column192: simplelistwalker is now default when setting listbox.body
column193: padding class now has a clipping mode that pads or clips fixed widgets to make them behave as flow widgets.
column194: fix for boxadapter backwards incompatibility introduced in 0.9.9
column195: removed some forgotten asserts that broke 8-bit and cjk input.
column196: move to urwid.org and use sphinx docs for generating whole site, move changelog to docs/changelog.rst
column197: fixed an edit.render bug that caused it to render the cursor in a different location than that reported by edit.get_cursor_coords in some circumstances.
column198: columns widget now tries to keep column in focus visible, hiding columns on the left when necessary
column199: new asyncioeventloop for python 3.4, python 3.x with asyncio package or python 2 with trollius package
column200: instance of terminal has no __super attr thanks pylint!
column201: fixes for a number of string encoding issues under python 3
column202: many internal string processing functions have been rewritten in c to improve their performance.
column203: new attrmap widget supports mapping any attribute to any other attribute, replaces attrwrap widget
column204: new example program bigtext.py demonstrates use of bigtext.
column205: add popular ides folders to .gitignore
column206: create section in docs for example program screenshots generated as images like the tutorial examples
column207: added a clear function to the display modules to force the screen to be repainted on the next draw_screen call.
column208: add suggested basic color combination images to manual
column209: italics support
column210: fix encoding exceptions when unicode used on non-utf-8 terminal
column211: new linebox class for wrapping widgets in a box made of line- drawing characters. may be used as a box widget or a flow widget.
column212: small changes to enable windows support
column213: fixes for a columns.get_cursor_coords regression and a selectableicon.get_cursor_coords bug
column214: fixed a filler render bug, a raw_display start/stop bug and a number of problems triggered by very small terminal window sizes.
column215: new widgetplaceholder widget useful for swapping widgets without having to manipulate a container widget s contents
column216: fixed a padding bug when the left or right has no padding.
column217: fix for terminal widget crash with python 3
column218: new set_encoding function replaces util.set_double_byte_encoding.
column219: fix for raw_display when terminal width is 1 column
column220: new web_display module that emulates a console display within a web browser window. application must be run as a cgi script under apache.
column221: fix for missing modified signal in simplefocuslistwalker
column222: fix python 3.8 syntaxwarning: str object is not callable
column223: fixed curses_display bug affecting text with no attributes.
column224: columns class may now contain a mix of box and flow widgets. the box widgets will take their height from the maximum height of the flow widgets.
column225: add ability to specify linebox title attribute
column226: gridflow now supports multiple cell widths within the same widget
column227: new get_encoding_mode function to determine how urwid will treat raw string data.
column228: shortened resize timeout on gradual resize to improve responsiveness.
column229: break rather than raising exception on shard calculation bug.
column230: fixed a bug that prevented the use of utf-8 strings in text markup.
column231: #275: late fix for proper exception reraising from within main loop
column232: can now run urwid/curses_display.py to test your terminal s input and colour rendering.
column233: fixed a memory leak related to objects listening for signals
column234: remove extra newline generated on exit of raw_display
column235: add a test to check the linebox.pack is good.
column236: fixed cursor in screenshots of cjk text. fixed end key in edit boxes with cjk text.
column237: filler widgets may now wrap box widgets and have more alignment options.

column3: this was previously required by the simple classes and is now also required by consumer and producer.

column5: tests no longer depends on distribute, which was deprecated and merged back into setuptools.
column6: kombu can now be used with pydev, pycharm and other static analysis tools.
column7: if the accept whitelist is set and a message is received with a content type that is not in the whitelist then a contentdisallowed exception is raised. note that this error can be handled by the already existing on_decode_error callback
column8: transport defaults to amqp, and is not required. user, password, port and virtual_host is also not mandatory and will default to the corresponding transports default.
column9: consumer/producer can now be instantiated without a channel, and only later bound using .revive.
column10: it was possible to enable this mode previously using the fanout_prefix, and fanout_patterns transport options, but now these are enabled by default.
column11: amqp: transport options are now merged with arguments supplied to the connection.
column12: when using celery and the pickle serializer with binary data as part of the payload, unicodedecodeerror would be raised as the content was not utf-8. we now replace on errors.
column13: the dead-letter queue was enabled by default to help application authors, but now that kombu is stable it should be removed. there are after all many cases where messages should just be dropped when there are no queues to buffer them, and keeping them without supporting automatic cleanup is rather considered a resource leak than a feature.
column14: still, it is possible that using priorities in combination with routing can be more beneficial than using routing or priorities alone. experimentation and monitoring should be used to prove this.

column17: message compatibility is handled by adding a body_encoding property, so messages sent by older versions is compatible with this release. however if you are accessing the messages directly not using kombu, then you have to respect the body_encoding property.
column18: auto delete support for virtual transports were incomplete and could lead to problems so it was removed.
column19: now comes with default global connection and producer pools.
column20: removed deprecated use of stopiteration in generators and invalid regex escape sequence.
column21: exchange.delivery_mode now defaults to none, and the default is instead set by producer.publish.
column22: the transport is implemented on top of azure service bus and offers paas support for more demanding celery workloads in azure. the transport is intended to be used in conjunction with the azure cosmosdb backend.
column23: kombu 3 consumers will no longer accept pickle/yaml or msgpack by default, and you will have to explicitly enable untrusted deserializers either globally using kombu.enable_insecure_serializers, or using the accept argument to consumer.
column24: compression can now be used with binary message payloads.

column27: the transport is implemented on top of azure storage queues. this offers a simple but scalable and low-cost paas transport for celery users in azure. the transport is intended to be used in conjunction with the azure block blob storage backend.

column32: the polling interval default has been changed to 0 and a new transport option has been added. this parameter specifies how long to wait for a message from sqs, and defaults to 20 seconds, which is the maximum value currently allowed by amazon sqs.

column40: acks are now implemented by storing a copy of the message when the message is consumed. the copy is not removed until the consumer acknowledges or rejects it.

column279: queue.__repr__ now makes sure return value is not unicode .

column345: the checks were removed in celery/kombu#938 due to assumption that it only affected jython. however, bz2 support can be missing in pythons built without bz2 support.
column347: this module contains a consumermixin class that can be used to easily implement a message consumer thread that consumes messages from one or more kombu.consumer instances.

column354: it used to be message, but now it s message.

column357: this means that the last resource released will be the one acquired next. i.e. if only a single thread is using the pool this means only a single connection will ever be used.

column28: the parameter of the set_slippage api function was updated from spread to slippage to better describe its purpose in the fixed slippage model.
column29: added instructions on how to create a conda environment for python 3.6, and updated visual c++ instructions for windows and python 3
column30: fixes bug in data.history function that was formatting volume data as integers, now they are returned as floats with up to 9 decimals of precision. data bundles redone.
column31: added the support for live trading in huobi pro, okex, hitbtc and kucoin.
column32: improved installation notes for windows c++ compiler and conda
column33: added support for csv ingestion
column34: multiple algorithms can trade simultaneously against a single exchange using the same account.

column40: several usability improvements of the data marketplace that make the dataset parameter optional. if it is not included in the command line, will list available datasets, and let you choose interactively.
column41: changed handling of empty auth.json, instead of throwing an error for missing file
column42: the current data bundle takes 340mb compressed for download, and 460mb uncompressed on disk for catalyst to use.
column43: fixed an issue with single bar data.history
column44: fixed an issue preventing trading on gdax with several positions #299
column45: fix an issue with asset date in chunks
column46: always request more data to avoid empty bars and always give the exact bar number #260
column47: fixed an issue with orders that stay open #211
column48: fixed an issue with the order creation procedure for exchanges that do not support fetchmytrades method #404
column49: fixes issue of normalizing timestamps before comparison
column50: comprehensive trading functionality against exchanges bitfinex and bittrex.
column51: improved error handling for unsupported timeframes
column52: addition of api reference
column53: upgraded the requests lib
column54: fix issue with daily chunks end date
column55: added ability to stop live algo at specified end date

column57: addition of release notes
column58: added a standardized dictionary of symbols for each exchange
column59: install
column60: added a retry mechanism to the handling of an order request timeout #350, #356
column61: added a function to reduce open orders amount from calculated target/amount for target orders #243
column62: utilized cancel_order in paper mode and fixed minor issues in live mode #95, #346
column63: fixes issue in the creation of bundles
column64: daily summary performance statistics compatible with pyfolio, a python library for performance and risk analysis of financial portfolios
column65: fix binance requirement of symbol to be included in the cancelled order #204
column66: fixed issue with auto-ingestion of minute data
column67: fixed issue with market order executing price
column68: added explanation describing the storing of the algorithm state in live mode #224

column73: using bitfinex instead of poloniex to fetch btc_usdt benchmark
column74: fixed an issue with the data history in daily frequency #274
column75: fix notenoughcasherror when an open order is filled minutes later #237
column76: fix issue with 1/1000 scaling issue of prices in bundle
column77: improved order execution for exchanges supporting trade lists
column78: added order creation exception handling according to the ccxt manual #315
column79: raising an error for order amounts smaller than exchange lots

column82: retrieval of crypto benchmark from bundle, instead of hitting poloniex exchange directly
column83: data marketplace: ensures compatibility across wallets, now fully supporting ledger, trezor, keystore, private key. partial support for metamask . current support for digital bitbox is unknown, but believed to be supported.

column91: properly handle of empty candles received from exchanges #236

column98: removed redundant capital_base validation
column99: fixes issues in empty benchmark

column2: this is the cumulative release with many backward incompatibility changes.
column3: views are no longer inherits and implement an activation interface. this change makes things much simple internally, and fixes inconsistency, in different scenarios. @flow_view, @flow_start_view decorators are no longer callable.
column4: activation now passed as a request attribute. you need to remove explicit activation parameter from view function signature, and use request.activation instead.
column5: task_loader not is the attribute of a flow task. in makes functions and signal handlers reusable over different flows.
column6: add process.data and task.data generic json field for default models
column7: add process.artifact and task.artifact generic fk fields for default models
column8: fix issue with task assign on default post
column9: all conditions in if, switch and other nodes receives now a node activation instance instead of process. so you can gen an access to the current task via activation.task variable.
column10: resolve this-referencies for split and switch nodes conditions
column11: every _cls suffix, ex in flow_cls, activation_cls, was renamed to _class. the reason for that is just to be consistent with django naming theme.
column12: fixes and improvements in the flow chart rendering
column14: django-extra-views integration is removed. this was a pretty creepy way to handle formsets and inlines within django class-based views. instead, django-material introduce a new way to handle form inlines same as a standard form field. see details in the documentation.
column15: to use celery job with django 1.8, django-transaction-hooks need to be enabled.
column16: flow namespace are no longer hard-coded. flow views now can be attached to any namespace in a url config.
column17: built-in class based views are renamed, to be more consistent. check the documentation to find a new view name.
column18: about
column19: same for callable in the .assign and .permissions definitions.
column20: add italian translation
column21: added portuguese translation
column22: flow_start_func, flow_start_signal decorators need to be used for the start nodes handlers. decorators would establish a proper locking avoids concurrent flow process modifications in the background tasks.
column23: improved task detail ui in frontend
column24: drop compatibility with django 1.8/1.9/1.10
column25: add additional template blocks for left panel. close #311
column26: fix prefetch_related usage on process and task queryset
column27: allow flow.handler redifinition with inheritance
column28: fix obsolete node url resolve
column29: added agpl licence additional permissions
column30: support task permission checks on user model subclasses
column31: changelog
column32: allow to overide flow view access by flow.has_view_permission method
column33: new process dashboard view
column34: add custom rollback to update_status migration
column35: make django-rest-swagger requirements optional
column36: sign up
column37: add view.oncreate callback support
column38: rest api support

column7: fixed #98: contains act like jquery

column10: add cookies arguments as allowed arguments for requests
column11: fixed #23: removeclass adds class attribute to elements which previously lacked one
column12: run tests with python3.6 on ci
column13: use requests to fetch urls

column15: fix issue 44: case problem with xml documents

column17: added pyquery.outerhtml
column18: added .xhtml_to_html and .remove_namespaces
column19: fixed #112: make_links_absolute does not apply to form actions
column20: .text now return an empty string instead of none if there is no text node. fix #45
column21: pyquery.val is ''
column22: pyquery.val is ''
column23: do not raise an error when the http response code is 2xx
column24: use restkit s proxy instead of paste
column25: added pseudo selector :has
column26: readme_fixt.py was not include in the release. fix #54.
column27: remove some unmaintained modules: pyquery.ajax and pyquery.rules
column28: support for keyword arguments in pyquery custom functions
column29: improve .extend by returning self
column30: refactoring of .text to match firefox behavior.

column2: an explicit exception is raised when range is called with 0-based indices
column3: pandas dataframes and series are now supported for reading and writing, both via range object and udfs
column4: : importing udfs with the add-in was throwing an error if the filename was including characters like spaces or dashes . to fix this, close excel completely and run xlwings addin update.
column5: macos: the regression with book.fullname that was introduced with 0.20.1 has been fixed .
column6: xlwings.view and xlwings.load now use chunking by default .
column7: upon writing, pandas series are now shown by default with their name and index name, if they exist. this can be changed using the same options as for dataframes :
column8: new documentation about how to use xlwings with other languages like r and julia, see xlwings with r and julia.
column9: sheet.autofit and range.autofit: the integer argument for the axis has been removed . use string arguments rows or r for autofitting rows and columns or c for autofitting columns .
column10: for array formulas with or without numpy, see the docs: user defined functions
column11: : this version adds support for the vba module on mac excel 2016 and is now feature equivalent with mac excel 2011 .
column12: pywin32 is now automatically installed when using pip
column13: windows: fix a regression introduced with 0.20.0 that would cause an attributeerror: range.clsid with async and legacy dynamic array udfs .
column14: optimized connection: set the optimized_connection = true in the vba settings. this will use a com server that will keep the connection to python alive between different calls and is therefore much more efficient. however, changes in the python code are not being picked up until the pythonw.exe process is restarted by killing it manually in the windows task manager. the suggested workflow is hence to set optimized_connection = false for development and only set it to true for production - keep in mind though that this feature is still experimental!
column15: the atleast_2d keyword had no effect on ranges consisting of a single cell and was raising an error when used in combination with the asarray keyword. both have been fixed :
column16: xlwings.view has been enhanced to accept an optional sheet object
column17: exciting times! v0.9.0 is a complete rewrite of xlwings with loads of syntax changes . but more importantly, this release adds a ton of new features and bug fixes that would have otherwise been impossible. some of the highlights are listed below, but make sure to check out the full migration guide for the syntax changes in details. note, however, that the syntax for user defined functions did not change. at this point, the api is fairly stable and we re expecting only smaller changes on our way towards a stable v1.0 release.
column18: xlwings can now be used with threading, see the docs: threading and multiprocessing .
column19: : a long-standing bug that caused the excel file to close and reopen under certain circumstances has been fixed : depending on your security settings and in connection with files downloaded from the internet or possibly in connection with some add-ins, excel was either closing the file and reopening it or giving a file already open warning. this has now been fixed which means that the examples downloaded from the homepage should work right away after downloading and unzipping.
column20: the udf server has received a serious upgrade by njwhite, getting rid of the many issues that were around with using a combination of async functions and legacy dynamic arrays. you can now also call functions defined via async def, although for the time being they are still called synchronously from excel .
column21: # x will be returned unchanged as transposed both when reading and writing
column22: note that you will need to update the vba module and that apart from pywin32 there is now a new dependency for the windows version: comtypes. it should be installed automatically though when installing/upgrading xlwings with pip.
column23: when writing to ranges while excel is busy, xlwings is now retrying until excel is idle again
column24: converters are accessed via the new options method when dealing with xlwings.range objects or via the @xw.arg and @xw.ret decorators when using udfs. as an introductory sample, let s look at how to read and write pandas dataframes:
column25: this version marks an important first step on our path towards a stable release. it introduces converters, a new and powerful concept that brings a consistent experience for how excel ranges and their values are treated both when reading and writing but also across xlwings.range objects and user defined functions .
column26: : vba settings: udf_path has been replaced with udf_modules. the default behaviour doesn t change though .
column27: calling python from within excel vba is now also supported on mac, i.e. python functions can be called like this: runpython"). running frozen executables isn t available yet on mac though.
column28: native dynamic array formulas can now be used with async formulas
column29: the interpreter setting has been deprecated in favor of platform-specific settings: interpreter_win and interpreter_mac, respectively. this allows you to use the sheet config unchanged on both platforms .
column30: : workbook.caller is now also accessible within functions that are decorated with @xlfunc. previously, it was only available with functions that used the @xlsub decorator .
column31: fixed an issue when the new async_mode was used together with numpy arrays
column32: the syntax to add a new chart has been slightly changed :
column33: log file has been retired and removed from the configuration/add-in.
column34: the purpose of this document is to enable you a smooth experience when upgrading to xlwings v0.9.0 and above by laying out the concept and syntax changes in detail. if you want to get an overview of the new features and bug fixes, have a look at the release notes. note that the syntax for user defined functions didn t change.
column35: python 3.6 is now supported
column36: excel constants have been added under their original excel name, but categorized under their enum , e.g.:
column37: log_file: so far, the log file has been placed next to the excel file per default . this has been changed as it was causing issues for files on sharepoint/onedrive and mac excel 2016: the place where log_file = "" refers to depends on the os and the excel version.
column38: this release adds an often requested & powerful new feature to user defined functions : dynamic expansion for array formulas. while excel offers array formulas, you need to specify their dimensions up front by selecting the result array first, then entering the formula and finally hitting ctrl-shift-enter. while this makes sense from a data integrity point of view, in practice, it often turns out to be a cumbersome limitation, especially when working with dynamic arrays such as time series data.
column39: mac excel 2011 is now supported again with the new add-in. however, since excel 2011 doesn t support the ribbon, the config file has been created/edited manually, see environment variables .
column40: this is a simple example that demonstrates the syntax and effect of udf expansion:
column41: the xlwings dlls are now properly versioned, allowing to use pre 0.11 releases in parallel with >0.11 releases

column43: this release fixes a bug introduced with v0.11.6 that wouldn t allow to open workbooks by name
column44: : matplotlib figures are now converted to 300 dpi pictures for better quality when using them with pictures.add .
column45: : sometimes, a column was referenced instead of a named range
column46: unicode book names are again supported .
column47: : user defined functions support now multiple source files, see also under api changes below. for example : udf_modules="common;myproject"
column48: cross-platform: xlwings is now additionally supporting microsoft excel for mac. the only functionality that is not yet available is the possibility to call the python code from within excel via vba macros.
column49: this version adds two exciting but still experimental features from excelpython :
column50: expand option: this works the same as the range properties table, vertical and horizontal but is only evaluated when getting the values of a range:
column51: xlwings.book.save now supports relative paths. also, when saving an existing book under a new name without specifying the full path, it ll be saved in python s current working directory instead of in excel s default directory .
column52: settings don t have to be manipulated in vba code anymore, but can be either set globally via ribbon/config file or for the workbook via a special worksheet
column53: objects like books, sheets etc. can now be compared and are properly hashable
column54: : like windows, mac now also only shows errors in a popup. before it was including stdout, too
column55: if a sheet, range or chart object is instantiated without an existing workbook object, a user-friendly error message is raised .
column56: this release brings further improvements with regards to the add-in:
column57: runfronzenpython now accepts spaces in the path of the executable, but in turn requires to be called with command line arguments as a separate vba argument. example: runfrozenpython "c:\path\to\frozen_executable.exe", "arg1 arg2" .
column58: : python errors are now also shown in a message box. this makes the mac version feature equivalent with the windows version :
column59: opening a file via xw.book was causing an additional book1 to be opened in case excel was not running yet
column60: fixed an issue introduced with the previous release that always showed the command prompt when running udfs, not just when using conda envs .
column61: the excelpython project has been fully merged into xlwings. this means that on windows, udf s are now supported via decorator syntax. a simple example:
column62: you can still use a vba module instead of the add-in, but the recommended way is the add-in
column63: pro breaking change: the table.update method has been changed to treat the dataframe s index consistently whether or not it s being written to an excel table: by default, the index is now transferred to excel in both cases.
column64: the most important update with this release was made on windows: the methodology used to make a connection to workbooks has been completely replaced. this finally allows xlwings to reliably connect to multiple instances of excel even if the workbooks are opened from untrusted locations . this gets rid of the dreaded filename is already open... error message that was sometimes shown in this context. it also allows the vba hooks to work correctly if the very same file is opened in various instances of excel.
column65: application as attribute of a workbook has been removed :
column66: windows: with udfs, you can now get easy access to the caller by using caller as a function argument . in that sense, caller is now a reserved argument by xlwings and if you have any existing arguments with this name, you ll need to rename them:
column67: runpython can now be called in parallel from different excel instances .

column76: to reference the calling workbook when running code from vba, you now have to use workbook.caller. this means that wb = workbook is now consistently creating a new workbook, whether the code is called interactively or from vba.
column77: the vba error pop-up can now be muted by setting show_log = false in the vba settings. to be used with care, but it can be useful on mac, as the pop-up window is currently showing printed log messages even if no error occurred.

column86: windows: the setting show console now also shows/hides the command prompt properly when using the udf server with conda. there is no more switching between python and pythonw required .
column87: the workbook class has the following additional methods: current and set_current. they determine the default workbook for sheet, range or chart. on windows, in case there are various excel instances, when creating new or opening existing workbooks, they are being created in the same instance as the current workbook.

column2: orjson.dumps raises an exception if the object to be serialized is not given as a positional argument. orjson.dumps is intended and ok while orjson.dumps is an error. this makes it consistent with the documentation, help annotation, and type annotation.
column3: serialization is 10-20% faster and uses about 50% less memory by writing directly to the returned bytes object.
column4: manylinux1 wheels for 3.6, 3.7, and 3.8 are now compliant with the spec by not depending on glibc 2.18.
column5: fix repeated serialization of str that are ascii-only and have a legacy layout.
column6: orjson.dumps does not serialize dataclasses.dataclass attributes that begin with a leading underscore, e.g., _attr. this is because of the python idiom that a leading underscores marks an attribute as "private."
column7: orjson.dumps pretty prints with an indentation of two spaces if option=orjson.opt_indent_2 is specified.
column8: numpy support now includes numpy.uint32 and numpy.uint64.
column9: fix dataclasses.dataclass attributes that are dict to be effected by orjson.opt_sort_keys.
column10: the recursion limit of default on orjson.dumps has been increased from 5 to 254.
column11: performance improvements and lower memory usage in deserialization by creating only one str object for repeated map keys.
column12: improve serialization performance marginally by using the fastcall/vectorcall calling convention on python3.7 and above.
column13: orjson.dumps serializes dataclasses.dataclass and uuid.uuid instances by default. the options opt_serialize_dataclass and opt_serialize_uuid can still be specified but have no effect.
column14: orjson.dumps accepts datetime.datetime, datetime.date, and datetime.time. each is serialized to an rfc 3339 string.
column15: fix compatibility with debug builds of cpython.
column16: orjson.dumps serializes dict keys of type other than str if option=orjson.opt_non_str_keys is specified.
column17: orjson.dumps does not serialize dataclasses.dataclass attributes that are initvar or classvar whether using __slots__ or not.
column18: orjson.opt_passthrough_subclass causes orjson.dumps to pass subclasses of builtin types to default so the caller can customize the output.
column19: orjson.dumps serializes dict instances sorted by keys, equivalent to sort_keys in other implementations, if option=orjson.opt_sort_keys is specified.
column21: performance improvements to serializing a list containing elements of the same type.
column22: aarch64 manylinux2014 wheels are now compatible with glibc 2.17.
column23: improve deserialization performance of floats by about 40%.
