column84: about
column85: fix documentation on default, in particular documenting the need to raise an exception if the type cannot be handled.
column86: orjson.dumps now serializes datetime.datetime objects without a tzinfo rather than raising jsonencodeerror.
column87: use vectorcall apis for method calls on python3.9 and above.
column88: fix annotation of optional parameters on orjson.dumps for help.
column89: orjson.dumps accepts a default callable to serialize arbitrary types.
column90: orjson.dumps serializes integers up to a 64-bit unsigned integer's maximum. it was previously the maximum of a 64-bit signed integer.
column91: improve serialization and deserialization performance.
column92: disable unsupported simd features on non-x86, non-arm targets
column93: dict key can only be str.
column94: publish python3.10 wheels for linux on amd64 and aarch64.
column95: orjson.dumps accepts orjson.opt_omit_microseconds to not serialize the microseconds attribute of datetime.datetime and datetime.time instances.
column96: dataclasses.dataclass instances without __slots__ now serialize faster.
column97: fix deserialization raising jsondecodeerror on some valid negative floats with large exponents.
column98: orjson.dumps available to raise an error on integer values outside the 53-bit range of all json implementations.
column99: orjson.dumps serializes dataclasses.dataclass instances if option=orjson.opt_serialize_dataclass is specified.
column100: orjson.dumps serializes numpy.ndarray instances if option=orjson.opt_serialize_numpy is specified.

column2: pex 2.0.0 is cut on the advent of a large, mostly internal change for typical use cases: it now uses vendored pip to perform resolves and wheel builds. this fixes a large number of compatibility and correctness bugs as well as gaining feature support from pip including handling manylinux2010 and manylinux2014 as well as vcs requirements and support for pep-517 & pep-518 builds.
column3: this release adds support for including sources and resources directly in a produced pex - without the need to use pants.
column4: with network configuration now wired up, the pex_http_retries and pex_http_timeout env var support in pex 1 that was never wired into pex 2 is now dropped in favor of passing --retries and --timeout via the cli
column5: bug fix: we did not normalize package names in resolvableset, so it was possible to depend on sphinx and sphinx-1.4a0.tar.gz and get two versions build and included into the pex. #147.
column6: this release restores and improves support for building and running multiplatform pexes. foreign linux* platform builds now include manylinux2014 compatible wheels by default and foreign cpython pexes now resolve abi3 wheels correctly. in addition, error messages at both buildtime and runtime related to resolution of dependencies are more informative.
column7: this release focuses on the resolver api and resolution performance. pex 2 resolving using pip is now at least at performance parity with pex 1 in all studied cases and most often is 5% to 10% faster.
column8: the resolver api removed precedence which is now pip default precedence: wheels when available and not ruled out via the --no-wheel cli option or use_wheel=false api argument.
column9: this release brings official support for python 3.9 and adds a new --tmpdir option to explicitly control the tmpdir used by pex and its subprocesses. the latter is useful when building pexes in space-constrained environments in the face of large distributions.
column10: now supports extras for static urls and installable directories. #65.
column11: the --cache-dir setting is deprecated in favor of build time control of the cache location with --pex-root and new support for control of the cache's runtime location with --runtime-pex-root is added. as in the past, the pex_root environment variable can still be used to control the cache's runtime location.
column12: add recipe to use pex with requests module and proxies. pr #659
column13: the focus of this release is better support of the --platform cli arg. platforms are now better documented and can optionally be resolved to local interpreters when possible via --resolve-local-platforms to better support creation of multiplatform pexes.
column14: the resolver api replaced fetchers with a list of indexes and a list of find_links repos.
column15: bug fix: scrub sys.path and sys.modules based upon both supplied path and realpath of files and directories. newer versions of virtualenv on linux symlink site-packages which caused those packages to not be removed from sys.path correctly. issue #21
column16: a new suite of pex tools is now available in pex itself and any pexes built with the new --include-tools option. use pex_tools=1 pex --help to find out more about the available tools and their usage.
column17: this release fixes a regression in handling explicitly requested --index or --find-links http repos. in addition, performance of the pex 2.x resolver is brought in line with the 1.x resolver in all cases and improved in most cases.
column18: this release brings enhanced performance when using the pex cli or api to resolve requirements and improved performance for many pexed applications when specifying the --unzip option. pexes built with --unzip will first unzip themselves into the pex cache if not unzipped there already and then re-execute themselves from there. this can improve startup latency. pex itself now uses this mode in our (link
column19: adds support for pex_path environment variable which allows merging of pex environments at runtime. this can be used to inject plugins or entry_points or modules from one pex into another without explicitly building them together. #30.
column20: bug fix: pex-info values were overridden by environment variables with default values that were not explicitly set in the environment. fixes #135.
column21: adds helper method to dump a package subdirectory onto disk from within a zipped pex file. this can be useful for applications that know they're running within a pex and would prefer some static assets dumped to disk instead of running as an unzipped pex file. #12.
column22: this release upgrades pip to 20.3.3 + a patch to fix pex resolves using the pip-legacy-resolver and --constraints. the pex package is also fixed to install for python 3.9.1+.
column23: this release changes pex requirement resolution behavior. only stable requirements are resolved by default now. the previous behavior that included pre-releases can be retained by passing --pre on the pex command line or passing allow_prereleases=true via the api.
column24: a hotfix that finishes work started in 2.1.37 by #1304 to align pip based resolve results with --pex-repository based resolve results for requirements with '.' in their names as allowed by pep-503.
column25: this release includes full manylinux support, improvements to wheel resolution and a handful of other improvements and bugfixes. enjoy!
column26: add support for parsing extras and specifiers. pr #1161
column27: breaking change: pex -r now takes requirements.txt filenames and not requirement specs. requirement specs are now passed as arguments to the pex tool. use -- to escape command line arguments passed to interpreters spawned by pex. implements #5.
column28: this is a hotfix release for a regression in setuptools compatibility introduced by #542.
column29: this release brings support for a --venv execution mode to complement --unzip and standard unadorned pex zip file execution modes. the --venv execution mode will first install the pex file into a virtual environment under ${pex_root}/venvs and then re-execute itself from there. this mode of execution allows you to ship your pexed application as a single zipfile that automatically installs itself in a venv and runs from there to eliminate all pex startup overhead on subsequent runs and work like a "normal" application.
column30: this release fixes the hermeticity of pip resolver executions when the resolver is called via the pex api in an environment with pythonpath set.
column31: the release also fixes --cert and --client-cert so that they work with pep-518 builds in addition to fixing bytecode compilation races in highly parallel environments.
column32: change the interpretation of -i to match pip's -i. this is useful for compatibility with devpi.
column33: this is a hotfix release that fixes a bug exposed when pex was asked to use an interpreter with a non-canonical path as well as fixes for 'current' platform handling in the resolver api.
column34: we now support reproducible builds when creating a pex via pex -o foo.pex, meaning that if you were to run the command again with the same inputs, the two generated pexes would be byte-for-byte identical. to enable reproducible builds when building a pex, use the flags --no-use-system-time --no-compile, which will use a deterministic timestamp and not include .pyc files in the pex.
column35: this release adds the --intransitive option to support pre-resolved requirements lists and allows for python binaries built under gentoo naming conventions.
column36: spruce up pex and pex-tools clis with uniform -v / --version support and default value display in help. pr #1301
column37: as part of the resolution performance work, pip networking configuration is now exposed via pex cli options and the networkconfiguration api type / new resolver.resolve api parameter.
column38: bug fix: accommodate osx python python binaries. previously the osx python distributions shipped with osx, xcode and available via link could fail to be detected using the pythoninterpreter class. fixes #144.
column39: this release fixes a performance regression in which pip would re-tokenize --find-links pages unnecessarily. the parsed pages are now cached in a pip patch that has also been submitted upstream.
column40: we recently regained access to the docsite, and link is now up-to-date.
column41: this release adds support for -c and -m pexfile runtime options that emulate the behavior of the same arguments to python as well a fix for handling the non-standard platform reported by setuptools for apple system interpreters in addition to several other bug fixes.
column42: this release fixes a bug in sys.path scrubbing / hermeticity and a bug in the -d / --sources-directory and -r / --resources-directory options whereby pep-420 implicit packages were not respected .
column43: special thanks to dan blanchard for seeding the initial pr for manylinux support and wheel resolution improvements.
column44: this release changes the behavior of the --interpreter-constraint option. previously, interpreter constraints were anded, which made it impossible to express constraints like '>=2.7,<3' or '>=3.6,<4'; ie: either python 2.7 or else any python 3 release at or above 3.6. now interpreter constraints are ored, which is likely a breaking change if you have scripts that pass multiple interpreter constraints. to transition, use the native , and operator in your constraint expression, as used in the example above.
column45: adds interpreter detection for jython and pypy.
column46: adds twitter.common.python.resolver resolve method that handles transitive dependency resolution better. this means that if the requirement futures==2.1.2 and an unqualified futures>=2 is pulled in transitively, our resolver will correctly resolve futures 2.1.2 instead of reporting a versionconflict if any version newer than 2.1.2 is available. rb #129
column47: the 1.0.0 release of pex introduces a few breaking changes: pex -r now takes requirements.txt files instead of requirement specs, pex -s has now been removed since source specs are accepted as arguments, and pex -p has been removed in favor of its alias pex -o.
column48: adds console script support via -c/--script/--console-script and pex_script. this allows you to reference the named entry point instead of the exact module:name pair. also supports scripts defined in the scripts section of setup.py. #59.
column49: new feature: adds an interpreter cache to the pex tool. if the user does not explicitly disable the wheel feature and attempts to build a pex with wheels but does not have the wheel package installed, pex will download it in order to make the feature work. implements #47 in order to fix #48
column50: this is a hotfix release for 1.4.8 that fixes a regression in interpreter setup that could lead to resolved distributions failing to build or install.
column51: this release significantly improves performance and correctness of interpreter discovery, particularly when pyenv is involved. it also provides a workaround for eperm issues when hard linking across devices, by falling back to copying. resolve error checking also now accounts for environment markers.
column52: use pip for resolving and building distributions. pr #788
column53: change the setuptools range to >=2.2,<16 by handling entrypoint changes as well as being flexible on whether pkg_resources is a package or a module. fixes #55 and #34.
column54: bug fix: filename should be part of the .pex cache key or else multiple identical versions will incorrectly resolve
column55: this release fixes bugs in --unzip and --venv mode pex file execution and upgrades to the last release of pip to support python 2.7.
column56: this release upgrades pex to the latest pip which includes support for the new 2020-resolver (see: link as well as support for macos bigsur. although this release defaults to the legacy resolver behavior, the next release will deprecate the legacy resolver and support for the legacy resolver will later be removed to allow continuing pip upgrades going forward. to switch to the new resolver, use: --resolver-version pip-2020-resolver.
column57: bug fix: urllibcontext used replace as a keyword argument for bytes.decode but this only works on python 3. pull request #46
column58: this ordinarily should not be a problem but the zipimporter caches metadata by filename instead of stat/sha, so if the underlying contents changed a runtime error would be thrown due to seemingly corrupt zip file offsets. rb #684
column59: this release includes an initial body of work towards windows support, abi tag support for cpython 2.x and a fix for version number normalization.
column60: add readme and supported python versions to pypi description. #258
column61: this release brings a fix to handle top-level requirements with environment markers, fully completing environment marker support.
column62: this is a hotfix release that fixes requirement parsing when there is a local file in the cwd with the same name as the project name of a remote requirement to be resolved.
column63: this release brings a consistency fix to requirement resolution and an isolation fix that scrubs all non-stdlib pythonpath entries by default, only pre-pending or appending them to the sys.path if the corresponding --inherit-path= is used.
column64: add interpreter constraints option and use constraints to search for compatible interpreters at exec time #427
column65: this is a bugfix release for a regression that inadvertently went out in 1.3.0.
column66: the resolver api removed context which is now automatically handled.
column67: fixes an issue where sourcetranslator would overwrite .egg/.whl distributions already on disk. instead it should always check to see if a copy already exists and reuse if there.
column68: this is a hotfix release for the bug detailed in #756 that was introduced by #752 in python 3.7 interpreters.
column69: adds -m and --entry-point alias to the existing -e option for entry points in the pex tool to evoke the similarity to python -m.
column70: add delayed pkg_resources import fix from #713, with an integration test pr #730
column71: slightly demystify the relationship between platforms and interpreters in the library api and cli pr #1047
column72: refactor http handling in pex to allow for alternate http implementations. adds support for requests, improving both performance and security. for more information, read the commit notes at 91c7f32. rb #778
column73: the release also removes --use-first-matching-interpreter, which was a misfeature. if you want to use fewer interpreters when building a pex, use more precise values for --interpreter-constraint and/or --python-path, or use --python or --platform.
column74: add type hints to util.py and tracer.py pr #1044
column75: for users of the pex api, it is recommended to add minor version ranges, e.g. pex>=1.0,<1.1. for users of the pex cli, major version ranges such as pex>=1,<2 should be sufficient.
column76: adds a number of flag aliases to be more compatible with pip command lines: --no-index, -f, --find-links, --index-url, --no-use-wheel. removes -p in favor of -o exclusively.
column77: this release brings a fix for building sdists with certain macos interpreters when creating a pex file that would then fail to resolve on pex startup.
column78: unlike in the past, the (link we release can now also be controlled via the pex_root environment variable. consult the cli help for --no-strip-pex-env to find out more.
column79: beyond bugfixes for a few important edge cases, this release includes new support for @argfiles on the command line from @jjhelmus. these can be useful to overcome command line length limitations. see: link
column80: add manylinux wheel support and fix a few bugs along the way #316
column81: bug fix: executed entry points shouldn't be forced to run in an environment with __future__ imports enabled.
column82: without this change, once a distribution aged past the ttl it would never be used again, and builds would re-create the same distributions in tmpdirs over and over again.
column83: pex 2.1.0 should be considered the first pex 2-series release that fully replaces and improves upon pex 1-series functionality.
column84: this release hardens a few aspects of --venv mode pexes. an infinite re-exec loop in venv pex scripts is fixed and the activate family of scripts in the venv is fixed.
column85: api changes to be wary of:
column86: this release introduces the ability to copy requirements from an existing pex into a new one.
column87: this release brings a bugfix for macos interpreters when the macosx_deployment_target sysconfig variable is numeric as well as a fix that improves pip execution environment isolation.
column88: bug fix: allow pex 0.8.x to parse pex files produced by earlier versions of pex and twitter.common.python.
column89: this is another hotfix release to fix incorrect resolve post-processing failing otherwise correct resolves.
column90: update cache dir when bdist_pex.run is called directly. #278 fixes #274
column91: there is also support for a new resolution mode when building pex files that allows you to use the results of a previous resolve by specifying it as a -pex-repository to resolve from. if you have many applications sharing a requirements.txt / constraints.txt, this can drastically speed up resolves.
column92: bug fix: sys.exit called without arguments would cause none to be printed on stderr since pex 1.0.1. #143.
column93: adds __hash__ to link so that packages are hashed correctly in twitter.common.python.resolver resolve
column94: this release adds the --use-first-matching-interpreter flag, which can speed up performance when building a pex at the expense of being compatible with fewer interpreters at runtime.
column95: api change: decouple translation from package iteration. this removes the obtainer construct entirely, which likely means if you're using pex as a library, you will need to change your code if you were doing anything nontrivial. this adds a couple new options to resolve but simplifies the story around how to cache packages. rb #785
column96: this release opens up setuptools support for more modern versions that support breaking changes in setup used in the wild.
column97: this release adds support for validating pex entrypoints at build time in addition to several bugfixes.
column98: support for copying requirements from an existing pex. pr #948
column99: bug fix: replace uses of os.unsetenv with del os.environ pull request #11
column101: the pex command line interface now adheres to semver insofar as backwards incompatible cli changes will invoke a major version change. any backwards incompatible changes to the pex environment variable semantics will also result in a major version change. the pex api adheres to semver insofar as backwards incompatible api changes will invoke minor version changes.
column102: add support for controlling prerelease resolution. #350 fixes #28
column103: bug fix: since 69649c1 we have been unpatching the side-effects of sys.modules after pex.execute. this takes all modules imported during the pex lifecycle and sets all their attributes to none. unfortunately, sys.excepthook, atexit and __del__ may still try to operate using these tainted modules, causing exceptions on interpreter teardown. this reverts just the sys unpatching so that the abovementioned teardown hooks behave more predictably. fixes #141.
column104: this can greatly speed up repeatedly creating a pex when no requirements have changed. a build tool can create a "requirements pex" that contains just a static set of requirements, and build a final pex on top of that, without having to re-run pip to resolve requirements.
column105: this release is a quick fix for a regression that inadvertently went out in 1.1.3 .
column106: allow pexbuilder to optionally copy files into the pex environment instead of hard-linking them.
column107: refactor tox.ini to increase the number of environment combinations and improve coverage.
column108: the --platform cli option and platform resolver api argument now must be full platform strings that include platform, implementation, version and abi; e.g.: --platform=macosx-10.13-x86_64-cp-36-m.
column109: fix reproducible build test improperly using the -c flag and add a new test for -c flag pr #725
column110: add a test for the regression in fixedeggmetadata._zipinfo_name and revert the breaking commit. fixes #216
column111: refactor reproducible build tests to assert that the original pex command succeeded pr #724
column112: this release is a quick fix for a regression that inadvertently went out in 1.1.5 .
column113: allow pex to be invoked using runpy . pr #637
column114: this is another hotfix release to fix a regression in pex --sources-directory handling of relative paths.
column115: breaking change: removes the -s option in favor of specifying directories directly as arguments to the pex command line.
column116: adds support for pex_python environment variable which will cause the pex file to reinvoke itself using the interpreter specified, e.g. pex_python=python3.4 or pex_python=/exact/path/to/interpreter. #27.
column117: this is a hotfix release that fixes --venv mode shebangs being too long for some linux environments.
column118: this release fixes another bug in --venv mode when pex_path is exported in the environment.
column119: fix bug in cached dependency resolution with exact resolvable. #365
column120: guard against modules with a __file__ of none. issue #756 pr #757
column121: fix invalid regex and escape sequences causing deprecationwarning pr #646
column122: remove long deprecated support for _pex module. pr #1135
column123: ensures that .egg/.whl distributions on disk have their mtime updated even though we no longer overwrite them. this gives them a new time lease against their ttl.
column124: avoid reordering of equivalent packages from multiple fetchers pr #762
column125: a patch release to fix an issue with the --use-first-matching-interpreter flag.
column126: adds a new package abstraction by refactoring link into link and package. rb #92
column127: consolidates documentation of pex_ environment variables and adds the --help-variables option to the pex client. partially addresses #13.
column128: about
column129: the --manylinux cli option and use_manylinux resolver api argument were removed. instead, to resolve manylinux wheels for a foreign platform, specify the manylinux platform to target with an explicit --platform cli flag or platform resolver api argument; e.g.: --platform=manylinux2010-x86_64-cp-36-m.
column130: this is a htofix release that fixes a bug when specifying a custom index via the cli.
column131: this is the first release including only a single pex pex, which supports execution under all interpreters pex supports.
column132: add new --no-use-system-time flag to use a deterministic timestamp in built pex pr #722
column133: constrain the virtualenv version used by tox. pr #968
column134: twitter.common.python is no longer a namespace package
column135: add dummy flush method for clean interpreter exit with python3.6 #343
column136: fix resolve regressions introduced by the 1.4.8. pr #580
column137: this release improves interpreter discovery to prefer more recent patch versions, e.g. preferring python 3.6.10 over 3.6.8.
column138: fix pythoninterpreter caching and ergonomics. #518
column139: this release is a quick fix for a bootstrapping bug that inadvertently went out in 1.2.0 .
column140: this release fixes a bug in --resolve-local-platforms handling that made it unusable in 2.1.16 as well as fixing a long standing file handle leak and a bug when running under macos framework builds of python .
column141: adds http retry support for the requestscontext. rb #1303
column142: adds twitter.common.python.pex_bootstrap bootstrap_pex_env function in order to initialize a pex environment from within a python interpreter.
column143: adds pex_profile_entries to limit the number of entries reported when pex_profile is enabled.
column144: introduce new --no-compile flag to not include .pyc in built pex due to its non-determinism pr #718
column145: add type hints to variables.py and platforms.py pr #1042
column146: this release fixes a deadlock that could be experienced when building pex files in highly concurrent environments in addition to fixing pex --help-variables output.
column147: finally, the long deprecated exposure of the pex apis through _pex has been removed. to use the pex apis you must include pex as a dependency in your pex file.
column148: pin pex to setuptools prior to 9.x until we have a chance to make changes related to pep440 and the change of pkg_resources.py to a package.
column149: this release fixes pexes such that they fully support environment markers, the canonical use case being a python 2/3 pex that needs to conditionally load one or more python 2 backport libs when running under a python 2 interpreter only.
column150: this release brings an exit code fix for pexes run via entrypoint as well as a fix for finding scripts when building pexes from wheels with dashes in their distribution name.
column151: expand the range of supported setuptools. pr #541
column152: fix up inherits_path tests to use new values #450
column153: pythoninterpreter: support python binary names with single letter suffixes pr #769
column154: this finishes off the effort tracked by issue #716
column155: this is the last release before the 1.0.0 development branch is started.
column156: fix issue with wheel when using --index-url option pr #865
column157: bug fix: fix handling of fetchers with file:// urls.
column158: this release fixes a bug in which interpreter discovery failed when running from a zipped pex.
column159: bug fix: adds content method to http contexts that does html content decoding, fixing an encoding issue only experienced when using python 3. issue #10
column160: follow redirects on http requests #361
column161: use open with utf-8 support. #231
column162: honor interpreter constraints even when pex_python and pex_python_path not set pr #668
column163: bug fix: pex_coverage and pex_profile did not function correctly when systemexit was raised. fixes #81.
column164: fix for ambiguous resolvable bug in transitive dependency resolution #367
column165: performance improvement: don't always write packages to disk if they've already been cached. this can significantly speed up launching pex files with a large number of non-zip-safe dependencies. rb #1642
column166: make sure pexinfo is isolated from os.environ. pr #711

column2: improved documentation with more examples and mention linq explicitly
column3: fixed sequence.zip_with_index behavior. used to mimic enumerate by zipping on the left size while scala and spark do zip on the right side. this introduces different behavior and more flexible behavior in combination with enumerate a start parameter was also added like in enumerate
column4: dependencies and supported python versions
column5: added support for reading to and from sqlite databases
column6: fold_left and fold_right had incorrect order of arguments for passed function
column7: improved _html_repr_, show and tabulate by auto detecting named tuples as column names (link
column8: changed all relative imports to absolute imports with __future__.absolute_import
column9: improved _html_repr_ and show to tell the user 10 of n rows are being shown if there are more than 10 rows (link
column10: new features
column11: new features
column12: new features
column13: new features
column14: new features
column15: new features
column16: fixed case where _wrap is changing named tuples to arrays when it should preserve them
column17: adding extend feature
column18: detect when its possible to pretty print a table and do so
column19: allow variance on versions of certain packages: link and link
column20: product modified to allow linq projected product
column21: official and tested support for python 3.5. thus scalafunctional is tested on python 2.7, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, pypy, and pypy3
column22: reaching 1.0 primarily means that api stability has been reached so i don't expect to run into many new breaking changes.
column24: drop ci testing and official support for python 3.3
column25: added optional initial value for reduce (link
column26: pinned versions of all dependencies
column27: sum modified to allow linq projected sum
column28: implemented optimized version of reduce_by_key
column29: added data interchange tutorial with pandas (link
column30: added precompute attribute to reverse transformation
column31: thanks to chuyuhsu for implemented large parts of the compression feature!
column32: select from linq
column33: about
column34: list/to_list have a parameter n to limit number of results
column35: added interface to csv.dictreader via seq.csv_dict_reader (link
column36: thanks to versae for implementing most of the pseq feature!
column37: fix bug with incorrect wrapping of pandas dataframes link
column38: added table of contents to readme (link
column39: remove package installations from default requirements that sometimes break installation on barebones systems in python 2.7
column40: aggregate from linq
column41: fix python 3 build error due to wheel installation of enum34. package no longer depends on enum34
column42: where from linq

column2: reuse the presets for hdf5 and openblas with caffe and mxnet
column3: fix mingw-w64 builds with recent versions of gcc 5.x and potential issue with using "w32threads" for ffmpeg
column4: remove unneeded @opaque types from gsl and replace them with their definitions whose names end with "_struct"
column5: in addition to leptonica and tesseract, use only the officially supported gcc compiler for ffmpeg, fftw, and gsl under windows as well, to prevent compatibility issues
column6: replace requires with requires static in jpms .platform modules

column2: the add add_multicolumn and add_multirow methods on tabular classes are removed in favor of the much more robust and easier to use .multirow and .multicolumn classes.
column3: the non keyword argument for filename is now called path instead of filename to show it can also be used with paths.
column4: the internal method propegate_packages has been spelled correctly and made "internal" by adding an underscore in front of the name, resulting in _propagate_packages
column5: default configuration for certain options can be overwritten with the new pylatex.config module.
column6: added .pagestyle class to support the creation of various page styles. in addition to this class .head and .foot were added for creating unique headers and footers within the page styles. a .simple_page_number function was also added for easy displaying of a simple page number.
column7: the temp directory is only removed in generate_pdf when cleaning is enabled
column8: the container_name attribute has been changed to ~.latexobject.latex_name so it can be used more than containers. by default it is still the lowercase version of the classname. to change the default for a class you should set _latex_name
column9: this realease brings some great changes. the whole package has been refactored and actual documentation has been added. because of this, things have been moved an renamed. one of the most notable changes is that all normal text is now escaped by default.
column10: compiling is more secure now and it doesn't show output unless an error occurs or explicitly specified.
column11: use known working versions for python 3.5 and lower of ordered-set dependency
column12: the old table class is renamed to .tabular. a new .table class has been created that represents the table latex environment, which can be used to create a floating table.
column13: see these docs for changes that have not yet been released and are only present in the development version. this version might not be stable, but to install it use:
column14: the default of the filepath argument for the .document.generate_pdf and .document.generate_tex have been changed to none. the response to the default is not changed, so this is a fairly invisible change.
column15: added tikz basic drawing functions for nodes and paths, with minimal coordinate support.
column16: when subclassing a class and special latex packages are needed, you now have to specify the packages class attribute instead of passing packages along with the __init__ method.
column17: added a new type of container .containercommand for supporting commands with data.
column18: installs from git now get installed as a special version based on the commit. this is done by using versioneer.
column19: content of subclasses of .container is now automatically escaped. content of .arguments or .options is not escaped by default.
column20: filenames with a ~ in them now also work as figure paths. this caused issues when using temp directories on windows.
column21: .quantity got a new options keyword argument and learned to handle uncertain quantities.
column22: removed useless list class constructor arguments for list_spec and pos. these were probably copied from the .tabular class.
column23: .tabular.add_row now accepts cells as arguments, so they don't have to be wrapped in a list or tuple anymore.
column24: tables like .tabular now raise an exception when rows with wrong size are added
column25: releases can be done with much less manual work for the maintainer in the future.
column26: the default allignment of a multicolumn is not c instead of |c|, since vertical lines in tables are ugly most of the time.
column27: fix a bug in plt and one in fix_filename that caused an error when using them with some filenames
column28: removed base keyword argument of the .package class. .command should be used when changing of the base is needed.
column29: fixed the testall.sh script such that sphinx and nosetests get called with the correct python version.
column30: add .commandbase, which can be easily subclassed for a command that is used more than once.
column31: for all of the previous changes the old submodules and names should still work during the transition period, but they will be removed before the final release.
column32: filenames should now be specified to the ~.document.generate_pdf/~.document.generate_tex methods of document. if this is not done the default_filename attribute will be used.
column33: with statement support
column34: allow the data keyword argument of containers to be a single item instead of a list. if this is the case it will be wrapped in a list on initialization.
column35: removed the submodules pylatex.parameters, pylatex.command and pylatex.numpy. the content of the first two was moved to pylatex.base_classes.command and the content of the last one was moved to pylatex.math.
column36: add label and cross reference support.
column37: command and parameter classes
column38: the plt class has been merged with the .figure class. its ~.figure.add_plot method also doesn't take a plt argument anymore. the plt module is now imported when the ~.figure.add_plot method is used. this also allows for adding plots in the .subfigure class.
column39: add .noescape string class, which can be used to make sure a raw latex string is not escaped.
column40: the table object is going to be deprecated in favor of the better named .tabular object. this will take a couple of releases.
column41: removed the title, author, date and maketitle arguments from the .document constructor. they were from a time when it was not possible to change the preamble, which is now very easy. they are not so commonly used that they should be part of the main .document object.
column42: for better readability let ~.escape_latex change a newline to \\%\n instead of simply \\.
column43: .tabular.add_row now accepts a list of mappers
column44: allow supplying a mapper function to dumps_list and the add_row method for tabular like objects.
column45: .quantity now correctly splits prefix and unit into seperate commands.
column46: removed
column47: fix bug where the geometry options were not applied in some cases
column48: escape generated \n characters by pylatex by placing a % sign in front of them.
column49: made ~.latexobject.separate_paragraph, ~.latexobject.begin_paragraph and ~.latexobject.end_paragraph class attributes instead of instance attributes.
column50: latex_name is now fixed for the .document class. this way you can safely subclass it.
column51: replace filename by filepath in the names of the arguments.
column52: added a new .position package with the following classes: .center , .flushleft , .flushright , .minipage , .textblock , .verticalspace and .horizontalspace
column53: add support for booktabs tables, which look nicer than normal tables.
column55: pypi installs will not fail anymore for python 2.7, when 3to2 and future were installed.
column56: .document packages now get propagated from the preamble elements as well.
column57: .container now has a ~.container.dumps_content method, which dumps it content instead of a dumps method. this allows to override just that method when subclassing .environment so you can do dump in some special inside the environment, while still keeping the \begin and \end stuff provided by .environment.
column58: made lots of keyword arguments keyword only arguments. this was needed to make it easy to keep the api the same in the future.
column59: all notable changes to this project will be documented on this page. this project adheres to semantic versioning.
column60: fixes filename generation with dots in the final filename on windows.
column61: matplotlib support now uses the tmpfile module, this fixes permission issues with the badly previously badly located tmp directory.
column62: add fragment class which is a container without any latex code surrounding its content.
column63: an unfinished quantity class that can be used in conjunction with the quantitities package. link
column64: the graphics submodule has been renamed to figure.

column70: added
column71: added
column72: added
column73: added
column74: added
column75: added
column76: added
column77: added
column78: allow overriding of the default numbering of .section class.
column79: the command and parameters submodules have been merged into one command submodule in the base_classes submodule.
column80: install now works on python 3.6+
column81: fix package delegation with duplicate packages
column82: the old baseclasses have been renamed as well. they now have easier names that better show their purpose.

column91: added the ability to add your own column types through the .columntype class.
column92: make width and placement keyword only arguments for the ~.figure.add_plot method.
column93: changed from using $$ ... $$ for displaymath to using \.
column94: added the option to select a color when adding an hline or adding a row to any ~.tabular environment.
column95: moved ~.latexobject.separate_paragraph, ~.latexobject.begin_paragraph and ~.latexobject.end_paragraph attributes to .latexobject.
column96: added the ability to choose the enumeration symbol in a list using the enumeration_symbol keyword argument of .enumerate.
column97: .tabular can now have a width specified to override the calculated width based on the table_spec argument.
column98: .package instances now actually get deduplicated.
column99: added .standalonegraphic to support the creation of images outside of figure environments.
column100: baselatexnamedcontainer now uses the name of the class as the default container_name
column101: make labels/sections with weird characters work
column102: add the textcomp package by default. this way some special glyphs, like the euro symbol can be used in the source.
column103: propagate packages recursively add packages of sub containers
column104: fixed a bug in the .document class, that lead to an error if a filepath without basename was provided.
column105: subfigure class for use with subcaption package
column106: partial experimental support for multicol/multirow
column107: more descriptive error when no compatible latex compiler was found.
column108: _star_latex_name attribute of .latexobject to append a star
column109: .tabu and .longtabu environments learn 'spread' and 'to' syntax to control their width.

column2: - new and updated features extractors
column3: - some descriptors output by the streaming_extractor have been fixed and now have
column4: differences are significative, and are more significative in lower bands
column5: bin instead of truncating, hence we're not taking into account the bin n 0,
column6: - external features / examples enhancements:
column7: - new algorithms for onset detection, beat tracking and melody extraction

column9: network is a directed acyclic graph, the composites have better defined semantics, and the order of execution of the
