column2: deprecated lockfile library which is used by the local storage driver has been replaced with fasteners library.
column3: fix a regression introduced in 0.13.0 and make sure to include content-length 0 with put and post requests.
column4: introduce godaddy dns driver with examples and documentation.
column5: existing apis directly on the libcloud.* module have been deprecated and will be removed in version 0.6.0. most methods were moved to the libcloud.compute.* module.
column6: retrying is off by default and can be enabled by setting libcloud_retry_failed_http_requests environment variable.
column7: replace old enum style provider constants and replace them with a string version. this change allows users to dynamically register new drivers using a new set_driver method.
column8: improve and add new features to brightbox driver
column9: add new vmware vsphere driver which utilizes pyvmomi library and works under python 3.
column10: deprecate rackspace_us and rackspace_uk provider constant and replace it with a new rackspace constant. driver referenced by this new constant takes a region keyword argument which can be one of the following: us , uk .
column11: fix a bug with content_type and encoding of object and path names in the atmos driver.
column12: update oneandone driver to accomodate latest changes to the api. this means removing deprecated ex_remove_server_firewall_policy method and replacing port_from and port_to argument on the firewall policy with a single port attribute.
column13: storagevolumesnapshot now has an attribute name that has the name of the snapshot if the provider supports it. this used to be .extra, but that is inconsistent with node and storagevolume. the extra dict still holds name for backwards compatibility.
column14: remove deprecated provider constants with the region in the name and related driver classes .
column15: those attributes contain value of stdout and stderr produced so far.
column16: fix attach_volume method and allow maximum of 64 disks to be added when lun is not specified. previously there was a bug and only a maximum of 63 disks could be added.
column17: deprecate cloudfiles_us and cloudfiles_uk provider constant and replace it with a new cloudfiles constant. driver referenced by this new constant takes a region keyword argument which can be one of ord , dfw , iad , syd , lon .
column18: update supported ec2 regions and instance sizes and add support for eu-north-1 region.
column19: deprecate rackspace_us and rackspace_uk provider constant and replace it with a new rackspace constant. driver referenced by this new constant takes a region keyword argument which can be one of the following: ord , dfw , iad , syd , lon .
column20: fix a bug with azure storage driver works when used against a storage account that was created using kind=blobstrage. this includes updating the minimum api version used / supported by the storage driver from 2012-02-12 to 2014-02-14.
column21: previously path specified in the auth_url was ignored and only protocol, hostname and port were used. now user can provide a full url for the auth_url variable and the path provided in the url is also used.
column22: fix a bug with chunkstreamreader class and make sure file descriptor is also closed if the iterator isn t fully exhausted or if the iterator is never read from.
column23: use of lxml is now disabled by defalt, use libcloud.utils.py3.default_lxml = true to reenable. lxml has compatibility issues with a number of drivers and etree is a standard package.
column24: add new pollingconnection class. this class can work with async apis. it sends and an initial request and then periodically poll the api until the job has completed or a timeout has been reached.
column25: update gce and softlayer drivers to utilize crypto primitives from the cryptography library instead of deprecated and unmaintained pycrypto library.
column26: add support for creating nodes without a service account associated with them. now when an empty list is passed for ex_service_accounts argument, vm will be created without service account attached.
column27: introduce new list_regions` class method on the base driver class. this method is to be used with provider drivers which support multiple regions and region constructor argument. it allows users to enumerate available / supported regions.
column28: include created and updated attribute in the openstack 1.1 driver.
column29: fix universal wheel metadata and ensure conditional dependencies are handled correctly.
column30: fix handling of binary data in local storage driver on python 3. now the file which is to be written or read from is opened in the binary mode .
column31: make sure ttl attribute is correctly parsed and added to the record extra dictionary.
column32: add new at_exit_func argument to deploy_node method. with this argument user can specify which function will be called before exiting with the created node in question if the deploy process has been canceled after the node has been created, but before the method has fully finished.
column33: add rebuild and resize commands
column34: add support for using an http proxy for outgoing http and https requests.
column35: fix deploy_node so it correctly propagates an exception is a private key which is used is password protected, but no password is specified.
column36: update deploy_node method so it complies with the base compute api and accepts deploy argument.
column37: when this variable is set to true, behavior is also consistent with libcloud versions prior to v2.0.0.
column38: only officially supported and recommended approach still is to use provider.foo enum type constant, but since the string notation was unofficially supported in the past, we will still support it until the next major release.
column39: add new stdout and stderr attribute to sshcommandtimeouterror class.
column40: allow for use of shared network and subnetwork
column41: add start, stop instance methods and fix incorrect state terminated to stopped
column42: update cloudsigma driver so the unavailable and paused node state is correctly mapped to error and paused respectively.
column43: fix libcloud.utils.py3.urlquote so it works with unicode strings under python 2.
column44: refactor the test classes to use the full libcloud.http and libcloud.common.base modules, with connection, response all used with requests_mock. this increases our test coverages and catches bugs in drivers custom parse_body and auth modules
column45: fix a possible race condition in deploy_node which would occur if node is online and can be accessed via ssh, but the ssh key we want to use hasn t been installed yet.
column46: previously this argument value could only contain a project name, now the value will be checked against project name and id.
column47: fix a regression with hash computation performance and memory usage on object upload inadvertently introduced in 2.0.0 and make it more efficient.
column48: add support for abiquo api v3.x, remove support for now obsolete api v2.x.
column49: fix add an extra check otherwise list_containers breaks with attributeerror when fromimages is specified
column50: add new driver for windows azure storage with support for block and page blobs.
column51: deprecate lazylist method of iteration over large paginated collections and use a new, more efficient generator based approach which doesn t require the iterator to be pre-exhausted and buffering all of the values in memory.
column52: now most of the large imports are lazy and only happen when that data is needed method is called).
column53: add new standard api for image management and initial implementation for the ec2 and rackspace driver.
column54: fix handling of the containers with a lot of objects. now a lazylist object is returned when user calls list_container_objects method and this object transparently handles pagination.
column55: support for multipart uploads and other improvements in the s3 driver so it can more easily be re-used with other implementations .
column56: update google compute engine driver to use and work with api v1.
column57: previously, that driver followed driver class per region approach. that approach will be deprecated and removed in a future release.
column58: fix a bug with consuming stdout and stderr in the paramiko ssh client which would manifest itself under very rare condition when a consumed chunk only contained a single byte or part of a multi byte utf-8 character.
column59: and now we simply ignore byte sequences which we can t decode and include rest of the output which can be decoded.
column60: and now we simply ignore byte sequences which we can t decode and include rest of the output which can be decoded.
column61: update openstack identity driver so a custom project can be selected using domain_name keyword argument. previously, that wasn t possible and the first project which was returned by the api was always selected.
column62: add support for authenticating against keystone and openstack based clouds using openid connect tokens.
column63: detect bad version of requests that leads to errors in parsing azure storage responses. this scenario is known to happen on rhel 7.6 when requests was installed via yum.
column64: add support for prettifying json or xml response body which is printed to a file like object when using libcloud_debug environment variable. this option can be enabled by setting libcloud_debug_pretty_print_response environment variable.
column65: update list of image projects and add new centos-8 and debian-10 based images.
column66: modify paramikosshclient to connect to the ssh agent and automatically look for private keys in ~/.ssh if the auth and ssh_key argument is not specified when calling deploy_node.
column67: add methods for getting and creating ports
column68: added support for managing host anti-affinity rules, added paging support to all supported calls and added support for requesting priority ordering when creating acl rules
column69: a lot of the existing compute drivers already implemented that functionality via extension methods so it was decided to promote those methods to be part of the standard libcloud compute api and update all the affected drivers.
column70: fix softlayer driver and make sure all the code is up to date and works with the latest version of the actual softlayer deployment .
column71: add new methods for managing network and storage pool capabilities and include other improvements in some of the existing methods.
column72: when this value is set to true , libcloud won t try to sanitize the url path and remove any double slashes.
column73: update get_object method and ensure object.size attribute is an integer and not a string. this way it s consistent with list_objects method.
column74: fix cloudsigma driver so it correctly handles subscription objects without the start_time and / or end_time attribute.
column75: previously all the constants were contained in libcloud/compute/constants.py file. that file was imported when importing ec2 driver which would add unnecessary import time and memory overhead in case this data was not actually used.
column76: update driver and add support for the new api v4.
column77: change ex_describe_tags, ex_create_tags and ex_delete_tags methods signature in the ec2 driver. argument is now called resource . this methods work with both node and storagevolume objects.
column78: update driver and make sure request data is sent as part of http request body on post and put operations .
column79: this regression was introduced in 2.0.0 when we moved to using requests library.
column80: modify paramikosshclient so that password and key arguments are not mutually exclusive and both can be provided.
column81: add created and updated attribute to the loadbalancer extra dictionary in the rackspace driver.
column82: increase the maximum size of block blobs that can be created to 100 mb. this includes updating the minimum api version used / supported by the storage driver from 2014-02-14 to 2016-05-31.
column83: add extension methods for starting and stoping the node to the cloudstack driver.
column84: working with the object oriented apis
column85: add support for creating volumes based on snapshots to ec2 and os drivers. also modify signature of base nodedriver.create_volume to reflect the fact that all drivers expect a storagesnapshot object as the snapshot argument.
column86: new gridspot driver with basic list and destroy functionality.
column87: fix an issue with the ex_list_keypairs and ex_list_security_groups method in the cloudstack driver which caused an exception to be thrown if the api returned no keypairs / security groups.
column88: fix openstack drivers not correctly setting urls when used with identity api, would default to 127.0.0.1 and service catalog urls were not adhered to.
column89: region which is used is controled by the region driver constructor argument.
column90: update contrib/dockerfile which can be used for running tests so it only run tests with python versions we support. this means dropping support for python < 3.5 and adding support for python 3.7 and 3.8.
column91: fix deploy_node so it correctly propagates an exception if invalid or unsupported private key is used.
column92: map stopped node state in the cloudstack driver to nodestate.stopped instead of nodestate.terminated, stopping to nodestate.pending instead of nodestate.terminated and expunging to nodestate.pending instead of nodestate.terminated.
column93: introduced error messages for deprecated drivers
column94: update create_node_method and allow users to create nodes from bootable volumes without specifying image argument.
column95: add type annotations / hints for rest of the base compute api classes and methods.
column96: expose cloudstack provider. this driver can be used with an arbitrary cloudstack installation.
column97: fix an issue with libcloud_debug not working correctly with the linode driver.
column98: fix an inconsistency in ibm sbc driver and make sure public_ips and private_ips attributes are a list.
column99: https proxy can be set up by either setting https_proxy / http_proxy environment variable or by using driver.connection.connection.set_http_proxy method.
column100: google compute now supports paginated lists including filtering.
column101: updated support for opennebula.org v1.4, v2.x, and v3.x apis and included additional compute tests validating functionality.
column102: don t throw an exception if a limit for a particular cloudstack resource is unlimited and not a number.
column103: fix a regression with timeout argument provided via _ex_connection_class_kwargs method being overriden with none inside the basedriver constructor method.
column104: previously this argument was not exposed to the end user and defaulted to 3 seconds which means it would be quite easy to reach rate limits with some providers when spinning up many instances concurrently using the same credentials.
column105: added support for changed api for describing quotas.
column106: remove old deprecated paths.
column107: improvements to google auth for storage and compute and mime bug fix
column108: update digitalocean driver so it supports ttl attribute for record objects. this includes support for specifying a record ttl via extra attribute when creating and updating a record.
column109: provide functionality to get and set control access for vapps. this way created vapps can be shared between users/groups or everyone.
column110: as part of this change, also various issues with invalid argument names were identified and fixed.
column111: refactor rackspace driver classes and make them easier to use. now there are two rackspace provider constants - provider.rackspace which represents new next-gen openstack servers and provider.rackspace_first_gen which represents old first-gen cloud servers.
column112: update driver so it works with api v3 and v4. #1328
column113: fix a bug with driver not working correctly due to a regression which was inadvertently introduced in one of the previous releases.
column114: changes to the profitbricks compute driver to drop support for the old soap api and provide support for v3 of the rest api.
column115: update libvirt driver to use ip neight command instead of arp to retrieve node mac address if arp command is not available or the current user doesn t have permission to use it.
column116: add the new error class providererror and modify invalidcredserror to inherit from it.
column117: add support for https proxies and fix driver.set_http_proxy method.
column118: fix a bug when uploading an object would fail and result in 401 invalid signature error when object mime type contained mixed casing and when s3 interoperability authentication method was used.
column119: allow user to pass url argument to the cloudstack driver constructor. this argument can be provided instead of host and path arguments and can contain a full url to the api endpoint.
column120: fix a bug with not escaping container and object name in the atmos driver.
column121: deprecated ibm sce, hp helion, opsource, ninefold and cloudframes drivers, removed driver code and tests.
column122: request parameters are sent via query parameters and not via request body, as such, only string values are supported.
column123: fix bug where instantiating a connection from url and then requesting an action with a leading / would lead to a malformed url.
column124: as reported in the corresponding bug, the docker daemon will respond in an install_image call with all the messages produced during the procedure parsed as json docs. in that case the response headers also contain the value transfer-encoding : chunked . that kind of response can now be parsed properly by the dockerresponse parse_body method. also, another small change is that previously the id of the new image was marked in the json document as id, but now it s marked as sha256, so the regex used to discover the id has been updated.
column125: allow to define hostname and username
column126: add cloudstackproject class to the cloudstack driver and add option to select project and disk offering on node creation.
column127: add support for the client certificate and static token based authentication to the driver.
column128: update create_volume method in the cloudstack driver and add ex_volume_type argument to it. if this argument is provided, a volume which names matches this argument value will be searched and selected among the available disk offerings.
column129: modify elasticstack driver class to pass vnc auto instead of vnc:ip auto argument to the api when creating a server. it looks like vnc:ip has been replaced with vnc .
column130: add new rackspacenovabeta and rackspavenovadfw driver based on the openstack.
column131: update s3 and other drivers which are based on the s3 one to correctly throw containeralreadyexistserror if container creation fails because container with this name already exists.
column132: also default to a multipart upload when using upload_object_via_stream. this methods is more efficient compared to old approach because it only requires buffering a single multipart chunk in memory.
column133: add force_ipv4 argument to _wait_until_running and default it to true. this will make libcloud ignore ipv6 addresses when using deploy_node.
column134: add extension methods for the elastic ip management to the ec2 driver. also modify ex_allocate_address and ex_release_address method to take domain argument so it also works with vpc.
column135: fix a bug with config_drive attribute in the openstack driver. new versions of openstack now return a boolean and not a string.
column136: add support and update dimension data driver to use api v2.0 by default.
column137: fix create_node features metadata and update affected drivers.
column138: deprecate the following ec2 provider constants: ec2_us_east, ec2_eu, ec2_eu_west, ec2_ap_southeast, ec2_ap_northeast, ec2_us_west_oregon, ec2_sa_east, ec2_sa_east and replace it with a new ec2 constant. driver referenced by this new constant now takes a region argument which dictates to which region to connect.
column139: reduce redundant api calls in cloudstack driver
column140: allow user to limit a list of subnets which are returned by passing subnet_ids and filters argument to the ex_list_subnets method in the ec2 driver.
column141: add support for nova 2.x and keystone 3
column142: remove various code patterns which were in place for supporting multiple python versions, including 2.5 and 2.6. libcloud hasn t supported python < 2.7 for a while now, so we can remove that code.
column143: existing list_* methods which previously used lazylist class are preserving the old behavior and new iterate_* methods which use a new generator based approach have been added.
column144: add new methods for managing storage volumes and other extenstion methods to the ibm sce driver.
column145: decrease sleep delay inside paramiko client which is used to prevent busy waiting while waiting for data on the channel.
column146: fix a bug with connection code throwing an exception if a port was a unicode type and not a str or int.
column147: optimize various code imports , so now importing most of the modules is around ~20-40% faster and in some cases such as ec2 driver even more.
column148: update cloudstack driver to better handle errors and throw providererror instead of a generic exception.
column149: fix a regression in the azure arm driver which didn t allow custom storage uri suffix to be used with create_node.
column150: fix a bug with the libcloud ssl verification code. code was too strict and didn t allow - character in the sub-domain when using a wildcard certificate.
column151: the ec2 instance type updated with correct disk sizes , conversion errors between gib an mb, disk count were the cause. added instance types - g2.8xlarge and t2.large.
column152: changes with apache libcloud 0.15.1
column153: changes with apache libcloud 0.15.1
column154: include last_modified and content_type attribute in the object extra dictionary when retrieving object using get_object in the s3 driver. also modify meta_data dictionary to include all the headers prefixed with x-amz-meta- .
column155: add network mode and labels when creating containers within docker driver.
column156: _node_node method now ensures image and size attributes are also set correctly and populated on the node object.
column157: this means if you specify host and region argument, host won t be inferred from the region, but host argument will be used for the actual connection host value.
column158: this method doesn t need to buffer the whole file content in memory and also supports pipelining which makes uploads much faster and more efficient for larger files.
column159: fix api version used to list and delete nics
column160: fix error with getting node id in _to_floating_ip method when region is not called nova.
column161: drop support for python 2.6 and python 3.3 they re no longer supported, and the python ecosystem is starting to drop support: two of our test dependencies no longer support them.
column162: fix openstack ip type resolution - make sure ip addresses are correctly categorized and assigned on private_ips and public_ips node attribute.
column163: minor fixes to get the library and tests working on python 2.7 and pypy.
column164: allow deploy_node to use non-standard ssh username and port
column165: this change allows drivers to support libcloud_debug and ssl certificate validation functionality. previously they have bypassed libcloud http layer so this functionality was not available.
column166: add ex_create_cloud_service and ex_destroy_cloud_service method to the azure driver.
column167: enable the azure storage driver to be used with the azurite storage emulator and azure blob storage on iot edge.
column168: fixed bug in docker util library for fetching images from the docker hub api. api was returning 301 and redirects were not being followed.
column169: enable ssl certificate verification by default and throw an exception if ca certificate files cannot be found. this can be overridden by setting libcloud.security.verify_ssl_cert_strict to false.
column170: fix upload_object_via_stream method so illegal seek errors which can arise when calculating iterator content hash are ignored. those errors likely indicate that the underlying file handle / iterator is a pipe which doesn t support seek and that the error is not fatal and we should still proceed.
column171: various improvements, fixes and additions to the driver.
column172: add new methods for managing storage volumes and snapshots to the ec2 driver
column173: fix an issue with double encoding the container name in the cloudfiles driver upload_object method. also properly encode container and object name used in the http request in the get_container and get_object method.
column174: add volume management methods and other various improvements and fixes in the runabove driver.
column175: fix create_record and update_record method and pass none instead of string value null for priority, port and weight parameters if they are not provided as method arguments.
column176: modify values in the record extra dictionary attribute in the zerigo dns driver to be set to none instead of an empty string if a value for the provided key is not set.
column177: allow preemptible instances to be created
column178: storagevolume objects now have an attribute state that holds a state variable that is standardized state across drivers. drivers that currently support the state attribute are openstack and ec2. storagevolume objects returned by drivers that do not support the attribute will have a state of none. when a provider returns a state that is unknown to the driver, the state will be unknown. please report such states. a couple of drivers already put state fields in the extra fields of storagevolumes. these fields were kept for backwards-compatibility and for reference.
column179: don t sent content-length: 0 header with post and put request if raw mode is used. this fixes a regression which could cause broken behavior in some storage driver when uploading a file from disk.
column180: add extra attribute to the member object and populate it in the rackspace driver.
column181: fix a regression introduced with recent xmlrpiclib changes which broke all the gandi.net drivers.
column182: modify create_node method in cloudstack driver to return an instance of cloudstacknode and add a new expunging node state.
column183: deprecate the following elastichosts provider constants: elastichosts_uk1, elastichosts_uk2, elastichosts_us1, elastichosts_us2, elastichosts_us3, elastichosts_ca1, elastichosts_au1, elastichosts_cn1 and replace it with a new elastichosts constant. driver referenced by this new constant now takes a region argument which dictates to which region to connect.
column184: add support for digitalocean api v2.0 while maintaining support for the old api v2.0.
column185: add change size and restore
column186: introduced new base api for instantiating drivers.
column187: fix deploy_node so an exception is not thrown if any of the output produced by the deployment script contains a non-valid utf-8 character.
column188: fix deploy_node so an exception is not thrown if any of the output produced by the deployment script contains a non-valid utf-8 character.
column189: improved debugging and logging of http requests.
column190: fix a bug with not being able to specify meta_data / tags when uploading an object using google storage driver.
column191: add support for python 3.x.
column192: fix an issue with installation failing on some operating system and file systems combinations which don t support file names longer than 143 characters.
column193: storagevolume objects on ec2 and openstack now have a key called snapshot_id in their extra dicts containing the snapshot id the volume was based on.
column194: note: when this variable is specified, the specified path is the only ca file which is used to verifying the server certificate.
column195: note 1: key_files and key_material arguments are mutually exclusive. note 2: key_material argument is not supported in the shelloutsshclient.
column196: allow creating and accepting image members
column197: add ex_create_multi_value_record method to the route53 driver which allows user to create a record with multiple values with a single call.
column198: align joyent driver with other drivers and deprecate location argument in the driver constructor in favor of region argument.
column199: for consistency with other drivers, update rackspace driver to set record.name attribute for the records which refer to the bare domain to none instead of setting them to fqdn.
column200: added an integration test api and a test suite for validating functionality without mocking any libcloud subsystems
column201: add extra dictionary to the cloudstacknode object and include more attributes in the extra dictionary of the network and volume object.
column202: add new ex_create_balancer_access_rule and ex_create_balancer_access_rule_no_poll method to the rackspace driver.
column203: set the minimum required version of requests to 2.5.0 since requests 2.4.0 and earlier exhibit xml parsing errors of azure storage responses.
column204: propagate an exception in deploy_node method if user specified an invalid path to the private key file. previously this exception was silently swallowed and ignored.
column205: create cloudstackfirewallrule class and corresponding methods.
column206: add hard and soft reboot methods to rackspace driver.
column207: fix a bug / regression which resulted in increased memory consumption when using download_object method. this method would store whole object content in memory even though there was no need for that.
column208: fix a bug which caused the connection to not be closed when using python 2.6 and calling get_object on an object which doesn t exist in the s3 driver.
column209: fix a bug which caused the connection to not be closed when using python 2.6 and calling get_object on an object which doesn t exist in the s3 driver.
column210: if openstack auth 2.0 api is used, also parse out tenant id and name and save it on the connection class .
column211: add new g2 instances to the ec2 driver.
column212: new driver for kt ucloud (link based on the cloudstack driver.
column213: modify openstackauthconnection and change auth_token_expires attribute to be a datetime object instead of a string.
column214: update s3 driver so a single driver class can be used for different regions.
column215: update ec2 instance type map and pricing data. high storage instances are now also available in sydney and singapore region.
column216: also update the code so it doesn t crash if an unknown node state which is not defined locally is returned by the api when listing nodes. such states are now mapped to unknown.
column217: fix authentication with temporary iam role credentials in the ec2 driver.
column218: add support for ssd disks to google compute driver.
column219: allow user to associate arbitrary key/value pairs with a node by passing ex_metadata argument to create_node method in the ec2 driver. those values are associated with a node using tags functionality.
column220: changes with apache libcloud 0.13.1
column221: changes with apache libcloud 0.13.1
column222: added additional parameters to the rackspace driver in list_balancers for filtering and searching.
column223: append ord1 to available rackspace location, but keep in the same node as dfw1, because it s not readable or writeable from the api.
column224: if you are unable to upgrade, you can use the following workaround, as long as you only use code which supports / works with authentication signature algorithm version 4:
column225: fix an inconsistency in opsource driver and make sure public_ips is an empty list , not unknown
column226: fix a bug in consuming stdout and stderr strams in paramiko ssh client. in some cases , exit_status_ready gets set immediately even before the while loop to consume the streams kicks in. in those cases, we will not have consumed the streams at all.
column227: add unittest2 library dependency for tests and update some tests to use it.
column228: fixed malformed xml requests with dimension data driver.
column229: change public_ip and private_ip attribute on the node object to the public_ips and private_ips since both of the objects are always a list.
column230: fix a regression with calling encode_container_name instead of encode_object_name on object name in get_object method. reported by ben meng
column231: include a better message in the exception which is thrown when a request in the rackspace driver ends up in an error state.
column232: add new ex_virtual_network_name and ex_network_config argument to the create_node` method in the azure driver. with those arguments user can now specify which virtual network to use.
column233: fix an issue with mutating connectioncls.host attribute in the azure driver. this bug prevented user from having multiple azure drivers with different keys instantiated at the same time.
column234: reintroduce s3 multipart upload support with signature v4
column235: fix node s block device mapping was parsed from incorrect mapping. ebsinstanceblockdevice is different from ebsblockdevice.
column236: fix a bug in the linode driver and remove extra newline which is added when generating a random root password in create_node.
column237: when creating volume snapshot, the arguments name and description are truely optional when working with newer openstack versions. the openstack driver will now only post thost arguments if they are non-nonetype.
column238: update create_node method so it throws an exception if node location can t be inferred and location is not specified by the user .
column239: fix a bug and make sure we also correctly handle scenario in get_object method when the object size is returned in x-goog-stored-content-length and not content-length header.
column240: support for iterating over records and zones in the aurora dns driver.
column241: note: the openstack.py base driver no longer works by default with rackspace nova. the default endpoint parsed from the service catalog is the default compute endpoint for devstack.
column246: use lxml library for parsing xml. this should substantially reduce parsing time and memory usage for large xml responses .
column247: modify vmware vcloud driver and implement new features for the vcloud version 1.5.
column248: this was achieved by implementing two changes on the paramikosshclient class:
column249: fix caching of auth tokens in the google compute engine drivers. now we make sure that the file is truncated before writing a new token. not truncating the file would cause issues if the new token is shorted then the existing one which is cached in the file.
column250: add timeout argument to the paramikosshclient.run method. if this argument is specified and the command passed to run method doesn t finish in the defined timeout, sshcommandtimeouterror is throw and the connection to the remote server is closed.
column251: in most cases, this won t matter and sanitzing double slashes is a safer default, but in some cases such as s3, where double slashes can be a valid path , this option may come handy.
column252: fix a bug with driver incorrectly handling the value of ex_hourly argument in the create_node method which caused nodes to always be created with hourly billing, even if this argument was set to false.
column253: add support for multiple api versions to the eucalyptus driver and allows user to pass api_version argument to the driver constructor.
column254: add option to expunge vm on destroy in cloudstack driver.
column255: allow user to specify which ip to use when calling deploy_node. . previously it only worked with public ip, now user can pass private_ips as an argument and ssh client will try to connect to the node first private ip address.
column256: enable paramiko library debug log level if libcloud_debug is used and paramiko is installed.
column257: update list_sizes method so it accepts ex_project_id argument and works with project api tokens.
column258: support for http proxies with backendservices.
column259: use more consistent name for gogrid driver and use http post method for unsafe operations
column260: fix a regression with get_driver method not working if provider argument value was a string instead of get_driver).
column261: allow user to limit a list of internet gateways which are returned by passing gateway_ids and filters argument to the ex_list_internet_gateways method in the ec2 driver.
column262: add sync / ex_sync argument to the ex_stop_node, ex_start_node and destroy_node method. when this argument is set to false, method will return immediately without waiting polling and waiting for a long running api operation to finish before returning. for backward compatibility reasons, it defaults to true.
column263: add support for automatic sni using the hostname supplied to connect to.
column264: currently those methods are implemented for the local storage azure blobs, cloudfiles, s3 and any other provider driver which is based on the s3 one .
column265: allow for old and new style service account client email address
column266: allow for old and new style service account client email address
column267: update ex_describe_tags method in the ec2 driver and allow user to list tags for any supported resource. previously you could only list tags for a node or a storage volume.
column268: fix a race condition on gce driver list_nodes- invoking gce s list_nodes while some vms are being shutdown can result in the following libcloud.common.google.resourcenotfounderror exception to be raised.
column269: added support for adding a family to an image on google compute driver
column270: fix a problem in deploy_node - make it work with providers which don t instantly return created node in the list_node response. also add __str__ and __repr__ method to deploymenterror so the error message is more useful.
column271: refactor cloudstack connection class so it looks more like other connection classes and user can specify which attributes to send as part of query parameters in the get request and which inside the body of a post request.
column272: fix list_nodes method so it correctly handles pagination and returns all the nodes if there are more than 500 nodes available in total.
column273: allow delete instances from managed group
column274: properly handle record creation when user doesn t provider a record name and wants to create a record for the actual domain. reported by matt perry
column275: bugfix values with wildcards failed signature validation.
column276: update storage drivers to default to application/octet-stream content-type if none is provided and none can be guessed.
column277: use assertisnone instead of assertequal with none in tests
column280: fix a bug which would cause some prepared requests with empty bodies to be chunked which would cause some of the provider apis such as openstack to return http 400 errors.
column281: add extension method for modifying node attributes and changing the node size.
column282: update ca_certs_path to also look for ca cert bundle which comes with openssl homebrew formula on os x .
column285: add support for sa-east-1 region to the amazon s3 driver.
column286: use ipaddress and privateipaddress attribute for the ec 2node public and private ip.
column287: make sure driver works correctly for objects with ~ in the name.
column288: make sure driver works correctly for objects with ~ in the name.
column289: also add a new key_material argument. this argument can contain raw string version of a private key.
column290: fix upload_object_via_stream method so it also works with iterators which don t implement seek method. if the iterator doesn t support seek, entire iterator content will be buffered in memory.
column291: add support for modifyvolume and describevolumesmodifications
column292: update openstack 1.1 driver to comply with the api specs. need to make another call to retrieve node name and ip addresses when creating a node, because the first call only returns an id an the password.
column293: fix a regression introduced in v3.3.0 which would break ec2 driver for some regions because the driver would incorrectly try to use signature version 2 for all the regions whereas some newer regions require signature version 4 to be used.
column294: allow user to specify a condition and weight when adding a member in the rackspace driver.
column295: add deprecated attribute to the node object in the google compute engine driver.
column296: allow users to filter objects starting with a prefix by passing ex_prefix argument to the list_container_objects method in the s3, google storage and cloudfiles driver.
column297: add a standard api and methods for managing storage volumes to the ec2 and cloudstack drivers. base api consistent of the following methods: create_volume, destroy_volume, attach_volume, detach_volume.
column298: add new driver for vmware vsphere (link based clouds.
column299: add support for health monitors and connection throttling
column300: also improve how reading a file in chunks works with drivers which support chunked encoding - always try to fill a chunk with chunk_size bytes instead of directly streaming the chunk which iterator returns.
column301: add ex_import_keypair_from_string and ex_import_keypair method to the cloudstack driver.
column302: note: backblaze api doesn t upload streaming uploads so when using upload_object_via_stream whole file is read and buffered in memory.
column303: implement ex_edit_node method for gogrid driver which allows changing node attributes like amount of ram or description.
column304: add utility get_regions and get_service_names methods to the openstackservicecatalog class.
column305: disable cache busting functionality in the openstack and rackspace next-gen driver and enable it only for rackspace first-gen driver.
column308: add fault attribute to the extra dictionary of the node instance returned by the openstack driver.
column309: add missing regions in aws storage and compute drivers
column310: new driver for serverlove.com and skalicloud.com
column311: add support for private ip addresses in gce instance creation
column312: now majority of the import time is spent in importing requests library.
column313: fix libcloud_debug_pretty_print_response functionality and make sure it works correctly under python 3 when response.read function returns unicode and not bytes.
column314: fix method for create instance properties, it previously ignored the disk type parameter and defaulted to pd-standard.
column315: add support for elastichosts new united states and canada locations.
column316: gce driver now raises resourcenotfounderror when the specified image is not found in any image project. previously, this would return none but now raises the not-found exception instead. this fixes a bug where returning none caused ex_delete_image to raise an attributeerror.
column317: update the driver to throw more user-friendly error message if user is using driver for a region x, but trying to upload / download object to / from a region y.

column340: use match_hostname function from backports.ssl_match_hostname package to verify the ssl certificate hostname instead of relying on our own logic.

column342: add new driver for durable dns service

column346: add support for retrying failed http requests.

column413: previously it incorrectly tried to retry on such exception. this means the exception would only bubble up after all the retry attempts have been exhausted.

column422: previously, user would see an error similar to failed after 3 tries: utf-8 codec can t decode byte 0xc0 in position 37: invalid start byte .

column2: version 1.1.0: added type2-fuzzy gmm um and uv added support to calculate average time of algorithms
column3: version 2.0.0: new release! added a new platform-independent gui based on qt. new python and matlab wrappers. new api and added three new algorithms: pawcs, twopoints and vibe.
column4: version 1.9.2: added subsense and lobster algorithms of pierre-luc et al. .
column5: version 1.9.0: added a new framework for background subtraction using multiple cues of seungjong noh and moongu jeon . added opencv 2.4.8 support .
column7: installation instructions ubuntu or osx
column8: version 3.0.0: new release! changed software license from gpl-v3 to mit. big refactoring of the source code to be compatible with opencv 4.x. improved python installation. fixed bugs, issues, ...

column11: version 1.6.0: added kde of a. elgammal, d. harwood, l. s. davis, non-parametric model for background subtraction eccv'00 . added texture-based background subtraction of marko heikkila and matti pietikainen a texture-based method for modeling the background and detecting moving objects pami'06. added opencv 2.4.5 support, some improvements and bug fixes, ...
column12: version 1.7.0: added texture-based foreground detection with mrf of csaba kert sz . some improvements and bug fixes, ...
column13: compiling bgslibrary with visual studio 2010 and opencv 2.4.x

column16: version 1.9.1: added sigma-delta background subtraction algorithm of manzanera and richefeu .

column4: this release removes the version pinning for "construct" library as its api has been stabilized and we don't want to force our downstreams for our version choices. another notable change is dropping the "mirobo" package which has been deprecated for a very long time, and everyone using it should have had converted to use "miio" already. furthermore the client tools work now with click's version 7+.
column5: supported devices added to readme.md and version bumped #39
column6: this release includes small improvements for powerstrip and vacuum support. furthermore this is the first release with proper documentation. generated docs are available at link - patches to improve them are more than welcome!
column7: air humidifier ca added to the list of supported and discovered devices by mdns
column8: i can not get load_power with my set is xiaomi smart wifi with two usb #549
column9: pinned versions loosed and cryptography dependency bumped to new major version
column10: a bug exposed in python-miio when using version 2.8.17 or newer of the underlying construct library -- causing timeouts and inability to control devices -- has also been fixed in this release.
column11: additionally, a compatibility issue when using construct version 2.9.23 and greater -- causing timeouts and inability to control devices -- has been fixed again.
column12: discovery now uses mdns instead of handshake protocol. old behavior still available with --handshake true
column13: the initial udp handshake is sent now several times to accommodate spotty networks
column14: air purifier: some additional models added to the list of supported and discovered devices by mdns
column15: chuangmi.plug.v3: works now with updated firmware version
column16: supports for the following new devices thanks to syssi and kuduka:
column17: air purifier 2s added to the list of supported and discovered devices by mdns
column18: this release adds support for several new devices, and contains improvements and fixes on several existing integrations. instead of summarizing all changes here, this library seeks to move completely automated changelogs based on the pull request tags to facilitate faster release cycles. until that happens, the full list of changes is listed below as usual.
column19: retry and timeout can be change by setting a class attribute #884
column20: firmware updates for vacuums , the most prominent use case being installing custom firmwares . installing sound packs is also streamlined with a self-hosting server.
column21: this release brings support to a couple of new devices, and contains fixes for some already supported ones. all thanks for the improvements in this release go to syssi!
column22: considering how far this project has evolved from being just an interface for the xiaomi vacuum, it is time to leave 0.1 series behind and call this 0.2.0.
column23: vacuum objects can now be queried for supported fanspeeds
column24: this is a bugfix release which provides improved stability and compatibility.
column25: add basic support for yunmi.waterpuri.lx9 and lx11 #826
column26: good bye to python-mirobo, say hello to python-miio! as the library is getting more mature and supports so many other devices besides the vacuum sporting the miio protocol, it was decided that the project deserves a new name. the name python-miio was previously used by a fork of python-mirobo, and we are thankful to schumyhao for releasing the name for us.
column27: the protocol quirks handling was extended to handle invalid messages from the cloud , improving interoperability for dustcloud.
column28: dependency management is now done using poetry & pyproject.toml
column29: the most significant change for this release is unbreaking the communication when using a recent versions of construct library . on top of that there are various smaller fixes and improvements, e.g. support for sound packs and running python-miio on windows.

column33: strip has been renamed to powerstrip to avoid confusion
column34: don t require typing with python 3.5 and newer #123
column35: this release is mainly to re-add mapping parameter to miotdevice constructor for backwards-compatibility reasons, but adds also pyyaml dependency and improves miot support to allow limiting how many properties to query at once.

column37: fixes communication with newer firmwares

column40: this is a bugfix release because of further breaking changes of the underlying library construct.
column41: the highlight of this release is a crisp, unified and scalable command line interface called miiocli . each supported device of this library is already integrated.
column42: in order to simplify the initial configuration, a tool to extract tokens from a mi home's backup or its database is added. it will also decrypt the tokens if needed, a change which was introduced recently how they are stored in the database of ios devices.
column43: device errors are now wrapped in a exception for easier handling.

column48: added ability to pass in custom decoder for get_token methods (excluding
column49: changes in version 0.5.0
column50: changes in version 0.5.0
column51: updated docstring to correct incorrect documentation
column52: changes in version 0.5.1
column53: changes in version 0.5.1
column54: default connection timeouts moved into session module logic
column55: fixed encoding of tilde bug in urlencode #186
column56: added better error reporting for get_token methods
column57: added get_session method to service wrappers
column58: added get_auth_session method to service wrappers
column59: default response_type removed from oauth2service.get_authorize_url
column60: added requirements.txt
column61: bugfix corrected improper oauth 1.0/a handling of entity-methods
column62: raise_for_status removed from all service wrapper helper methods
column63: cleaned up oauth2service.get_access_token

column2: define_enum_class and define_mutlti_enum_class accept a case_sensitive argument. when false , strings are mapped to enum member names without case sensitivity, and member names are serialized in lowercase form. flag definitions for enums whose members include duplicates when case is ignored must now explicitly pass case_sensitive=true.
column3: alias default values now matched the aliased default value.
column4: pickling flags now raises an clear error instead of a cryptic one. pickling flags isn't supported; instead use flags_into_string to serialize flags.
column5: testcase.enter_context: allows using context managers in setup and having them automatically exited when a test finishes.
column6: multi-flags now accept any iterable type for the default value instead of only lists. strings are still special cased as before. this allows sets, generators, views, etc to be used naturally.
column7: added public flag holders for --test_srcdir and --test_tmpdir. users should use absltest.test_srcdir.value and absltest.test_tmpdir.value instead of flags.test_srcdir and flags.test_tmpdir.
column8: the format is based on keep a changelog.
column9: as a deterrent for misuse, flagholder objects will now raise a typeerror exception when used in a conditional statement or equality expression.
column10: an exception is now raised instead of logging.fatal when logging directories cannot be found.
column11: flagsaver overrides can now be specified in terms of flagholder.
column12: added --pdb flag: when true, uncaught exceptions will be handled by pdb.post_mortem. this is an alias for --pdb_post_mortem.
column13: tempfile management apis for tests: read/write/manage tempfiles for test purposes easily and correctly. see testcase.create_temp{file/dir} and the corresponding commit for more info.
column14: @parameterized.parameters now treats a single abc.mapping as a single test case, consistent with named_parameters. previously the abc.mapping is treated as if only its keys are passed as a list of test cases. if you were relying on the old inconsistent behavior, explicitly convert the abc.mapping to a list.
column15: alias present counter now correctly reflects command line usage.
column16: surplus entries in assertionerror stack traces from absltest are now suppressed and no longer reported in the xml_reporter.
column17: #94: license files are now included in sdist.
column18: xml test output is written at the end of all test execution.
column19: flag serialization is now deterministic: this improves bazel build caching for tools that are affected by flag serialization.
column21: all notable changes to python absl are recorded here.
column22: parameterized.product: allows testing a method over cartesian product of parameters values, specified as a sequences of values for each parameter or as kwargs-like dicts of parameter values.
column23: absltest now integrates better with --pdb_post_mortem.
column24: absltest.mock: alias to unittest.mock for better unittest drop-in replacement. for py2, it will be available if mock is importable.
column25: logging.vlog_is_on: helper to tell if a vlog call will actually log anything. this allows avoiding computing expansive inputs to a logging call when logging isn't enabled for that level.
column26: added
column27: added
column28: added
column29: added
column30: added
column31: added
column32: added
column33: added
column34: added
column35: added
column36: flags enum support: flags.define_enum_class allows using an enum derived class to define the allowed values for a flag.
column37: test output now includes start/end markers for each test ran. this is to help distinguish output from tests clearly.
column38: _tempdir and _tempfile now implement __fspath__ to satisfy os.pathlike
column39: changed
column40: changed
column41: changed
column42: changed
column43: changed
column44: changed
column45: changed
column46: about
column47: bazel 0.23+ or 0.22+ is now required for building/testing. specifically, a bazel version that supports @bazel_tools//tools/python:python_version for selecting the python version.
column48: aliasing a multi flag no longer causes the default value to be appended to.
column49: flags serialization works better: the resulting serialized value, when deserialized, won't cause --help to be invoked, thus ending the process.
column50: several flag fixes to make them behave more like the absl c++ flags: empty --flagfile is allowed; --nohelp and --help=false don't display help
column51: testonly=1 has been removed from the testing libraries, which allows their use outside of testing contexts.
column52: app.call_after_init: register functions to be called after app.run is called. useful for program-wide initialization that library code may need.
column53: flags.validate_all_flags: a new method that validates all flags and raises an exception if one fails.
column54: defining an alias no longer marks the aliased flag as always present on the command line.
column55: asserttotallyordered no longer requires objects to implement __hash__.
column56: flags.mark_bool_flags_as_mutual_exclusive: convenience function to check that only one, or at most one, flag among a set of boolean flags are true.
column57: multiple flags are now set together before their validators run. this resolves an issue where multi-flag validators rely on specific flag combinations.
column58: both python 2 and python 3 versions of tests are now created. to only run one major python version, use bazel test --test_tag_filters=-python to ignore the other version.
column59: argparse integration: absl-registered flags can now be accessed via argparse using absl.flags.argparse_flags: see that module for more information.
column60: xml_reporter now includes timestamps to testcases, test_suite, test_suites elements.
column61: make --helpfull work with unicode flag help strings.
column62: fixed
column63: fixed
column64: fixed
column65: fixed
column66: fixed
column67: fixed
column68: fixed
column69: fixed
column70: fixed
column71: logging.log_every_n_seconds: like log_every_n, but based on elapsed time between logging calls.
column72: absltest.expectedfailureif: a variant of unittest.expectedfailure that allows a condition to be given.
column73: building with bazel 0.2.0 works without extra incompatiblity disable build flags.

column2: new api methods api.search_facets and api.search_filters to get a list of available facets and filters.
column3: convert line endings of shodan/client.py and tests/test_shodan.py to unix
column4: add history and type parameters to shodan.dns.domain_info method and cli command
column5: include timestamp, vulns and tags in csv converter
column6: the changelog is now part of the packages.
column7: improved unicode handling
column8: remove deprecated api wrapper for shodanhq.com/api
column9: stream: handle timeout=none, none can't be compared with integers
column10: fixed the bug #47 which was caused by the cli using a timeout value of "0" which resulted in the "requests" library failing to connect
column12: override environment configured settings if explicit proxy settings are supplied
column13: add support for new vulnerability streaming endpoints
column14: new optional parameter proxies for all interfaces to specify a proxy array for the requests library
column15: fixed bug that caused an exception when parsing uncompressed data files in python3
column16: add basic support for the bulk data api
column17: new method to edit the list of ips for an existing network alert
column18: add library methods for the new notifications api
column19: add the ability to save results from host lookups via the cli
column20: about
column21: fixed bug that prevented an open port from being shown in "shodan host"
column22: ability to specify list of fields to include when converting to csv/ excel
column23: add support for paging through the domain information
column24: python3 fixes for outputting images
column25: support put requests in the api request helper method
column26: fix bug when converting data file to csv using python3
column27: improved exception handling to improve debugging shodan init
column28: new command shodan alert disable to disable a notification trigger
column29: improved unicode handling in python2
column30: remove unused imports
column31: updated docs to make them python3 compatible
column32: new command shodan alert enable to enable a notification trigger
column33: stream: automatically decode to unicode, fixes streaming on python3
column34: include docs in packages
column35: allow a single network alert to monitor multiple ip ranges
column36: new option "-d" for shodan domain to lookup open ports for ips in the results
column37: new option "--skip" for download command to help users resume a download
column38: new command shodan alert triggers to list the available notification triggers
column39: show user-friendly error messages when running shodan radar without permission or in a window that's too small
column40: new command shodan scan list to list recently launched scans
column41: fixed bug that prevented shodan scan submit from finishing
column42: changelog
column43: shodan cli now installs properly on windows
column44: new option "-s" for shodan domain to save results from the lookup
column45: sign up
column46: added "images" convert output format to let users extract images from shodan data files
column47: fix excel file conversion that resulted in empty .xlsx files
column48: change bare 'except:' statements to 'except exception:' or more specific ones
column49: add new methods to ignore/ unignore trigger notifications
column50: skip to content
column51: improved output of "shodan host"
column52: fix bug that caused unicode error when printing domain information
column53: terms
column54: sign in
column55: add flag to let users get their ipv6 address shodan myip -6
column56: added "shodan radar" command
column57: only change api_key file permissions if needed
column58: explore
column59: new command shodan alert info to show details of a specific alert
