column2: the use of both the until and count parameters is now deprecated as inconsistent with rfc2445
column3: switched setup.py to use find_packages, and started testing against pip installed versions of dateutil in ci. fixed issue with parser import discovered by @jreback in pandas-dev/pandas#18141.
column4: fixed issue with the addition and subtraction of certain relativedeltas. reported and fixed by @kootenpv
column5: implemented of __hash__ for relativedelta and weekday, reported and fixed by @mrigor
column6: corrected readme to reflect that tests are now run in pytest. reported and fixed by @m-dz
column7: made some changes to the ci and codecov to test against newer versions of python and pypy, and to adjust the code coverage requirements. for the moment, full pypy3 compatibility is not supported until a new release is available, due to upstream bugs in the old version affecting pep-495 support.
column8: an issue with string encoding causing exceptions under certain circumstances when tzname is called was fixed.
column9: moved parser module into parser/_parser.py and officially deprecated the use of several private functions and classes from that module.
column10: a replace method has been added to rrule objects by @jendas1, which creates new rrule with modified attributes, analogous to datetime.replace
column11: added some flexibility in subclassing timelex, and switched the default behavior over to using string methods rather than comparing against a fixed list.
column12: several deprecated functions were replaced in the tests by @moreati
column13: changed python setup.py test to print an error to stderr and exit with 1 instead of 0. reported and fixed by @hroncok
column14: fix an issue with relativedelta and freezegun
column15: refactored build and release sections and added setup instructions to contributing. reported and fixed by @kynan
column16: deprecated the idiosyncratic tzstr format mentioned in several examples but evidently designed exclusively for dateutil, and very likely not used by any current users.
column17: fixed a bug with base offset changes during dst in tzfile, and refactored the way base offset changes are detected. originally reported on stack overflow by @martinthoma.
column18: fixed issue with fuzzy parsing where tokens similar to am/pm that are in the end skipped were dropped in the fuzzy_with_tokens list. reported and fixed by @jbrockmendel .
column19: fixed issue with tzwin and tzwinlocal where dst transitions were incorrectly parsed from the registry.
column20: added support for parser weekdays with less than 3 characters. reported by @arcadefoam , fixed by @jonemo
column21: added pep-495-compatible methods to address ambiguous and imaginary dates in time zones in a backwards-compatible way. ambiguous dates and times can now be safely represented by all dateutil time zones. many thanks to alexander belopolski and tim peters @tim-one for their inputs on how to address this. original issues reported by yupeng and @zed .
column22: fix and add test for python 2.x compatibility with boolean checking of relativedelta objects. implemented by @nimasmi and c dric krier
column23: fixed to assertion logic in parser to support dates like 2015-15-may , reported and fixed by @jbrockmendel
column24: improve error message when rrule s dtstart and until are not both naive or both aware. reported and fixed by @ryanpetrello
column25: fixed indexerror in parser on dates with trailing colons, reported and fixed by @jbrockmendel
column26: an issue where the wkst parameter was improperly rendering in str was reported and fixed by daniel lepage .
column27: removed duplicate test name that was preventing a test from being run. reported and fixed by @jdufresne
column28: started enforcing that within vtimezone, the value parameter can only be omitted or date-time, per rfc 5545. reported by @unrud
column29: switched the tzoffset, tzstr and gettz caches over to using weak references, so that the cache expires when no other references to the original tzinfo objects exist. this cache-expiry behavior is not guaranteed in the public interface and may change in the future. to improve performance in the case where transient references to the same time zones are repeatedly created but no strong reference is continuously held, a smaller strong value cache was also added. weak value cache implemented by @cs-cordero , strong cache added by g k en nurlu
column30: fixed issue with parsing an unambiguous string representation of an ambiguous datetime such that if possible the correct value for fold is set. fixes issue reported by @jordonphillips and @pganssle
column31: fixed issue with tz.gettz for tz variables that start with a colon. reported and fixed by @lapointexavier
column32: added support for more than 6 fractional digits in isoparse. reported and fixed by @jayschwa .
column33: corrected parse documentation to reflect proper integer offset units, reported and fixed by @abrugh
column34: started including the license file in wheels. reported and fixed by @jdufresne
column35: fixed relativedelta.weeks property getter and setter to work for both negative and positive values. reported and fixed by @souliane
column36: added rrule: prefix to rrule strings generated by rrule.__str__, in compliance with the rfc. reported by @andrewpashkin , fixed by @jarondl and @mlorant
column37: added new methods for working with ambiguous and imaginary dates to the tz module. datetime_ambiguous determines if a datetime is ambiguous for a given zone and datetime_exists determines if a datetime exists in a given zone. this works for all fold-aware datetimes, not just those provided by dateutil.
column38: deprecated zoneinfo.gettz due to confusion with tz.gettz, in favor of get method of zoneinfo.zoneinfofile objects.
column39: replaced parse calls with explicit datetime objects in unit tests unrelated to parser.
column40: tweaked parser error message to include rejected string format, added by @pbiering
column41: improved the logic in travis and appveyor to alleviate issues where builds were failing due to connection issues when downloading the iana timezone files. in addition to adding our own mirror for the files , the download is now retried a number of times
column42: added a pyproject.toml file with build requirements and an explicitly specified build backend.
column43: style improvement to zoneinfo.tzfile that was confusing to static type checkers. reported and fixed by @quodlibetor
column44: add support for parsing bytesarray, reported by @uckelman and fixed by @uckelman and @pganssle
column45: fixed an issue where dateutil timezones were not compatible with basic time objects. one of many, many timezone related issues contributed and tested by @labrys.
column46: fixed case where tzrange.utcoffset and tzrange.dst might fail due to a date being used where a datetime was expected .
column47: updated the documentation for relativedelta. removed references to tuple arguments for weekday, explained effect of weekday and better explained the order of operations that relativedelta applies. fixed by @kvn219 @huangy22 and @elliotjh
column48: fixed an issue where parser.parse would raise decimal-specific errors instead of a standard valueerror if certain malformed values were parsed . reported and fixed by @amureki .
column49: added time zone inference when initializing an rrule with a specified until but without an explicitly specified dtstart; the time zone of the generated dtstart will now be taken from the until rule. reported by @href . fixed by @absreim .
column50: fixed issue where passing whole number floats to the months or years arguments of the relativedelta constructor would lead to errors during addition. reported by @arouanet , fixed by @lkollar
column51: rrule performance under certain conditions has been significantly improved thanks to a patch contributed by @dekoza, based on an article by brian beck
column52: fixed issue with parsing dates of the form x m yy. reported by @jbrockmendel.
column53: fixed parser issue where commas were not a valid separator between seconds and microseconds, preventing parsing of iso 8601 dates. contributed by @ryanss
column54: fixed rrule.between for cases where after is achieved before even starting, as reported by andreas k hler.
column55: fixed parser bug where yearfirst and dayfirst parameters were not being respected when no separator was present.
column56: added a lock to tz.tzical s cache. reported and fixed by @unrud
column57: python 3.5 was added to the supported platforms in the metadata and the test suites .
column58: fixed testing of folds and gaps, particularly on windows
column59: refactored tzwin and tzrange as a subclass of a common class, tzrangebase, as there was substantial overlapping functionality. as part of this change, tzrange and tzstr now expose a transitions function, which returns the dst on and off transitions for a given year.
column60: changed many aspects of dealing with the zone info file. instead of a cache, all the zones are loaded to memory, but symbolic links are loaded only once, so not much memory is used.
column61: implemented internal timezone information with binary timezone files. datautil.tz.gettz function will now try to use the system timezone files, and fallback to the internal versions. it s also possible to ask for the internal versions directly by using dateutil.zoneinfo.gettz.
column62: implemented __abs__ for relativedelta. reported by @binnisb and @pferreir
column63: an issue that arose when timezone locale changes during runtime has been fixed by @carlosxl and @mjschultz
column64: an issue with tox failing without unittest2 installed in python 2.6 was fixed by @moreati
column65: switched release.py over to using pep517.build for creating releases, rather than direct invocations of setup.py. fixed by @smeng10 .
column66: features
column67: performance improvement to parser from removing certain min calls. reported and fixed by @jbrockmendel
column68: relativedelta weeks parameter can now be set and retrieved as a property of relativedelta instances.
column69: fixed deprecated escape characters in regular expressions. reported by @nascheme and @thierryba , fixed by @thierryba
column70: add doctest examples to tzfile documentation. done by @weatherpattern and @pganssle
column71: improved documentation on the use of until and count parameters in rrule. fixed by @lucaferocino .
column72: fixed an issue where tzfile objects were not properly handling dst and tzname when attached to datetime.time objects. reported by @ovacephaloid.
column73: several classes have been marked as explicitly unhashable to maintain identical behavior between python 2 and 3. submitted by roy williams
column74: fixed issue where test_tzlocal_offset_equal would fail in certain environments due to an invalid assumption about what time zone names are provided. reported and fixed by kubilay kocak .
column75: fixed an issue with the setup script running in non-utf-8 environment. reported and fixed by @gergondet
column76: added a cache to tz.gettz so that by default it will return the same object for identical inputs. this will change the semantics of certain operations between datetimes constructed with tzinfo=tz.gettz.
column77: fixed bug in constructor of parser, and converted parser classes to new-style classes. original report and patch by michael elsd rfer.
column78: changed handling of t24:00 to be compliant with the standard. t24:00 now represents midnight on the following day. fixed by @cheukting
column79: parser issue where calling parse on dates with no day specified when the day of the month in the default datetime is greater than the number of days in the parsed month was fixed
column80: started raising a warning when the parser finds a timezone string that it cannot construct a tzinfo instance for . reported and fixed by @jbrockmendel
column81: fixed two digit zero-year parsing , as reported by jim abramson, and included test case for this.
column82: calls like gettz and gettz will now return the expected values, instead of the tz variable behavior.
column83: relativedelta now explicitly supports fractional relative weeks, days, hours, minutes and seconds. fractional values in absolute parameters are now deprecated.
column84: changed licensing scheme so all new contributions are dual licensed under apache 2.0 and bsd.
column85: fixed an issue where tzwin was not being properly imported on windows. contributed by @labrys.
column86: bug in zoneinfo file on platforms such as google app engine which do not do not allow importing of subprocess.check_call was reported and fixed by @savraj
column87: many rrule changes and fixes by @pganssle ,
column88: update documentation to reflect that the parser can raise typeerror, reported and fixed by @tomchuk
column89: formatting fixes to documentation of rrule and readme.rst.
column90: added .instance alternate constructors for tz.tzoffset and tz.tzstr, to allow the construction of a new instance if desired.
column91: added an example of how to use a custom parserinfo subclass to parse non-standard datetime formats in the examples documentation for parser. added by @prdickson
column92: expand definition of tz.tzlocal equality so that the local zone is allow equality with tzoffset and tzutc.
column93: fixed issue with several time zone classes around dst transitions in any zones with +0 standard offset
column94: all code is compatible with new-style division.
column95: as reported by mathieu bridon, rrules were matching the bysecond rules incorrectly against byminute in some circumstances when the secondly frequency was in use, due to a copy & paste bug. the problem has been unittested and corrected.
column96: improved the contributing documentation to clarify where to put new changelog files. contributed by @andrewcbennett
column97: add documentation for the dateutil.tz.win module and mocked out certain windows-specific modules so that autodoc can still be run on non-windows systems.
column98: expanded the description and examples in the relativedelta class. contributed by @andrewcbennett
column99: fixed an issue with fold support on certain python 3 implementations that used the pre-3.6 pure python implementation of datetime.replace, most notably pypy3 .
column100: dateutil now works on python 2.6, 2.7 and 3.2 from same codebase
column101: fixed bug where hours were not validated, leading to improper parse. reported by @heappro , fixed by @jbrockmendel
column102: zoneinfo_metadata file version increased to 2.0 - the updated updatezinfo.py script will work with older zoneinfo_metadata.json files, but new metadata files will not work with older updatezinfo.py versions. additionally, we have started hosting our own mirror of the olson databases on a github pages site
column103: corrected setup.py metadata to reflect author vs. maintainer,
column104: fixed issue with tzwin encoding in locales with non-latin alphabets
column105: dateutil zoneinfo tarballs now contain the full zoneinfo_metadata file used to generate them.
column106: additional documentation for parser and rrule.
column107: parsing an empty string will now raise a valueerror, rather than returning the datetime passed to the default parameter.
column108: the package is now zip-safe, and universal-wheelable, thanks to changes in the handling of the zoneinfo file.
column109: refactored relativedelta.weekday and rrule.weekday into a common base class to reduce code duplication.
column110: relativedelta objects previously did not use microseconds to determine of two relativedelta objects were equal. this oversight has been corrected. contributed by @elprans
column111: fixed issue where dateutil.tz was using a backported version of contextlib.nullcontext even in python 3.7 due to a malformed import statement. .
column112: changed order of keywords in rrule docstring. reported and fixed by @rmahajan14 .
column113: fixed incorrect parsing of certain dates earlier than 100 ad when represented in the form %b.%y.%d , e.g. december.0031.30 .
column114: switched to setuptools_scm for version management, automatically calculating a version number from the git metadata. reported by @jreback , implemented by @sulley38
column115: added support for value=date-time for dtstart in rrulestr. reported by @potuz and fixed by @unrud
column116: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column117: bug with lang=c fixed by mike gilbert
column118: changed private _byxxx from sets to sorted tuples and fixed one currently unreachable bug in _construct_byset.
column119: fixed issue with improper rounding of fractional components. reported by @dddmello , fixed by @m-dz
column120: fixed an issue where isoparser.parse_isotime was unable to handle the 24:00 variant representation of midnight.
column121: tzwinlocal objects now have a meaningful repr and str implementation
column122: fixed parsing of xxhxxm formatted time after day/month/year has been parsed.
column123: /usr/share/lib/zoneinfo was added to tzpaths for compatibility with solaris systems. reported by @dhduvall
column124: relativedelta can now be safely subclassed without derived objects reverting to base relativedelta objects as a result of arithmetic operations.
column125: tzoffset and tzrange objects now accept either a number of seconds or a datetime.timedelta object wherever previously only a number of seconds was allowed.
column126: added support for tzid parameter for dtstart in rrulestr. reported and fixed by @ryanpetrello
column127: the full pgp signing key fingerprint was added to the readme.md in favor of the previously used long-id. reported by @valholl
column128: added python_requires to setup.py so that pip will distribute the right version of dateutil. fixed by @jakec-github
column129: fix a parser issue where am and pm tokens were showing up in fuzzy date stamps, triggering inappropriate errors. gh #56 , gh pr #63.
column130: fix bug in rrule introduced in 2.4.0 where byweekday parameter was not handled properly.
column131: removed bare string exceptions, as reported and fixed by wilfredo s nchez vega.
column132: changed manifest.in to explicitly include test suite in source distributions, with help from @koobs
column133: added support for exdate parameters when parsing rrule strings. reported by @mlorant , fixed by @nicoe .
column134: fixed problem parsing strings in %b-%y-%d format. reported and fixed by @jbrockmendel
column135: updated all references to rfc 2445 to point to rfc 5545. fixed by @mariocj89
column136: fixed issue with parsing of tzstr on python 2.7.x; tzstr will now be decoded if not a unicode type. gh #51 , gh pr #55.
column137: switched ci over to use tox. fixed by @gaborbernat
column138: fix an issue with source distributions not including the test suite.
column139: moved many examples from the examples documentation into their appropriate module documentation pages. fixed by @tomasz-kluczkowski and @jakec-github
column140: fixed many misspellings, typos and styling errors in the comments and documentation. patch by hugo van kemenade .
column141: fix error where parser allowed some invalid dates, overwriting existing hours with the last 2-digit number in the string.
column142: dropped the use of assert in the parser. fixed by @jbrockmendel
column143: parsing errors will now raise parsererror, a subclass of valueerror, which has a nicer string representation. patch by @gfyoung .
column144: added explicit check for valid hours if am/pm is specified in parser.
column145: changed to an explicit error when rrulestr strings contain a missing byday
column146: fixed a problem causing issues importing zoneinfo in certain circumstances. issue and solution contributed by @alexxv
column147: added an explicit warning when running python setup.py explaining how to run the test suites with pytest. fixed by @lkollar.
column148: fixed recursive import issue with tz module
column149: now tz.gettz returns a tzlocal instance when not given any arguments and no other timezone information is found.
column150: trailing whitespace in easter.py has been removed. submitted by @omgimalexis
column151: fixed parser issue causing fuzzy_with_tokens to raise an unexpected exception in certain circumstances. contributed by @michaelaquilina
column152: fixed another parser precision problem on conversion of decimal seconds to microseconds, as reported by erik brown. now these issues are gone for real since it s not using floating point arithmetic anymore.
column153: tzfile now correctly handles files containing leapcnt . contributed by @hjoukl
column154: improved performance and inspection properties of tzname methods.
column155: added changelog to documentation.
column156: added changelog to documentation.
column157: datetime.timedelta objects can now be added to relativedelta objects. reported and added by alec nikolas reiter (gh issue #282, pr #283
column158: extensive improvements to the parser test suite, including the adoption of pytest-style tests and the addition of parametrization of several test cases. patches by @jbrockmendel .
column159: corrected link syntax and updated url to https for iso year week number notation in relativedelta examples.
column160: fixed an issue with improper caching behavior in rruleset objects
column161: moved version information into _version.py and set up the versions more granularly.
column162: fixed parsing of unicode date strings.
column163: fixed parser bug where unambiguous datetimes fail to parse when dayfirst is set to true.
column164: fixed issue where the count parameter of rrules was ignored if 0. fixed by @mshenfield , reported by @vaultah .
column165: add support for iso 8601 times with comma as the decimal separator in the dateutil.parser.isoparse function.
column166: significantly refactored parser code by @jbrockmendel and @pganssle
column167: added within_delta function to utils - added by @justanr
column168: several unused imports were removed by @jdufresne.
column169: version is now published in dateutil.__version__, as requested by darren dale.
column170: fixed issue where the tz.tzstr constructor would erroneously succeed if passed an invalid value for tzstr. fixed by @pablogsal
column171: added dedicated iso 8601 parsing function isoparse . initial implementation by @pganssle in gh pr #489 and #622, with a pre-release fix by @kirit93 .
column172: sort exdate and rdate before iterating over them, so that it s not necessary to sort them before adding to the rruleset, as reported by nicholas piper.
column173: changed error message raised when when passing a bytes object as the time zone name to gettz in python 3. reported and fixed by @labrys .
column174: added the tz.gettz.nocache function to allow explicit retrieval of a new instance of the relevant tzinfo.
column175: reduced number of ci builds on appveyor. fixed by @kirit93
column176: changed the behavior of tz.tzoffset to return the same object when passed the same inputs, with a corresponding performance improvement
column177: switched isinstance to callable, which is available on all supported python versions. implemented by @jdufresne
column178: updated many modules to use tz.utc in favor of tz.tzutc internally, to avoid an unnecessary function call. .

column2: the old sha-1 and md5 hash functions are available even when python s own hashlib does not include them.
column3: method update of a cmac object was not throwing an exception after the digest was computed or verify).
column4: introduced export_key and deprecated exportkey for dsa and rsa key objects.
column5: api documentation is made with sphinx instead of epydoc.
column6: code that uses such methods is doomed anyway. it should be fixed asap to use the algorithms available in crypto.signature and crypto.cipher.
column7: gh#426: the shamir s secret sharing implementation is not actually compatible with ssss. added an optional parameter to enable interoperability.
column8: undefined warning was raised with libgmp version < 5
column9: add support for loading pem files encrypted with aes192-cbc and aes256-gcm.
column10: cmac raises an exception whenever the message length is found to be too large and the chance of collisions not negligeable.
column11: contribute and support
column12: added a native extension in pure c for modular exponentiation, optimized for sse2 on x86. in the process, we drop support for the arbitrary arithmetic library mpir on windows, which is painful to compile and deploy. the custom modular exponentiation is 130% slower on an intel cpu in 32-bit mode, compared to mpir. still, that is much faster that cpython s own pow function which is 900% slower than mpir. support for the gmp library on unix remains.
column13: reduced the amount of c code by almost 40% . modularized and simplified all code related to block ciphers. pycryptodome is now free of cpython extensions.
column14: ctr cipher objects accept parameter nonce and possibly initial_value in alternative to counter .
column15: gh#341: prevent key_to_english from creating invalid data when fed with keys of length not multiple of 8. thanks to vstoykovbg.
column16: symmetric ciphers do not have a default mode anymore . an expression like aes.new will now fail. if ecb is the desired mode, one has to explicitly use aes.new.
column17: replaced hmac code with a bsd implementation. clarified that starting from the fork, all contributions are released under the bsd license.
column18: new parameter output for crypto.util.strxor.strxor, crypto.util.strxor.strxor_c, encrypt and decrypt methods in symmetric ciphers . output is a pre-allocated buffer where the result must be stored. this requires less memory for very large payloads; it is also more efficient when encrypting several small payloads.
column19: new attribute oid for hash objects with asn.1 object id
column20: features
column21: the allow_wraparound parameter of crypto.util.counter is ignored. an exception is always generated if the counter is reused.
column22: gh#187: fixed incorrect aes encryption/decryption with aes acceleration on x86 due to gcc s optimization and strict aliasing rules.

column49: when importing ecc keys in pem format, ignore the redundant ec params section that was included by certain openssl commands.
column50: removed implementation of deprecated quick check feature of pgp block cipher mode.
column51: point_at_infinity becomes an instance method for crypto.publickey.ecc.ecckey, from a static one.
column52: for ocb ciphers, a final call without parameters to encrypt must end a sequence of calls to encrypt with data .
column53: fixed a warning about type mismatch raised by recent versions of cffi
column54: compatibility with pycrypto
column55: added hash functions blake2b and blake2s.
column56: import and export of ecc curves in compressed form.
column57: crypto.io.pem and crypto.io.pkcs8 used to accept empty passphrases.
column58: aes-gcm is 9x faster
column59: add support for left multiplication of an ec point by a scalar.
column60: gh#142. fix mismatch with declaration and definition of addmul128.
column61: added support for sha-512/224 and sha-512/256.
column62: gh#121. the record list was still not correct due to pep3147 and __pycache__ directories. thanks again to john o brien.
column63: added certain resistance against side-channel attacks for ghash and dsa.
column64: add support for loading pem files encrypted with aes256-cbc.
column65: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column66: the dsa parameter p prime was created with 255 bits cleared .
column67: on windows, mpir library was stilled pulled in if renamed to gmp.dll.
column68: reverted to original pycrypto behavior of method verify in pkcs1_v1_5 and pkcs1_pss.
column69: for performance reasons, ccm cipher optionally accepted a pre-declaration of the length of the associated data, but never checked if the actual data passed to the cipher really matched that length. such check is now enforced.
column70: gh#188: more prime number candidates than necessary where discarded as composite due to the limited way d values were searched in the lucas test.
column71: gmp headers and static libraries are not required anymore at the time pycryptodome is built. instead, the code will automatically use the gmp dynamic library if found in the system at runtime.
column72: added dedicated tests for all cipher modes, including nist test vectors
column73: added support for nist p-384 and p-521 curves.
column74: human-friendly messages for padding errors with ecb and cbc.
column75: for cfb/openpgp cipher object, encrypt and decrypt do not require the plaintext or ciphertext pieces to have length multiple of the cfb segment size.
column76: the library can also be compiled using mingw.
column77: added support for manylinux wheels.
column78: simplified build process by removing autoconf.
column79: gh#381: make notarization possible again on os x when using wheels. thanks to colin atkinson.
column80: the salt for pbkdf2 can be either a string or bytes .
column81: removed unused sha-3 and keccak test vectors, therefore significantly reducing the package from 13mb to 3mb.
column82: gh#65. keccak, sha3, shake and the seek functionality for chacha20 were not working on big endian machines. fixed. thanks to mike gilbert.
column83: include type stub files for crypto.io and crypto.util.
column84: added type stubs to enable static type checking with mypy. thanks to michael nix.
column85: add support for importing ecc and rsa keys in the new openssh format.
column86: ciphers and hash functions accept data as bytearray, not just binary strings.
column87: fixed compilation problem with mingw.
column88: method encrypt of aes siv cipher could be still called, whereas only encrypt_and_digest is allowed.
column89: gh#308: align stack of functions using sse2 intrinsics to avoid crashes, when compiled with gcc on 32-bit x86 platforms.
column90: added crypto.signature.pss and crypto.signature.pkcs1_15
column91: faster pbkdf2 for hmac-based prfs . thanks to christian heimes for pointing out the implementation was under-optimized.
column92: rsa and dsa keys are checked for consistency as they are imported.
column93: gh#266: aes-gcm hangs when processing more than 4gb at a time on x86 with pclmulqdq instruction.
column94: aes-ecb and aes-ctr are 3x faster
column95: ciphers and hash functions accept memoryview objects in input.
column96: unsuccessful verification of a signature will now raise an exception .
column97: added size_in_bits and size_in_bytes methods to rsakey.
column98: with the old python 2.6, use only ctypes to interface to native code.
column99: ctr mode does not modify anymore counter parameter passed to new method.
column100: added shake128 and shake256
column101: for cbc/cfb/ofb/ctr cipher objects, encrypt and decrypt cannot be intermixed.
column102: the counter parameter of a ctr mode cipher must be generated via crypto.util.counter. it cannot be a generic callable anymore.
column103: key size for arc2, arc4 and blowfish must be at least 40 bits long .
column104: crypto.random stops being a userspace csprng. it is now a pure wrapper over os.urandom.
column105: forgot inclusion of alloca.h
column106: removed support for python < 2.6.
column107: add python 3.8 wheels for linux and windows.
column108: gh#129. pycryptodomex could only be installed via wheels.
column109: method update of an eax cipher object was returning the underlying cmac object, instead of the eax object itself.
column110: removed use of alloca.
column111: remove crypto.util.py3compat.unhexlify and crypto.util.py3compat.hexlify.
column112: gh#322: remove blanket -o3 optimization for gcc and clang, to cope with buggy compilers.
column113: the initial counter for a cipher in ctr mode can be a byte string .
column114: added support for poly1305 mac .
column115: gh#106. not all docs were included in the tar ball. thanks to christopher hoskin.
column116: added rsa.import_key as an alias to the deprecated rsa.importkey .
column117: add support for ci in windows via appveyor.
column118: start using importlib instead of imp where available.
column119: removed ability to update a blake2 hash after the first call to digest
column120: added crypto.publickey.ecc module , including export/import of ecc keys.
column121: fixed resoucewarnings and deprecationwarnings.
column122: gh#420: fix incorrect cfb decryption when the input and the output are the same buffer.
column123: removed attribute crypto.publickey.rsa.algorithmidentifier.
column124: removed the parameters disabled_shortcut and overflow from crypto.util.counter.new.
column125: all iv/iv and nonce parameters are optional. if not provided, they will be randomly generated .
column126: benchmarks work again (they broke when ecb stopped working if an iv was passed. patch by richard mitchell.
column127: gh#312: it was not possible to invert an ec point anymore.
column128: pem files with windows newlines could not be imported.
column129: cbc/cfb/ofb, the cipher objects have both iv and iv attributes. new accepts iv as well as iv as parameter.
column130: when creating elgamal keys, the generator wasn t a square residue: elgamal encryption done with those keys cannot be secure under the ddh assumption. thanks to weikeng chen.
column131: fix renaming of package for install command.
column132: removed ability to update a sha-3 hash after the first call to digest
column133: ecckey has new methods size_in_bits and size_in_bytes.
column134: speed up execution of public key algorithms on pypy, when backed by the gnu multiprecision library.
column135: removed ambiguous method size from rsa, dsa and elgamal keys.
column136: initial support for pypy.
column137: added option to install the library under the cryptodome package .
column138: windows wheels are automatically built on appveyor
column139: improved the performance of scrypt by converting some python to c.
column140: gh#317: dsa.generate was not always using the randfunc input.
column141: gh#232: fixed problem with gcc 4.x when compiling ghash_clmul.c.
column142: add support for msvc.
column143: ability to test installation with a simple python -m crypto.selftest.
column144: minimal length for blowfish cipher is 32 bits, not 40 bits.
column145: add support for xchacha20 and xchacha20-poly1305 ciphers.
column146: der objects were not rejected if their length field had a leading zero.
column147: gh#175: fixed incorrect results for ctr encryption/decryption with more than 8 blocks.
column148: gh#338: deal with gcc installations that don t have x86intrin.h.
column149: gh#372: fixed memory leak for operations that use memoryviews when cffi is not installed.
column150: removed the following methods from all 3 public key object types :
column151: new dependency on ctypes with python 2.4.
column152: gh#198: fix vulnerability on aesni ecb with payloads smaller than 16 bytes .
column153: in crypto.util.number, functions floor_div and exact_div have been removed. also, ceil_div is limited to non-negative terms only.
column154: read the docs: private repos and priority support. try read the docs for business today!
column155: fix building of wheels for os x by explicitly setting sysroot location.
column156: in certain circumstances aes gcm produced wrong ciphertexts.
column157: allow legacy rc2 ciphers to have 40-bit keys.
column158: gh#121. the record list was not always correctly filled for the pycryptodomex package. thanks to john w. o brien.
column159: examples
column160: edit on github
column161: added original keccak hash family . in the process, simplified the c code base for sha-3.
column162: added stream cipher chacha20.
column163: removed method copy from blake2 hashes
column164: removed support for python < 2.4.
column165: other changes
column166: gh#123 and #125. the sse2 command line switch was not always passed on 32-bit x86 platforms.

column2: this release updates the renderer and texture extraction, with full support for perspective projection , and contains various other smaller improvements and fixes.
column3: updated v2::softwarerenderer and related code to compile with the latest eos changes and without opencv
column4: the api and functionality of eos have been quite stable for a while now and proven themselves robust and useful. this release mainly constitutes the exciting bump to v1.0!
column5: removed render_affine, this was used in the old texture extraction and is no longer needed .
column6: this is a release with quite a few nice changes and improvements. please read through the release notes carefully.
column7: added python bindings for eos::core::rect and eos::core::landmark<eigen::vector2f>. the python bindings are now using landmark and landmarkcollection natively, without having to keep a separate list of landmark identifiers.
column8: note: whereas previously, meshes without vertex colour would be rendered with the colour , in the new renderer, they will have default colour black . in any case, it does not make sense to try and render a mesh without vertex colours or texture.
column9: other recent changes & improvements include supporting uv coordinates with seams, support for landmark/vertex definitions in the morphablemodel class to give certain vertices a fixed semantic meaning, and lots of other things. see the release notes from v0.17.0 and v0.18.0 for more details.
column10: removed the old render function, moved v2::softwarerenderer to the render namespace, and added a convenience function for the new renderer that can be called like the old renderer - calling code needs slight adjustments. the core of the new renderer is the same, but the architecture has been changed to mirror more closely the hardware pipeline, with vertex- and fragment shaders. results should be exactly the same, and they have the same parameters.
column11: moved v2::extract_texture to the eos::render namespace and made it the new default . calling code needs to be adjusted slightly, but the function's parameters are very similar. this new texture extraction uses the rasterizer of the new renderer, and supports both orthographic and perspective projection.
column12: it also contains a number of other minor improvements and an updated documentation.
column13: write_obj now also inverts the y axis of the uv coords, to be consistent with write_textured_obj
column14: this release was in the devel branch for a few months, and never actually left the devel branch. the morphablemodel format version was increased to 3, from adding landmark_definitions. since there are quite a few model files with this version in circulation, it was deemed best to make it an "official" model version and release it as v0.17.0.
column15: eos/@patrikhuber is now part of github sponsors. if you are finding eos valuable, there is now the possibility of becoming a sponsor.
column16: this might actually have been causing wrong code to be run or some bad memory access to - the assert that checks for that in sample_to_mesh is not triggered in release and relwithdebinfo builds, therefore we haven't caught this for a while.
column17: added clear_buffers function to softwarerenderer and rasterizer to clear the colour- and depth buffers
column18: added functions to compute face and vertex normals of a mesh
column19: moved write_obj and write_textured_obj into a separate header, eos/core/write_obj.hpp, so that including mesh.hpp doesn't result in transitively including <fstream> and <string>
column20: removed estimate_affine_camera. see the commit message, for people that were still using this.
column21: this release mainly fixes the write_obj and write_textured_obj functions to now also write out the texture triangle indices , when they're present in a mesh. previously for meshes who used a different set of texture triangle indices, this could cause weird artefacts on the top of the head because the tti were not written to the obj.
column22: improved softwarerenderer::render to correctly deal with texture maps with seams
column23: added vertex visibility check function that supports both orthographic and perspective projection . introduced an enum class projectiontype, which specifies whether orthographic or perspective projection should be used.
column24: these are in-progress changes on new rendering/texture extraction stuff in the render::v2 namespace - these work in principle but are not too thoroughly tested or used in eos yet.
column25: this release adds support for texture maps with seams. when a texture map contains seams, the vertices at the seams are usually duplicated, and then some of the triangle indices are different in uv space from the triangulation of the 3d vertices. this change allows to support the texture coordinates of the full-head 4d face model .
column26: this is a minor update that slightly improves the internals of loading .scm models from cvssp from the university of surrey, and also adds load_scm_model to the python bindings, so these models can be loaded directly in python.
column27: texture_triangle_indices is now correctly passed along to sample_to_mesh in all morphablemodel member functions . previously, get_mean and the draw_sample functions would have returned a mesh without the texture triangle indices .
column28: updated extract_texture to support uv coordinates with seams
column29: removed the opencv dependency of eos/morphablemodel/io/cvssp.hpp, and clarified the documentation slightly
column30: the updated release is also available on pypi.
column31: the morphablemodel file format version was increased to 4 to store an additional member containing the uv triangulation
column32: small maintenance release with updated python bindings, fixed demo.py script , and fixed bfm2009/2017 converter scripts.
column33: the update also includes the most recent version of pybind11, and addition of sample_to_mesh to the python bindings.
column34: and as always, various small improvements to the code style and to the documentation.
column35: uncommented v2::extract_texture and updated all affected code
column36: models can now optionally store landmark/vertex definitions, for example mappings like "eye.right.outer_corner" <=> 177 from a generic name to vertex ids - and then a second mappings file can be used, that maps from 2d landmark identifiers to these generic names . this separates the vertex definition from a particular set of 2d landmarks.
column37: removed the old extract_texture function, which only supported affine cameras
column38: this release contains an important fix for models that have separate texture_triangle_indices, like e.g. the 4dfm.
column39: improved v2::extract_texture to not crash when the projected model is partially outside the image
column40: subsequently, the utils can now be built without opencv
column41: improved v2::extract_texture to support texture coordinates with seams
column42: the documentation at link is now updated to eos v1.1.0
column43: see the v1.2.0 release notes for all the changes and improvements in this release!
column44: added new draw_wireframe function that doesn't need opencv and added python binding for it
column46: prefixed all header guards with eos_ in the eos::core namespace to reduce possible name collisions
column47: the updated release is available on pypi.
column48: revamped the image class to a better and more future-proof design
column49: improved read_obj a bit to handle a few more cases. still, don't rely on it to parse every .obj file, it's not meant to do that. use your own or assimp or something like that.
column50: please also have a look at the changes in v0.17.0.
column51: added project function to pcamodel
column52: renamed "isomap" to "texturemap" throughout, and the <filename>.isomap.png output of the example apps to <filename>.texture.png
column53: created new directory eos/core/image/ and moved image_opencv_interop.hpp there
column54: moved render::rect to core namespace
column55: about
column56: now we always handle models correctly that contain texture triangle indices, like the 4dfm.
column57: note: the storage order is now row-major, as opposed to col-major before. in the future, we may add means to choose the storage order.
column58: updated mpark::variant to their latest master . this should fix a few compile errors with certain compilers when compiling eos in c++14 mode.
column59: added simple image resize function
column60: updated pybind11 to their latest master commit, and changed the visual studio cmake generator for the python bindings from vs 2017 to vs 2019 .
column61: improve error messaging when loading morphablemodels with odd versions
column62: this is a follow-up update pushing the python bindings to pypi:
column63: added missing inline to draw_sample
column64: one major recent addition is support for the 4d face model, 4dfm, a full-head 3d morphable face model with 36 expressions/action units, from 4dface.io.
column65: fixed constructing a 4x4 rotation matrix r instead of 3x3 in the python bindings of scaledorthoprojectionparameters

column2: removed support for deprecated builder categories which have been replaced by tags.
column3: avatar caching is now working properly and size argument is now handled correctly.
column4: removed deprecated support for constructing build steps from class and arguments in buildfactory.addstep.
column5: a new www.ws_ping_interval configuration option was added to avoid websocket timeouts when using reverse proxies and cdns
column6: removed support for deprecated nextworker function signature that accepts two parameters instead of three.
column7: the deprecated send function that can be overridden by custom reporters has been removed.
column8: fixed errors when an email address matches github commits but the user is unknown to it.
column9: removed deprecated support for block_device_map argument of ec2latentworker being not a list.
column10: avatargithub class has been enhanced to handle avatar based on email requests and take size argument into account
column11: ssh connections are now run with -o batchmode=yes to prevent interactive prompts which may tie up a step, reporter or change source until it times out.
column12: fixed regression in pending buildrequests ui where owner is not displayed anymore .
column13: removed deprecated encoding argument to bitbucketpullrequestpoller.
column14: the deprecated mtr step has been removed. contributors are welcome to step in, migrate this step to newer apis and add a proper test suite to restore this step in buildbot.
column15: improved consistency of log messages produced by the reconfig script. note that this output is not part of public api of buildbot and may change at any time.
column16: this release includes all changes up to buildbot 2.10.2.
column17: added pullrequesturl property to the following pollers and change hooks: bitbucketpullrequestpoller, githubpullrequestpoller, githubeventhandler. this unifies all bitbucket and github pollers with the shared property interface.
column18: messageformatter will receive the actual builder name instead of whole buildset when used from buildsetstatusgenerator.
column19: removed deprecated support for template_filename, template_dir and subject_filename configuration parameters of message formatters.
column20: improved error message when try client cannot create a build due to builder being not configured on master side.
column21: added support for default pylint message that was changed in v2.0.
column22: removed support for deprecated db_poll_interval configuration setting.
column23: plugin database will no longer issue warnings on load, but only when a particular entry is accessed.
column24: removed support for the following deprecated parameters of messageformatter report formatter: template_name.
column25: built with sphinx using a theme provided by read the docs.
column26: brought back the old behavior of the filedownload step to act more gracefully by returning failure instead of raising an exception when the file doesn t exist on master. this makes use cases such as filedownload possible again.
column27: updated buildbot requirements to specify sqlalchemy 1.4 and newer as not supported yet.
column28: removed support for deprecated loghorizon, eventhorizon and buildhorizon configuration settings.
column29: fixed issue with getnewestcompletetime which was returning no completed builds, although it could.
column30: fixed exception when submitting builds via try jobdir client when the branch was not explicitly specified.
column31: fixed missing data in owners and worker columns in changes and workers pages .
column32: python 3.5 is no longer supported for running buildbot master.
column33: re-added support for lazylogfiles argument of shellcommand that was available in old style steps.
column34: removed support for old-style steps.
column35: fixed usage of invalid characters in temporary file names by git-related steps
column36: added support for fossil user objects for use by the buildbot-fossil plugin.
column37: removed display of hidden steps in the build summary tooltip.
column38: removed deprecated status configuration setting.
column39: the deprecated buildbot.status module has been removed.
column40: bitbucketpullrequestpoller has been enhanced to optionally authorize bitbucket api.
column41: allow usage of basic authentication to access github api when looking for avatars
column42: implemented report generator for new build requests
column43: fixed incorrect state string of a finished buildstep being sent via message queue .
column44: fixed handling of secrets in nested folders by the vault provider.
column45: fixed parsing of urls of the form link in bitbucketstatuspush. these urls are in the sourcestamps returned by the bitbucket cloud hook.
column46: fixed a race condition in log handling of rpmlint and warningcountingshellcommand steps resulting in steps crashing occasionally.
column47: removed deprecated buildbot.test.fake.httpclientservice.httpclientservice.getfakeservice function.
column48: implemented support for configurable timeout in the reconfig script via new progress_timeout command-line parameter which determines how long it waits between subsequent progress updates in the logs before declaring a timeout.

column2: fix an issue with the memmap and memdump offsets being inconsistent
column3: the main goal of this release was mac os x and android arm support. we also included a number of other exciting new capabilities, such as dumping cached files, exploring process privileges, analyzing virtualbox and vmware saved state and snapshot files, and carving ie history urls and mft records.
column4: this is the first release to support all major 64-bit versions of windows. it also included the ability to convert raw memory images to crash dumps, extract command history and console input/output buffers, and an api for accessing cached registry keys and values from memory. ten new plugins were added with a specific focus on malware analysis.
column5: this first major release from the 1.x series added over 40 new plugins and took volatility beyond windows xp. it supported 2003 server, vista, 2008 server, and 7. it also introduced a new scanning framework and a pluggable address space system with examples such as ewf and firewire.
column6: this is the first release since the publication of the art of memory forensics! it adds support for windows 10 , linux kernels 4.2.3, and mac os x el capitan. additionally, the unified output rendering gives users the flexibility of asking for results in various formats while simplifying things for plugin developers. in short, less code leads to more functionality. this is especially useful for framework designers , because you can interface with a plugin directly and ask for json, which you then store, process, or modify however you want.
column7: starting with this release, we also provide linux and mac binary builds, which means you can use volatility on all major platforms without installing python or any dependencies.
column8: imagecopy and raw2dmp can display the number of bytes copied or converted
column9: this release improves support for windows 10 and adds support for windows server 2016, mac os sierra 10.12, and linux with kaslr kernels. a lot of bug fixes went into this release as well as performance enhancements . see below for a more detailed list of the changes in this version.
column10: new plugin to identify applications with promiscuous sockets
column11: the release of this version coincides with the publication of the art of memory forensics. it adds support for windows 8, 8.1, 2012, and 2012 r2 memory dumps and mac os x mavericks . new plugins include the ability to extract cached truecrypt passphrases and master keys from windows and linux memory dumps, investigate mac user activity , and analyze advanced linux rootkits.
column12: verinfo plugin updated and moved into core framework
column13: fix an issue with vadtree's graphviz fill colors not being rendered by some viewers
column14: this release introduced support for 32- and 64-bit linux memory samples, an address space for lime , and a suite of 14 new plugins to investigate windows gui space--including clipboard contents, desktop windows, and screenshots.
column15: added profiles and support for mac 10.10 yosemite and 10.11 el capitan
column16: restructured and depolluted namespace
column17: plugins to scan linux process and kernel memory with yara signatures
column18: majority of existing plugins updated with x64 support
column19: this release also coincides with the community repo - a collection of volatility plugins written and maintained by authors in the forensics community. many of these are the result of the last 4 years of volatility plugin contests, but some were just written for fun. either way, its an entire arsenal of plugins that you can easily extend into your existing volatility installation.
column20: this release also coincides with the community repo - a collection of volatility plugins written and maintained by authors in the forensics community. many of these are the result of the last 3 years of volatility plugin contests, but some were just written for fun. either way, its an entire arsenal of plugins that you can easily extend into your existing volatility installation.
column21: recover sent and received adium messages, including those protected by otr
column22: detect api hooks in both userland processes and the kernel
column23: malfind plugin detects injected code with erased pe headers
column24: find api hooks in both the kernel and process memory
column25: dlllist shows load count to distinguish between static and dynamic loaded dlls
column26: new macho address space for 32- and 64-bit mac memory samples
column27: new pluggable address spaces with automated election
column28: added support for memory dumps from the most recent virtualbox version
column29: added a plugin to find and print text on the notepad application's heap
column30: add support for kaslr linux kernels
column31: converting x86 and x64 raw dumps to ms crash dump
column32: new plugin to print and extract compressed swap data
column33: ability to reveal clear-text pgp emails sent or received with the mail application
column34: updated documentation and command reference
column35: new plugin to find hidden threads
column36: list processes that are using raw sockets
column37: new arm address space for linux and android devices on arm
column38: ability to scan for multiple executive object types concurrently with a single pass through the memory dump
column39: fix an issue translating strings in pae and x64 images
column40: added support for virtualbox elf64 core dumps
column41: add options to yarascan to scan process and kernel memory at once
column42: add apis to paged address spaces to allow easy lookups of pte flags
column43: introduction of linux support
column44: vadinfo plugin allows --addr to specify one region rather than printing them all
column45: new plugin to print basic and complex thread data
column46: new plugin to automatically detect mac os x profiles
column47: list ip and socket filters
column48: merged malware plugins into volatility core with preliminary x64 support
column49: vmware saved state and snapshot
column50: vmware saved state and snapshot
column51: vmware saved state and snapshot
column52: vmware saved state and snapshot
column53: addd support for linux kernels up to 4.2.3
column54: dump lkms to disk, and check tty devices for rootkit hooks
column55: new plugin to print editbox controls from the gui subsystem
column56: parse ie history/index.dat urls
column57: explore recently unloaded kernel modules
column58: vmware saved state and snapshot files
column59: new plugin to report kauth scopes and listeners
column60: yarascan plugin allows you to control --size and --reverse
column61: updated object model and profile subsystems
column62: evtlogs: parse xp and 2003 event logs from memory
column63: getsids plugin automatically resolves user and service sids
column64: support for windows bitmap crash dumps
column65: check the arm system call and exception vector tables for hooks
column66: callbacks and timers plugins work on 64-bit memory images
column67: approximately 35 new linux plugins
column68: virtualbox core dumps
column69: virtualbox core dumps
column70: virtualbox core dumps
column71: virtualbox core dumps
column72: 32- and 64-bit linux kernels up to 3.16
column73: new plugin to print the current working directory of processes
column74: add support for tagging mac memory ranges as heaps, stacks, etc.
column75: psxview plugin adds two new sources of process listings from the gui api
column76: plugins to extract metadata from all of these new formats
column77: hashdump, cachedump, and lsadump plugins updated for x64 and win8/2012
